Reviews.Title: “Hilton Molino Stucky, Venice Italy”
Reviews.Author: TWilliamson07
Reviews.Content: I liked the Hilton a lot! Although not on Venice proper, the hotel has a shuttle every 20 minutes so it's an easy commute and it gets you out of the crazy tourists area in Venice. The hotels huge but everything is well thought out. Very comfortable beds and the rooms are nice and large. Food and drinks are definitely on the high side but service is excellent and the food is good. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Hotel Molino Stucky”
Reviews.Author: Bobby027
Reviews.Content: Four fantastic days in Venice the hotel was magnificent, lovely room great service, fantastic buffet breakfast. The staff were very helpful they had a courtesy water taxi which was a great way to get round Venice. The hotel is situated over the canal from St Mark's Square but in a great location. The vacation was lovely and the hotel couldn't have done anything better. This is a great place for couples, family who are touring Venice. We arrived at the hotel by private water taxi 100 euro and left the same way it was a great way to arrive and leave Venice. A memorable holiday indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: dlkMontreal_
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in April . We were a little concerned with the location but that quickly disappeared the hotel shuttle service is quick and efficient.It was actually nice to escape the hordes of people in Venice and relax at the hotel before heading back across for more visiting and dinners . The hotel rooms are nicely decorated as is the rest of the hotel .The views from the rooftop bar are not to be missed. Staff were friendly and efficent. Dave & Lyne Montreal ,Canada

Reviews.Title: “Refreshingly Romantic for such a large hotel”
Reviews.Author: Whitney P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for three nights. We found the location to be perfect. Although the taxi over to the "mainland" takes a few minutes, it did not alter our experience at all. We used both the hotel water shuttle, as well as the ACTV 72 hour pass (highly recommended). I would not have expected such great service from a city with a large tourist population. The Bacaromi restaurant was fantastic. Guiseppe, our waiter, spent time to answer our questions about Venezian history and also gave us spot on tips for additional dining experiences. The hotel is quite large and yet they made it feel intimate. I cannot think of anything negative about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enormous hotel and very busy at times, but the staff still manage to make you feel special.”
Reviews.Author: PYT13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely huge and, each time we have been here, there has been a conference going on so it's exceptionally busy. But amazingly the staff still make it seem effortless and calm! Take time to wander through Guidecca island if you can. It's tempting to just go straight across to San Marco but you'll be missing some treats. Trattoria Altanella (along a little alley just before the Iron Bridge) served meals to Earnest Hemingway! It's been run by the same family for 100 years. Try it for lunch, you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DorsetUKPaul
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a fantastic location. The hotel feels special the moment you get off the water taxi.. The check in is very quick and efficient and the rooms are great! We got an upgrade to a fantastic suite... (even though we paid through reward points). Access to the St Marks Square is by complimentary water taxi running at least once an hour between 6 am and midnight (or beyond at the weekends) so travel is very easy... The hotel has great faciilities and is very relaxing, particularly being on the waters edge. The staff are very friendly and helpful... Nothing seems too much trouble...get to the rooftop bar for sundown for great views and good atmosphere. A must if you are visiting Venice , we will be back (again!)

Reviews.Title: “Best in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: elasesino82
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel during spring break, and let me just say I was impressed. If your use to the Hilton standard then it doesn't get any better than this! By far the nicest and most luxurious Hilton hotel I've stayed in anywhere or in Europe. Being on the grand canal we had a view from our room that was spectacular! With a window that opened up to the canal. The hotel is immaculate, and the service was amazing especially the concierge desk. breakfast was pricy at about $25usd however it was very good as well. a lot of the hotel still has a lot of the original architecture, there are several shops in the hotel along with gift shops. If you are concerned about going to central Venice Then don't be, there is a complimentary shuttle service that runs every 10 to 15 minutes into St. Mark's Square and continues throughout all day and late night. the great part is that it's in a more peaceful location without being on the beaten path of central Venice on a separate island called guidecca. the vapporetto stops right in front, but if you prefer a faster route from marco polo airport I would recommend a private water taxi (pricy) but what a way to travel through Venice in style! if you can afford it, water taxi is about $100usd ( up to 4ppl) one way and 30mins vs. 1hr and 30mins on city water bus and $15 per person one way from Marco polo airport.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scats36
Reviews.Content: Although it is easy to list all the favorable features of the Molino Stucky, it is a bit difficult to list the less-favorable features. First the positive: First class service, immuculate and spacious rooms, outstanding bathrooms, good restaurants, great views from the rooftop lounge, a quiet location and just a perfect place to spend a vacation. But....there are a few less-positive elements in this almost-perfect hotel. First is the layout of the hotel. Since the Molino Stucky is a converted factory it is composed of a number of buildings that have been linked somehow to make one facility. It is therefore a bit of a maze and takes some time to acclimate to the confusing corridors adn different elevators. Secondly is the case of the "blessing in disguise" location. The location while quite favorable because of it's quiet location is therefore not on the main island of Venice. This involves taking a boat (complimentary) each time you wish to walk through Venice. It can be a problem timing the departures and can sometimes be a long wait. The shuttle to Marco Leaves every hour and the shuttle to Zattere, every forty minutes. On occasion the shuttle that is coming from San Marco stops or skips Zattere because it is full or almost full. It's not fun waiting in inclement weather! The other option is to take the local vaporetto which can be an expense. All in all, I'd stay at the Molino Stucky anytime. because the good far outweighs the bad.

Reviews.Title: “Something different for a stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Aussie7leagueboots
Reviews.Content: We have visited Venice many times over the years, usually staying in the middle of the hustle, bustle and noise of Venice. This visit we stayed at the Stucky. It certainly was a different experience. I travel frequently for work in the Asia Pacific area and use Hilton hotels a lot and so I thought using Hilton for a holiday stop in Italy would be interesting. Our room was clean, as quite as a tomb and the bed comfortable. The bathroom was very generously proportioned with a separate bath tub and shower. Alas, no face washers were provided. We tried to use the room phone but it wasn't working. Also there was no hotel information in the room nor was there a minibar price list. If your budget doesn't run to private transport, access to the hotel is either by Vaporetto ( Water bus) or by using the free hotel shuttle boat from either San Marco or Zattere which is the area facing the island on which the hotel is situated. Catching the shuttle from the Zattere stop can be problematical. It arrived from the San Marco stop already full several times during our stay meaning an extra 15 minute wait, making the total wait almost an hour. It's much better to use the San Marco stop and get there early. Breakfast was so so. As is often the case in hotels where the staff bring around coffee, after the first cup it's difficult to catch the attention of staff to get another one. Also the plates are tiny meaning they pile up on the table and aren't cleaned away during your breakfast. I made some toast only to find there was no margarine provided and only hard little blocks of butter which are impossible to spread. Newspapers either in Italian or English weren't provided in the breakfast room. Despite all these little quibbles, we enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It was a quite retreat from what was a very crowded Venice. The Giudecca area where the hotel is located also has some interesting corners to visit that visitors would normally not see and a few nice places to eat along the water front.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Kitkat071
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five days over Easter. We had an executive room which was nice and big with plenty of cupboard and wardrobe space. We have Hilton diamond status so we received free use of the executive lounge which we could use till 11 pm. Breakfasts were included and we received wifi free because we had an executive room. The ferry shuttle is free and runs till 1.30am. The staff at the hotel are lovely and go out of there way to help with anything that you require. We definately will stay here again when retuning to Venice. Don't let the fact it's not on the main island stop you. Its only a ten minute free ferry ride away.

Reviews.Title: “oh dear perhaps I exspect too much”
Reviews.Author: Sussex_Ashington
Reviews.Content: I am sad to say our trip to the Hilton did not live up to exceptions. The Hotel is very big, location excellent, but it has no sole. The rooms very shabby, with one of the net curtains missing. The bathrooms could do with being refreshed. There was no turn down service on the two nights we stayed. As we were there over Easter we expected it to be busy, but breakfast on Easter Monday was a shambles, they were not prepared for so many guests, the buffet and dining room reminded me of a canteen from the 1960â€™s. We have stayed in many Hiltons over the years, this one just didnâ€™t hit the mark for us. Our rooms although delux looked over the internal workings of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not Stuck at the Molino Stucky Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bnoel
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Venice, my wife and I were unable to reserve a room near St. Mark's. I was able to get a room at the Molino Stucky Hotel across the channel in the Giudecca District, and was greatly surprised at this Hilton affiliate hotel. From a convenient (free) shuttle provided by the hotel, to a very first class, attentive staff, our stay was very enjoyable. Stricken with a flu virus, my wife and I spent more time within the hotel than we would have normally, and enjoyed every minute. Good food at the restaurants, and a fabulous roof-top bar/lounge helped to contribute to our expanding waistlines. Ended up canceling a reservation in another city to stay on at Molino Stucky for an additional few days. We can't wait to return and enjoy this level of hospitality again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel amazing”
Reviews.Author: alp a
Reviews.Content: We stayed with my wife 3 nights in Hilton Stucky in Venice. Hotel might be alittle bit far from airport however, Hilton stucky is amazing.Location and hotel is fantastic. Also From the day we checked in until the day we checked out all the staff was very very helpful especially Concierge Irene and carlo they are amazing and Irene knows everything about Venice. Also Alessandro in front desk is very friendly. The F&B staff was friendly and helpful the breakfast buffet was excellent,service is the best service I saw in Hilton chains. I strongly recommend everybody to stay in this hotel. There were only 1 problem the carpent in our room seems like not been vacuumed almost like a month.This was a little problem but overall amazing. I would like to thank all the staff in Hilton stucky for their great smiles and help. Thanks Alp & Ece

Reviews.Title: “Superb, but watch the â‚¬â‚¬â‚¬â‚¬”
Reviews.Author: visitor150811
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location, slightly away from the maddening crowds, shuttle boat service makes it all work. Spacious rooms. But, But, But - watch the incredible prices that are charged for just about everything, food costs ridiculous, drinks the same and they even charge for internet (â‚¬27 per day!). Great shame as the costs drive residents out of the hotel and in to town. Amazing how many people are on the early shuttle boats heading across to get breakfast at a cafe, instead of paying the inflated price in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great, quiet hotel away from the crowds of Venice”
Reviews.Author: OneInaMillion50
Reviews.Content: We started our 2012 European Spring break cruise with a couple of days visit to Venice before our cruise left from the Port of Venice. We stayed at the Hilton Molino Stucky because it is located off the main island of Venice, on the island of Guidecca. After arriving from the airport on our private water taxi from the airport (a 100 euro fare which was a HUGE thrill for our 7 year old), our adventure began. We were given a nice room on the 5th floor which faced the quiet courtyard (we used a hotel voucher using miles from AAdvantage so we didn't expect a canal view) and we were immediately given a roll-away bed for our young son without asking or reminding staff that we had a reservation for 3. We dropped off our suitcases, and headed out to the hotel pier to catch the shuttle boat over to San Marco Square for lunch and sightseeing (it was our 1st time in Venice). The trip is a short 10-15 minute boat ride which is complementary for Hilton guests which stops at Zattere and then at San Marco Square. http://www.molinostuckyhilton.com/shuttle.php The boat can get easily filled up with hotel guests on inbound or outbound boats (a shuttle can hold at most 40 people at one time), so make sure you are not late arriving or you will have to wait 45-60 minutes for the next complementary hotel shuttle. If you have the chance to purchase your room with the buffet breakfast (or upgrade your room to include the breakfast), it is a wonderful meal with a lot of different choices, both hot and cold, and well worth a visit each morning. Check-in and check-out went extremely smooth, with the help of very friendly staff. If you visit Venice and don't want to be in the center of "tourist town" in small rooms and hard to navigate streets and bridges with luggage, I would highly recommend the Hilton Molino Stucky. (Be aware that the rooftop pool and bar is closed until sometime in May -- we had heard about the great view but were unable to access the roof even for viewing and pictures, and the only reason that the hotel didn't get our highest rating.)

Reviews.Title: “Great birthday treat”
Reviews.Author: janelancs
Reviews.Content: A really great stay, the executive lounge was excellent both for food and really helpful staff. Was a shame that the pool area wasn't open as the weather was superb but the pool doesn't open untill May.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, let down by staff”
Reviews.Author: Wildmanpunk
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately this great hotel was let down by one staff member in particular. It is located on Giudecca Island so away from the hustle and bustle, the shuttle service is good although we did have to wait for about 35 minutes on one occasion as the first boat was full. This isn't ideal especially when it is cold. The room was lovely and cleaned every day. The breakfast was excellent, it had everything you could want and the staff were attentive. However our stay was tainted by the attitude of one staff member, Francesco, on the reception desk. Our TV wasn't working on the first day when we arrived, and on asking if it could be fixed he said it wasn't a problem of the hotel and would be sorted at some point the next day (it wasn't), he seemed to find it amusing and was very dismissive, not really what you expect from the good hotel. It's a shame one person can let down a whole hotel, but I wouldn't recommend staying here because of this one incident.

Reviews.Title: “As long as you don't mind a little inconvenience...”
Reviews.Author: 2bawanderer
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful weeklong stay at this beautiful hotel. But let's get the biggest issue out of the way: it is NOT on the main islands of Venice. The Hotel is located on Guidecce island, across from the other cluster of islands that make up most of Venice (about a 10 minute boat ride). The hotel does provide a free shuttle boat every twenty minutes to either of one or two locations (except for when they are on "pause" for an hour plus), but you have to make amends with this inconvenience. To be honest, despite our best planning, there were two nights when we found ourselves waiting up to 30 minutes on the dock for the shuttle in the rain [you can always take a public transport boat or private water taxi to get you near or to the hotel]. But if you can get by this inconvenience (and we found it wasn't that hard), the hotel is marvelous. From the interior architecture, much of this hotel was at one point a set of apartments. Our junior suite had a very spacious living room with fold out bed, a large bedroom with king bed, a functioning kitchenette (but no cookware) and a lovely bathroom with tub, shower and bidet. The decor was lovely and the maid service impeccable. For those with access to the "executive club", a good breakfast was provided (well-prepared, but never-changing menu). In addition, this area had beverages all day (including beer, wine and prosecco), a cocktail hour with hors d'oeuvres and snacks. The concierge was excellent, giving very clear directions and sound advice on questions ranging from the best way to get to Murano Island (he arranged for free transportation from one of the glass factories) to what we should wear to a Vivaldi concert (causal was fine) to making arrangements for private water taxi from/to hotel (110 euros). The hotel's general service was excellent, with prompt porter service, excellent bellmen (who on three occassions provided us with umbrellas before we knew we needed them) and an attentive front desk. Even Enrico at the bar remembered my nightcap drink after the first night and stood ready to serve me my "usual" from the second night onward. The hotel even had coffee, tea, orange juice and biscotti for travelers who had to leave the hotel before breakfast started. Was everything perfect? No. The internet rate was highway robbery at 25 euros a day. And again, the location was an inconvenience. But when all was said and done, the stay was really marvelous.

Reviews.Title: “Gr8 property with equally gr8 view”
Reviews.Author: Ankit B
Reviews.Content: Amazing staff. Gave us room as requested without holding tantrums. Amazing shuttle service offered to Hilton guests. Good for couple stay as it almost an island hotel so lot of safety is required. Would recommend to anyone visiting Venice if budget is not criteria.

Reviews.Title: “They charge for wifi!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shoko R
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel in a lovely afternoon after a long trip and high expectations. then I found out they charge for Internet!!!! I mean if you are going to do that, at least list it in big bold letter when reservations are made, so I could stay at another hotel!!! You have to PLUG IN THE CABLE for your laptops in the room to get connection!! Who does that now days? There goes the first impression. Besides, the shuttles are very slow and you always have to wait for 40 minutes, not a very good location if you are looking for convenience around the city. I've been traveling a lot recently and came across many good hotels along the way, and I have to say the independent hotels I've stayed in were much more genuine and friendly, they provide real hospitality and their staff really care about your needs, no wonder all the big brands are loosing their brand equity. Oops! I better watch my time now since each minute cost a lot!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, beautiful place.”
Reviews.Author: vixens80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Molino Stucky for 2 nights. We visited Venice for our anniversary and this hotel did not disapoint! We were upgraded to an executive suite with a view of the lagoon. Amazing! We were also surprised with champaign and strawberrys as an anniversary gift.The location is perfect, the complementary boats are frequent and timely. The staff are helpful and friendly. The roof top bar is a must. We can't wait to get back!

Reviews.Title: “Very much a Hilton In Venice”
Reviews.Author: HappyHikerGirl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 2 nights at the Hilton Molino Stucky; March 17-18. The hotel is a series of interconnected buildings. We stayed in the Foscari building, room number 545. ROOM: We found the room very large for Italian standards, as expected given a US hotel chain. We had a large king size bed, desk, 2 chairs (one for the desk), large night stands, a sitting table, and several lamps. The room was still rather dark when we had all the lights on in the room. There was a wardrobe with a safe in the separate entry hall, I liked having the entry hall as we could take off our shoes and coats before entering our room. The carpet seemed a bit warn and could use a cleaning or replacement. The bed was the most comfortable bed we used during our 11 day trip. It wasn't too hard or too soft - just right! All other beds in Italy we found VERY hard. There were beautiful wood beams - the underfloor of the floor above was exposed. It seemed to be typical of Venetian construction. The beams were beautiful. The windows opened which in March was very pleasant, although we did have several flies enter the room. There is signage asking guests not to open windows due to mosquito and flies. BATHROOM: full size bathroom with a bath tub, separate shower, bidet, toilet, and sink with a large counter. Toiletries provided were pleasant. As we found in all of Italy, we were only provided a hand towel and bath towel - no wash cloth. BREAKFAST: We decided to opt-in to the buffet breakfast offered by the hotel on Sunday for convenience. While good, I did not think it was worth 30 Euros. We were offered a discount for the buffet because my BF is a Hilton Rewards member and therefore we paid 30 Euros for both of us to enjoy the breakfast. The buffet had plenty of breads, meats, cheeses; a hot section of scrambled eggs, potatoes, sausage, and bacon; a nice selection of fruit and yogurt; as well as prosecco, coffee, tea, water, and juices (FYI - Sodas are 8 Euros and cost in addition to the buffet). Convenient and simple, but not worth the price. SERVICE: we only interfaced with staff when we checked in and I found it distasteful that the gentleman checking us in attempted to up sell us at every chance he had. Another couple was checking in at the same time. When the individual servicing us was not trying to sell something to us, I listened in to that conversation and gained SO much more information about the hotel and the facilities. SHUTTLE & LOCATION: The shuttle ran on time in March - note were were there several weeks before peak season begins. We had no difficulty finding a seat when catching the shuttle to either Zattere or San Marco. Note that it is a five minute trip to Zattere and there are 2 trips to Zattere each hour. There is only one boat to San Marco each hour. If you are willing to walk I highly recommend getting off at Zattere and walking to the more touristy sections (such as San Marco). We walked through Venice from Zatterre on Sunday and it was wonderful. We saw families strolling out and about, people walking their dogs, stumbled upon a grocery store and had a picnic lunch. It was wonderful to not be amongst all the shops and tourists (we tourists were still out and about just not in HUGE numbers when walking from Zatterre to other parts of Venice). I also highly recommend walking down the island of Giudecca - again it is not as touristy and we found a great little bakery very close to the public water bus (we took the water bus to the train station - the Stucky shuttle does not go to the airport or train station you have to take a water taxi at 100 Euros or the water bus. We took a water taxi at a cost of 120 Euros from the airport to the Stucky on arrival - it was a very pleasant, short ride to the hotel, but when you aren't in a hurry take the water bus and you'll see more of the islands). Explore, explore, explore! VALUE: I cannot really comment. We cashed in reward points to stay at the Stucky for little more than the tourist tax. Based on the rates we saw, published online, I don't think staying at the Molino Stucky is worth the standard rate. It felt like a very American hotel experience, as expected.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, wonderful staff and beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: The2explorers28
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Molino Stucky in Venice for 2 nights in mid March. Prior to our trip I emailed the Hotel asking, if possible, for a room with a view and on arrival they offered us an amazing free upgrade to the 'Thats Amore' Suite which not only provided views over the water to Venice, but also had its own seperate living room area, 2 large flat screen tvs, a huge comfortable bed and a very well appointment bathroom (with a heavenly shower). It was a wonderful start to our trip and made our stay very memorable. The suite was located in the Arsenele part of the hotel (the hotel is so large they provide you with a map to get around) and it seemed to us to be one of the nicest wings. The hotel itself is exactly what we look for in a hotel - modern, yet retaining its unique features, clean and with excellent staff (who were incredibly helpful in making reservations for us at a restaurant). We sat in the lobby bar one afternoon to have a quick drink before heading out for the evening and a waiter bought over a selection of free cakes for us - which was a lovely touch. We also went for a jog around Guidecca Island early one morning which was a great alternative to the gym (which was a little small and hot!) - the views over to the main island of Venice were stunning. The shuttles which run over to Zattere and to St Marks Square were reliable and always on time, however we did find the timetable a bit infrequent on occasions (I assume this is because we travelled off peak) but the hotel itself does make the incovenience of taking the shuttles worthwhile. I would 100% recommend this hotel to anyone who visits Venice - we will hopefully return one day in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Natasha B
Reviews.Content: Spent there only one night but it was so great we ll definately repeat it. The rooms are elegant, impecably clean, stuff very friendly. Lobby bar cocktails were great also. I would rate the stay 10 out of 10, would advise everyone, especially couples on romantic trip;)

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional But With Cautions”
Reviews.Author: ovando
Reviews.Content: Travelers to Venice might quickly overlook the Molino Stucky because of its Hilton brand, but that would be a mistake. Constructed in partnership between the city of Venice and Hilton in 2007, the hotel was created in the shell of a 19th century brick flour factory after a five-year renovation project that is considered one of Italyâ€™s finest historic reuse projects. We were extremely impressed at the level of construction detail that we observed throughout the property, noting that Hilton spared no expense in using the finest woods, marbles and metal finishes throughout the sprawling complex. While the hotel lacks the historic charm and patina of the Gritti Palace, Europa, or the Danieli, its imposing setting, modern elegance, and interesting spaces more than make up for the ambiance to found in the hotels around the Grand Canal. The hotelâ€™s location away from the chaos and crowds at the center of Venice may be its greatest attribute. Located on Giudecca Island, the hotel provides quick, frequent and complimentary shuttle service to Zattere and San Marco. Book a room with a view of the main islands if you can, but if you find yourself on the other side of the hotel donâ€™t despair. Just head up to the 8th floor skybar after dark to sip some prosecco and to enjoy the view of lighted buildings along the lagoon. We found all of the hotel staff extremely professional and friendly, and willing to go out of the way to be helpful. The staff in the lobby bar was particularly congenial. The only staff shortcoming that we noticed were with those employees who answered phone calls that we placed from our room to obtain hotel information. You cannot dial the front desk from your room phone, but rather you must push a phone button labeled â€œMagic,â€� which is not exactly what we experienced. Some staff on the other end of the button gave us either the wrong information or possessed poor English speaking skills, compared to the staff working in public areas. (Not a problem if you speak Italian, of course) Oh yes, during our March stay the hotel had a concierge on duty only on the weekends, which made getting information difficult since we had to wait in line for some time at the front desk as only two staff were ever on duty to handle the guests for the hotelâ€™s 379 rooms. There was plenty of suited staff with gold nametags moving about the hotel, but far too few working the front desk. Upon check-in we were upgraded to a king suite that was terrific! All of the room furnishings were of very high quality, and the bed was exceptionally comfortable, more so than any Hilton property where we have ever stayed, including its Waldorf Astoria collection. And the bath was very large, with separate tub and shower. It was interesting to note the high level of craftsmanship evident in the bathroomâ€™s marble floor and wall tiles. Overall, our king suite occupied the same space as two deluxe king bedrooms. But light sleepers or those who retire early would be advised to avoid staying on the 7th floor in the wing that houses the rooftop bar and restaurant. Our room turned out to be right under the 8th floor restaurant and bar. We were kept awake until 1:30 AM one morning by the sound of tables, chairs and furniture being dragged across the floor over our heads, presumably by the cleaning crew. And since our room was at the end of the hallway, we found that 8th floor staff were constantly bringing kitchen and restaurant gear â€“ including dirty dishes â€“ to the 7th floor landing just outside our door, and then leaving the double-doors at the end of the hallway wide open. Whenever I closed them to seal of the noise, someone would soon prop them open again. When we complained the next morning, the desk staff graciously offered to move us to a lower floor. And interior rooms, adjacent to or opposite the hotelâ€™s several restaurants, should be avoided as well since the sounds of trash transfer, deliveries, and employees on break can echo loudly within the brick interior spaces of the hotel complex. We found the hotelâ€™s employees who worked in these areas to be rather loud late at night and early in the morning. So be sure to check on the location of your room if you are sensitive to noise. Our lovely room did come with a few frustrating complications. It was always overly warm even when evening temperatures dropped to the 40â€™s. The room thermostat had no cooling feature, no numbered degree settings, and a non-functioning fan. And then the oddest thing occurred on our second night. The television turned on by itself with a loud, irritating beeping noise. We went into the bedroom to investigate we found a message from the hotel desk on the screen, inviting us to the happy hour on the rooftop bar. The obnoxious beeping continued until we turned the television off. While we appreciated the personal invitation, we found the method of delivery rather unnerving. Should a hotel have the ability to turn on a guestâ€™s television? We didnâ€™t think so. We then wondered what else the hotel could do with that television. Another frustration was there was no room information on how or where to get ice. It turned out there was no ice machine in the 7th floor, although our â€œMagicâ€� button promised one. The closest machine turned out to be on the 5th floor, but in a different wing of the hotel. But I only discovered this after asking an employee who I found polishing a wood door in the hallway. He left his post to lead me down two floors and into the wing with the ice machine. But on this initial trip, and each one that followed, the ice machine was out of order. So was the machine on the 4th floor that was shown to me as a backup. I was eventually forced to call room service for ice. They were very quick, but the cost each time was a one Euro tip. One more thing. We were required to obtain a new internet password every day. Although the cost of internet service was included in our room fee for the length of our stay, every evening I had to place a â€œMagicâ€� phone call to obtain a new user name and password. This process is automated in most Hilton hotels, so we found this manual routine rather odd. We enjoyed drinks and appetizers in the lobby bar on two nights, before we headed into the center of Venice for dinner, and then had a nightcap at the hotelâ€™s rooftop terrace bar when we returned. The rooftop restaurant and bar are not to be missed, or the rooftop swimming pool that was closed in March. But we noticed that the three restaurants and bars in the hotel that we frequented had different prices for the very same prosecco. Even the staff could not explain this fact when asked. Hilton members with Diamond status, or those who can afford it, should consider booking an executive room to secure all-day access to the executive lounge that offers food and drinks, from breakfast until late in the evening. Food is available all day, and wine, refrigerated beers and prosecco are on hand as soon as breakfast is cleared. Guests could easily eat two meals a day here, and then splurge on dinner at fine restaurant in the main section of Venice. But the executive lounge is oddly situated on an open, elevated side of the lobby bar requiring key-card â€œgatedâ€� entry. This gated process must seem rather unwelcoming to non-executive guests sitting in the lobby bar area. The placement of the lounge was most certainly a design after-thought. Not only does it appear oddly situated, but the setting does not feel â€œexecutiveâ€� or privileged in the least, but instead appears placed where it is for the convenience of food service delivery and clean-up. Management needs to rethink this one. And it also needs to consider a soft goods renovation of the furniture in the public since the furniture is looking rather worn. Overall our experience at the Molino Stucky was much better than we expected, and we would surely stay there again, admittedly keeping in mind the cautions that we have noted here. The hotel management tries very hard to please its guests and provides several means to evaluate the quality of your stay, but there numerous details that need attention. We understand that some of the quirks that we experienced are uniquely Italian, or perhaps simply Venetian, yet they were numerous and problematic enough to deserve mentioning to prospective guests.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Venice”
Reviews.Author: L H
Reviews.Content: On arrival the hotel seemed lovely. It is a very attractive building. At first it seemed exactly what my husband and I expected based on the website. Unfortunately travelling in February means that some of the restaurants and the heated roof top pool were closed which was disappointing. The boat that took us to San Marco was also infrequent which could again be attributed to the time of year. The room was comfortable and clean. However it was very hot and the air conditioning wouldn't work- luckily the windows opened. We were disappointed to discover that nearly all of the hotel's services were only offered as an additional service. In all 4/5 stars we've stayed in previously we've had use of the spa facilities (Jacuzzi/sauna etc) included in our room rate (where applicable) however at Molino Stucky this was an additional extra. The highlight of the hotel for us for the Saturday night buffet served in the roof top bar. The selection of mini deserts were superb and we enjoyed our evening. We also found the staff helpful and the restaurant recommendations were much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: travellinman2009
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very quiet location across the canal from the main island. If you have a room facing the canal, the views are fantastic. Our room was also very spacious and comfortable. The need to take the shuttle boat over to the main island may be slightly inconvenient but otherwise this hotel is great and very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great staff”
Reviews.Author: notrevo
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel, I have nothing bad to say about the place. I was fortunate to be upgraded to a suite which was delightful, the exec lounge had everything you could wish for. The hotel was perfect for a wedding anniversary celebration. The staff were polite, helpful and courteous, and nothing was too much trouble for them. The hotels location is on the island of Giudecca which is a five minute crossing on the courtesy shuttle. Best way from the airport is the water taxi service, but not cheap at EUR 120 each way, but it only takes half an hour rather than 90 mins on the vaperetto service. Highly recommended, and the team there are a superb reflection on the management team at the Molino.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: LondonDes
Reviews.Content: Finding the shuttle at Zattare was easy enough from P. Roma and the locals were very helpful in directing us. The trip from Zattare to the hotel is very short (and, incidentally, the walk from Zattare to St Mark's is easily done in 10 mins so don't feel you need to wait for a shuttle to St Mark's). Bear in mind the morning rush to get to town so make sure you are at the shuttle a good 15 minutes before it leaves if you want to get on it in peak times. With regard to the room (standard room booked), I must confess to doing a little jig when we checked in and it had a view of the lagoon (thank you!). It was a lovely room as well and my only gripe is with the TV having virtually no English channels and really expensive pay per view movies (old or new). The hotel staff were all very pleasant and friendly - I must particularly mention the housekeeping staff and the waiting staff at breakfast. Also, the concierge kindly managed to re-arrange a tour we had missed (as the boat was full - see above) without too much fuss. In the same breath I must thank the manager for his birthday card and Hilton $'s (which I have kept as a souvenir!). It was very kind of you to remember my birthday. The breakfast spread is very good, although I wouldn't pay full price for it. On the subject of food, the prices are extortionate. We are talking 28 Euro for a cheeseburger and fries in your room, plus a delivery fee (for room service) of 8 Euro and 6 Euro for a bottle of water! So essentially your burger, fries and a water is costing you 42 Euro. For one. To eat in the restaurants you get charged a cover charge per person and service fee as well, which I find a bit of a slap in the face. Unfortunately these prices meant that instead of supporting the hotel establishments as we would usually do, we rather ate in town (where some restaurants do the same, but there are many that do not). The spa seems comprehensive, although we did not make use of it, and the gym is basic. I couldn't find an indoor swimming pool (?), which I found a bit odd for a 5* hotel. As it is only March the one on the roof was closed. All in all a really good hotel and a brilliant 4 days in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “BOOK NOW”
Reviews.Author: beachlife_8
Reviews.Content: Wow. We have just returned from The Molino Stucky and words cannot say how amazing a hotel it is. Every single member of staff were polite,friendly and welcoming. The hotel upgraded us as it was my partners birthday whilst we were there. Our room was fantastic with the most wonderful view over Venice. We were treated as though we were royalty and made to feel very special. A birthday cake,champagne,card and Hilton money were all placed in our room as a surprise. Breakfast is a must in the hotel as the quality very good and choice was endless well worth the money.We drank cocktails in the Skyline Bar that has views over Venice from its terrace.These too were amazing. A cruise ship passed our suite window one morning and we have never seen a sight like it. Every single second of our stay from booking in to checking out was perfect and that is all thanks to Mr Ferreo and his team. A BIG THANK YOU from Jeannette and Paul

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nate A
Reviews.Content: Great location I believe even a better location than on the main island of Venice. The staff was excellent and after letting them know we were on our honeymoon they upgraded our hotel for free to a hotel with a view! I could be happier with this hotel. Both my wife and I really enjoyed this hotel and although we would probably never stay that long in Venice again if we were to visit Venice there is no other hotel we would stay at, but this one! Free shuttle service to the main island is great too!

Reviews.Title: “4 days in Venice”
Reviews.Author: traveler29556
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 12 day vacation to Italy. We began our visit in Venice and stayed at the Hilton Molino Stucky Venice. We flew into Marco Polo airport and took the Alilaguna public water taxi from the airport to a stop directly in front of the Hilton. It was efficient, inexpensive and offered a nice introduction to Venice. The exterior of the hotel reflects its former life as a flour mill while the inside has been nicely redone with a modern, spacious lobby and several restaurants. Check-in was easy; however, the staff were uninformed that Hilton Gold members receive complimentary breakfast and it took three staff members to set this right. Our room was supposedly an upgrade, but it only had a partial canal view. The size was standard for an American hotel room, and the furnishings were in good condition. The housekeeping staff did a nice job, and the entire hotel felt very clean. We had breakfast every morning at the hotel, and it was excellent. The staff was attentive and friendly. The buffet offered a large selection of yogurt, fruit, cereal, breads, pastries and hot items. We did not eat at any of the other restaurants in the hotel because there were so many great places to try in Venice! The gym was well-equipped with multiple treadmills with individual tvs, an elliptical and several weight machines. The hotel offers free shuttle service to Zattere and San Marco from 9AM until midnight, except for a brief break around 9PM. It runs every 15 minutes or so and made traveling between Giudecca and the mainland quite easy. Based on other reviews, I thought that Giudecca would have several restaurant options and might be a nice place to spend the evening; however, we found it to be very residential and vacant, perhaps because of the time of year we visited? Overall, we greatly enjoyed our trip to Venice and had a good experience at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Overwhelming view”
Reviews.Author: Dogsheep
Reviews.Content: The Sky bar is the Hiltons cocktail bar on the roof, great cocktails, smiling service and they even let us use their free boat shuttle service back to piazza Piazza San Marco, all in all a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: anuwat1303
Reviews.Content: We paid 140 euro (exclude breakfast) for one night we stayed in Hilton Molino and we thought it was quite a good value for five star hotel in Venice. The rooms are clean and spacious by Hilton standards. The downside is that there's no free wifi (9 euro per day) and the hotel shuttle starts a bit late at 9 in the morning (from November till March). Otherwise, the staff are friendly and the hotel itself is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel, very spacious by Venice standards”
Reviews.Author: TheFrog59
Reviews.Content: This place is a converted flour mill and pasta factory, not on the main island but the free hotel shuttle to Zattere (5mns across the water) and to St Mark's Square (a further 5-10mns) runs 2 or 3 times an hour and is excellent. The hotel itself is huge, very well appointed and clean. Rooms spacious and comfortable, although I hope (for the rest of you) that not all rooms have a toilet for the handicapped like ours did. It's ideal if you need such a facility but when you don't, it's an uncomfortably high perch... Initially we were a bit disappointed to find that, despite specifically booking a Kingsize Deluxe Plus room (the Plus bit means a view of the water), we were given a twin. They changed it, but a little apology for their mistake would have been nice. We ate in the main Rialto bar - good but very expensive. The Skyline Roof bar is nice (but the Roof pool is closed until May). We also followed signs and eventually found the Spa - but I think the healthy exercise aspect is travelling the mile of corridors, stairs and lift to find it. If travelling from Marco Polo airport, the most direct is the Allilaguna (or something) B boat, which stops right outside. If you want to visit Murano (for the glass etc), be aware that if the hotel suggests a free complimentary taxi boat, it's a nice ride in a classy boat but it delivers you to a glassworks with the mandatory visit of their gallery and a clear expectation that you part with large amounts of money to purchase a piece of glassware (mostly upwards of 5000 Euros). The marked prices are at least 4 times what you should pay, and even if you limit yourself to the small tourist-type necklaces to appease your conscience, you will pay 25 Euros for something which costs 6 Euros in all the souvenir shops. We fell for it, but console ourselves by saying that this extra covered the taxi ride, the excellent demonstration, and he was a nice chap anyway. Overall, an excellent hotel, with easy access to the best places to visit - but don't miss the last boat back at around half past midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: DEBT07
Reviews.Content: Room was really quiet which is exactly what we wanted. Shame no complimentary mineral water , unusual for Hilton & 5 star hotels, did have tea/coffee making though. Free shuttle is great, works perfectly to get to main island. Staff at Hilton excellent, very accommodating. Skyline bar great feature. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Had to pay for upgrade.”
Reviews.Author: amberlower
Reviews.Content: I just read of a fellow Diamond member and was disappointed to find that the hotel took points for OUR upgrade and it was to a room with only ONE view of Venice (the other member mentions TWO views? - corner suite? ) I would have thought that if they were going to give an upgrade, they would NOT have taken the points, and we are ALWAYS given an upgrade, being Diamond for many, many years . This definitely puts a dampener on what was otherwise a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT miss this experience”
Reviews.Author: kakha
Reviews.Content: First a note on me so you can judge my review. I am a Hilton Diamond member so usually get an upgrade. This time I certainly got an upgrade -- to a fabulous side room with two separate views of the city across the water. Nonetheless, regardless of your status the entire hotel is worth seeing and worth staying at. It is an amazingly renovated hotel, with beautifully restored beams everywhere, high ceilings, and a totally great atmosphere. The staff are all friendly and the breakfast (if it is included) is excellent. They keep the hot food hot, which is not always the case in some hotels. The Executive Lounge is good but not one of the best. Finger foods are fine, cheese is excellent, and okay choice of wines (and spirits later on in the day). Are there any drawbacks? Yes, one -- location. You do need to take the hotel's free water taxi across to the main part of the city. This can be a little annoying if you like to walk around a town for an hour or so, return to the hotel for a short break and then out again (that's how we operate). However, I would stay here again because the free water taxi goes about 3-4 times per hour and takes 5-7 minutes to get across. In the end no big deal because when you come back to the hotel you are in a stunningly fabulous place. [I am writing this review in the lounge, looking out across the water to the main part of Venice. Life is good.

Reviews.Title: “The quality of the food was terrible, except for the breakfast. The worst meal in the lounge and shockingly priced. Disappointi”
Reviews.Author: Lisa C
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed that the hotel was only accessible by shuttle boat. It was relaxing. The roof top was spectacular with an amazing view. We would stay here again despite the food prices and quality of some of the food;))

Reviews.Title: “It's the people that make the Molino 5 star”
Reviews.Author: EssereVeneziana
Reviews.Content: I was booked in to stay for 10 nights at the Molino Stucky Hilton for Carnevale. I decided to extend my stay and spent my whole three week vacation! I have to say, it's not the appointment of the rooms that makes a hotel 5 star, it's the people. I've never met better hotel staff. The staff at the Molino were unbelievable. Professional, friendly, warm and sincere. They all made my time in Venice magical. Make sure you dine at Barcaromi Restaurant. The food is awesome (have the Fegato ala Veneziana). Both the chefs there are amazing. Guiseppe, Abdel and Giovanni at Bacaromi - THANK YOU! .... Guiseppe is a powerhouse. I don't know how he does it, but he runs the restaurant like clockwork and still manages to give every guest full, personal attention. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like I was staying at the best hotel in Venice: a quality hotel for Valentine's Day!”
Reviews.Author: NJBond
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel, inside and outside, a real pleasure to stay here. We were staying for Valentine's night so really wanted the hotel to live up to our expectations as it looked stunning from the pictures I had seen online. The instructions for arrival by car to the hotel given on the Hilton website were accurate and very helpful. We arrived from Tronchetto parking and took the vaporetto to Zattere and then the free shuttle to the Hilton jetty. All ran smoothly. Upon arrival the concierge and FOH staff were professional and efficient. Our room was stunning, spacious and in trend with the style of Venice. Lovely, quality robes and slippers in the room which I think is a nice touch. I loved the separate dressing room area and somewhere to store the luggage other than in the main bedroom. We spent the afternoon relaxing and having some drinks in the bar. The service was fantastic and the bar area roomy and relaxing. We sat at the bar with a fine bottle of Bisol Prosecco and a very welcoming bar man who happened to be practicing his cocktail mixing techniques and offered us a free cocktail to taste his new creation! What a treat! We were eating out the hotel for dinner as we had prebooked but we did notice that the Valentines menu was â‚¬120.00 each which we thought was very pricey.The concierge service was exceptional - the lady told me straight off how to get to the other side of Venice for our restaurant booking, what water bus to catch and all the times, very impressed. Skyline Bar was intimate and romantic but didn't get to see the great views as it was dark (and very cold!!). Cocktails were strong (a little bit too intense) and for one Mojito and one Mai Tai cost nearly â‚¬30.00! I thought the free shuttle service to San Marco square and to Zattere was an excellent service, it really helped to explore the main city of Venice with ease. Maybe running a later shuttle than 12 midnight may have been an idea, until 1am would have been useful. We opted out of breakfast as this was going to be â‚¬30.00 for the two of us and thought this was rather excessive ...... would rather grab a cappucino and croissant in a little cafe somewhere.On departure we also were give a discount voucher to save money on the parking at Tronchetto - this was a good deduction and saved us about â‚¬12.00. Overall a beautiful hotel which oooooozzzeeed luxury, style whilst keeping traditional features in place. Only down side was the cost of the drinks/food/mini bar ...... it really would be a hotel to stay in for a special occassion to really appreciate it ...... which we did :)

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in the world!”
Reviews.Author: Kauai-Biz-Traveler
Reviews.Content: This is one of the true 5-star hotels that lives up to its billing. It is by far the nicest hotel experience that I have had in visiting over 30 countries and hundreds of cities around the world. The service is first rate to every person on the staff. There are more nooks and crannies in this hotel for meetings and socializing as well as all the well-adorned expected amenities, spa, restaurants, etc, that you would want in business or leisure travel. The only downside for some people would be the extra water taxi ride to cross over to the main sections of Venice. However, they offer a free shuttle with 3 convenient stops and a separate water taxi service to visit the glass factories that is also for free (something that would cost about $150+) as an excursion from the shopping district. So, I actually consider the separate location away from the crowds, and with the free shuttles to be a positive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully appointed room”
Reviews.Author: NeddyBun
Reviews.Content: Mixed impressions. A good location with free shuttle service to St Marks Square and Zaterre. Our room was beautifully appointed, clean, comfortable and quiet. The breakfasts were up to the standard you would expect and the staff were slick. But, the converted Molino lacks a bit of character and warmth. The ground floor bar and dining area was reasonably busy, but the atmosphere and service was slightly unwelcoming so we didn't linger long. The rooftop bar was an improvement but you pay a premium for the view. We stayed at the end of March (technically 'out of season') and the rooftop pool was closed, even though the weather was glorious. Sad, as we would have enjoyed a post sightseeing swim.

Reviews.Title: “Five star for Venice, Three star for elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: OzayrO
Reviews.Content: In Venice even the crap hotels get a star just for being in Venice it seems. You will notice scummy hotels carrying four star ratings. This hotel wasn't an exception. Overall throughout the world dont expect much cleanliness in Hilton Hotels. The carpets were dirty and I haven't been to a five star hotel, junior suite without a shower before. They didn't have a turndown service, no complementary water in the rooms and the food is astronomically expensive (â‚¬18 for a sandwich and â‚¬8 a coke). The hotel is on its own island so getting around is an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful city over rated hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Truthtel
Reviews.Content: Let me tell you trip of a life time for me and my husband. But this hotel almost ruined it for us. I had to call to get our room cleaned for whatever reason maids skipped our room 2 times. Toilet paper oh ya had to ask for that too. The food is over priced garbage and they charge you a fee to eat in there restuarnt. In town they do but at my own hotel please. New years eve dinner a joke food looked like reheat yuck. Drinks included for the price of the party. Well they tried to charge us for that too. I had to pitch a fit which was embarrassing. It was like 400 euros for the party. We ordered room service breakfast they didn't give us at all what we ordered and the coffee was burnt taste like it was old or something. Just all around a really bad stay. Please if you are going to spend money to go on a trip do not stay there it will make your trip awful. To top it all off the only thing they did for us was take off the room service charge. Oh by the way it's illegal to charge you a coperto charge is illegal in Italy. Once again in town they do it but definitely should not in your own hotel. Just buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay....Raising the bar for other hotels in the area!!!”
Reviews.Author: MSoca
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect the first time we visited three years ago and it was perfect now that we took our three small kids to Venice for their first time. When reading reviews please keep in mind that what might be perfect for me it might not suit your needs. That been said I want to mention that the hotel location for us is ideal. Giudeca is right in front of Zattere and St. Marks and the hotel offers a convenient free shuttle service to both islands every 20 minutes, not a minute late, it takes 5 mins to Zattere and 10 to St. Marks. We also took the vaporetto to get to Lido, there are vaporetto stations everywhere. We had a suite and a double room (connecting since we had the kids, rooms # 608-609) on the sixth floor, very spacious and beautiful decorated with murano chandeliers, classy with a rustic feeling. In total we had 2.5 bath and plenty of closets and sitting area. Breakfast was inlcuded and it was plenty of fruits, meats, cereals, yogurts, juices and different rolls. I would like to mention and give credit to Fabrizzio who went out of his way to help me fight a really bad cold bringing me hot water, lemon and honey to help me with my voice, the restaurant staff was very attentive and friendly.The views over the Grand Canal are amazing, you wake up in the morning and look outside your window and its like a post card, the sun shinning and to see the golden color over the city is overwhelming. Don't miss Signoretti the Murano Glass factory. They offer a free taxi to the island of Murano to visit a blow-glass factory. The place itself is a museum. Beautiful pieces, the art of blowing glass is ancient and its pass from generation to generation, there is no school, is a way of life, an art. You won't feel obligated to buy, they won't push you but you will want to have some of this unique pieces at home. The entire staff is correct and professional always willing to do what they can to make you feel great and help you in any way needed. The concierge service is available to help you find places and make reservations. We needed a babysitter one night and they sent Paola, a fine young lady who spoke perfect English and who my kids enjoyed talking about Venice's culture and history. Our experience was one to remember and I will always consider coming back to the Hilton Molino Stucky while visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: steven m
Reviews.Content: I love to travel. 4-6 times a month... 85 countries....000's of hotels but the Hilton Molino Stucky is like no other. Coming from Florida I wanted somewhere special to celebrate Valentine's Day and my birthday. It was Carnivale time so Venice sounded fun. We stayed here once before and had a fantastic time. It was soo good, I decided to return. Unusual because my preference would normally be to try somewhere else. However, I'm glad we did. Upon our return we were blown away. This is unlike other hotels. Arriving by boat is a unique and fun experience. Travelling across to St Marks by the hotel water shuttle iseems like the best way to arrive in the heart of the city. Upon our arrival at the Molino, the staff were superb. Incredibly friendly and helpful. This was a consistent theme throughout our stay; the management clearly spends a lot of time selecting and training their staff. From reception to waitors to housekeepers, they were all superbly attentive and made us extremely welcome. They genuinely seemed delighted we were the there. Our suite was magnificent; the view is the best in Venice, surpassed only by the view from the Skyline bar upstairs. This hotel has it all. It was hard to leave. Only the beauty of maginificent Venice could make us leave. This is truly one of the world's most fascinating and romantic cities; terrific to walk around. The one night we ate dinner at the hotel, we were really surprised. The hotel is a huge imposing edifice (a former flour factory) with bumndles of character. Its corridors are unique and there are loads of nooks and crannies. However, I thought the restaurant might lack character. The opposite was true. Somehow they managed to create a small intimate and atmpospheric restaurant in the middle of this magnificent hotel. The food and wine were delicious perfect. It felt like we were in a restaurant hidden away in a small town nobody knows. I can't remember the name but I heartily recommend it. As a contrast, the Skyline bar was trendy and fashionable. Great place place to visit and a fun contrast. Drinks were well made and we enjoyed relaxing there at the end of every day. Without hesitation, I can fully recommend this hotel. It was so good, I felt compelled to write a review (my first) as I want you all to shre in this magnificent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, but Frustration Abounds !!!”
Reviews.Author: Firefyter304
Reviews.Content: Our trip of a lifetime.... Carnivale in Venice, and a 10 night stay at the Molino Stucky. It should have been perfect, but there is always more to the story. To be fair, it was probably the busiest time of the year for the staff of the Hilton, and they seemed to put forth a proportional effort, but sometimes that effort seemed to go nowhere. It started a little rocky when trying to arrange a shared taxi from the airport through their concierge.... you can only arrange this 24 hours in advance of arrival, and flying from the west coast it meant we were in transit at this 24 hour mark. Good luck getting through to the concierge at Carnivale time.... any clue how frustrating it is waiting on automated hold on a cellphone in an airport and then being cut off 15 minutes later... twice? So we have a back-up plan, send an e-mail with our names, flight number, arrival time and a request for the service, and then check for a response at the next stop on our journey. This should work, right?... Wrong, the response says "find our contact information you need below".... and includes their phone number.... ARRGGGHHH. So we get to Venice 28 hours later (a delay in Paris, and lost luggage in Venice) and find that we have no hotel taxi, but we can hire a private taxi at 120 euros plus luggage fee.... Its Carnivale after all. So what do we do?, what any stupid Americans would do.... we go Alilaguna, because who wants to pay for the private taxi. A LONG two hours later we arrive at the Molino Stucky after seeing every Venice stop on the Blue Line enroute. The hotel is beautiful, the front desk help are so understanding of our frayed and tired attitude, and the bellman Roman is an absolute delight in getting us settled in. The room is on the Giudecca wing facing an interior courtyard.... not as fancy as the room pictures on the website show, but it is comfortable and at this point anything with a bed and a shower will do. We go downstairs to find that on Giudecca on a Sunday evening, in the winter, probably none of the 4 restaurants are open (yes only 4, the rest are osterias which means drinks or finger food).... OK, we will do one of the Hiltons restaurants. We head to Bacaromi, because its too early for the Aromi, and we have an AMAZING selection of tapas, a fried selection of shrimp, squid, and octopus (their version of fish and chips), and a half carafe of wine. It was wonderful, reasonably priced (70 euro plus tip), and the bartender who took care of us was great. So things are looking up, and now its time to recoup from our long day and half getting here. At 3 A.M., the alarm clock goes off, because it says its 8:30 and the last traveler was kind enough to leave the alarm set. Finally get the stupid thing turned off and awaken at 9:00, ready for coffee and new adventures.... coffee is instant Nescafe (GROSS...) and we missed the shuttle to the main island by 5 minutes. We find Roman, and he kindly tells us where we can find a small grocery store on Giudecca (the Coop, pronounced Copa), and we fall in love with the fresh selection of fruit, bread, cheeses, and ham.... back to the room with our bounty and a little food to perk us up. We finally meet up with our concierge, and he kindly sets us up with a little sightseeing and party reservations that we asked for. We do Venice that day, and then a little bar-hopping that evening in costume.... It is all so Venice!! Back to the room where the bed has been turned down and little candies on the pillows, (leaving that 2 euro coin under the pillow works) try to set the clock and make sure the alarm is off but unable to make the clock work, so we use the cellphone as a back-up. Alarm clock goes off at 5:30 A.M. although it says 11:28 (I swear it's possessed), so we get up a couple of hours later and do our morning routine.... instant coffee (getting a little used to it), go to the Coop and pick up breakfast stuff, and miss the shuttle by 5 minutes. My wife does the spa for a couple of hours where she is foot molested in the jacuzzi by some letch from Lido who is hitting on her relentlessly, but otherwise states it is a beautiful facility. We do more sightseeing (the crowds are getting heavier) and shopping for gifts to take home to the family. We always seem to hit the shuttle when its going to Zattere, not San Marco (there is a rotating pattern), so we find ourselves walking through Dorsoduro and over the Accademia or Rialto bridge to get to San Marco. Restaurants are a trip... they charge you for bread and water, coperto, (a cover charge) if you set at a table, although they may not provide it to you. Water is always bottled and cost more than beer or wine (so we drank a LOT of wine) and the food is expensive.... sometimes really good, and sometimes not. Pizza is everywhere, but its not like we are used to in the US. We did find a place called a rosticceria, that grills a lot of different foods (vegetables, meat, etc) and it offers it up buffet style... good quality, fair pricing, no coperto, and always open when we came by. That is also a problem that requires planning.... restaurants seemed to close at 7 or 8 P.M., and were also closed for a 2 or 3 break mid-afternoon. Do try the Devils Forest Pub.... great atmosphere and drink, OK food, and free Internet (which cost 28 euro a DAY at the hotel). We did the Murano, Burano, Torcello excursion.... it was a RIP-OFF. The trip only gives you 30 minute stop on Murano at one glass factory for a quick demo and then a trip to their showroom.... then back on the boat (what about the other factories, the glass museum, and a bite to eat?). The stop at Torcello was 50 minutes, and it only has a church, two restaurants (both closed), and a couple of snack bars and tables set up flea market style with the same tourist goodies you find at San Marco. Oh yeah, it cost 1,50 euro each to pee here.... back on the boat and off to Burano. This was the neatest stop of all because it seemed like an actual community with shops, restaurants, and real people (kids dressed up for Carnivale), so we ditched the tour group, bought gifts, had a meal (best fish of the entire trip) and then caught the ACTV boat back to Cannaregio. We found out that we could have bought a regular Blue Line ticket for 15 euro each, and gone to the same islands on our own schedule, without paying for the tour. The concierge did tell us that they can arrange for a private taxi to take us from the hotel to Murano, but the charge would be covered by the factory where we made our purchase.... sounds iffy to me, because the factory rep at our first stop stated the Hilton covered it as a comp to their guests. Now the hard part.... the weekend leading up to Shrove Tuesday. It was PACKED with people, not just on the main island, but everywhere. The hotel announced a new shuttle schedule in order to cope with demand, but it seemed to only add a few more time slots in the evening (but not during their one hour break around 9:00 P.M.). Now, with the approximately 350 rooms and all of the guest's trying to get to San Marco on a 40 person shuttle every half hour, you can see where this equation becomes problematic. After a while, the crowds are so fearful of not making the shuttle and having to wait a half hour, that they just crowd onto the ramp and the launch like hysterical cattle! More than once we were bumped off the boat, and the next shuttle that arrived was only going to Zattere, so we did our long walk again over the bridges to San Marco. Oh yeah.... The alarm clock.... we spoke with the maids a couple of times, asking them if they could set the right time on it (I swear, there was no way to do it), and after a couple of attempts at it, they just unplugged it and turned it toward the wall so you couldn't see the display. OK.... So am I totally down on the Hilton? NO, it was just Carnivale, and what could they do? If I return, I would stay on the main island.... the shuttles only run from 9 to midnight at half hour intervals, and we always seemed to end up in Zattere.... it would be nice to just walk out of our hotel and get something to eat without worrying about what time it was or which stop we had to go to. I would go back and have dinner at the Hilton, and would definitely go to the pool bar (which was closed for winter, so we couldn't get access to the views). Otherwise Giudecca is best used as a respite from the crush and crowds of Venice. Venice itself?, well its old, has a LOT of old master style of art (but you wait a long time in line to see it), and once you figure out where your going, its quite a trip. Getting lost in Venice is part of the fun (don't trust the Per San Marco signs, they LIE), eating food you can't readily pronounce or identify is an adventure, and seeing everyone do the costume dress-up like little kids at Halloween is a blast. Just be prepared for "Ehhh, its Carnivale, what can we do?".

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RevJack-HM08
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed on our 40th anniversary in August 2008. The hotel gave us a suite which we appreciated very much. I would like to return at some point and time because we loved the city and would like to visit all the sights we missed last time. The only negative was that we had to get a water bus or hotel shuffle to St Marks square, but they came very frequently and you can obtain a daily or weekly pass very reasonably. The hotel provided a very good breakfast buffet and the service was good and the rooms were very large and quiet. We were amazed at the structure of the building that liked that it was a converted factory with huge wooden beams holding up the floors above. This is a great hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Practical, friendly”
Reviews.Author: FotallyTocused
Reviews.Content: I was really pleasantly surprised by the Molino Stucky. Friendly, efficient staff. I liked the location at the end of Guidecca. You're away from the crowds and the hotel boat (5 mins to Zattere, 10 mins to San Marco) is frequent and leaves right from the door (as does the Alilaguna boat to the airport). There are a couple of good restaurants nearby. The hotel also seems to offer some really good rates. Downside: breakfast was so-so -- poor coffee, which is a disappointment in Italy, but otherwise a large buffet. If I knew a really romantic, intimate little place in Venice that was clean, comfortable, quiet and great value I might just recommend that instead -- but I've only stayed at the Stucky and I thought it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful...Simply wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Mike G
Reviews.Content: Location is a little mark, so use the hotel shuttle - it's free. The building and grounds are gorgeous, the staff very inviting and the rooms were clean and comfroatable. Big breakfast buffet included, with great cappucino's. Worth the price many times over!

Reviews.Title: “This is one of the best hotels in Venice as long as you are not in a hurry to get to the mainland!”
Reviews.Author: suner_12
Reviews.Content: In general, Venice hotels have small rooms and most of them are quite shabby. This Hilton is an exception. The rooms, lobby, breakfast room are all very cosy and big. The breakfast is excellent. The drawback is the fact that you are depended on the shuttle or else the public transport. The shuttle is not frequent enough. If it fills up, you have to wait for the next one. Also the public transport takes a long time because it stops very often until you get to San Marco. So if you are ready to get stranded on the island and does not care about this, then this is definitely the hotel you should stay in.

Reviews.Title: “A nice Hotel, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: TomL_Philadelphia
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice Hotel. Maybe if we had not come directly from the really perfect Hilton Rome Cavaliere I might say a great hotel, but I doubt it. Definetly at most four star. Some things that could be better (granted many are minor) I can't remember ever having a room at this price with absolutely no place to open a suitcase. Not even those folding stands. Nothing - zero - use the floor, or forget it. The rooms are small (at least ours was) but a folding stand would have really helped. Room Service might as well shut down at 11 PM (actually more like 10:45). We arrived late and unless you wanted a desert or a bowl of vegetable soup, there is nothing to eat. Not even a cold sandwitch is available. This was really annoying.Don't expect sympathy from the staff, just an explanation of the rules. You do get a nice view from the Canal side rooms, but the location, needing to take a boat to get to San Margo and the Grand Canal, really isn't ideal. Getting there initially is also somewhat of a hassle. Actually getting to any hotel in Venice is, it is part of the charm and the unique experience of your visit to Venice. It is just that they just don't make any effort to make it easier. We drove from Florence. Over the phone they explained where to park, but from that point on you are pretty much on your own. "Take the number 2 (no explanation of where to get it and it sure isn't obvious) to either the third stop or the fourth. If you get off at the third stop get on our boat (finding that is a challange in itself) or if you get off at the fourth stop walk over two bridges to the hotel." I suspect in the daytime this is all very easy. But a late at night there is not a soul around either at the parking garage or either of the boat landings to ask directions from and signage is practically non-existant. By your second day all of this is second nature, but I can't imagine why they don't email out some directions prior to your arrival. You will evenutally get there just fine. It is a little surprising that you won't see a bellman until you are inside and if arriving late like we did, not even then. We had to get all our luggage to our room with no assistance at all. You arrive on their boat but no one meets it to take their luggage? Maybe at a Hilton Garden that's expected, but shouldn't be that way at a Hilton. I know this sounds like I am really upset and dissapointed about our stay here. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice. It is a beautiful hotel with great views and from what I sampled very good food. It wouldn't take much at all to make it much better - the small things do matter at these prices. There are many things to really like about this Hotel, The views, the decor, the food, but the minor annoyances just keep me from gong to that 5th star. Again, after coming from the Cavalieri (who may deserve 6 out of 5) I just can't rate this one nearly that good.

Reviews.Title: “The best of all hotels in the best of all cities”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorClements
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Venice Hilton, the Molino Stucky, last year and the first thing we did when we got back was to book another 13 nights this year. We enjoyed it last year and weâ€™ve enjoyed it just as much this year. Last year, we were reticent about staying at the Hilton because itâ€™s on Giudecca Island about 300 m from Venice proper and the only transport is by boat. We were worried about transport in case it was too infrequent or full. The Hilton provides a free shuttle hourly to Saint Markâ€™s and weâ€™ve never had any problems getting it. Giudecca is relatively quiet (itâ€™s a real place full of real Venetians unlike the region round St. Markâ€™s). Even better, there is a direct public water bus from the airport to the hotelâ€™s doors, which makes getting from the aircraft to the hotel a very easy and inexpensive task. There are several excellent restaurants near the hotel along the Giudecca water front. The hotel is massive; itâ€™s a converted mill withlots of wooden beams and cast-iron pillars. We thought that the conversion from mill to hotel has been well executed. Itâ€™s a refreshing change from the anonymous you-could-be-in-any-city-anywhere-in-the-world hotel. The Molino Stucky has genuine character. Because we are Hilton Honorâ€™s guests and the hotel wasnâ€™t packed (February is the quiet season), we were upgraded. Our room is quite fabulous and we have a view across the water to Venice, which is probably the worldâ€™s most beautiful city. I asked for a quiet room and I havenâ€™t heard a sound since I got here. It takes three things to make a great vacation: location, hotel, and staff. Venice canâ€™t be beaten if you are photographers who like architecture as much as we do. The location of the hotel is excellent. The staff weâ€™ve met in the restaurant and lounge couldnâ€™t be better; we very much enjoy chatting to them because they are remarkably open and friendly (not like those in some hotels who turn a smile on and off as they pass you). Because our breakfast is included, we eat in the dining room where the buffet is very diverse. Typical breakfast buffets in other hotels often include a limited range of poor quality cheeses and cold meats. Here the cheeses and meats are first class (I love their soft cheeses like Gorgonzola) . There is also a remarkable range of cakes and pastries that are to die for â€“ unfortunately as a diabetic they are a temptation that I have to resist. The only thing missing are salad vegetables such as tomatoes and olives. This is a hotel we love and, like Arnie, â€œWeâ€™ll be back.â€� If you are interested in viewing our Venice images, they are at www.pbase.com/clements

Reviews.Title: “The very best”
Reviews.Author: Chris O
