Reviews.Content: This Hilton is at the very top of the Hilton standards, the staff are helpful, attentive and genuinely caring, the building itself is a real inspiration and the restaurants serve very good food options. The valentineâ€™s night special meal was very special and my wife and I also particularly liked the sky bar for both the great service and views with wow.

Reviews.Title: “Grazie, Hilton Molino Stucky!”
Reviews.Author: pbukta
Reviews.Content: Molino Stucky served as a great home base for our week in Venice. This hotel is located on La Giudecca which is across the water from lively San Marco Piazza. However, the hotel has its own complimentary vaporetto service and there are other water taxi spots nearby, so access around Venice is no problem. The professional staff take great care to welcome you with Venetian hospitality. And our little 2-year old girl always got attention! Breakfast consisted of a wonderful layout of European meats, breads, cheeses and the freshest fruit anywhere. Our room was spacious by American standards with high ceilings and a large bathroom with a separate shower and tub. We did notice the room felt a little damp, but we attribute that to Venice. MY TIPS: If you have the time, explore La Giudecca! There are gorgeous churches, a little co-op store and a handful of nice waterfront restaurants with stunning views of Venice. If you're travelling with young children, forget the stroller and invest in a good Deuter backpack for hauling your bambino or bambina. I always enjoyed getting up early and hiking several bridges to a water taxi stop. Along with the locals, I'd drop a Euro, down an espresso and start another wonderful day in Venezia!

Reviews.Title: “Venice is well worth a visit just for the Molino Stucky!!”
Reviews.Author: CDA_11
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 3 nights at the Molino Stucky Hilton in Venice and are in love with it!! The hotel is wonderful and great attention is paid to details. Set on the island of Giudecca, it is easily reachable from Marco Polo airport. If you want to save money, catch bus number 5 outside the terminal to Piazzale Roma for â‚¬5 per person and then the boat line 4.1 or 4.2 to Palanca for â‚¬6.50. The hotel is just on the right! Another way is to use the Alilaguna boats @ â‚¬15, which stop just outside the hotel. The journey time is 1.40 hours, whereas the bus option is a lot quicker. To go to St. mark's Square, you can use the free shuttle provided by the hotel which leaves at regular intervals, however be aware that the 40 mins past the hour shuttle only stops at Zattere and does not go to St. Mark's Square. The service in the hotel is first class. Their motto is 'smile' and their service is always provided with a smile and a helpful attitude. At breakfast, guest satisfaction was constantly checked and nothing was ever a problem. The Executive Lounge is next to the lobby bar and provides food and drinks all day long, until 2300. A room with a view is a must. We di not have dinner in the hotel as there were not many vegetarian options, but went to Zattere and ate at the Ae Oche restaurant, which was quite nice and offered good prices for Venice!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Arturo_mx
Reviews.Content: Well runned property, all te way Hilton do this. Easy to get to VeniceÂ´s must to see atractions, getting a boat that takes you to the front shore where your trip to Venice must begin. ThereÂ´s only two things to improve. 1.-Internet conection is expensive, I just donÂ´t know why hotels keep trying to get more money for a must-to-be-free amenitie. and 2.-No iron is availabel for each room, you must to go to an ironing room for each floor, what is so uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely outstanding. A fantastic hotel and excellent staff service”
Reviews.Author: 27kwai
Reviews.Content: A simply marvellous experience. A birthday trip for my wife was met with outstanding service from the concierge, front desk and breakfast restaurant staff. Our one niggle would be the housekeeping staff service where some lapses of service contrasted with everything else. A heart-shaped array of petals on the bed, a plate of chocolate dipped strawberries with a bottle of Prosecco on arrival and a 2nd bottle with a birthday cake on my wife's birthday all set the tone for a great stay. The concierge arranged good value transfers and changed them when the disappointing BA cancelled our flight at the 11th hour and we had to re-arrange our route. The quiet location is great - with a superbly reliable boat service to both San Marco and Dorsoduro. Being on Giudecca gave us a chance to explore places and eateries we'd not seen before- places used by local people with very reasonable prices. Where else could you get a good quality litre of wine priced at 9 Euros...with good food, in a restaurant in Venice?

Reviews.Title: “On the other side of all the action”
Reviews.Author: JennyVarela
Reviews.Content: Though this hotel was wonderful, my only negative comment is that you had to take a water taxi which the hotel provides for free which only runs every 30-40 mins and ends at 10pm. Hotel not for someone who wants to be in and out throughout the day. A huge plus is their bathrooms. I never thought I was a bathroom person until I saw theirs. Absolutely gorgeous

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! One of Hilton's Best”
Reviews.Author: Robert D
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. We stayed there using points but were still given rooms with views of Venice. It was just an awesome view. It was a sold out weekend we were there but they were still able to give us 2 connecting rooms. The only meals we ate were breakfast using the concierge lounge as a Diamond Honors Member. It was by far one of the best breakfasts in an executive lounge I have had. We also used the lounge for some drinks and light snacks in the evening. Granted the Hotel is huge and sometimes things are hard to find, but when in Italy, why rush and get worked up over small stuff? Overall it was great and we can't wait till we go back to Venice. We'll definitely be staying in the Molino Stucky next time. PS. I emailed the GM Mario ahead of time because we could only get one room on points and within a day or so, our reservation was updated to reflected 2 rooms both at the same amount of points. From reading other reviews on here, he is extremely responsive and very good which is reflected in the quality of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very good!!”
Reviews.Author: FlaviaHC
Reviews.Content: I spent only two nights in this great hotel with my husband and my son and liked very much. The hotel has the usual american standard but with some local charm due to its instalations. The service is friendly too. We were given an automatic up grade to a bedroom with a view, which was very nice! We had no meal in the hotel, just took a drink in the delightful rooftop bar with a magnificent view of Venice! It is worthwhile to try a Belini or an apple martini, very good! The rooms are spacious, comfortable and very quiet, the bathroom is beautiful and complete, all extremely clean. Although the hotel is at another island, it is close to main attractions of Venice and we did not feel isolated because the complimentary transfer of the hotel / venice / hotel works very well, times are fixed and the boats are comfortable and punctual. It takes between 5 and 8 minutes to arrive at Piazza San Marco, it is only necessary a little planning and attention not to miss the rides.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravel48
Reviews.Content: I experienced Venice with the usual special touch of Hilton. Staying at the Hilton Molino Stucky Venice was awesome! The view of Venice from the roof top pool was absolutely beautiful. A must stay when I return.

Reviews.Title: “Still arguing for money”
Reviews.Author: Norbert_PA
Reviews.Content: Been at this hotel within a conference delegation. Everything was arranged and paid through the organisation of my conference. At check-in as well as during check-out the reception confirmed that the room was already paid through the conference organisation. I got no bill or whatsoever. A month later I saw that the hotel charged 181â‚¬ to my private credit card. Without any authorisation, without any notice. I asked for explanation by email - no response. I asked again. I asked again. Finally they claimed that the conference would not pay for me so they simply charged my credit card. I responded that I would not accept that - no reaction again. And so on, and so on... A hotel of this category, treating customers like in the soviet union, refusing any communication, illegally charging credit cards without authorisation - be warned, check your bills and your credit card statements in the months after your stay!!! By the way: the food at the hotel restaurant is gross and extremely overpriced. Therefore, the restaurant staff is adequately rude! Lovely roof terrace bar, at least.

Reviews.Title: “So very perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Dawby
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week during my honeymoon. The hotel itself is gorgeous and the veiw of Venice is amazing. I can only imagine how beautiful the rooftop pool must be when it is open. Everything about the hotel delivered and the free shuttle across from Guidecca, where the hotel actually sits, to San Marco square was very convenient. We did buy a water bus pass for easier travel to outlying locations. Most of the restaurants and tourist sites are on the main island but there are a few wonderful places to both eat and visit on Guidecca. Make your trip to Venice more than a day trip and stay at the Molino Stuckey!

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong with this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chervin18
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights using my hilton honors points. I was a Diamond Elite member at the time so I was upgraded to a nice room with a view of the canal. The staff also left a half bottle of wine in my room which was a very nice touch to show that they appreciate loyal members. Breakfast was good but I wouldn't pay the amount they were charging if you didn't have free coupons for being an elite member. Luckily, I didn't have to pay. The selection was extensive. There were fruits, bread, bacon, sausage, eggs (not a big fan as they were soggy), cheese, fresh fruit juice, etc. The executive lounge was one of the highlights of my stay here. There was free soda, alcohol, and appetizers. If you've been to Europe, you'd know that soda is extremely expensive compared to the American prices. I've paid as much as 7 euros for a can of soda. Anyways, the attendant said we could bring soda back to our room. My wife and I ended up staying at the lounge after they had already closed but the attendant kept asking us if we wanted more alcoholic beverage. The service was excellent. TIP: Make sure you tip your servers well. The location is excellent. There is a free shuttle boat that goes to a station where you can go to St. Mark's square. It wasn't crowded and the frequency often enough that we didn't wait long when we missed the boat the first time. There was no need for us to take a water taxi. We enjoyed our stay here. We felt that 2 nights was plenty for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Todd R
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite with a view for my 20th wedding anniversary. The hotel staff do their job in a professional manner. The hotel is clean and it was clearly rebuilt with quality in mind. The downstairs lobby area is very roomy although finding a trash can is a feat. The mini-fridge has sensors for everything.. if you move it, you bought it and no extra room for anything. The water busses stop about a mile on either side of the hotel and you have to walk to get there. The hotel has it's own water bus that goes to 2 sites besides the hotel and is fairly easy to catch. The hotel is so large it has it's own map. I expected a much larger room than what I was given and was disappointed with the over all experience. I am not saying to not stay there as it may be the best hotel around, but I would recommend against paying extra to get the upgraded room.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Venice”
Reviews.Author: S1Alex
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little tricky to get to from the airport but bite the bullet and take the 120 euro water taxi...within 20 minutes of getting our bags we were at this beautiful property. Stayed for 3 nights over new year... Pros: we actually loved the location being that it was new years and the main island was crazy. The free shuttle is amazing and easy to use. Staff is exceptional. rooms are modern and big for europe. cons: only issue we encountered was loud noise during NYE and the staff addressed it both during and after the stay when it was brought to their attention. Gold/Diamond Hhonors - this hotel and city is worth the trip. executive lounge was phenomenal and breakfast was very good. went to Rome Cav afterwards and the Molino Stucky service and product was a much better experience. All in all, when traveling back to italy, we will always make a pitstop in venice from now on. This hotel is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Venice Panorama”
Reviews.Author: TheOldHacker
Reviews.Content: We had just come off a cruise and chose to stay in Venice for a few extra days. We decided on the Molino Stucky as one always knows the quality they will receive from Hilton. We were definitely not disappointed in our choice. We had a beautiful, quiet room that overlooked the city and the dock where the Hilton's private launch picked up and discharged passengers. The launch ran on a specific timetable and could be relied upon to be punctual. It was quite comfortable. The concierge arranged a trip for us to via a private water taxi to Murano for a tour of one of the Murano Glass Factories. It was a totally enjoyable experience. I highly recommend the Molino Stucky. The service was excellent, and the breakfast buffet was more than one could imagine - even better than the Cavalari in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great service”
Reviews.Author: Jayda L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights over new years eve and had a great time. The hotel rooms are fantastic with great beds and wonderful bathrooms. We also really enjoyed the service of free hotel boat to take you across the water. We had room service one night and this was great, if a little expensive. The location is a bit out of the way from the main parts of venice, but this added to our experience of being able to see more and get away from the crowds when we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Priceless”
Reviews.Author: Gail K
Reviews.Content: i was worried about the location before we stayed....how wrong was I! This is the perfect place to experience Venice. When the main island overwhelms you, get on the shuttle back to this little paradise and unwind. The island of Giudecca is also worth some exploring. We stayed for 4 nights and wished it was longer. The staff was great. The property was clean and comfortable. The spa was so relaxing. We loved sitting by the windows watching the boats go by. We will be returning some day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with character and great staff”
Reviews.Author: twyford_tiger
Reviews.Content: 30th birthday gift trip. Not a cheap trip, but upon arriving in Venice and seeing other establishments, actually quite reasonable. Very nice to be on Guidecca too, rather than actually Venice itself. The free water shuttle to Venice was great, the only problem being the 2 hour break in the evening (so restricting you when you want to go for dinner). The room we had was a great size, with a great bathroom too. And lovely to be able to open the windows in the room, if you have breakfast/an afternoon drink there. wifi is not available in the rooms themselves, so prob not top choice if that is important to you. Re Venice itself, a Gondola set us back eighty euros for 30/40 mins, but obviously has to be done!! We had a fantastic Pizza in Rosa Rossa, which was the cheapest and best meal whilst there! Harry's Bar is famous and apparently a must do if you read the guidebooks. We would say don't bother - approx 50 euros for a glass of water, a bellini, and a poor cheese and ham sandwich! The aguillera is the best way to get from the airport (25 euros each, return), and gives you a 100 minute boat ride to the hotel (a water taxi is 110 euros each way). You'll need a lot of cash for a visit - and don't expect to find any bargains in the shops!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Quality and Professional Staff”
Reviews.Author: SoCalSchmedley
Reviews.Content: My experience at this property has been outstanding. Unfortunately we were only here for two nights, so we did not experience many of the amenities other than the room, view and staff...all of which were - again OUTSTANDING. I stay at Hilton's around the world and this property is right up there with the best while the staff is clearly a cut above and to me that is what really matters. We were given an outstanding suite with a nice view and wonderful living area which was approved in advance by the General Manager, Mario. Carlo, the head Consierge, was extremely helpful and corresponded with us regularly with good insight and information. Upon arrival, the Guest Relations Manager, Constance met us and after a quick briefing on local attractions, schedules and suggestions escorted us to our room to ensure everything was perfect (it was). Finally, Irene was one of the most enthusiastic folks I've met in a long time...her suggestions for things to do, setting up a tour of a Murano glass factory and significant local transportation was critical to making use of our limited time. Finally, several very considerate demonstrations of appreciation were afforded us at every turn without our asking...we felt like truly appreciated friends, not pain in the butt guests. I highly recommend this property and commend the staff on making the trip one we enjoyed thoroughly.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: Overseasamerican
Reviews.Content: What a view! This ranks among the most fabulous hotels we've enjoyed. The view over to Venice is breathtaking both day and night! The room itself was beautiful, luxurious bath (although the shower ergonimics were a bit odd- but nothing to complain about). The hotel is in a converted flour mill- so the room also had beautiful beams and pipes making it so much more interesting than the normal 5 star room... With free water taxi service included to several points in Venice- so romantic and fun!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like living in a palace”
Reviews.Author: susana0172
Reviews.Content: Felt like living in a palace. Although it still maintained its original structure, it didn't look old fashioned at all. Room was nicely decorated and spacious. The service lived up to Hilton standard. Located in a separate island gives you more privacy yet you still can get to the "city centre" in no time. Breakfast was excellent, lots of selections of high quality food. Simply the best breakfast we had on our entire euro trip. two thumbs up for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hiltons worldwide!”
Reviews.Author: biguzzia
Reviews.Content: What's wrong with tripadvisor ranking this 75th in Venice? The reveiws seem very good and I can only add to the postive notes: it's definitely one of the best hotels in the city and in my experience one of the best Hiltons I have ever stayed at anywhere in the world (and we've seen a few...) The building is amazing and very unique, the views from the front rooms and rooftop pool are breathtaking, the food in the executive lounge is excellent and the location is perfect: away from the crowds but with a very convenient shuttle service straight into San Marco. I couldn't fault this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for holidays”
Reviews.Author: hoharrison
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best Hilton hotels in the World. Views to Venice downtown are great (from rooms with view and from rooftop bar). This is good place to spend holidays. Only problem with this hotel is location. It was hard to find complimentary hotel shuttle boat docks from downtown and other boats are quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great locatiom”
Reviews.Author: Richminn
Reviews.Content: W e were thee in December. Weather cool. Great place to be modern yet in a historical city. Offers water taxi service to st marks square free of charge. Free wifi. We were at the club level allowed wine and snacks. Hotel was not crowed. Had a great room plenty of space but it ws 390 euros a night. Went into town both days had plenty to do. Went to the glass island of Muro waste of time do not bother. Water taxi to airport 106 euros 40 minute boat ride. I would recommend. Staying in an historical hotel in this old town would be problematic. The only draw back is not local restaurants to eat at.

Reviews.Title: “Big maze of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tcemal
Reviews.Content: Looking back at reviews I found that there were rooms with thin walls, so I requested not to have "these rooms" A response came and was told "not to worry" On arrival we got a room with adjoining door and couple with a baby next door, you could here them cough. We went to reception and told them we were not happy and he immediately changed our room. My wife and I were tired so decided to eat at the hotel restaurant ARomi, the food was actually good and had normal Venice prices. The hotel is very large, it is like a maze to get to your room ( I found it annoying) others like it. The shuttle service is great and on time and convinient. I personally wouldn't stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Good choice, particularly for those who know Venice”
Reviews.Author: John_Conakry
Reviews.Content: First time visitors might be put off by an "international hotel" and one on Giudecca. But there are distinct advantages: the staff are better than in many traditional Venice hotels were tourists are tolerated for the money they bring and the location is not crawling with tourists. Rooms looking over the canal are great and probably worth the supplement. As eating out in Venice can be very expensive and not particularly good, access to the Executive Lounge is a real bonus. If you're flying in, the Alilaguna boat is very convenient - dropping you at the doorstep - and the route, if long, could hardly be more scenic. I could imagine the atmosphere in the hotel might be different if there were a large conferrence in town, but over Christmas I found it perfect. Molino Stucky would be my first choice on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Lynn & Stephen Tour”
Reviews.Author: Lynn M
Reviews.Content: What a great staff! The hotel was lovely. It's location is not in the main area but between the hotel boat and public transport it was easy to get where you wanted to go & it was quiet/relaxing. I look forward to going back when it is a little warmer and the pool is open.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: n0tat0urist
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a 5 min boat ride from the main island & 10 min from the main square, but don't let this put you off. It's nice returning to the calm location of the Hilton after a busy day on the main islands. There is also no chance of getting lost on the way to the main square, when the boat drops you off directly in front of it. The hotel itself is very nice & clean. The rooms were large for such a historic European city. Breakfast was quite expensive but there was plenty of choice. The layout of the hotel can be a bit confusing & easy to get lost but that's Venice. The roof top pool is a great place to watch the sunset; the reflections of the deep orange sky of the pool make quite a good picture.

Reviews.Title: “Venice overlooking the water ... perfect!”
Reviews.Author: DandMtraveling
Reviews.Content: It couldn't have been a better experience in Venice. We visited in November, so the rooftop bar was not open ... I believe this is a reason to return! (The only drawback was arriving by boat from the train station, the closest dock is a bit of a walk, over two bridges and with a rolling bag ... it is a little hassle.) However, from then on transportation was a breeze. The Hilton has boats to San Marco and another stop a few times an hour. A lovely, lovely 15 minute ride with grand views in every direction. Our room was very nice, the executive lounge breakfast, afternoon coffee and evening wine offerings were very pleasant. The staff in every contact were Hilton-Professional.

Reviews.Title: “Very accomodating stay, Transportation to historic area convenient”
Reviews.Author: ParadiseBlond
Reviews.Content: Hotel was well appointed and my room had an excellent view of the canal. As this hotel is a converted mill, the layout of the common areas are a bit dispersed but I believe this added to the charm of being in Venice. Food was okay, basic standard fare.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice venise experience”
Reviews.Author: sebaillet
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and very nice staff. Rooms are large and very clean. The hotel is beautiful, it's an old mill entirely restored. The roof top bar is a must do at night. The breakfast buffet is amazing. Staff very helpful and the hotel has a complementary shuttle to Murano which is a great experience .

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Molino Stucky Venice”
Reviews.Author: AnnieFSLondon
Reviews.Content: My husband and our 5 year old son stayed here last weekend, we had a suite which was very large and well equipped. A very nice double bedroom, first class bathroom, big spacious living area (with sofa bed) and a small kitchenette area, which we didn't use but would be perfect if you had a baby. The buffet breakfast was first class and all the staff were exceptionally friendly - I don't think our son has been given so many lollipops ever!! There's a very nice roof top bar and swimming pool (shut during the winter) and a regular, reliable taxi service. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, ok stay for 1 or 2 day visit”
Reviews.Author: alotofdots
Reviews.Content: We've been two days to venice and stayed over in the hilton. The hotel is located in a 1900s industrial mill. The location is not downtown and you can only go by boat. The hotel has a free boat shuttle service. The room was good, the roomservice not great. Since it was just to sleep and at the discounted rate it was quite good value. So I can recommend it if you get a good deal. Some other info that can be helpfull: there is a public boat service from the aitport to the hilton. It's called alilaguna and costs eur 25 pp roundtrip. It is however not very fast and you will pass many stops. On our way back we took a water taxi. These boats are fast and quite nice. Cost is around eur 100.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: Scenic ride to the hotel from the train station via water taxi through the canals. The Hilton Molino Stucky is a huge hotel, very modern, and beautiful. Location is good, just across the water from the main attractions with an water shuttle running all hours to two stops, Zattere and St. Mark's Square. We were staying on hotel points and were upgraded to a huge beautiful suite. The executive lounge on the main floor had nice food, wine, beer, etc available throughout the day and night. People were helpful and friendly and the spa was exceptional. A great place to stay and a great area to visit and do all the "touristy" things. I'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Graze and relax at the fabulous first floor lounge all day!”
Reviews.Author: wbacon
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Molino Stucky is a short vaparetto ride across the way from San Marco, and a great place to stay. We had a small 2-room suite that included the use of the well-stocked lounge (you want that), and had room for us and our three teenagers. The lounge had great foods and drinks throughout the day. Our smallish suite required using the convertible couch and a cot, but the staff put the room back in order forst thing in the AM. Beautiful hotel and setting, and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Byrnie86
Reviews.Content: The Hilton rarely fails to deliver and this was no exception! The location was perfect, 5 minutes from the hectic tourist trail of Venice centre. Service was excellent as was the food. The sky bar was extremely expensive, a brandy and coke and a cocktail came to aprox Â£50!! The view alone was worth one or two tho!! Definitly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great November stay at the Hilton Molino Stucky”
Reviews.Author: Noah25
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hilton Molino Stucky Nov. 19-21 2011. The hotel is very new and modern. The price for the room was amazing for a 5 star hotel of this caliber. We did have some issues with our original room (I-Pod player will not work without requesting a non-battery operated clock radio, hotel room hair dryer needs an adaptor from front desk before use, and voltage converter in the bathroom malfunctioning). The Hilton Molino Stucky made up for these issues by giving superb customer service. Thank you to Constance the amazing "Guest Relations Manager" for resolving our issues and making our stay absolutely amazing. We will stay here again on our next visit to Venice without question. Be aware the restaurant is extremely expensive so try to eat other places if money is an issue. Also, the sign for the free boat transfer from the two stops in Venice to the hotel on Giudecca island is extremely hard to find. Don't expect a big hilton sign. There is a small white sign with times and it only says the Hilton in small letters in the upper left corner I believe. The free boat transfer from San Marco Square to the hotel is in front of the Londra Palace hotel and the transfer from Zattera is in front of Chiesa Gesuati (Gesuati Church). This is good to know before you get to Venice. Thanks again Constance!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: kaeru2915
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night after arriving from a 14 day cruise. Our ship docked directly across from the Molino Stucky so that was convenient. It still cost us 50 Euros for a water taxi to get across the canal. After that the Hotel has it's own water bus - which is free. The front desk staff was very good and were able to let us in our room at 8:15am-after we left the cruise ship. They also booked a water taxi for us to take us to the airport the next morning(100 Euros). The room was very nice with a nice view of the canal. We ate supper in the bar/restaurant - it was good but a little expensive.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it--location, room, extras all 1st rate”
Reviews.Author: DCkatherineM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights after a wonderful Oceania cruise in late May. Check-in was pleasant and fast, not sure if we were upgraded, (I am HHonors gold) but our room faced the water and we had executive lounge access and a free FABULOUS breakfast buffet. The room and bathroom were spotless. The free shuttle was very convenient and we loved the rooftop pool. I agree the management should police the lounge chairs at the pool and remove towels and books saving loungers for absent 'owners'--this is really the only criticism. As for the executive lounge just being a separate part of the lounge, this is much nicer than being a closed-in room. We loved the quiet, private feeling while being a free 10 minute boat ride from everything.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location and Views”
Reviews.Author: alanp53
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Molino Stucky in April 2011. Great decision. My wife was due to have a knee replacement and we needed to be located to avoid unnecessary walking (you can do a lot of walking in Venice!). No trudging through the narrow streets with heavy luggage to find your hotel. One simple water taxi from airport to hotel and you are in their reception. Splendid room with amazing view over Venice. We 'vaporettoed' our way around the city (make sure you buy a season ticket so you can hop on & off at will). Great service in the Hotel, with included spa, but make sure you book a package including breakfast (which is exceptional!) as eating and drinking is mega expensive (unless on an expense account or do not need to stick to a budget e.g. cup of tea Â£8). However there are so many places to eat in Venice. Quality is high and sticking to the fixed price menus is great advice. It was a magical trip made all the more special by staying at the Molino Stucky.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service - Pick your room carefully!”
Reviews.Author: tmarven
Reviews.Content: When you book into a Hilton you expect the highest standards of service, quality of food and elegant surroundings. The Molino Stuckey Hilton surpasses these standards but has a few foibles the discerning traveller should consider. There are advantages to being located on Giudecca island, away from main hustle and bustle and with impressive views over the Guidecca Canal onto Venice central. However, with little to do, or places to eat on the island (in November) you are dependent on either the free hotel water taxi or local water bus to get to and from the centre. We had no problems with either service, but did see some services were cancelled due to fog (in November). It only takes 5 minutes to get from the hotel across the canal to Zattere, or about 10 minutes to get to St Marco. So consider your itinerary carefully to enjoy the quiet of Giudecca and the activities across the canal. [We did discover a nice local restaurant called Osteria ae Botti about a five minute walk from the hotel opposite the water bus stop Palanca.] The hotel is a lovely building having been converted and refurbished from a flour mill in 2007. The complex is actually a collection of inter-connected buildings with names conveniently beginning with A to G. The highlights are the Skyline bar and roof terrace with 360 degree views of Venice - which is fine in summer, but lost when dark and foggy (in November). We were very pleased with our room in Biennale (block B) overlooking the canal and done out to a very high standard UNTIL we started to hear every word and bodily function from the adjoining room. Seriously, this is a MAJOR ISSUE in these rooms. We asked to be moved, which the hotel did straight away - but it was a pain to re-pack and un-pack. So definitely check if you're getting an adjoining room and if so get a guarantee that you won't have neighbours! The hotel is also a major venue for business conferences, and whilst there were none there at the time of our visit one could imagine the addition noise and pressure on services. Not the cheapest place to stay but one that will appeal to the discerning traveller. We would definitely stay there again but pick our room carefully.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - Clean and Gorgeous Rooftop Pool”
Reviews.Author: MplsAmandda
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Italy and France in September of 2011. We flew from the U.S.A. and landed in Venice. We took the water taxi (linea blu) from the airport to the Hilton Molino Stuckey. The Hilton was nearly the last stop on the water taxi. I think it was approximately a 45 minute boat ride with 5-7 stops before we arrived at the Hilton. This was about the last thing I wanted to do after a long flight and the time change, but the price was too good to pass up. A private water taxi was something like 120 euro and we couldnâ€™t justify it. I think our tickets were something along the lines of 10 euro each. The taxi ride was quite beautiful as we were able to take in the many sites of Venice via water. It was amazing and my first taste of Europe. I enjoyed it very much. We were dropped off at the Hilton which is across the waterway from the main part of Venice. We checked into the hotel and took the elevator to our room on the 5th floor. The hotel room was gorgeous. It was clean and very well appointed. It was very spacious with a comfortable King bed. The windows in the room overlooked a side canal. We then took the elevator to the rooftop pool. The views of Venice from this lookout were SPECTACULAR. I couldnâ€™t believe my eyes. It was a hot day in September so we immediately took a swim in the pool. It was ice cold and felt wonderful. All of the lounge chairs were unoccupied, so we each picked one and relaxed after our long trip and took in the beautiful view. I then wanted a diet coke, 8 euro later I had one. OUCH! The prices at the hotel were VERY high. We stayed two nights at this hotel and utilized their free water taxi service constantly. It was wonderful. The hotel staff was very nice and spoke english which helped even though we were trying our best with our limited Italian. I loved Venice and wished we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel slightly out of the main city of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Aussieellie83
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a secret saver and while we were slightly disappointed that it was on a separate island to the main city, our beautiful room made it worthwhile. The boat shuttle runs frequently and quickly at all hours so it's really quick and not inconvenient to get to the main island. We received the kind of service you would expect at a 5 star hotel. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel; Incredible City Views; Close to everything (via water taxi) but feels far away”
Reviews.Author: travelinlight58
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hiltom Molino Stucky in Venice. The location was great. The views of Venice at night were really excellent. You are just a free boat ride away from St. Marc's and the hustle and bustle of the tourists' Venice ... but you are far enough away that it feels more relaxed somehow. We didn't have problems with the free shuttle. It was always on time. It worked for us. If we were in between shuttles and wanted to get back, we just took one of the city water taxis. The staff was great. Always friendly. Good recommendations and service. Executive lounge was good. Not as good as some Hilton International Exec Lounges (like Cavalerie Hilton Rome, Bangkok Hilton, etc.) ... but it was good enough. Whenever we wanted something we saw one night, but it wasn't put out yet, the staff accomodated and gladly got what we wanted. On top of all that, we were provided a free upgrade to a Suite! Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Much...”
Reviews.Author: BBBSTEPS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 days and had a great experience for the first 36 hours....until a couple of loud, rude, obnoxious women checked into the connecting room. Then we discovered how thin the walls were & how inept the hotel management is. This totally non smoking hotel refused to enforce that rule when notified several times that these women were polluting our room at all hours with cig smoke. We listened to them discussing it and the staff refused to deal with it. Completely unacceptable as the hotel's air handling system did nothing to disperse the smoke. Totally ruined the stay. The hotel should have dealt with the situation but failed completely.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a wonderful island location”
Reviews.Author: dubsthcentralboy
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. Certainly the best hotel I have stayed in while in Venice. The restaurant is fantastic and the rooftop bar and pool area is great, very relaxing. There is also a fantastic spa in the basement on the hotel. Rooms are very, very nice and well-appointed.

Reviews.Title: “VERY mixed bag of experiences at this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: LQGuy
Reviews.Content: We are fortunate to travel the world and stay at very nice hotels. Most of the time, we provide very positive reviews. The Molino Stucky though left us very pleased with two staff in particular, but VERY disappointed in the rooms! Lets start with the positive: The front desk clerk, Rita, checked us in. She was friendly, very pleasant, and helpful! To our amazement, she remembered our names throughout the four nights that we spent at the hotel. A very nice touch! Other positives include the fact that this is a newer hotel, so the public areas are clean, well planed out, nicely furnished, and not showing signs of wear. The fact that they were able to maintain the integrity of the exterior of the building was also nice. I'm afraid this is where my complements change to an honest account of some serious problems. After check-in, we went to our room after an exhausting journey to Venice. This is where the problems began. I've attached pictures, as I suspect some folks might not believe what I'm about to share. Upon entering the room, we noticed a number of serious flaws: 1. The carpet was disgustingly dirty! This is the first hotel we've ever stayed in where we made certain to use the slippers provided, for fear of walking bare-foot on the floor. 2. There was a large, thick wad of hair on the floor. That same thick wad remained in our room the ENTIRE FOUR NIGHTS we were there (pictures were taken on the third night). 3. There were droplets of blood on the left side of the bed sheets. 4. There is NO sheet between the comforter and the fitted sheet. This is very unsanitary, as you're covering yourself with the same comforter as EVERY OTHER PERSON WHO SLEPT IN YOUR BED before you! And once again, this was the way it was every single night! 5. The curtains were coming off of the rod on each end. 6. The inlaid twisted glass in the mirror was broken out. (this was not a big deal per se, but when taken in light of all the other issues, it was still noticeable). So when time permitted later after check in, we went to request a different room. We were taken by one of the bellman (who had the personality of a dead fish!) to look at another room. While everything else was in good working order in that room, the carpet in it was in even worse shape than the one we had! At this point, given how tired we were and not wanting to raise a bigger fuss, we just decided to tolerate what we had and stayed in the room we were already in. Food in Venice is over-priced to begin with (they have to ship everything in). We expected that. But the food prices in the hotel lounge are significantly jacked up from even those prices. In the hotels defense, the US dollar is worth far less than the Euro, so things are going to be more expensive for US folks. But even factoring that in, prices were grossly inflated here. A walk down the sidewalk from the hotel will take you to a few dining options on Giudecca that are more reasonable and better quality. As a Hilton Honors member, and having saved points for years for my dream vacation to Venice, I was extremely disappointed that this was what I got for my years of loyalty! Rita at the front desk (and a female staff member who worked both at the breakfast buffet as well as the lounge (she resembled the female concierge) were both very kind, welcoming, and a great addition to the staff there. But I'm afraid the rest of the experience was a bit of a let-down. We knew we'd be taking a shuttle boat to/from Venice (which we enjoyed the solitude of getting away from the crowds). We just weren't expecting a hotel of this caliber in a world-class city to be this new and yet so worn in its bedrooms. Very disappointing!

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: EdmondUK
Reviews.Content: First thing first, let's make no mistake about it: the hotel is not in Venice proper! But (and this is a very important BUT), the complimentary, frequent, ever so reliable boat shuttle service will whisk you to Zattere (5 mins) and St Marco (10 mins) in no time, 7 days a week. That's where the quibble ends... Now, about the good stuff: - Very agreeable room and superb club floor benefits which include free wifi and access to executive lounge with free drinks and canapes throughout the day (disclosure: I am HHonors Gold and was upgraded to a standard suite but the club room is reasonably priced for what you get) - Exceptionally friendly and helpful staff by Italian standard - Adequate fitness centre which is a rarity amongst European hotels, big or small (that said, don't bother with paying 25 euros for access to the spa area) As for Venice itself, yes, all the cliches are true: mind-bogglingly beautiful, photogenic and romantic! I would personally recommend 3 full days and no more to cover all the main attractions worth seeing (I certainly won't bore you with what is what and where to go here)... With regards to eating and drinking, please don't miss: Cantina del Vino gia Schiavi - technically a shop that sells booze but they also serve a huge selection of superb cicheti (Venetian canapes) which are 1 euro each. I defy you not to go back again and again! Bancogiro - a trendy but unpretentious restaurant that serves excellent and well priced food I Rusteghi - this watering hole tucked in a rather obscure corner near St Mark's Square has the most congenial host you will ever encounter (in Venice anyway) and the best freshly sliced parma ham in a mini bun you will ever have (in the whole wide world), especially when washed down with a glass or two of the house champagne like I did! Buon appetito!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location but.....”
Reviews.Author: Roger8218
Reviews.Content: As a piece of hotel architecture this is great....the conversion from a massive flour mill to the Hilton cost them Zillions and it shows but... I am a Hilton Diamond member and stood in line for 20 minutes at reception watching back office staff watching me whlst I watched them and the single receptionist working the desk. The arrival atmosphere is poor as since I last came it looks like they have gone after the cruise ship clients and this feels like a one night in and out room factory rather than a really gracious Venetian hotel...a real shame. For Hilton Honours members the current Executive Lounge area is just a fenced off part of the ground floor restaurant....it didn't feel special and it wasn't and no facilities or staffing that you would noramally get.....maybe this is temporary I don't know. Pool area is good on the roof with sensational views but no proper policing of the limited number of loungers many of hich were 'occupied' all day by a towel and a book and nothing and nobody else.....the hotel could just deal with these selfish guests by throwing their kit over the wall after half an hour of abandoning the loungers if they wanted to make it fair for everyone. The room I had was great both large and well furnished but try to avaoid rooms just looking down on where the Hilton ferry boat arrives and departs as the dock makes a lot of noise bouncing up and down all night long even on the 5th floor. Management need to get a grip on some of their staff...this is meant to be the HOSPITALITY industry....if there were more Italian staff I think it would be a lot better but too many East Europeans polite but cold. Finally the Concierge showed the most wonderful and moving behaviour to a handicapped guest I have seen anywhere...some of the other hotel employees could learn a lot from him!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Nydia B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only one night at the beginning of November. Hotel was spacious, clean, nice, up to date. The room was really good, we actually got an upgrade and we were very happy with this. Francesco at the check-in area was very attentive, service was outstanding. The shuttle service is very convenient, easy access to Venice, we didn't mind having to take the shuttle to get to Venice, you are right there within 5 to 10 minutes. If you are looking for a hotel with an old charm this might not be for you but if you appreciate new, spacious, modern, westernized hotel this is a great option for you. We loved it! Would definitely stay there again. We arrived at the Marco Polo airport and the we decided to take a shared taxi to the hotel (60 euros for 2 people), they have a both at the airport, I believe it is both #71, this was a great option for us, it is not as expensive as water taxi ($120 euros aprox) and it takes a decent amount of time to arrive to the hotel. On the other hand if you decide to take the public water transportation (aliguna) it is very cheap but it is takes forever to get to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovey hotel, fantastic view!”
Reviews.Author: han76
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Stucky looks out across the beautiful Venice skyline. This is a fantastic repurposing of a former industrial building in to a well maintained hotel with great facilities. The hotel is on the blue line directly from the airport so is very easy to get to without the need for a private water taxi. Once you've checked in you can make use of the free, regular shuttle boat from the hotel to St Mark's Square. It's a great place to stay as you can enjoy the lovely view of venice, get across the water easily but also escape the tourist crowds at the end of the day. Staff are friedn;y and helpful, the roof top bar is a great place to unwind, and the leisure facilites can also help you relax. The island of Giudecca where this hotel is based also has a growing number of art galleries to visit and well priced local eateries olong the front where you can get good quality local meals in atmospheric local establishments.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday treat”
Reviews.Author: noopy66
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to Venice and stayed at the Hilton for her 60th birthday, we had a very good long weekend and the Hilton Hotel was very nice. On our booking via an agent with the Hilton it was mentioned that it was her birthday and the booking person asked for something nice but the hotel never acknowledged her birthday at all, not even a 'happy birthday' card or mention, very poor. The whole of Venice is accessed by boat as expected, and the hotel has its own service to the main islands which runs a couple of times each hour and is free, this was very good, however travelling on so many boats (had a boat to and from the airport as well) did eventually get to us, if we had stayed at a hotel on the main island then we would not have had to use so many boats, something to consider if staying at this hotel? We found the food and drink very expensive at the Hilton, it was better to travel (again by boat) to one of the restaurants on the main island as there was more choice of food and cheaper. The room in the Hotel was very nice and especially the rooftop swimming pool, with its fantastic views of Venice. So, overall a good long weekend break, but glad to be back home away from all the boats.

Reviews.Title: “NOT JUST LIKE ANOTHER HILTON HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: jfm31
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights in Hilton Molino Stucky in October 2011. It was a romantic and relaxing week end. Rooms are great with luxury bathroom, good bed and nice view on the channel! The hotel is located on the Giudecca island across the channel. This location is great as it is very quiet and good place to stay after a day of visit in crowded places. Very convenient Private shuttles that go to St. Marks and stop at the Zattere vaporetto station. Also useful direct vaporetto shuttle are available from and to the Airport. I would easily recomend this hotel to anyone. Special thanks to Mr Mario Ferraro, General Manager of the Hilton for his very nice and appreciated welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvtobeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before our cruise and enjoyed our stay. We were upgaded to a suite which was beautiful. The breakfast buffet was excellent and had such a great variety of food. This hotel is a maze, when we checked in we were pointed towards the elevator and needless to say we couldn't find our room, there seems to be 2 different sections. We ended up asking a housekeeper and she couldn't even find our room, we spent 15 mins. walking around with her to find our room, I felt bad because I knew we were keeping her from our work. I was a bit disappointed with the clerk that checked us in, he knew we were Hilton Gold members but didn't share any of the benefits with us, we had to ask for everything. We were never told about the executive lounge but were just pointed to the lounge next to the check in desk. All said and done it is a beautiful hotel and I would rcommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent romantic week end in Hilton, Venice”
Reviews.Author: Marykar
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in Hilton Molino Stucky in october 2009. It was a romantic week end with my husband. Due to his dimond hilton card we were upgreaded and got a room with a view to the channel. It was a really nice excperience, I would easily recomend this hotel to anyone. Please, note that the hotel is situated quiet far from the city center of Venice but the navette boat of the hotel (free of charge) provides the guests of the hotel to the easy access to the city centre. I really have nothing negative to tell about this hotel. It is a standard Hilton hotel resembling to some extend to all the others hiltons around Europe. The room was nice, spacious, well decorated with all the necessary facilities. High quality service. We have got local present and free vouchers for drinks upon the arrival. Good meals. The hotels has a swimming pool on the roof, rare feature for a hotel in Venise. Also I appreciated drinks in the Sky bar that has a spectacular view to Venise... Realy nice place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: DenverPrincess
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Molino Stucky Hotel was great. We had a fantastic big room with a king size bed and a marble bathroom. The hotel is very quiet even when it is fully booked. The breakfast at the buffet restaurant is pretty good too, thinking it is Italy evven Prosecco is served every morningand omeletts can be ordered as well. The service is very attentive and customer oriented. onlythe kitchen is sometimes low to replenish the buffet when too many people are eating at the same time. The free shuttle service is a very nice offer too and we used it several times. It goes to St. Marks and stops at the Zattere vaporetto station. Overall a great location on the Guidecca island awayy from the hustle and bustle of Venice but close enough to enjoy the goods parts of Venice. Even some decent restaurants are near by Ae botti, da Mori, Alltanella, are only a few to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the center but not an issue”
Reviews.Author: peeam
Reviews.Content: Just returned after spending 4 nights at Hilton Molino Stucky. It not on the main island but on Guidecca island. The hotel has its own regular water shuttle and is well connected by Alilaguna water bus from the airport. There is also a vaporetti stop about 5 mins away. The room was comfortable, not as big as what one would expect in USA when spending that sort of money. I did not eat at the hotel. There is a great restaurant, Osteria ae Botti, at the vaporetti stop. As most of the time would be spent sight seeing, one can always eat before getting on the boat to back at the hotel. Overall, a good but not great place/value to stay in Venice. If you snag a really good deal, then go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing oasis”
Reviews.Author: Thierry_Paris14
Reviews.Content: Although I do want to give a fair feedback, we were upgraded to a suite which was a nice surprise and might be taken into account while reading this. Property is vaste, staff is friendly and helpful. Suite room was big, something like 60 mÂ². Hotel is calm, bed is fine, so a very good rest. Furniture was not new and might soon need a replacement. The pool I on the roof = great view = very hot (probaly too much) water at the end of the afternoon. Hotel has its own shuttle to go to san marco and vaporetto stop is 5 minutes walk to the hotel. From there, you can go to main island or to tronchetto parking (one or two stops. A very pleasant stay overall, a refreshing oasis in the hot august weather.

Reviews.Title: “Venice and the Greek Isles”
Reviews.Author: bballwey
Reviews.Content: On a recent cruise to the Greek Isles, my husband and I spent one night before and two nights after at this beautiful hotel. The staff, the views and the amazing food made this one of my favorite stays ever!

Reviews.Title: “seems remote, but complementary boat is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: mbeth1403
Reviews.Content: Spouse, adult son and I spent five nights here, on points. Hotel upgraded us to a suite. Bedroom had doors closing it off from the sitting area, where a separate bed was brought in. Son thought that bed not comfortable, so, guess what, mother spent next four nights there. It was fine. I slept fine. Son shared king-size bed with father. OK with me, as, when I can't sleep, I like to turn on lights and read. As to room, it really was roomy. Bathroom had separate tub and shower. Roomy, deep tub is wonderful for working out kinks after a long day of walking, wandering streets of Venice. Water was hot, pressure was good, amenities were nice. As spouse is Hilton Diamond, we had access to Executive Lounge. This is important, as food in Venice is pricey, and not always that good. (An Italian we met in Lake Como some years ago told us that Venetians do not often eat out, and so restos cater mainly to tourists - not repeat customers, usually - and so, have little reason to worry about actually providing great food.) Back to Molino Stuckey: this hotel can be crowded, and expensive, when cruise ship people are doing a pre- or post- cruise extension. Also, hotel seems to do a big business in business conferences. Lots of 'suits.' That said, food in executive lounge generally good, some night better than others for evening snacks. Breakfast was wonderful: son has become fan of prosciutto. The cheese is wonderful. However, on more than one occasion, I think the coffee served in the urns was INSTANT!!! The only other small quibble: on the day we arrived, we requested a second luggage rack (as there were three of us, this does not seem a big deal.) An officious bellhop told us, "There is only one to a room. We don't have extras." However, a lovely, helpful member of housekeeping, who came to make up the extra bed, brought not only extra towels, soap, etc, but also, one more luggage rack. Be aware, there are no iron or ironing boards in rooms. If you request them, they will be provided, but you are told to call for them to be picked up. This was fine with us. Complementary boat service, by alilaguna, was fine, going to either Zattere (accent on first syllable), which is short walk to Accademia, or San Marco and the crowds. We spent several evenings in Executive Lounge, relaxing, and couldn't help but notice that Americans, even when not having had much to drink, seem to speak as if they, and their listeners, were hard of hearing. On more than one occasion, spouse warned me not to accost loud guests to pipe down. I was tempted. Other than that hotel is wonderful. Son and I even splurged on massages on our last day before flying home.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton hotel with NO A/C working in the room!”
Reviews.Author: jay_d304554
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel but the Airconditioning was not working in the room even with individual controls for the termostat! Unheard off and whwn I complained they said that the Heat was on and If I was Hot in the room I should open the windows--- But be careful of the Mosquitoes and other insects that may come inside at night!!! I think Paris Hilton should experience this!!! She will fire all the Staff!!! The good thing was they give you 2 bottles of water!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flyerno.one
Reviews.Content: The Hilton was a very nice choice in Venice, it is a rather large hotel, so if you are looking for the intimate getaway this is not it. The rooms were very large, by european standards, and you could actually fit 2 people in the bathroom at the same time. The hotel does provide a shuttle boat back and forth to the other part of Venice. There is not much around the hotel, so the shuttle is needed. The rooftop bar and pool were also very nice, but I don't think it would be open in the winter.

Reviews.Title: “Not very convenient”
Reviews.Author: SJM08817
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, great views (we were on the 7th floor), but the shuttle service was not very convenient. If you missed the shuttle at the top of the hour (i.e. because there were too many people waiting to get on) then the wait for the next shuttle is 40 minutes. Thought the cost of the breakfast buffet was too expensive. The rooms were nice and clean. Bathroom offers both a bathtub and separate shower - which is a nice option. Would not opt to stay here again as it was a bit out of the way. The shared water taxi to the airport was a good value, but again, the time options were not very traveller friendly.

Reviews.Title: “An above average Hilton, only "downside" is location”
Reviews.Author: urbansombrero76
Reviews.Content: This is an above-average Hilton with some extra amenities. Great value for the luxury-like quality if you don't mind a less convenient location. I would categorize this is a business hotel with some nice extras that made it more personal/leisurely (i.e., excellent Philip Thomas Roth bath products and beautiful rooftop bar with excellent views). In short, if you are looking for a "Western-style" hotel, this is perfect. If you are looking for an authentic, typical Italian or Venetian-style hotel/palazzo, you will be disappointed. Our room was right along the water, so we had great views of Venice in the morning. Excellent service all around. Beautiful, roomy, clean rooms. Breakfast/drinks are very pricey, but overall price for room is lower than average for the quality because of the location. On that - the only downside is location. It is not on the "main" island of Venice. You'll need to be flexible with having to wait for the shuttle boat to to the island and back. Keep this in mind, especially at night - the boat takes a break during the evening, and is not always on time, so you may be "stranded" for a while. We waited for almost an hour near midnight. You can take the vaporetto too as another option, which we did after waiting. Overall - if you can be flexible with time (you're on vacation, after all!) this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Safe Pick for Venice”
Reviews.Author: mhdh2011
Reviews.Content: The hotel is housed in an old warehouse or factory and was converted to a hotel serval years ago. Thus, one advantage that the Hilton has over other hotels in Venice is that once inside the feel of the hotel is like a new luxury hotel with the views of Venice, this was one feature we really liked. This hotel is well positioned to see Venice and is on the water but it is not in the middle of everything, if we were to go back to Venice we would probably stay at the Boscolo Dei Dogi Venice which is also out of the way but has a beautiful garden and a more Italian feel. The biggest drawback was the water shuttle, we knew that we would have to take the shuttle to get to Venice every day but did not realize the amount of time we would be waiting for shuttles and going back and forth between the hotel and San Marco, after a few days we had a good handle on the schedule but valuable time in Venice was wasted. Our room was a canal view room and the view was amazing and the first two nights were incredible. However, the walls are very thin and the neighbor next door was a heavy smoker and on our last night and the smoke got so intense that we had to change rooms. Also, the thin walls allow you to hear everything that the other room is saying, depending on the language the neighboring rooms speak and understand this may or may not be an issue. The breakfast buffet was very good and the club lounge had a good selection of local snacks.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest Properties owned by Hilton.”
Reviews.Author: Kevin6363
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel In Venice. Rooms are clean, spacious, and comfortable. While the hotel isn't in the greatest location they do have frequent shuttle service to the nearby islands. stayed here three years ago and enjoyed it both times. The executive lounge is very nice with complimemtary food and drinks throughout the day. Staff is very helpful, polite, and extremely professional!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MadHatterMom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of those places that was so comfortable and was in such a great location (in my opinion), that I would stay again in a heartbeat. It all depends on how you like to travel. If you like to stay in the middle of all the action, this may not be for you. However, if you like to stay off the beaten path and like to get a feel for how locals live, this is a great place to stay. First: location. As others have noted, this hotel is across the lagoon from the main city of Venice. We came in by train and had no problems taking a vaporetto - even with quite a few suitcases in tow. The vaporetto stop is Palanca and it lets you off a short distance from the hotel. So, again, no problems hauling the luggage. Once at the hotel, you can take their water shuttle, which goes in a triangle between Guidecca, Zattere and San Marco. We didn't mind having to wait for a shuttle, but if you don't like to be inconvenienced by scheduling your outings around public transportation, you'll want to consider an option right in the city. On Guidecca itself, there are a handful of restaurants and shops, so we liked being able to stick close to the hotel if we wanted. There was a very nice shop that sold Venetian masks that we liked and also a great convenience store that had water, snacks and even sold a pasta of the day. Now for the room. We got the Family Suite and it was fabulous. It was super spacious and had a little kitchenette so we could store waters and fix small snacks in our room. The room had one full bathroom with a separate shower and tub, sink and toilet and then a half bath with just a sink and toilet. The only oddity was that the bedroom had no door. It was open to the living room, which means there wasn't a lot of privacy. The free breakfast was fine. There was plenty of room in the buffet room where the food was laid out and plenty of tables to sit down. This is a very big property, but it always seemed really quiet and, believe me, after a day of fighting the crowds in San Marcos, it was a great place to come back to. As stated before, I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Travelling with the kids.....”
Reviews.Author: mkbk1234
Reviews.Content: This trip we travelled with our 13yr old and 10yr daughters. The hotel is located in Guidecca on the opposite side to the main attractions and cruise terminal. We booked the family king suite. This consisted of a king beg, separate room, a dining table, small kitchenette and a sofa bed. One bathroom, two toilets. Fabolous layout for us. The girls shared the sofa and we were able to close our room off at night. The fridge in the kitchenette is empty which allows you to purchase drinks etc in Venice. The breakfast was a typical standard affair, not the world famous breakfast that they advertised. To get to San Marco you need to catch the hotel shuttle boat which leaves about every 30 minutes. The downside is that at about 8.30pm they stop for about 1 and half hours. You are then stuck on San Marco till about 10.15pm. The hotel itself it huge, rooms are lovely. The bar located on the 8th floor has wonderful views at sunset. For us as a family of four, the dollor being what it was, it was good value for money. The room was a great size. If flying into venice, catch a water taxi which is about 110 euros and they will drive you straight to the hotel. Thoroughly enjoyed this hotel - Beds were still hard .....

Reviews.Title: “Fab, Fab, Fab”
Reviews.Author: shoefreak
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from Two nights, three days in Venice, staying at this beautiful hotel with my husband and thirteen year old daughter. First impressions were fantastic, when you see the impressive red brick building as you round the corner onto Guidecca Canal. Check in was smooth, and when there was a problem with our access to the executive lounge it was sorted out without fuss. Rooms are as to be expected and the breakfast was fantastic. (Included in our booking, but usually 15 Euro). The staff were always friendly, helpful and proffesional. The front desk and conciege especially so. The hotel run a shuttle boat to and from St. Marco via Zattere. This is a nice idea, however, I do not think it is run frequently enough and as much as you think you won't, you do finding yourself trying to structure your day around it's timings, especially around 5ish when you might want to return to freshen up before dinner. Also, the St Marco stop is actually at San Zacaria...about 5min walk from St marco!! I only have one small critisism and it is very small...we really noticed a difference in the hotel between Friday and Saturday. Saturday morning when we arrived for breakfast, we were asked to sit in a dining room a little further away from the main one we had been in on Friday morning..this room lacked the atmosphere of the first as well as the friendly service. This could have been due to the fact that the hotel was much busier and felt much more 'corporate'. Apart from this tiny thing we had an amazing time and were made to feel very special. :)

Reviews.Title: “Spookarama”
Reviews.Author: Spookarama
Reviews.Content: What a way to get to your hotel by water taxi as that was a treat and the hotel was wonderful, great bathroom and room was a good size. The 2 nights I was there were wonderful and the view from my room was great over looking the water to the city.

Reviews.Title: “A bit too far from the hub....”
Reviews.Author: Sophie c
Reviews.Content: Well on first impressions the hotel is lovely with fabulous features of the pasta factory it used to be. However, it really was a little too far away from the main tourist areas of St Marks Square / Rialto Bridge. There was a shuttle service but it wasn't as regular as you would expect and it was not made clear that there is one stop before St Marks Square which led to a rather confusing first night trying to find a restaurant!! It would have been a good idea if the hotel gave the shuttle times to you on arrival along with a city map as these were only discovered after asking the next day. The room itself was very nice although there were a few little niggles that should not have slipped by housekeeping such as the light on the shaving mirror did not work and despite a note mentioning this, it never got fixed. There is a piece of coving hanging down in the bedroom which made it a bit tatty and the bin in the bathroom had lost its pedal meaning you could only use it manually. One other thing that should be mentioned is that the restaurants are VERY expensive! On our last night after a biog lunch and lots of walking, we were going to have snacks in the Rialto bar but with a burger and chips costing about Â£23 we soon changed our mind! There are a couple of restaurants to the right of the hotel, the second of which we came to was delicious and reasonable and I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sidmouth4you
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights over the first weekend in October. Overall, the hotel was excellent and is well recommended both for quality of hotel and location. positives: We found the staff very friendly, hotel very clean and nice decor. negatives: We ate the first night in the Aromi restaurant, which we found a bit over priced, stuffy, small portions served and over rated. We ate in the lobby bar on the subsequent three subsequent evening though it has a limited menu (and my better half had on the last night to send back a raw under cooked beef burger - the first I've ever seen that feat). I did email the hotel to book the Aromi restaurant but never did get a response, so instead phoned ahead but never did work out if the booking was ever made. Whilst phoning from the UK I also asked to buy a birthday cake for my wife but which never materialised... Overall a very smart hotel let down by its restaurant / food offering and customer services. I would expect more as its not cheap (we were staying in an exec suite). On this basis I can only give it a three star. Must do better if it wants to reflect its charges. Ps the exec suite had its own kitchenette but with no cooking utensils and crockery it was a tad useless.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay here!”
Reviews.Author: jbabbitt
Reviews.Content: If you're a Hilton Honors member, this is the hotel you want to save your points for! This was our last stop in our 9 day trip to Italy. I'm glad it wasn't the first. I wouldn't have wanted to leave. Hilton Honors members have access to the Spa and Executive Lounge with free food all day long. Our corner room on the 5th floor had a beautiful view of the lagoon. We saw many cruise ships come and go. The Hilton shuttle boat to St Marks was very convenient. We really loved our stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service mars my dream vacation”
Reviews.Author: Hitman99
Reviews.Content: i stayed here with friends after a WIndstar cruise. Our stay got off to a very bad start when we were shown to a first floor room overlooking an interior courtyard, instead of the top floor room overlooking the lagoon that I had booked. Since the hotel was supposedly completely booked, I was told by the hotel manager that there was nothing they could do. Later I talked to several different guests who had changed rooms based on their complaints, the most common of which was the loud noise in the rooms underneath the rooftop bar. The hotel is handsome and luxurious in many ways, but maddeningly inconsistent. From the outside it appears to be one monolithic building, but it is actually several different structures, all of which seem to be at slightly different levels. As a result, navigating through the hotel involves several ramps, odd passages, and cul-de-sacs --- very confusing. Handsome glass art pieces are featured, but many of the carpets in the hallways are worn and shabby. The rooms are handsome, but vary widely in style. Bathrooms have buttons and control knobs that appear to have no function, and heated towel racks that don't heat. There are no reading lights for the bed, but several mysterious switches located a few inches from the ceiling (???). Internet service and in-room movies are quite expensive, and selections limited, except for a plentiful supply of porn ("Anal Debauchery", etc). Room service was very spotty. At one point a housekeeper entered our room unannounced, without even knocking, and said loudly "Are you OK?" As we looked at her blankly, she left abruptly. Good thing we were dressed. The lobby area, bar and restaurant is well appointed and spacious. However, I could not find a clock there, or anywhere else in the hotel. There were only a few newspapers available, and only occasionally one in English. In the morning, coffee was thoughtfully placed out for the convenience of arriving/departing guests, but no wastebasket. As a result, empty cups and sugar wrappers littered the area. As a Hilton Honors member, I had access to the Executive Lounge, which was one of the highlights of our stay. Signs throughout the hotel show the Executive Lounge to be located on the sixth floor, but that space is empty. The Lounge is actually located along the outer edge of the lobby restaurant, outlined by a cast iron railing, with access controlled by a card key entry lock. The lock was disabled, so almost anyone could wander in and partake of the food & beverages offered, which were quite nice. Breakfast offerings included eggs, sausage, coffee & juices, yogurt, cold cuts, toast, pastries, etc. Later in the day, finger sandwiches and other light fare was available, along with beer, wine, and soft drinks. In the evening, several hot appetizers were offered. As has been noted, the rooftop pool and bar area offers outstanding views of Venice across the lagoon, and of the many cruise ships entering and leaving the port. There are several nice waterfront restaurants within walking distance of the hotel, mostly moderately priced. The one exception is "Harry's Dolce" which is quite expensive. Overall, this hotel has much to offer, but the lack of attention to detail, poor customer service, and physical deterioration of the facilities detracted from the enjoyment of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Off on silly things”
Reviews.Author: gringottsgoblin
Reviews.Content: The location is spectacular. Though the water taxi service is a bit erratic and gets v busy at night and they abandon you (be warned). The hotel generally is very nice. The roof top pool, is cool and the bars and restaurant are nice though expensive, and the food is okay. The staff are very nice and very attentive and they get full marks. Then there are weird things. Number one ...no shower curtain or screen so water sprays all over the place..(annoying). Number two..There is no iron or ironing board and you have to go through a rigmarole to get one including bad directions to a "pressing room" which you can never find (still looking for it actually)..again annoying, and NUmber three..curtains that do not quite block out the light...annoying..This little things add up and make a pretty good hotel into a slightly annoying hotel..At the price they should take note and do better. Other than that it is a safe bet in an expensive town..you could do a lot worse. Also my tip for hotels in Venice ..put your valuables in a very safe place..lots of robberies when i was there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: redboys
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Molino Stucky late last month. What a beautiful hotel. We had a large comfortable room with a view overlooking the Giudecca Canal. The staff was friendly and helpful especially in the Executive Lounge which was well stocked with delicious food and drink. Having to take a shuttle to the historic areas of Venice may be a draw back to some but we enjoyed coming back across the Canal away from the very tourist populated areas to the peacefulness of the hotel. The shuttle was easy to time leaving the hotel but took some planning to get back. If we didn't time it correctly, we could have an almost 2 hour wait during the (oddly timed) evening break. The rooftop lounge was expensive but lovely. It could be improved though by having more high top tables allowing for a better view. We took the public boat Alilaguna (rather than the very expensive water taxi) from the airport and although it took about 1 1/2 hours it was a great introduction to the beauty of Venice and dropped us off directly in front of the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel and Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Venice from a different angle”
Reviews.Author: bienypense
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights pre-cruise. The hotel was a superb preparation for that. Our room was spacious, elegant and nicely-furnished. The bathroom was immaculate, roomy and well-appointed. We wondered whether staying on the Giudecca would make us feel cut off from Venice, but it didn't. The staff were helpful and there were only two blips. One was a porter who wasn't on the ball, causing us and two other couples to miss our Alilaguna transfer to the Stazione Marittima. Oh well, the next one was along in 20 minutes, and it took that full time to queue at the front desk to make a complaint - to no avail! The other inconvience was the shuttle transfer across the canal to San Marco.
