On the Friday evening it filled before everyone was on, and the thoroughly unhelpful driver just shrugged and rudely told us we'd have to wait. It seems that on other times (different driver, or different mood) rather a lot more people were allowed on! We gave up and dined along the Fondamente from the hotel and had a good, relatively inexpensive meal with beautiful views. On Saturday afternoon, coming back from San Marco, we knew to join the queue for the shuttle before it arrived and so avoided being among those refused boarding. Iron out those couple of niggles and the hotel will well deserve full marks from its guests.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Celebrate an Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: istanbul5times
Reviews.Content: After securing low cost return flights from Leeds-Bradford to Venice for Â£80 each, we could afford to pay a little more on the hotel. My wife and I travelled to celebrate our 30th Wedding Anniversary. We pre-booked the water taxis from marco Polo straight to the hitel jetty. The journey this way is certainly different to your normal transfer to a hotel! The Molino Stucky sits on Giudecca Island, not far from the Cruise Terminal, and part of the experience was watching the cruise liners sail past between the main part of Venice and Giudecca, from the pool on the top of the hotel, or at the quayside. It looks as if everyone on the boats line the rails to watch travelling in and out of Venice. The courtesy shuttle taxis run frequently between San Marco and the hotel until late, and is a great free service saving you money on the water taxis. The hotel we found to be clean, efficient and the staff extremely polite. There are a couple of little restaurants on Giudecca that are well worth visiting either for lunch or evening meal if you fancy a change from going over to the main part of Venice. The room we had was overloking a side canal, and although not spectacular, was still pleasing enough. Large plasma tv and a number of English stations. The hotel even provided a congratulations card and a huge basket of fruit and a bottle of Cava - nice touch. Just one final recommendation. For our actual anniversary night, we went to the El Paradiso Restaurant which is in a small side alleyway off the quay, and just over the Rialto Bridge. The meal was excellent, and we were not rushed at all - definately recommend this for a special meal. All in all a really memorable romantic break, and I would go back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant 5* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travellerclass
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to go to Venice for a relaxing break from the 26 Sept to 30 Sept. We had taken advice from other trip advisors who had sugested that we should use the Public Water Taxi from Marco Polo Airport. This we did and we booked the tickets on line and got them pre-booked for only 13 euros each way per person. I believe if we had booked them as a round trip we could have got them cheaper. The boat trip to the Giudecca Island takes 90 minutes and you do get to see so much of Venice doing it this way. When you finally arrive at the Hilton you will be taken back by the sheer size of the place. It is a very modern looking place and has over 350 rooms. We were very impressed with the speedy check in and the prompt arrival to our room (126). Our room was stunning and very good quality. There were a few stains on the carpet but the room was spotless and the bathroom was palacial. One thing to be mindful of. The room has a mini bar which is very expensive. The whole mini bar is computerised so do not lift out bottles to investigate as you could be charged. We did have the two small 500ml bottles of water and had to pay 6 euros for each. The breakfasts were amazing and you would not want for anything. We had champagnee every morning and enjoyed the full english breakfast. The hotel also has a brilliant outside pool on the roof which was great for sunbathing and relaxing after exploring Venice. Venice is an expensive place to visit and please be carefull in and around St Marks Square. They are totally out of order with the pricing of food and drink. My wife was determined to sit in St Marks Square and have a drink and watch the world go by. We sat down at one of the bars which had an orcestra of 6 playing. We were given the drinks menu and found that the cheapest beer cost 11 euros for a 300ml bottle. We had one each at a cost of 22 euros and then got presented with a bill for 34 euros. To our amazment they had also charged us 6 euros each for the privelage of listening to the music. What ever anyone says a bill for 34 euros was far to much. A great place to eat in the evening is the Hard Rock Cafe. What value. A total of 60 euros gave us both a starter and main plus two large beers each. We absolutley loved Venice and would go back in a heart beat. If you shop around you can get some excellent places to eat and drink. We were surprised that St Marks square used to flood each day with between 4-6 inches of water. They do have board walks that you can use to walk around but these do get very crowded so pick the right time to go. We found about 1200-1300 the water was at its highest and the eneviatble problems in the square happened. We can only say good things about the Hilton Milino Stucky. It is a wonderful place and we felt spoilt and very relaxed as you are away from all the hussle and bussle. The hotel also has a regular free water bus service which is excellent and the timetable is very much kept to. We have tried to be as honest as possible with this Hotel/Venice review. It is magical. Thank You Hilton Milino Stucky, we will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “illness extended stay”
Reviews.Author: sombra471
Reviews.Content: What was supposed to be three days to visit the Bienalle turned into a nightmare when hubbie got sick and was admitted to local hospital. So I stayed 6 days here. It would be easy to think the superb superb service I received was a result of my hubbie's illness - or the fact the we are Diamond Hhons guests BUT - the staff really went out of their way, these were genuinely caring and thoughtful people. In my anxious state they became my friends - human friendly caring - I honestly don't know how I would have coped without their help and concern. So go - be nice to the staff - and enjoy all the rewards of a beautifully located hotel on the doorstep of one of the most fabulous cities in the world surrounded by beauty on every corner. (p.s. Hubbie is recovering! )

Reviews.Title: “Good but a couple of areas to improve upon.”
Reviews.Author: Richp
Reviews.Content: Firstly I should say that I'm quite a big fan of Hilton (outside the US anyway) and I haven't ever been particularly disappointed with their product. I thought this hotel was really nice - the conversion from an old flour mill has been done sympathetically. My room was very nicely done. I particularly thought that room service was very good. I also appreciated a complimentary bottle of Prosecco they sent up to me (I think because of the tier of my HHonours card, but I was just happy to drink it!). This is a large hotel and the layout was a bit confusing to be honest. If you are staying at the front of the hotel then you need to take the lift down to the Lobby and then walk to a different lift to get up to the pool. It's not a big deal but worth mentioning. I had access to the Executive Lounge which I thought was ok, but it was a bit strange that it is just a fenced off part of the main restaurant and bar. I didn't feel inclined to spend much time in there. The lounge used to be on the top floor and was obviously much bigger in the past. I thought the pool was spectacular but that a bit more attention should be paid to tidying up the sunbeds etc. There is no poolside service it would seem but there is a bar next to the pool so get your own drinks is the story there. They allow smoking around the pool which is not very nice to be honest. The hotel provides a free boat transfer to Venice (to Zattere and San Marco) and the timings are reasonable. However on more than one occasion the boat went early and I found the staff to be a bit rude. I got there just as they were about to leave (early) on one occasion and was told "no, its full". Well it certainly was not! very frustrating as the next one wasn't for an hour. If you are coming from the airport take the blue line boat from the airport, but be warned it takes approx 90 mins and stops everywhere on the way. The cost is 25Euro return. This is probably the cheapest way to get to the hotel and is a reliable service. The most disappointing aspect of the hotel was the bar/restaurant on the Ground Floor, next to reception. I ate there on my first evening. I think I could safely say that you should avoid eating here! I was suspicious that it was completely empty at 8PM... Anyway, I ordered a pasta dish which was a staggering 24Euros. When it came I am not exaggerating to say it was tiny - the size of a starter. It was actually quite tasty, but I told them it was way to small (I'm European, so used to small portions), they immediately knocked 20% off the bill which was quite fair but I got the impression that this was a common complaint. You can eat much better five minutes down the quayside near the Vaporetto stop. And in Venice itself there are some great places to eat for much less money. Apart from that - great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful base to explore Venice”
Reviews.Author: starchucks1969
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in August. The facilities were top-notch. The room was fully equipped, and had a very high ceiling that exposed the original wood beams, a neat bit of detail that gave it some character. We were in an inside room, so no view, but it was very quiet. The view from the roof pool area is spectacular, but I would have liked to have it open at all hours--even if they did not allow swimming, it would be a great place to take sunrise or late night pictures, or just enjoy the romantic view. Perhaps the coolest thing about this hotel is its location on an island across from Venice. I enjoyed exploring Guidecca, and it was a nice way to quickly escape the expensive and crowded tourist areas of Venice. The shuttle boats were on time and convenient. The breakfast buffet had a wide variety of items -- the cheese and meat selection was wonderful. Staff were gracious and helpful when needed. All in all, a wonderful place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice one night stay”
Reviews.Author: SmallBoatCruiser
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful facility--built within the original shell of an historic spaghetti factory. Very large but relatively easy to find one's way around. Very professional, helpful staff. Don't miss the views from the rooftop restaurant/bar and swimming pool. Hotel provides an hourly shuttle boat to get to the St. Mark's Square area as well as another, quieter neighbor across the Giudecca Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: teena192
Reviews.Content: Not to be too dramatic but I felt like I had died and gone to heaven when I arrived at this hotel. It was so beautiful. My favorite thing about the hotel was the views! View from my hotel room, view from the restaurant windows, and view from the pool. I had spent the first half of my trip at a local hotel in the main area of Venice and although it was also a great experience, the Stucky made me never want to leave. If you want to go all out in Venice, do it right and stay at this property. Only negative (and who really cares, just letting you know) is that wifi gets really spotty after the third floor in the main tower, most people were using their tablets and phones in the lobby or breakfast area. So if internet connection is your thing, keep this in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you don't want to experience local color”
Reviews.Author: eblebebe
Reviews.Content: There is no denying that this is a quality hotel in a very nice facility. But the place is huge, confusing and let's face it, not really "in" Venice. We tried, unsuccessfully, to find the spa and pool on our second evening and thought we were going to have to call for search and rescue to get back to our room. But our room was lovely. After an initial mix-up - being given a room with one bed when we had requested two, and even called the morning of arrival to re-confirm - we were quickly moved to a better room, on a corner with views of the Giudecca canal in two directions. (This is not the "Grand Canal" of Venice as stated in an earlier review. The Grand Canal is not visible from this property.) I found the additional transportation time and logistics of staying on the island to be limiting, causing us to do fewer evening activities than we otherwise might. Access to the Executive Lounge (Hilton Gold members) was a plus that definitely saved on breakfast and an evening glass of wine or two. The food offerings, though, were way below average for a Hilton. But by far my biggest complaint regarding this hotel was the utter ineptitude of the staff at the concierge desk. They had no information about anything, and behaved as though it was rude of us to ask even the most basic questions - anything special going on in town? best place for gelatto? It got to the point that when we had a question, one of us would say "I know, let's ask the concierge!" and it at least gave us a good laugh.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable place a short boat ride away from San Marco square”
Reviews.Author: funnyguy1949
Reviews.Content: WE stayed at this Hilton for five days in August. Check in was very quick and they allow early check-in after long international flights. This was the second time we had stayed at this facility, the last time being two years ago. We had a view of the Grand Canal and we were able to be mesmerized by the boats and ships venturing into the area. This Hilton in Giudecca is a welcome quiet retreat from the crowded and active San Marco area, but yet, just a short boat ride away from it all. We love staying here because of the excellent quality breakfast, attention to detail in the rooms and the helpfulness of the staff. You will get all the Hilton amenities here. Great restaurants nearby... This Hilton is truly a very nice find while staying in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Yucky in the Stucky”
Reviews.Author: pertboy
Reviews.Content: Lucky enough to stay here for 5 nights on HH points in September. Check in was quick and (initial) room was good. We took breakfast in the exec lounge, which in reality was like a fenced off playpen in the main bar area. Breakfast was a bit of a daily disaster due to the number of people wanting breakfast there and the lack of staff and coordination to clean up after guests depart. The range of food at breakfast was not brilliant, nor was the service. However, the service in the lounge throughout the rest of day/night was much better as the crowds thinned out. Throughout the day there were snacks/nibbles/cakes and free drinks which were much appreciated. Concierge was a very mixed experience depending on the staff member you encountered. Ranging from very terse (advice on where to visit: "St Marco square" and there endeth the advice and conversation) and unfriendly to very friendly and helpful. Location was fine - easy to get to with very frequent complimentary shuttles. Our one problem during the stay was with the laundry - we placed our towels in the bath each day to be replaced as they were wet/dirty after each use. However, we found that they just got refolded each day, so we'd come back in the evening to the same towels some of which were damp. On our penultimate night we went to take a shower, only to find the towels crawling with (I assume) mosquito lava as the damp towels were a great breeding sight. On closer inspection we also found larva in the grooves of the shower floor. When we complained we got just got fresh towels from the guy they sent up. We asked to be moved the following morning and got a suite which was nice. Whilst I appreciate mosquitos are a fact of life when close to water and with the heat of late summer, I felt this problem could've been avoided through better cleaning and laundry procedures However, it didn't spoil our stay in Venice, and we enjoyed the hotel overall - this problem and the lack of consistency in service unfortunately marks the hotel down

Reviews.Title: “Hilton quality, many pros and some cons”
Reviews.Author: Paulklib
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at Molino Stucky before boarding a cruise to Dalmatia and one day (day room) before flying back home in the evening. The two nights were in a suite thanks to a kind complimentary upgrade; the day room was a basic queen size room, which is quite spacious. We chose this hotel because it is just in front of the cruise terminal (however, the cost of a water taxi to cross the Giudecca Canal is around 60 euro ... for some 800 meters; but this is Venice). The pros : Hilton standards : kind reception, efficient concierge, perfectly clean room; very quiet location on Giudecca, free shuttle to Zattere and San Marco, smiling service; above all, great restoration of an industrial building, unique rooftop swimming pool and bar with fantastic views; one can really relax after an exhausting day in Venice; some good restaurants within walking distance (a.o. Cipriani, really worth a visit). The cons : The place is huge, expect incentive travel groups; shuttle service frequency to San Marco is too low (one per hour; there is also a hourly service to Zattere, with easy access to Accademia bridge); breakfast bakeries average; lack of outside spaces (except the already mentioned rooftop pool and bar), a pity Hilton does not use the internal courtyards to create a fresh garden area); decoration of the rooms is impersonal; free slow speed internet on two old PCs in the lobby. Conclusion : it is a matter of taste; there are many smaller hotels in Venice with lots of charm; however, the experience of the rooftop swimming pool on a warm day is a fantastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: MaireGirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful, clean with comfortable beds and bedding and the staff is wonderful. They have a free boat (shuttle) every 30 minutes to St. Marks Square, we will be sure to stay here again. Great bar on the rooftop! Breakfast was very expensive and a bit disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Pity it wasn't longer”
Reviews.Author: buggsusa
Reviews.Content: We were on a bus tour and only had one night at this hotel in Venice, OMG, it was amazing! We wish we could have stayed longer, even had champers with our brekky!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hilton”
Reviews.Author: BizTraveler_scr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed the end of August. Had a king suite with a view. It was spacious and well appointed. As a Hhonors Diamond member I had complementary access to the lounge with free drinks and snacks so I did not experience the high priced water others mentioned in their reviews. Rooftop pool and bar were a nice plus, however if you're really interested in laying by the pool (which I don't understand in Venice) you need to get to the pool early as there is limited seating. The complementary shuttle was very convenient. Since we did a lot of walking there was little need for any other transportation. The tripadvisor reviews I read prior to my trip had me concerned about how I was going to get to the hotel - warnings on water taxis or multiple connections with luggage. Turned out to be very simple. If money is no object just take a private water Taxi. We took a water Bus which took us right to the door. It's the largest hotel in the islands so all I had to do was mention the hotel name and they actually took us right to the door (sometimes have to drop you off at San Marco where a Hilton shuttle can take you to the door). You can buy round trip tickets inside by baggage claim.

Reviews.Title: “Secluded, yet easily accessible hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dlk2111
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the San Lucia Train Station around 7 AM after taking an overnight train from Croatia. The train station isn't that close to the hotel, but there are a variety of travel options to get there. We decided to walk, so we could see some of the city before we got to the hotel. It was somewhat difficult since we were carrying our bags and Venice isn't the easiest place to navigate. The hotel is located on Giudecca Island, which is part of the Dorsoduro district. The hotel provides a free shuttle to and from Giudecca Island to Zattere and Saint Mark's Square, so it is very convenient. When we arrived, our room was upgraded by the front desk, so we could go to our room right away. The room was beautiful and the hotel ammenities were numerous. There are several restaurants, bars, the rooftop pool is incredible, and the fitness/wellness center is decently equipped. The concierge was very helpful with providing information about restaurants (we ended up going to Trattoria ai Cacciatori, which is about a 10 minutes walk from the hotel), attractions, and our travel option to the airport the following day (water bus is cheapest, but takes an hour).

Reviews.Title: “One of Hiltons best”
Reviews.Author: malone44
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Stucky for a few nights while in Venice. We had a executive king plus room with lovely views out to Venice. It was room 432 just below the old mill sign, the itself was very small for Â£500 per night when spoke to reception to see if we could get something a little larger as it was our anniversary and also paying such a high rateam. The answer was sorry madame but this is Venice, what does that mean? Is that mean its okay to charge Â£500 per night for such a small room. Anyways back to all the positives wasn't going to let this little issue spoil our break, how long where we going to spend in the room anyway. The shuttle bus service is great and very regular it makes your visits into town so romantic and great fun, only takes 10 mins and stops at two places, get off at the first stop and take the 30min walk into St Marks square through the old streets and bridges great way to see Venice. Venice is the most romantic city I have ever been to really enchanting. Back tot the hotel, it has a great roof top bar with fab views spent many a night drinking champagne up there and the music is great and candlelit at night. There is a roof top swimming pool which is amazing great way to unwing for an hour before dinner, the executive lounge is ok for drinks and little nibbles never ate at the hotel always in Venice and the food in the town is great. I have rebooked the Hilton for some of my family going out next week for a few days so I do recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Hotel - a Fabulous Restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: ForeverPacking
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Hilton Molino Stucky in Venice after disembarking from a cruise. Wanting to experience the culinary delights of Venice, we endured an exhausting excursion which required numerous water shuttles, water taxis and the connection times that go with such a trek... and it was not even close to being worth the time, energy or the money (and it had a great rating on TripAdvisor!). Upon returning to the Molino Stucky, I discussed this with Marko Ludovici, the front office manager who compassionately convinced me to try the Hilton's gourmet restaurant "Aromi." The next evening after an exhausting day of sightseeing in the heat, instead of embarking on yet another tiresome "adventure in travel!" - we simply dressed and took the elevator to the lobby, then strolled out the door and into the wonderful, gracious care of Giovanni Burrafato, the maestro and maÃ®tre d' of "Aromi." Stunningly, Giovanni transformed "having dinner" into "fine dining" Venician style! It was an evening that resenbled a symphony of elegance and grace. Excellent food, unbelievable service, an event we will never forget. Giovanni gave us memories of Venice that matched the dreams we'd had of Venice! So if you are staying at the Molino Stucky and find yourself exhausted from a day sightseeing, consider "dining in." You have one of Venice's finest restaurants litterally at your door! Awards: Aromi is listed in the famous Italian gastronomic guide â€˜Ristoranti dâ€™Italia Espressoâ€™ and is amongst the most prestigious restaurants in Venice. The Aromi Restaurant and Terrace earned 15/20 score and one â€˜Hatâ€™ (a prestigious symbol which represents the category of the restaurant in the guide).

Reviews.Title: “Incredible - most of all the rooftop pool”
Reviews.Author: VnJnAnJ
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on priceline.com, and got a great deal. We were traveling with our two chioldren (8 and 4). When we checked in, the first room they gave us was an interior room - very nicely appointed and a nice size by European standards, but only a view of an interior courtyard. My husband went back to the front desk to ask if they could find any rooms facing the outside, and to our very great pleasure they gave us a really nice room. The room was very large with a living space and they even gave us an extra bed for our 8 year old at no additional charge. The room faced another building, but looking sideways out the window you could see the Guideca Canal and the heart of Venice. You could make out the domes of various basilicas, and hear the churchbells in the mornings. The bathroom was incredible - beautiful marble and a very nice bathtub. I'm a sucker for a gorgeous bath, and this place definitely had one! The public spaces were lovely, with nice sofas for lounging. We absolutely LOVED the rooftop pool. The views are incredible. And although the pool is fairly small, we stayed away during the over-crowded hours and thoroughly enjoyed it. Very polite staff. The complimentary shuttle boat is great. Restaurants in hotel are extremely expensive, and restaurants in the area are fairly expensive as well (as you would expect in Venice). The staff told us where to find a local supermarket ("Coop" - short walk away - fantastic selection - great prices!!!). We used that a lot and were very very, very pleased with it. GREAT, especially considering the amazing price we were able to book at.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property”
Reviews.Author: cunningtim
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice property. Our room was superb. The food offerings in the club lounge were great.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Sharon-JoeJr
Reviews.Content: Helpful Staff . Super accommodations. A little hard to find launch site by St Marks.

Reviews.Title: “Only a quick stay, but left with a good impression”
Reviews.Author: RoundTheWorld3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night after a 7 night cruise that disembarked in Venice. Overall, a great looking, comfortable, and convenient hotel. We stayed in a king room, which was gigantic by Venetian (or even European) standards, with a huge bathroom, modern furnishings, and a charming view of the Giudecca Canal where we could see the cruise ships coming and going. The hotel itself was very large, modern, and well decorated. It had a boutiquey vibe that is probably not too common in Venice. Even though the hotel is located on Giudecca, the convenient shuttle boat made us feel like we were still in the middle of the action. The boat was always on schedule (both departing and returning to the hotel) and took only about 10 minutes. The hotel staff was fair. We had a bit of difficulty checking in, due to the fact that our room was booked using Hilton points and we had not brought a print out confirmation of this. We were told that we had to have a paper copy of the reservation, but luckily the hotel had a free computer and printer in the lobby we could use to retrieve our email confirmation. Our experience with the hotel concierge was also just ok. When finding out options for our return back to the airport in the morning, the concierge insisted that the Alilaguna boat (a 2 hour journey?) was the only way to go. Having spent several days in Venice the year before, we knew that while a bit costly, taxi boats were readily available. This is what we ended up taking to get back to the airport. The taxi is its own little adventure, as it navigates the narrow canals to make its way through the main island and out to the airport. It is a 30 minute ride that is well worth 100 Euros if efficiency is important and you are willing to spend a little bit more for convenience. Overall, we would stay here again for the hotel's convenient yet quiet location, clean and comfortable rooms, and convenient shuttle boat.

Reviews.Title: “Great and then some!”
Reviews.Author: ChloderosLaclos
Reviews.Content: Hhonors Diamond; upgraded to a suite. My family really enjoyed the rooftop pool. Beautiful views. We had access to Executive lounge with food and drinks throughout the day; it was nice to come back to prosecco and canapes and desserts after a long day of touring the sites. It's a gorgeous hotel. Service was impeccable from check-in to check out. We liked the location on Guidecca Island. Hilton has it own private water shuttle. So it was very convenient to and from the bustle of Venice. My stay at this Hilton made me fall in love with Venice all over again. Quiet stay with good night sleep for 3 nights before cruise. Internet was free. Can't speak to restaurant food as we didn't try or room service. They also have private water taxi service to and from hotel from airport.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views of Venice and the Lagoon”
Reviews.Author: ElaLondon
Reviews.Content: Right from the start i liked this Hotel. Free shuttle boat from S. Marco to the hotel every 20 minutes until 1am. Excellent customer service and comfortable rooms. The best part was the panoramic outdoor pool located on the 8th floor with the amazing views. There is also rooftop bar and restaurant on this fllor hosting parties. Nice buffet breakfast in the morning and good relaxation in the spa. Planning to be back next summer to enjoy the pool and the views! x

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful one nite stay before our cruise. We made the best choice!”
Reviews.Author: love2go222
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night with my boyfriend and stepson. We were given a very big and bright room with a double bed and a single bed. We also had a large sofa and a dining table! The location was perfect as we boarded Azamara cruise the day after. San Basilio dock is just opposite the Giudecca island where the Hilton is located. The hotel is amazing, bright, clean and modern, staff is very helpful and kind, the roof pool is so convenient when you travel with a teenager, the boat shuttle has been always on time and very reliable, and we loved the breakfast buffet as well as the Prosecco! We dined in one of the restaurants on the right hand side of the hotel, very friendly staff. I enjoyed walking on the Giudecca at nite and be away from the crowd. Now that I have stayed there I can't believe how people can possibly write any negative comment. Magical and beautiful stay! From the airport we took the private water bus which dropped us off directly in front of the hotel. Journey time about 1 hour and costs â‚¬25 return.To reach Molo San Basilio, we only had to catch the Hilton water shuttle to Zattere and then cross two bridges. Easy 10 min walk. Loved it! Don't hesitate one second!

Reviews.Title: “this was my 5th time at this hotel and love it”
Reviews.Author: pam d
Reviews.Content: venice is so busy, with ever one rushing and hectic, it is a pleasure to remove one's self and just rest up at this great hotel. the staff are friendly and efficient. we stayed in the tower suites which i rx to everyone. the suites are pricey but with 2 bathrooms, it cannot be topped. the roof top pool is wonderful and has beautiful views of the canals

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, not the best location”
Reviews.Author: morrisonkid
Reviews.Content: Upside: Quiet location on the island of Giudecca, away from the crowds of Venice. Good breakfast buffet. Awesome hotel bar on the roof of the hotel with great views of Venice. The rooftop pool was also very nice, although very few lounge chairs. Downside: Making sure you got in the shuttle line early enough to get a ride to Venice an back. Some rude european tourists and asian tourists that would cut in line for the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, beautiful hotel with great amenities and service”
Reviews.Author: chgotrvlr71
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Venice Molino Stucky Hilton during a recent Italian vacation that I took my parents on. The hotel is beautiful and wonderfully refurbished from a former historic flour mill. The rooms were spotless and well-appointed with comfortable beds and spacious bathrooms. The hotel staff were efficient, pleasant and accommodating. As Hilton Honors Gold member we had access to the Executive lounge which had great food and beverages throughout the day. Others have mentioned the difficult location. This was my fifth time to Venice and NO hotel is easy to get to with bags and I didn't find the Hilton any more problematic than any of my other visits to other Venetian hotels. Also we found the shuttle to be reliable and frequent enough to serve our needs. Water taxis and the ACTV are both expensive and we found the shuttle to be a nice touch and saved a lot in taxi fares. One suggestion, the hotel is listed near the ACTV Palaca stop which is a short hike to the hotel. Especially with luggage. The hotel shuttle however stops adjacent to the Zastere ACTV stop on the other side of the canal. This was MUCH more convenient and was how we returned to parking lot at Pizalle Roma. It would be helpful if the hotel put the shuttle schedule on their web site, if they already do, I was unable to find it! Final suggestion is the hotel website also does not explain very well the parking situation for those (albeit I am sure few) who drive to Venice. For others that drive, you can park at the Tronchetto or Pizalle Roma parking garages at the end of the causeway. The Tronchetto lot is cheaper I believe but you have a long walk to either the Tronchetto ACTV stop or must take the people mover to Pizalle Roma. We parked at Pizalle Roma (â‚¬25 per day) and walked across the street to the Pizalle Roma. You want to catch a number 2 line boat in the direction of Tronchetto -- not towards the train station -- it is about 4-5 stops from there to the Zastere stop which is across the canal from the hotel. The hotel shuttle boat stops at the dock just north of the ACTV stop and runs about every 20-40 minutes to the hotel OR get off at the next stop Palanca and walk about 500 meters to the hotel over two Venetian bridges. The pool is also beautiful and they have a great fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “top hotel-top place”
Reviews.Author: amfitryon
Reviews.Content: we stay two nights at the end of August 2011 with very good weather [important for this hotel,ifyou want to enjoy everything].For us it was our second time and we had the same great emotion.Never is enough the time for Venice and the hotel,because and the hotel is very pleasant to enjoy the circoulation of any kind of boat on your feet,in Giudeca channel.Of course the most of the rooms don,t have view,but is not so bad,because all have luxury furniture.Breakfast in medium level,for Hilton.Enjoy the two atractions; the roof top pool and the gratis boat of the hotel to p.S.Marco,every 20 min.Thanks to the smile and very kind staff.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven!!!”
Reviews.Author: Skylarc24
Reviews.Content: Venice, Italy was the first country Me and my wife visited outside UK. We went there last March 7 to 9, 2011 and luckily, we didn't know that there was a huge festival going on there which they called Mask Festival. Going to Hilton Molino Stucky Venice is very convenient coz there's an Alilaguna Lines serving from the sea port near the Marco Polo Airport going directly to Hilton. We arrived approximately at the airport around past 12 in the afternoon and reached the hotel by 2pm. Our stay in Venice during that time was amazing coz there was festival going on and the best thing - the weather at that time was cooperating: sunny with blue sky though its a bit cold coz the season is still winter going to spring. Travelling from seaport going to Hilton is like having mini tour of the island already coz the Alilaguna lines passed by to almost all of the major tourist destination of the city and the scenery was utterly magnificent. Upon arrival at the hotel, we were greeted and attended by the door man very politely. The lady in the reception gave a warm welcome to us and gave a brief summary of the features of the hotel. Our room was upgraded due to I am a Hilton Honors Gold Member and I was delighted about that. The interior design of the hotel was magnificent, a truly Venetian Style. As far as I remember, we were allocated at 4th or 5th floor of the hotel. Upon arrival to our room, we were so amazed and delighted coz the room given to us was marvelous and chic. It was a room with a living room separated from the bed room. The best part was, our room was located to the view where you can see the top view of some main parts of the city. Apart from that, we were given complimentary bottle of Bellini (Flavoured Sparkling Wine) and some chocolates. Amazing. With regards to food at their bar lounge, nothing special. The service is quite a li'l bit slow or maybe we're just hungry and can't wait to stroll around that's why we want to be in a quick mode at that time. Since we have this Hilton Honors thingy, we got access as well with their Executive Lounge wherein you can have a mini buffet of canapes, sandwiches, sweets, light salad, some finger foods, softdrinks, juices and the best part is alcoholic drinks which were composed of beers, wines, spirits, liqueurs and of course the italian version of champagne - prosecco. At that time, since it was still winter, their swimming pool was closed. There were some place on top floors that were accessible to guests who wants to have an amazing view of the entire island of Venice. Since the pool was closed during that time, we just went to the Spa section of the hotel wherein you can indulged yourself and enjoyed their relaxing jacuzzi. The hotel's building itself was very big and if you got time to stroll around, you can still go to some garden within the hotel. One of the best thing I've experienced here was the BREAKFAST. The selections of food here was superb. I thought we're having lunch buffet already but the variety of foods, cold cuts, hot food and drinks was amazing. And the shocking part is - they served Prosecco with their breakfast - truly amazing. The distance of the hotel from the main tourist spots was like 15-20 mins by boat. The very good thing with this hotel, they have a private boat just for Hilton guests and this is complimentary at the same time it runs from early morning till late in the evening. Just to be safe, ensure that you always have the time schedule of the boat so that atleast you've got idea if your boat already left or your waiting for nothing. As far as I remember, the boat service got a break during lunch or dinner time or both. Although Hilton is secluded from the main Island coz the hotel is in Giudecca, I prefer to be like this coz it's away from noise and you have time to relax after your busy day/night strolling around the islands of Venice. One of the best place I've been... We might go back but not during the Mask Festival coz we experienced it already during this time...

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Views”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie T
Reviews.Content: -Friendly Staff -Great Restaurants, good food and prompt service -Best Shuttle Boat Service, regular and free -Only 10 minutes to Main Squares -Family Friendly -Amazing Views -A Touch on the Expensive Side -Wifi Only in Common Areas -Great Breakfast, amazing idea with takeaway coffee available to pour yourself! -Large Room and Comfortable Bed!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Farshad_Dubai
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel with a great Team! Very good location and the Hilton FREE Shuttle Service brings you the the best places! Thanks for an perfect time in Venice !

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Jesse S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed on our honeymoon trip. The hotel is a (free) shuttle ride from Drosodoro & St. Mark's - the shuttle only leaves once an hour from the hotel so generally, all your plans will be somewhat dependent on figuring out which shuttles to take. They are very timely and reliable. Rooms -- The rooms are the smallest that I experienced during our entire 15 day stay in Italy. We had an "Executive View" room. Staff -- The staff is helpful and courteous. Location -- Requires a shuttle ride to go anywhere (it is a short ride, but only runs once an hour, and there is a "break" from 8:30pm to 10:30pm or so in both directions. Last shuttle is at 12:30am or so. So you have to very carefully plan your days and nights unless you want to take a very expensive watertaxi. Business services -- A whopping 20 Euros a day (it may even have been 25 Euros, I can't remember exactly) -- you even have to pay to use many of the music stations and TV stations - basically, at this place, you pay extra for everything (in addition to a very high room rate) Restaurant/bar - Nice roof bar with a view - but surprisingly, when we went up there around midnight, there was music for the first 30 minutes and then the music was gone. Drinks were about 18 Euros each or so - we had to wait an eternity to get them, even though the place was fairly empty. Gym/Pool - Available and clean. Overall, definitely way overpriced - would not stay here again unless the rate was about half of what it actually was.

Reviews.Title: “Modern With A Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: Totham
Reviews.Content: Unusually for Venice the Hilton is a large modern built (part converted) hotel in a quiet location on an island overlooking the main area of beautiful Venice. The hotel runs a frequent complimentary boat service to St Marks square 15 mins or just 5 mins to the opposite landing. We had a King room on 7th floor nice quality, decent bathroom and very comfortable bed. On the top floor the hotel has a nice outdoor roof top pool with great views and a bar / bistro. The hotel also has a nice canal side restaurant on ground floor. This is Venice which is expensive and the hotel is no exception, prices for food and drink are very high. We did not try the breakfast at 30 euros /head but heard it was good and can sometimes be pre booked through Expedia etc at lower cost. Some cheaper eateries and places for breakfast down the canal or near opposite landing. Overal I would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, the location was a little bit of a pain, but not bad”
Reviews.Author: Mike W
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fantastic. Their shuttle from St. Mark's and Zattere was useful but the Water Taxi line 2 also stops at Palanca which was nearby and occasionally was more convenient. Would definitely use that line to and from the train station. The location on Giudecca was also nice because it was a little quieter. The service was fantastic and the room was also amazing. Very nice and worth it. The bed was the most comfortable of the whole trip. The view from the hotel bar (Skyline) was also good. The breakfast buffet was large and fantastic. Overall a great experience. If you are a Hilton Honors Diamond or Gold member, the perks were also great; the executive lounge had great food and drinks. If you have Hilton points, this is a great place to use them in Italy. We would definitely stay again if points were available. (Not sure if the actual price would be worth it in dollars...)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a pool - a Venice rarity”
Reviews.Author: someone1Ljubljana
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend when visiting the Bienale and chose this hotel as it's a little remote from the busy Venice centre. The hotel is located on a Guidecca island, which is a 5 minute ride by boat from San Marco place. If it was my first time in Venice I would rather stay in the centre, but after many visits it was nice to stay somwhere different. The Guidecca is not a touristy part of the city and you can see the locals doing their business and there are some caffes and restaurants that reflect the local spirit. The main reason for choosing this hotel was a pool on the top floor, where we could cool off every morning. If you came before 11 you could allways get a sun lounge, but afterwards you could only lay down on your towel. The pool is on the smallish side, but not too crowded as people prefer laying in the sun. The sight from the pool is amazing as it looks on Venice Zattere and the pool itself is put a bit higher than the sun lounges. The only complaint is that it closes too early (6.30). Night swimming would be amazing. There is also a bar nearby which has amazing views. The hotel room was nicely furnished in a classical style with wallpaper, heavy curtains and chandeliers from Murano glass. The room views are sadly limited to the courtyard mainly, as only the best rooms have a frontside water view. The rest of the hotel was nothing flashy, it was more understated. You could see some details and remainings of what the hotel used to be - a flour mill. Also the structure of the buliding shows that, wooden ceilings, an iron bell.. Another interesting thing: there is a women's prison just behind the hotel, but it's very quiet and you would never guessed it, if there wasn't for a sign and cameras. The service was nothing special, but was okay though as it'ssuch a big hotel. The free boat ride to San Marco and Zattere was quite frequent, butthe thing we missed was some benches in front of the hotel where people could sit while waiting for the boat. There is a lot of unused space and it doesn't make sense why aren't there any. The bottom point is I would go there again, but only during the summer so I could use the pool as Venice can get incredibly hot.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel In europe”
Reviews.Author: Acampoma
Reviews.Content: By far the best service and amenities in all of Europe. Staff was warm, inviting, and thoughtful. At the end of each Long And busy day, It was great to come back to this relaxing place to unwind and recharge for the next day. Pool and room had beautiful view of grand canal

Reviews.Title: “For those with Hilton Honors...”
Reviews.Author: enn25
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with all of our relatives before an Adriatic cruise in July. A total of 4 families. Each family had a member who had Hilton Honors Gold level membership so a couple of the perks we normally get are room upgrades and access to the executive lounge at Hilton properties. Upon check-in at Molino Stucky, we ended up with 2 executive level rooms, 1 regular King with a view room, and 1 executive level suite. Other than the king room, all of the rooms we received were upgraded from the original type of room booked. So far, so good. But this is where it ended. Although the room assigner at the hotel was doing his/her job, the front desk at check-in was clueless. We had walked straight to the Hilton Honors Member check-in desk upon arrival. The lady at the desk gave us these forms to fill out even though we clearly said that we are checking in and are already Honor members. Turns out the forms we filled out signed us up for Hilton Honors (I received my Blue entry-level card today!). When we asked if we were upgraded, she turned next to her to ask her "manager" in Italian. Her manager said something and didn't even address us (maybe she didn't speak English?). The check-in lady then told us no because we didn't pay for it. Fine, I didn't dwell on it (although I was perplexed since we did pay and was not traveling on points). When I asked next about the executive lounge access, she said that we didn't get it because we didn't pay for an executive level room. Oh well. So we headed to our room just grateful that we could get our rooms before the official check-in time. After a while, my husband decided to go down and speak to a different person at the front desk. He needed the internet access codes (another free perk for Gold members). Well, he lucked out and got someone who totally knew about Hilton Honors and the benefits. He reswiped our cards to give us executive lounge access, told us that we were indeed in upgraded rooms, and gave us our internet codes for the reminder of our stay. He was efficient, fast, and basically knew what he was doing. The other family members all ended up talking to him. So my one note to management at Molino Stucky if you are reading this - pleae staff Hilton Honors check-in desk with someone knowledgeable in the program! And please commend Besides the messy check-in, there are no major complaints from all of us. The rooms were nicely cleaned and beds very comfortable. My brother and sister-in-law's room did however have mosquito larvae on the shower floor. Upon calling housekeeping, it was cleaned up but they larvae returned 2 days later so we don't know if they were coming out of the drain or if there were female mosquitos laying eggs daily in their bathroom. Not a surprise considering the numerous mosquitos in Venice. We didn't have the maids opening up our windows but I did see several rooms being cleaned with opened windows during our stay. The buffet breakfast in the Molino restaurant was great. We didn't try the breakfast in the executive lounge. The buffet had a huge selection and looked clean (except for a couple of guests on two different occasions, where I saw them reusing their dirty but empty plates again). The executive lounge was as expected. Unfortunately, I'm sure there were guests using the lounge who didn't have access because the lock to the gate was broken and other guests were just letting people in upon sight. I did get asked by a young server if we had access but unfortunately he didn't ask anyone else. Overall, I would say that I would return to this property. Venice is beautiful and it was nice to come back to a clean AIR-CONDITIONED property away from the crowds! Just beware, like other reviewers have said, that the free water shuttle that Hilton runs may not let you on even though you were waiting there at the stop and there is room still on the shuttle, thus prolonging your wait another 20 - 40 minutes for the next shuttle. This was tough to do with small children in our group. The wait for the shuttle is not shaded and it got HOT fast.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with fabulous room”
Reviews.Author: Matthew S
Reviews.Content: Best rooms of our month long trip across Europe. Great staff and service. The shuttle service is a budget and lifesaver.....water taxi's are not cheap in Venice as nothing is. The hotel was a bastion of cordiality which I could not say the same for the rest of Venice. The executive lounge was nice....you just ask for espresso as opposed to the self service machines everywhere else. If I had to find something to pick at....the business center computers werent up to snuff....one wasnt working and the other was slow...but this is a reach.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed in low quality high priced rooms”
Reviews.Author: multicruiser
Reviews.Content: Like many who have reviewed this hotel, I used Hilton points to book this hotel for 50,000 points. Without a high status upgrade, I was assigned a room with a view of the brick wall. There seem to be a lot of these no view rooms and it also seems they give them to the points people. My wife found this room to be unacceptable and we hit the desk. They changed the room to one with a view of th courtyard but changing rooms was a long difficult process because of where the new room was located. Seems that the hotel is more than one building and it is unbelievable how fare you can drqag luggage to change a room. Checked in and was told breakfast was another 30 Euros each but if I paid with check in it was only 15. That's something that is in character with Hilton ... overcharging for what should be free. Interesting that among those things you don't get when you use Hilton points is the internet for which they charge 16 Euros and hour. Truly takes your breath away when you are told that a hotel that considers itself high end charges for stuff that cheap motels give you for free. Between the view, breakfasgt and lack of free internet, one gets the idea that Hilton really doesn't care about customer loyalty. The location of this hotel is not really convenient. Yes, there is a shuttle boat that usually runs every 20 minutes, except when it isn't on that schedule because it is break time.The shuttle can get crowded enough for them to tell you that you have to wait for the next boat. Even when the seats are not full, I saw the boat captain turn people away because of capacity controls.supposedly forced on them by the Gov't. If you are going to the Maritima terminal for a cruise, you take the water but one stop. But if your ship is docked at the other terminal you have a really inconvenient run to get to the ship. Their shuttle will not take you to the ship ... despit what another reviewer said. The official rate for a waterf taxi from where Azamara docked to the hotel .... pretty much just across the canal was 50 Euros. That was the extraordinary rate quoted by the official water taxi people at the terminal. There is a water bus that will run you one stop to Zatere where you can walk over to where Hilton's boat will take you to the hotel. We found a nice bakery with excellent pastries at bargain prices by walking along the canal to where there are a strin of stores and restaurants. We actually stayed at the hotel twice on this trip, one day before and one after the cruise. I would choose something different if I had it to do over again. The big fancy hotel was not all that fancy but it was certainly pricey. The pool on the roof, you can talk about it and make it sound much better than it really is. The fact is that there is so little attention to providing something to sit on that many people end up sitting on the deck. Significantly fewer lounges than needed.and as soon as somebody gets up, somebody is hopping up to grab the lounge. I don't see this as luxury as much as it is an indicator of poor space planning. When they decided to put the hotel where they did, they took it out of the high cost district where people actually are close to the action. The shuttle taxi they provide only partially offsets the inconvenience of a location that too quiet. With so many things to see in Venice, there are better choices for location.

Reviews.Title: “Venice”
Reviews.Author: kirsten anderse... a
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hilton Venice on the Giudecca Island provides a encellent experience of Venice, with a fantastic view on the historic part itself. The use of the boat shuttle to from the hotel put the visitor in the real ambiance of this unique city. We loved our stay in this very well renewed mill. Excellent welcome, very clean rooms, very comfortable Nice Back with Pivate Watertaxi to AirPort Marco Polo

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel great roof top pool and bar but can get expensive.”
Reviews.Author: Dalestacey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and must get to it by boat. They have free water taxi's to Venice regularly. The first room we had did not have a view so we changed and had a wonderful view. The staff was very nice and friendly. Breakfast everyday was great. We filled up and just did a light lunch and a nice dinner. The wifi is VERY expensive and they do not provide any WiFi hotspots even in the lobby. There are two computers past the bar with printers for boarding tickets, etc. These are free but do not have timers. I had to wait for over 40 minutes to get on one as the other people stayed on forever. For the price you pay for this hotel, they should give you a hotspot. We wanted to upload a few pictures and could not do it. The rooftop pool was nice but small and not nearly enough lounge chairs. The bar is extremely expensive so hang on to your wallet. You are paying for the view. The rooftop pool and bar were closed the last two days of our trip there for some unexpected maintenance. This is a great hotel but some of the carpets need replaced. Room was comfortable and had A/C. They will clear out the minibar so you can put your own stuff in it if you would like. My husband is a diabetic and this was handy. I would go back to Venice and go back to this hotel. We loved this trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: AngDew
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hilton Stucky for 1 night only en route to cruise. We took the Alilaguna water bus from airport straight to hotel steps, couldn't be better and one of the reasons why we booked and only E15 per person. The hotel is on Giudecca Island, but they have a complimentary shuttle boat over to St Marks which runs frequently and it was good to return to hotel away from the hustle and bustle. Decided to take a private transfer over to San Basilio (costs minimum E50 for a 3 minute ride) for the start of our cruise on Azamara (fantastic ship), but the alternative was to get hotel shuttle to St Marks and then water bus back to port, the private taxi took us straight to customs check in so no humping cases up and down steps over bridges, completely hastle free and worth the E50. The hotel is large and very impressive and typical venetian facade, but inside was ultra modern and of very high quality, just as a 5* hotel should be. Breakfast was extremely good, we didn't dine in the evening as we were over on main island. Be pre-warned that restaurant prices in Venice are beyond sky high, E24 for a green leaf salad and E6 for a petite bottle of orange juice!!! To sum up, Hilton Molino Stucky was a great experience and I wished I had booked for the 1 night stay after our cruise, we went to Centurion Palace, big mistake. Well done Hilton, hopefully we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you don't take the vaporetto”
Reviews.Author: Cintia C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the Giudecca, and not in the main island of Venice. The rooms are very good and have big space. It would be difficult to have all this space near Piazza San Marco. BUT the hotel should provide enough boats to make the transportation of the clients. Imagine that you have to wait 40 minuts after dinner because the last boat couldnt carry all the guests that were in the line in the last 10minutes... We complained to the captain, to the manager, but all of them said they could do nothing about it. So, I can only conclusa it is not worth the value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Fdamiri
Reviews.Content: Been there for 3 nights. Nice surroundings, rooms and service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: sparodi
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, luxourious, beultiful, great service...!!! The only downside that bother me a little was the fact the hotel is on a isolated area, you need to cross the channel every time you need anything, relying on the hotel's shuttle, or the vaporetto.

Reviews.Title: “A short but pleasant stay in an unusual hotel”
Reviews.Author: WJSLondon
Reviews.Content: We chose Molino Stucky because of its location on the Giudecca which has the merit of being a bit more peaceful than the centre of Venice but still easy enough to get to. We were expecting a fairly interesting looking hotel and we got more than that. The service was very good too. When we got there we were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the build generally and our room . If you like stylish bars the rooftop bar is for you-it is great. We would go back there if we were staying in Venice in high season again as it is great to avoid the crowds. The Stucky has a water bus which runs regularly to the centre and if you enjoy the fact of being in a city on water this is an added bonus. Hilton often have good deals too and for Venice we did not think the hotel was too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Holes in the sheets and they don't care!”
Reviews.Author: Stainerm
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel with our two children ages 11 & 9 in mid-July for one night. We stayed in a family suite at a cost of â‚¬495 and suffered: (i) holes in the sheets (photos taken); (ii) â‚¬20 for two "free" coffees; (iii) no towels at the pool; (iv) no porters available for one hour; (v) executive lounge full; and (vi) shower head broken. We know that Venice is expensive and we also know that it is very busy in peak season - hence the reason for paying so much to stay at what we thought was a decent hotel.The service was appalling and all that we have received from the hotel is a "thank you for comments" statement - Hilton themselves are leaving it to the hotel to deal with the matter. I would discourage customers from staying at this hotel and suggest that they find alternative accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Really pays off!”
Reviews.Author: Maren_Rodrigo
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Venice in the summer with our 1,5 baby and the Hilton at Giudecca Island proved to be the best choice by far. For us the decision to stay at such high star hotel for not an easy call, but when we figured out how much added value we had included it proved to really pay off. For starts the shuttle is included to Zattere and San Marco, so you can forget about the vaporretos fairs/packages. As we wanted to visit Murano we found out that there was a complimentary service there also. Having a swimming pool at the roof top was the cream on the top. The view was amazing from there!! So actually we could enjoy the warm and full Venice but also hide/refresh on the hot hours of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Staff”
Reviews.Author: ThinkMarcom
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, very comfortable rooms, and even though not within the main part of Venice, very convenient with the regular water taxis as part of their complimentary service. Internet service was outrageously priced however! The staff could not do enough for you, very helpful and welcoming! Overall, the hotel of course is a bit pricey and you could probably find something at better value, but we enjoyed our stay enormously.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms - but don't go to Aromi Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: heebmi
Reviews.Content: Helpful and mostly nice staff. Very nice and spacy rooms and a really great rooftop pool and bar. A good shuttle to Zattere and Marcus Place. There is one big negative point, their so called gourmet restaurant is not worth a dime. Save your money and go somewhere else. The food is below average, the menu is small - no daily specials and the cook is not very inventive. The quality of food was just miserable

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: fayeq8
Reviews.Content: this hotel has a great location, nice view, excellent service and great restaurant

Reviews.Title: “A large hotel that manages to retain small hotel warmth - fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: mrwatson
Reviews.Content: Despite the downpour I very much enjoyed my stay at the Hilton (and my first time in Venice!). I was attending a conference so didn't have much choice but the hotel didn't disappoint. Lovely room, well appointed and decent sized with gobs of toiletries etc. to take home for all you hotel toiletry afficionados! out there. Fantastic view of the river and the Piazza San Marco. The hotel ran a free shuttle service over to San Marco quite frequently which was handy and allowed a quick break between sessions to see the piazza, tower and even a quick museum break at the Museo Correr (which was showing a fabulous Julian Schnabel exhibit).

Reviews.Title: “For the size of the hotel, we had a very nice and quiet time”
Reviews.Author: socaltraveller18
Reviews.Content: Rooms were well sized. Place is very large. The room was well set up, bathroom nice, could have had a better view, it was partally obstructed but looking the right way nice view. It's an upgrade from most american Hiltons. The shuttle is indispensable, just be prepared for issues if the boat is filled up from San Marco and you're getting on at Zittare. Pool has an awesome view of Venice, but it was crowded and be prepared for the cold water, which comes with having a pool on top of the 8th floore. Still, after each day the pool was great to have after a long day of sightseeing. We were actually very pleased with the stay, the only minor issues were the quality and cost of the internet and issues with using the hairdryer in the bathroom. Clean, well appointed, and for a European hotel, large rooms

Reviews.Title: “Peace away from the crowds...”
Reviews.Author: LyCx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Venice Hilton for 5 days and overall had a lovely time. The hotel is in a beautifully converted warehouse and Venice is a wonderfully romantic place to visit. As mentioned in some of the reviews, the Hilton is on an island opposite the main part of Venice. We chose it deliberately as we felt it would be nice at the end of the day to get away from the hustle of central Venice. We also liked the idea of the rooftop pool for a nice cool down at the end of the busy day which few central hotels offered!. Obviously if you prefer to be in the thick of it in the centre of Venice this would not be the hotel for you. Equally if you prefer small hotels this would probably not be for you either. There have been comments about the shuttle provided by the hotel and I would say that in our experience this pretty much ran on time and was regular and we used that quite easily to get over and back whenever we needed to. The hotel has obviously recently been converted in a very tasteful manner and so everything felt new and in good condition. The rooms were lovely and beds very comfortable as you would expect from the Hilton brand. We found the breakfast service generally to be efficient and friendly and with a good selection provided (buffet style). In addition, whilst expensive (and probably not somewhere to drink all night!) we also found the bar on the roof of the hotel was a nice place to have a final drink or cocktail before retiring due to its stunning views looking over onto Venice. We paid an upgrade to our room rate to get access to the Executive area which is a gated off area on the ground floor giving access to free drinks and coffee as well as a range of food/'nibbles' during the day. If you are going to be around the hotel during your stay and in the bar and are likely to make sufficient use of this then it is definitely worth considering paying the extra for access to this - the range of drinks and food available was very good. The one thing I would mention is that we had requested a front facing room with views overlooking Venice and were very pleased with the stunning views when we entered the room. However on moving in we realised that, despite being several floors up and with double glazed windows, the front part of the hotel was also the part where the hotel shuttle boat arrived and left from during the night (late into the night and then from 6am!). On our first night the revving of the engine disturbed us every half hour - although admittedly we are probably relatively sensitive to noise, so if this is not something that normally bothers you then it might not be an issue. We therefore went down to reception the next morning. Despite being surprised we could hear it from there, they were obliging and considerate (the receptionist could not have been more helpful in fact) and moved us to a room at the back of the hotel away from the shuttle. However in losing our lovely view they also upgraded our room slightly to a bit larger one which was a nice touch and enough to make us feel better about losing the view (along with our lovely peaceful nights sleep from then onwards!). We would defintely return to this hotel if we were to visit Venice again in the future and we very much hope we will have the opportunity to do so.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Both Worlds!”
Reviews.Author: soonerservant
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a week at the Molino Stuckey and we loved it! We both agreed that it offered the best possible stay in Venice. When we were walking around seeing lots of people drag their luggage through the streets and over the bridges of Venice, we were grateful that we were at the Hilton Molino! Our group was picked up from the airport and dropped off at the Hilton. It couldn't have been much easier. The hotel is beautiful, the room spacious and comfortable. We had a room on the sixth floor and had a beautiful view of Venice. The hotel provides a free shuttle that goes to Zattere, just across the canal and also down to San Marco square. The shuttle is frequent and convenient. You can catch the local water taxi at Zattere or a short walk down the canal at Palanca. You can purchase a 24 hr, 36 hr, 48 hr or longer pass and ride all over Venice, including Lido and Murano. So you have easy access to all the sights, but a quiet refuge to come home to. It only gets better, the breakfast buffett is terrific (and included with the room). It has a wide variety of foods including eggs, sausages, prochuitto, fresh fruits, an assortment of breads and pasteries, juices and they will even bring you a freshly prepared cup of capucinno. They have a beautiful pool on the roof, in which we enjoyed a chilly swim. The view was phenomenal! While staying at the Hilton, be sure and spend some time walking down Giudecca. There are some terrific restaurants near the hotel. We really enjoyed our least expensive meals at a little pizza and panni shop called "La Foca". The people who run it are very kind and friendly and make a terrific panni. We had ours made with ham, salami, cheese and mushrooms. The bread was fresh and crispy. Two sandwiches and two soft drinks only cost 10 euros! It was fun walking around and seeing the locals as they lived their normal lives. Monday and Tuesday the island was very quiet, but particularly Thursday and Friday the shops were all open and it was very cool. One evening there was a large family celebrating, as one son put it "the old man's 66th birthday". If you have the chance, don't miss the opportunity to stay at this fabulous hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Suite Room”
Reviews.Author: doctrav
Reviews.Content: We took the public water bus to Stucky when we arrived. The stop was 2 bridges away so try not to carry heavy luggages. We were upgraded to a suite with great water view as we wanted to have daily breakfast... very lovely classy spacious rooms with great soft mattress! The hotel standard was of a higher than usual Hilton standard. The bathroom is rather large and pampering The Breakfast buffet was amazing... good spread and value for money!!! Tips- next time drop one stop earlier- the walk is shorter.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning luxury hotel, great location, would definitely stay again.”
Reviews.Author: lozmeister83
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Molino Stucky on the last three nights of an eleven day holiday to Italy. We were originally supposed to stay at a different hotel but after the hotel agent our travel company booked it through went into administration we were given a choice of alternatives and we chose this one. It is on a little island just over the lagoon from the main tourist area but the hotel offers a free shuttle service which takes around 15 minutes to get to San Marco. It's not that frequent but there is an Alilaguna stop right outside the hotel or alternatively a public water taxi stop about a five minute walk down the main street. The hotel itself is lovely and extremely big but easy to navigate as there are signs on the walls directing you so finding your room in the maze of corridors is not too difficult. We had a great view across the lagoon which was lovely but the hotel advises people to keep the windows closed due to the mosquitos though they do provide mosquito plugs for everyone to use in their rooms. Saying this, we didn't have any problems with the mosquitos, though we took some spray with us so we wouldn't get bitten when we were out and about which seemed to work. The breakfast is really good with an extensive choice of food for all diets though in terms of evening meals the hotel choice is a little limited due to price but we ate there on the last night and it was very nice. The rooftop bar is great for cocktails but still very pricey but again, worth it for a treat. We paid for a private water taxi from the train station to the hotel as my husband had read that the public water taxi was a fair walk which we didn't fancy with our suitcases but we later discovered that it was no where near as far as we imagined. We asked for a price for the water taxi to the airport when we were leaving but at a 100 euros we decided the Alilaguna for 15 euros each was more feasible, though be warned, it takes an hour and a half to get to the airport as it stops along the way at San Marco, Lido, Murano etc. Venice is a great city and definitely worth a visit, Piazza San Marco is crazy with tourists but once you get onto the side streets it is much easier to get around. Murano is definitely worth a visit for the glass and the bridges such as Rialto are a must. Overall a great trip and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “One of the finest hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: TravelingProducer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a girlfriend on Hilton points about 3 weeks after they opened. The service was fantastic, the location to die for and the amenities top notch. I am sure there are lot of other, perhaps more affordable hotels in Venice, but the luxury of this property cannot be overstated. (I stayed here longer ago that this setup will let me indicate, but that didn't make it any less amazing)

Reviews.Title: “Always love to return!”
Reviews.Author: worldwide972
Reviews.Content: This hotel is our favourite destination when staying in Venice for weekend escapes as a couple, or as a family. Everithing is done profesional, rooms are very clean, spacious, wonderfull, you can see wooden beams in the ceiling of the rooms/suites as hotel used to be mill in its old times. Very stylish, with some antiquites details but on the other hand, very modern. Pool on the top of the roof offers you lots of privacy if you're an early morning person and you like swimming with no company in the pool before breakfast. But it is worth to wake up so early and get spectacular view over the Venice bay. There is a free shuttle boat from hotel to Piazza San Marco, the Basilica di San Marco, and the Doge's Palace - ask for a free time schedule when check in. Executive Lounge is located on ground floor, practically in the lobby, separated with metal fence, which shall open with a room key but usually get stuck and you can not enter - a lot of guests does not know that this is an Executive Lounge and are just entering with the idea that this is coffe place as a part of bar in the lobby. Selection of food, cakes, nuts, nibbles, wines, teas and coffe in Executive lounge area is great, but you don't have so much privacy and quietness as you had it when lounge was located on the 8th/9th floor 2 years ago. Pitty! Hope that they will decide to return Executive Lounge back where it was and also offer breakfast for Executive guests as main restaurant for breakfast is usually so crowded, occupied, overflowed during the whole time reserved for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: talltree123
Reviews.Content: 1. Clean and updated hotel 2. Shuttle boat to San Marco is convenient 3. Foods at the executive lounge is excellent, probably better than foods offered by any US Hilton properties 4. Friendly services. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: GarethN
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel strictly on past experiences with hotels in Europe. The thought was to go with a recognized name and hope we wouldn't be disappointed. We were concerned about the location but booked it anyway. The hotel is just off the main tourist area of venice but this proved to work out great for us. They have a shuttle boat that runs until late so getting back and forth was no issue (the shuttle takes a few minutes to get across). Being able to escape the crowds late at night and retreat to our own island proved to be a bonus we didn't anticipate. The hotel is quiet and the rooms were ver comfortable. We never did eat at the hotel but we did enjoy a drink at the rooftop bar where the view was amazing. The pool is on the roof and is something we plan on going back to enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BlackSharpiePen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed the Hilton Molino Stucky. While the hotel is not located on the main island, the free water shuttle to the main island and the quiet (less touristy) location was ideal for us. We enjoyed walking the back alleys on Giudecca and the break from the hectic tourist environment on the main island. The staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel is beautiful and well appointed. As a Hilton Gold Member, we enjoyed the free breakfasts and the evening hors de vors. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Venezia.

Reviews.Title: “This is a fantastic hotel, if you are planning a visit to Venice then this is the plact to stay.”
Reviews.Author: dclark635
Reviews.Content: My wife and I Stayed in the Hilton for 5 nights after a week crusing the Adriatic. The hotel was fantastic, we were checked in at 10am after arriving earlier than planned. The room was ready forn us and really was excellent. The location of this hotel is perfect, just 10mins on free shuttle takes you to Zattere. The hotel has a fantastic roof top pool, everything about the hotel is first class, this is the first time I have taken time to write a review however felt I should recommend this hotel. If you are planningn a trip to Venice then this hotel would be an rexcellent choice. WE LOVED IT.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotels view”
Reviews.Author: jajasa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here During peak season and Loved the view from our room facing grand canal. The restaurant is expensive but worth every cent. The view from the roof top bar is exquisite. The staff was great and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Boat Ride Away From The Crowds!”
Reviews.Author: 2Travel-4funNow
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel across the lagoon from the main part of Venice. Given that it was Carnivale, that was a great location. The free boat shuttle to San Marco Square brought us right to all the crowds and at the end of the day took us away from them. It could not have been better!

Reviews.Title: “not great value”
Reviews.Author: 1907Karen
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely room but view was not great. The hotel was smart and modern but some things disappointed e.g., indoor pool very small, breakfast expensive and not of the high standard we are used to at Hilton, rooftop pool was really cold. The biggest disappointment was what to have been a special evening dinner in their 'posh' restaurant. we were the only customers at 7.00pm, only one other table was occupied after 9.00pm, food was over-priced and we had to send backone of the main courses of 'mixed fish' which was actually a few bits of sickly batter concealing mostly batons of carrot and coutgette. It was removed from our bill which still came to over Â£100 with only two very small glasses of house red wine!

Reviews.Title: “We will return”
Reviews.Author: Jardaok
