Reviews.Content: It is rather huge hotel at Guidecca island very close to all the Venice attractions. Hotel itself and rooms are nice and providing good value for money. We have appreciated free water shuttle service (San Marco) operating from the morning till late night 2-3 times an hour (with some breaks during day). There is great swimming pool on the roof. The cocktail bar was fine but service slow and prices high. The hotel flagship restaurant Aromi is fine but both food and service are just average and so not great value for money. In case that you arrive by car you can read a very basic advice at the hotel web site (I would certainly appreciate more detailed advice!!!). There is recommended parking company (where you can get 20% discount) but there is no advice how to go to your final destination, to the hotel itself. Actually, you have two basic alternatives: a) water taxi where they will ask you for â‚¬ 60,- (!!!) for a 5 minutes trip or you can take a water line (Nr. 2?, I am not sure) where you pay â‚¬ 6,50 per person and ship stops about 200 m from the hotel (but you have to cross two typical bridges between the ship stop and the hotel). I have stayed in the Executive floor and so my review is valid only to the Executive room level, nevertheless I think that there will not be a big difference. The original Executive lounge is closed for some time and you can find the lounge close to the reception. Service in the lounge was rather below the expected standard, nevertheless not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Gallia53
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel away from the crowds and yet close to everything thanks to the free shuttle boat. Large clean rooms, well decorated and confortable. Housekeeping doing a great job except for the replenishment of the hospitality tray or the complimentary bottled water (is their anybody checking?). Beautiful bar and excellent service at the top floor for a relaxing night cap with Venice at your feet. There is no "executive lounge" as such but only part of the restaurant/bar by the lobby. It is far from being relaxing with people litterally throwing themselves at the small dishes as soon as they were brought. The hotel should consider having a separate executive lounge for more relaxing environment. All things considered, the Molino Stucky is an excellent hotel that can be highly recommended. Easy transport to/from the airport by water-taxi (100â‚¬ one way, ~25mn) or Alilaguna (15â‚¬ per person, 90mn)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Lovely”
Reviews.Author: nkoritz
Reviews.Content: Perfect location away from the crowds yet close to everything. The property is beautiful and very well maintained. We had a lovely room that overlooked the Grand Canal. The hotel's free Water Taxi shuttle is a wonderful service. Nothing but great things to say about this property.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steven H
Reviews.Content: Staff was excellent. Location perfect. Take a water taxi from the airport, experience next to none.

Reviews.Title: “...improvements needed”
Reviews.Author: yumi82
Reviews.Content: I have been at the Hilton Molino Stucky in Venice for the second time during the 1st week of July. Usually never had problems with the Hilton Hotels worldwide and I often took the advantage of being an HHmember. Venice was diffferent. ...I lived in Venice for a year and I know how things work there, but still I would have preferred a different kind of service ...also considering the prices for the rooms there. Really satisfied with cleaningness, the bar at the ground floor and the sky bar ...even if based on American style menu. I did not enjoy the reception. The hotel was full and guess they had some difficulties to manage all the guests. Rooms not ready at check in time and we kept waiting 10 mins afte 10 mins for them ...at the end we waited almost one hour and a half. Not even a glass of water has been offered, nor the access to the executive lounge (being our room executive). if we would have know it at least we could have dropped of our luggage and start going to visit the city. We asked for a late check out but it was denied. The reception area was messy, nothing to help (unpolite) people to stay in line while waiting to ask for something. After visiting Venice I would have had and aperitivo at the sky bar, and drink my cocktail on the swimming pool area ...no! i couldn't ...the pool closes around 7. Then the hotel is on Giudecca island,, ...the time schedule of the complimentary shuttle service should be reviewed. My first stay there has been much better...

Reviews.Title: “6 Points Not in Other Reviews”
Reviews.Author: mmt7
Reviews.Content: I'll stick with 6 points not mentioned in other reviews. I am a Diamond member at Hilton, but that did not mean much at this hotel. The only upgrade was a room with a view. 1) No wireless internet in the rooms 2) Hilton Shuttle fills up in peak season; show up early. We missed getting on a shuttle due to the line and were forced to wait 40 minutes, and that shuttle didn't even to go San Marcos. 3) Executive Lounge is a joke. Food was always out and the service was awful. Two employees were always there, however I am not sure what they were actually doing. Water was out nearly every time I looked for it. Glasses were hard to come by. If you want eggs in the morning, good luck. They are gone in 5 minutes, and take another 30 minutes for a new batch. Most staffers were rude (with one exception). Not a good ratio. 4) Concierge, while helpful with making reservations, gave us wrong directions. We spend an hour each night walking around asking people where this place was. Both turned out at least 10 blocks from where we were told they were. It does not help that the Hilton map reads like one you get at Disneyworld. Not even close to drawn to scale. 5) Beds are stiff and uncomfortable. Not up to Hilton standards. 6) Venice is an expensive city; I knew that going on. However, what you pay for this hotel, you would be much better off staying in San Marcos. There is nothing special or unique about this place. I gave it two stars due to the value for money paid, poor service, and average facilities. And don't be fooled by the "world class" skyline pool. There are only 20 chairs and the pool is the size of a standard kids pool.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great rooftop pool, not central but free shuttle boat”
Reviews.Author: Vickisloane
Reviews.Content: I used the last of my Hilton points to stay here so can't comment on the value. Lovely modern hotel and I was upgraded to a big executive room, it was a lovely room. Rooftop pool is lovely. It is a 15 min free shuttle boat from St Mark's Square etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot To Stay”
Reviews.Author: westsidebernie
Reviews.Content: A beautiful relatively new hotel. Great rooftop pool and bar. The bar service was awful and the drink was two sips, however it would not change my opinion on whether I would stay there again. Room was very quiet (which I love). Very elaborate - a chandlier over the bed. Nicely decorated and nice bathroom. Found the boat to take over initially, but it never came, ended up with the valporetto which worked wonderfully. It did show up last night there and was fine. The island itself is quiet, so nice change of pace from Venice proper. I give it a 5 star rating. Just put a little more drink in the glass and keep the waiters coming over, especially when no one was in there. Check in people were great. 20% discount at the garage - thronchetta (sic).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Hawkeye52241
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay this year at the Molino Stucky, and the fifth in Venice. I used points once and got a 189 euro per night rate the other time. The Hilton location is perfect; on Guidecca island and away from the crowds. Guidecca is peaceful, authentic and has good restaurants that are half the price of ones on the main islands. The hotel is in an interesting complex of buildings, and has a rooftop pool (with a pricey bar). There is a frequent shuttle (every 30 min) to the main islands; more frequent at weekends and evenings. It does occasionally get full. We got regular Vaporetto passes so we were not over-reliant on the hotel shuttle (and these allow one to get to the Biennale, railway station, Canareggio and other islands too). We got upgraded both times. Once to a 3rd floor room with a wonderful view of the Guidecca canal; the other to a huge 5th floor suite with a view south over the lagoon. The rooms are beautiful, large, bright, clean and comfortable. Helpful though sometimes inexperienced staff at the front desk. Substantial and varied breakfast buffet - we got it free otherwise it is 30 euros! The executive lounge was wonderful, great food and drink and nice staff. A few more general comments relevant to hotels in Italy and US expectations: 1. A number of times I was embarrassed to be American while listening to pushy, aggressive and rude US guests. Or ones that ask dumb questions ('What is the best way to to see Venice when it rains?'). In the US concierges will put up with this; in Europe they point to an umbrella! 2. Staff do not speak english natively and so you need to be patient and careful in making requests. Given that most Venice hotels feature tiny rooms with views of walls or courtyards the Molino Stucky stands out. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: ellen1895
Reviews.Content: We were here on a company trip so not complaining. This is our second trip to Venice and the first time we stayed in a hotel off the grand canal which I highly recommend. This hotel is NOT on the grand canal as the pictures show online. I was under the impression it was rt next to st marks. Anyhow you have to take a water taxi or shuttle to get anywhere from this location. Very inconvenient. This is a typical large chain hotel which sums up our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location away from the relentless crowds. Few niggles though..”
Reviews.Author: DivingFrenchie
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in the this awesome modern and unique building over the Easter week end and it was busy everywhere in Venice with a pleasant 25deg- cannot imagine doing Venice in full summer season with hordes of tourists and 30 degrees! Our positive experience: - courteous, professional staff at reception with excellent linguistic skills. - quick check in -the hotel is a unique building with fantastic features. Thoroughly clean and neat everywhere. - the manager at the bar/Exec lounge/ restaurant downstairs ( Pink lookalikey) was a credit to the hotel, very approchable & helpful. -Perfect location in our opinion, just across the main squares ( san marco, zattere) by a quick 8mns on the shuttle and Giudecca island is quiet ( it's mostly residential) and it is a pure PLEASURE to go back to the hotel away from the hordes of crowds. Thank god we took that option! The NOT so good: - although the exec room had lovely views on the canal & a huge bathroom, the walls were like PAPER and you can hear EVERYTHING from the rooms on both sides. We had a German couple with a severely autistic disabled child who had hours of nocturnal distress and on the other side a couple watching loud TV until late at night. When we complained at reception to be moved rooms, we were informed the hotel was full. This is fair enough but I'd advise NOT to accept a connecting room as you might as well leave the door open and share with the other room occupants. Incredibly thin walls, not good enough for a HIlton! -1 of the breakfast room is like a canteen with tables on top of each other- squeezed like sardines in there. We simply decided to choose where to sit rather than being directed by the friendly lady at breakfast reception. - Yes it's a Hilton but the prices are extortionnate as this has been mentioned by so many other reviews. The 35euros burger ( that came cold with cold fries too), the over-inflated mini bar prices and the outrageously expensive drinks & cocktails on the roof bar. I am not sure this is justified at all, regardless it being a Hilton or not. - the shuttle: when at full capacity the shuttle should run a bit more often as it happened quite frequently it was full and we had to wait for another one.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this hotel for so many reasons...”
Reviews.Author: Dusty-traveller
Reviews.Content: We were booked in this hotel as part of a pre-cruise stay of one night. The room was prepaid and the cruise line issued a hotel voucher. As I did not have my Hilton Honors number available when I made the booking, I later phoned Hilton directly and added the number to my reservation. No problem, and I received a confirmation via email from Hilton showing that it had been prepaid and that it was a "King Executive with View". So far so good, right? We checked in behind a crowd of people stumbling around in the lobby (only two people at the desk with at least 3 others just standing around) The long and short of it -- our room was TINY with twin beds jammed into a small alcove against the wall with about 2 feet between them and a "view" of an inside courtyard, a/c ducts and drab buildings. After much complaining and showing them a copy of the printed Hilton reservation, we were finally moved to the correct room which we had paid for (and very grudgingly at that) The room was comfortable and nicely appointed (in comparison to the previous version) with a lovely view over the Guidecca Canal. The area around the hotel is a bit isolated and removed from central Venice -- being on the island of Guidecca. The hotel did provide a scheduled complimentary water bus over to St. Mark's Square, but we did not use this since we planned to see Venice on our return from the cruise. Instead we walked along the canal and visited a few shops and cafes while enjoying the quiet and views. Despite putting out the "do not disturb" sign, as we were tired from a long day and half of travel, we were disturbed by housekeeping for turn-down service. Fortunately, we were both reading, as the housekeeper barely knocked then barged in the room. There was no apology, just a rude grunt and slamming of the door. We walked about the hotel in seach of the executive lounge, but were directed to a closed one, then no one seemed to know where to find the open one. The hotel is vast and filled with conventioners, cruise ship travellers and did not seem particularly inviting nor quiet. It is a large hotel and offers little by way of the true character and charm of Venice which we happily discovered the following week when we stayed at the La Calcina when we returned from our cruise and enjoyed discovering the real Venice. The Hilton is far too removed and institutional. And though pleasant, the staff all seemed to want to do only what was necessary and no more. The final insult came on check-out when I went to pay for our internet charge (which is 27 Euro per 24 hours and we knew this in advance) and a room service charge. Keeping in mind the room had been prepaid directly to the cruise company and the hotel voucher presented at check-in. Included in the bill was another room charge! I pointed this out and they first tried to tell me that the room had not been prepaid. They were unable to produce the hotel voucher, though I offered them a copy to show it had indeed been prepaid. So then they tried to tell me that the room charge was for the "upgrade" we received to the room with a view. Again I showed them the original Hilton reservation confirmation showing that our room was already the executive room with a view so there had in fact not been an upgrade at all. They nevertheless insisted I had to pay this charge. I refused and asked to speak with a manager. The manager again went through the same spiel and even tried to take the papers away from me so that I couldn't prove what I had claimed. I held my ground and eventually they took the charge off, but then presented me with a bill for the mini-bar -- which we never opened nor had a key for. Beware of this place. While the glitz and marble might look great, this particular Hilton is a disgrace. Loved Venice, but hated the Molino Stucky.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place and service”
Reviews.Author: Danielmolnar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is the worst place. Service is slow and the concierge doesnt know what he is doing. Its better to stay in a 4 star hotel than this one which tey called 4 star

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous. Perfect in every way.”
Reviews.Author: okiemom
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It is very nice and well appointed with a fabulous staff. Every interaction we had with the front desk or concierge was first rate. They were friendly, helpful, knowledgeable and spoke English very well! The breakfast was incredibly good. Our room was large and the bath was large. Beds were very comfortable and the venetian glass chandelier is the perfect touch to the beautifully decorated room. The pool has an incredible view and is very comfortable. Our only complaints were the wait during the evening break for the shuttle ( however we planned accordingly after the first evening) and the fact that we could only stay 2 nights! I would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - but watch out for the Italia Club”
Reviews.Author: aereed
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights as part of a trip on the Orient Express but we booked seperately. The hotel is stunning and the staff are excellent. Take our advice and pay the extra for the rooms at the fvront of the hotel over looking the Canel and St Marks. The breakfast and rooms were really of excelent standard and free water taxis take you backwards and forward to the main islands regularly. The only issue we had was that the hotel was taken over by a company called Italia club - which was American. This meant that the hotel in effect was an all American affair - i will say ythe guests of the Italia Club were not the issue - it was the over bearing and very loud American organisers that were and it did mean that you could not use ythe restaurant terraces (which you want too in Venice) the nights they were at the hotel. A must when in Venice but check the Italia mob are not in residence!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with a quick shuttle to Piazza San Marco”
Reviews.Author: tuslac
Reviews.Content: Newer hotel up to the Hilton standards. Employees where very nice and helpfull. Here are some miscellaneous comments: - free water shuttle to Pizza San Marco, good shecudlign of hours until late at night - rooms are very nice, large and functional - bathrooms where very clean - as a Hilton honors diamond we got access to an executive lounge which was nice to come back to after a day of sightseeing - pool on the top floor has excellent views of Florence - we got free Wi-Fi but not sure if it was because of out Diamond status

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: flavad99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with hilton honors points, probably the most opulent hotel I've ever stayed at. I was upgraded to a suite upon my checkin. Views from the top of the hotel were incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: CoronadoCarol
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a perfect location for sightseeing, with a free hotel shuttle to Zattere and to St. Mark's Square. The room was small but nice, with a somewhat cramped bathroom and too little storage space (and no iron and board). The prices for everything were high--but they actually provided room for your own stuff in the refrigerator ! The staff were helpful, especially the young woman who checked us in who got us a room earlier than the check in time, and found us a very quiet room as we requested. Breakfast every day was included, and good (although it would not have been acceptable at 30 euros per person). One dinner was also included in our rate; the dishes ranged from acceptable to good, although the posted prices were very high. There is an unpublicized hotel bar downstairs that has Aperol spritzes for 3 euros, perhaps a bid to entice the locals. The pool on the roof had a wonderful view, but no umbrellas or shade in the June heat so was (for some) unusuable. As usual, this expensive hotel charged extra for the things that cheap hotels give you for free, such as printing out boarding passes (I have never had to pay for this before in a five star hotel with a concierge).

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and Clean Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: staciamiele
Reviews.Content: Positives: Huge hotel, new interior with clean and modern rooms. Negatives: A bit of a boat ride to downtown. Hotel boat is not easy to find and nearby vendors could not help. This is a beautiful hotel with great staff. The only downside is that it's not in the middle of the main land area. In the future, I would probably pay a little more to be in the center of it all.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a stunning property”
Reviews.Author: AaronRadez
Reviews.Content: I stayed with some friends at the Hilton Molino Stucky in late February, 2011. It was impeccably clean. The service was prompt, courteous and friendly. It was quiet, peaceful and the finish grade was quite luxurious. The hotel's stand alone location and water shuttle service offers the wow factor one would expect from a 5 star property in Venice. Albeit a little off the beaten path, the complimentary shuttle between San Marco and Giudecca was very easy to use. There are a few restaurants near the hotel if you don't want to make the trek in to town or partake in the Hilton's offerings.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with beautiful views!”
Reviews.Author: KelMar79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Molino Stucky Hilton for 2 nights before we departed for a cruise from Venice. This hotel waa beautiful. Although it wasn't right in Venice, but across the canal on an island, the shuttles every 20 minutes made the 5-10 minute ride quick and easy! Check in was easy and all the hotel staff were friendly and always had a smile. We never made it to the pool but we heard it was beautiful and had great views. The rooftop bar was very cool, especially at night, but drinks were very expensive. The hotel was very clean and immaculate. The elevators sometimes took a while and are extremely tiny, but we were on the first floor so we took the stairs a lot. The rooms were very nice and clean. Bigger than what I had expected. Beds were comfortable. Shower was a bit small...especially for my 6'7 husband, but it served its purpose. We made the mistake of leaving our bedroom window open (which have no screens) and when we came back to the room a couple hours later we had a lot of flies. All in all this hotel was wonderful and I highly recommend it to anyone visiting Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely AMAZING in every way! We'll be back for sure!!!”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_Hoser
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 1 night, pre-cruise and wished that we were staying for a week! Oh, where to start?! We stayed for free on Hilton Honors points and it was an amazing use of the 50,000 points for this category 7 hotel. As Diamond members we received a free uprade to a very nice sized room on the 6th floor directly overlooking the Guidecca canal... amazing! The room was probably 400 sq feet with a great tub and huge shower. A juliet balcony overlooked the canal with cruise ships sailing right by you in the evening and in the morning! Couldn't have been happier with the room. Ceiling were around 10 feet or so, great bed. To you Diamond and Gold Members out there, this place really caters. The executive lounge was great with selections of white and red wine and champagne as well. Lots of beer and other hard liquor brought out later in the evening. The appies here were the BEST of our trip... better than other Waldorf and Conrad properites we stayed at while they were also very good. Breakfast was excellent with many choices and great service. Again free for us so even better! Champagne was included to drink on it's own or make a mimosa which is always great and called for on vacation!! Front desk staff and concierge were very friendly and helpful. We can't wait to return to Venice in a couple of years and their is absolutely no doubt that we will be staying at this hotel.... I am saving up the points and already have enough for 3 free nights.... hope to stay here for maybe a 5 nights!!! Excellent shuttle service to everything, including the cruise terminal (extra charge for cruise terminal but waaay cheaper than water taxi) You will feel like you are staying in the nicest hotel in Venice in this beautiful hotel. Way to go Molino Stucky!!! Pictures to follow!

Reviews.Title: “horrid convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: norfolkcruisers
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with a view and ended up in the back of the hotel with a view of a wall, the fridge was filthy,the hairdryer socket didn't work, the room was located directly under a function room so every night was furniture moving night at 1 am. We also booked breakfast which the hotel said we had to pay for even though we had paid the agent upfront.Eventually the hotel accepted we had paid.

Reviews.Title: “"Most Amazing Room Ever!"”
Reviews.Author: CAIRVINE22
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton Diamond member my wife and I used points to book our three night stay in Venice. Upon arrival at Venezia Santa Lucia Station we walked outside and took the #52 Vaporetto to the Zattere stop. We then hopped on the convenient Hilton Shuttle to Guidecca. We checked in and were informed that our room had been upgraded. We were escorted to our room and were pleasantly surprised by the result. As we walked into Room 119 there was a kitchen area complete with a refrigerator, stove top, and microwave. We continued past the dining area into the living room. There were four large expansive windows in this area that opened out to the Guidecca canal. We were then escorted through the dressing area past the full bathroom which included a jacuzzi tub, separate shower, and bidet, to the bedroom which had a king bed and another set of windows which opened out onto the Guidecca canal. We cannot put into words how stunning the room was with the exquisite furnishings and view. The staff were extremely friendly and accommodating. The all-inclusive breakfasts and access to the all-inclusive executive lounge were outstanding. The evening night caps at the rooftop Sky Lounge were spectacular. The ambiance, music, and bartending staff were fantastic. We looked forward to ending our days of siteseeing there. We cannot say enough about our experience at this hotel. Certainly the upgrade made our stay more memorable; however, the property is worth seeing. We will certainly stay at this hotel again on our next visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely wonderful but..”
Reviews.Author: machelle53
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely wonderful just one flaw.. the beautiful rooftop pool closes at 730 pm. I was so looking forward to relaxing in the pool and gaze at the city lights. The pool door was locked and when I asked why I was told I could come back in the morning well I had to leave for my flight by 700A It was such a let down. Do not know why the pool closes so early?

Reviews.Title: “Loved it , nice and new and clean ....very happy customer Mr Hilton”
Reviews.Author: FelixF
Reviews.Content: Stayed with tour group 2 nights . What else can i say but it exceeded our expectations in all areas.Was the highlight of our trip as far as Hotels were concerned. Have never stayed with Hilton Hotels before ...look what I've been missing out on. PS They have a free water shuttle to St Marks Square which visually is close by but naturally you can't walk ...nor swim !!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific visit”
Reviews.Author: ccbozard
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay while visiting Venice. While it's location is a bit away from all the "attractions", the free shuttle boat allows you quick access - and then when you are done touring, you can get away from it all. The rooftop pool is a great amenity. Lots of options on the breakfast buffet. Room was very clean, bed was ultra comfortable, staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “All flash and no substance”
Reviews.Author: sloshel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for one night following a cruise. We had been looking forward to it for almost a year, after seeing photos of the hotel on its website. We are Hilton Hhonors members and used points to pay for the stay. We arrived at 10:00 a..m and were pleasantly surprised that a room was available for us to check into immediately. That is where the "pleasant" ended. The king-bedded room was very small and dark. There was one tiny window that looked out directly onto another building of the hotel (the hotel has 4 buildings.) Since we did not plan to spend much time in the room, it was not a big deal. The fitness center was small, dimly lit, and only had 2 machines that were usable. There was a beautiful pool with an incredible view on the top (8th) floor. However, there were not nearly enough lounge chairs in the pool area to accommodate the guests who came to use the pool or sunbathe. We asked the concierge (a bald, middle aged gentleman) to make us a reservation for a water taxi to the airport for the next morning. He asked us for our room number, then what time we wanted the taxi, then asked for our room number again. He was not at all helpful and was downright rude and condescending. When we came to the lobby the next morning to wait for the taxi, the front desk staffperson told us there was no reservation. Then the original concierge came up to us and told us the taxi would be here soon....we watched him call for a taxi then. Thank goodness we had allowed ample time to get to the airport. On the positive side, our room was clean, and the property is truly gorgeous. The room was quiet, but with the one small window and an incredibly hard mattress, I felt like we were in a prison cell. If I had paid for this stay rather than using points, I would be truly disappointed. Not up to Hilton quality by any stretch of the imagination.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with service.”
Reviews.Author: phylly34
Reviews.Content: My room was not ready, pillow in middle of bed with no case, bugs in sink with whisker shavings, toilet seat very loose, mosquitoes. Also, I was bitten on face, hands and arms by bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance defined”
Reviews.Author: OsideJC
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 night borning some hard earned Hilton points, I can not think of a better place to use them! Excellent service, ELEGANT property in an aweinspiring location. Since the property is not in the main part of Venice you have to take the water taxi from the train station, then the free Hotel shuttle (boat) takes you directly to the property, finding the dock for the shuttle was a bit confusing the first time but afterwards was a breeze. This amkes a nice base to explore Venice, I would highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the concierge”
Reviews.Author: cruiseagentandtaxman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on Easter weekend. The nice part about this newly renovated hotel is the fact that it is a bit apart from the oppressive crowds around St Mark's Square. The hotel shuttle is very convenient, but if you want to have a quiet dinner away from the crowds, Harry's Dolci is a few minute walk away. HOWEVER, watch out for the concierge. We had to meet our cruise ship and needed a taxi to take us. he ship was docked DIRECTLY across the canal from the hotel. It was docked about a 3 minute walk from the hotel shuttle stop across the canal. However we could see barriers on the dock, so we were concerned we could not simply cross the canal and get to the ship. The concierge assured us that we needed to take a 60 EURO taxi ride to the main cruise terminal in order to board the ship and he collected the money from us and gave us a hotel voucher. He was SO wrong it was criminal. The taxi took us directly across the canal and dropped us off at the barriers - where cruise personnel were taking the bags. We could have easily taken the hotel shuttle for free. I pointed this out in a letter to Hilton on our return. Their response was "we've told managment" and hope you try us again. They clearly feel a need to stiff their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Hilton excellence”
Reviews.Author: acoulter
Reviews.Content: We are Hiton Honors and the stay was a good example of Hilton service. The boat service to main attractions was reliable and free. We were very comfortable except for the limiting and slow Internet service. Food was acceptable and room was large and very comfortable. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: JPNYC33
Reviews.Content: We wanted to use our points so decided to stay at the Hilton. It's on Guidecca Island, so we were a bit concerned about the convience of getting from the hotel to downtown Venice, but we decided it's worth the money saved. Turns out we didn't have to worry at all. Guidecca is literally right across the river (maybe a mile length wise) and there is a shuttle every 20 minutes from the hotel to Zattare and San Marco. While it's not as convenient as staying on the main island, it's also not that bad. And the hotel is GORGEOUS. From outside, it's this huge brick building that takes up a good chunk of Guidecca. And from the inside, there are courts where you can sit within the building but be outside.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - but a few catches”
Reviews.Author: topherashley
Reviews.Content: First off, this is a great hotel but an AMAZING hotel if you get the canal view. You can't beat the views of Venice from your room. I would be disappointed if I was not facing this view though. The skybar is great and gives you a view of San Marco Square. Transportation to this hotel can be difficult as you have catch a private taxi from the airport or really know what you are doing and get around to the free transport at San Marco. I'd recommend but know that you are boating it to and from the main island. This can be difficult if you are tight on time.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: dipayanb
Reviews.Content: Being a Hilton property one obviously sets very high standards, but Stucky was a bit disappointing. The hotel service was a big let down. In our room we figured that the coffee maker was missing, though the sachets were there, the internet connection was available but cable was missing and when we asked for a dental kit, the attendant got us only one and was acted all surprised when we asked explained that obviously we would need two of them. To top it all, the room's locker malfunctioned and a security guard came along with the technician to get it repaired. The location is also a bit odd, but I guess anyone booking the rooms at the hotel would be aware before hand. The hotel is located on a lonely island and one has to use the hotel's ferry service that takes 10 minutes to reach St. Marks Square. Though it seems like a convenient arrangement - there is a ferry every 20 minutes - there is a long break of around an hour at night which is a bit annoying. Also, if you have to catch a train or reach the airport at odd hours, it can be a bit annoying as well finding a transport option. For the price it charges and the brand it flaunts, I would think that this is a bad option.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but with some faults”
Reviews.Author: BNM60
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Molino Stucky for 4 days for my husbands birthday. Overall the hotel was OK but unless youask specifically for clean towels they just hung up the dirty ones hoping you wouldn't notice. Although I ordered a birthday cake at the Aromi restaurant, they forgot this completely, although the meal was very nice. Venice is very overcrowded and the hotel was thankfully away from this being on a island. However, you do have to be seaworthy to withstand all the necessary boat trips back and forth to Venice proper. Travellers beware however, Venice is extremely expensive and the Italians are very brazen in asking for tips on top of all this! Check out all the concerts - these are many and ferquent and usually very good.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst!”
Reviews.Author: nishmist
Reviews.Content: Possibly, one of the worst 3 star hotels I have been in to. The carpets were stained. The bathroom had a tub, no shower curtain, no shower cubicle. There are 40 TV channels, but nothing worth seeing. When I spoke to the receptionist, she said â€œyou should have had a shower curtain but I cannot send anyone now to put itâ€�. She did not even apologise. Later in the sky bar, the bartender completely forgot one of the drinks & after 15 minutes when we reminded him, he said that particular drink was not there & brought us another one instead. But he never apologised! The only positive thing after the stay was that during the check out the relations manager appeared to take my complaints seriously & told me that they would look in to it & reduced 30 euros (off the drinks) in spite of my resistance!

Reviews.Title: “Good base for Venice”
Reviews.Author: rebel75
Reviews.Content: We booked in January and got a half-price deal Â£357 for 3 nights, it was a good hotel but I think I probably would have been disappointed if I'd paid the full price. Our room was spotlessly clean but the air con wasn't great and we found it too hot at night. Breakfast - food was very good, but other hotels we stayed in during our trip to Italy were 3 star and the food was better. There was a feeling of being on a conveyor belt in the mornings because it is a large hotel and as such has a lot of people to see through breakfast, but the service was extremely efficient and friendly. We loved the rooftop bar, great views of Venice - of course the drinks were outrageously expensive but it's worth doing once during your stay. (Pets are allowed here, but I draw the line at having to share the roof top bar with a barking dog while I'm trying to enjoy my overpriced cocktail... very annoying!!) The shuttle boat across to Venice was great, except when it was busy when we saw some guests left behind - get there a few minutes early during busy times. Also be aware that the service takes a break for a couple of hours in the evening - we thought we could get a vaporetto back instead but guess what, they were also on a break!!! With careful planning you won't get caught out like we did... Nothing much to see really on Giudecca itself - it's nice for an evening stroll, and there are a couple of nice snack bars and ristorantes but seems to be largely an island suburb. All in all a good hotel and compares well price wise to other Venice hotels, especially if you can get a good deal booking in advance. The staff were efficient and friendly. But if you're looking for a hotel with character this is probably not for you...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ntanna
Reviews.Content: The Hilton in Venice is a great hotel. Situated on an island away from the main town. It has regular free shuttle services to the main square. The hotel is well equipped. Nice beds, very clean. The breakfast is a must... a wide range of world foods and italian cheeses.

Reviews.Title: “Great city break”
Reviews.Author: NewlyWed14
Reviews.Content: I visited Venice in February 2011 for Valentines day with my husband. Venice is incredible and very romantic. We both loved it and 3 nights was enough for us as we were able to do/see everything we wanted. As for the Hilton Molino Stucky, the location is great because it's away from the centre of Venice although the regular shuttle boat was great and we were pleased to be so well connected. The service is brilliant and was always on time. We stayed in a Deluxe suite which was very small compared to other rooms we have stayed in. The temperature was also very hot and uncomfortable in the room and we had trouble sleeping. This is my main criticism of the hotel. We were not too impressed with the breakfast, I was expecting more variety as I have seen a lot better in non-Hilton hotels which is a shame. The rest of our stay was great and we had a lovely time. The staff were very helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic base for exploring Venice”
Reviews.Author: AngusMcGonagle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. Everything about the stay was great. It feels like a little bit of a retreat from the main areas of Venice, and if you're OK with that, it's lovely. The room was good sized, comfortable and looked out over Venice. The bed was enormous and the floor was absolutely silent so making for good sleep. One of the main reasons we chose the Hilton was to get a decent breakfast. This was included in our deal and didn't disappoint. There was a wide selection of food with a local twist. The service was generally very good and we received some good recommendations from the front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service. Quiet location, LARGE and comfortable by euro standards.”
Reviews.Author: phatduc
Reviews.Content: Thanks guys we really enjoyed our stay! Top notch service, everyone went out of their way to accomodate. The property is sprawling by euro standards, a tastefully coverted industrial-era factory of sorts, rooms/baths are modern and large by euro standards, rennovated in line with western tastes for a comfortable upper range luxury hotel stay, vs the cozy/charm/romance of a Venetian Baroque/ Gothic palazzi experience that are replete on the islands surrounding grand canal. After a week of the cozy/charming/romantic Italian hotel experience, the scaled up size and modern fit out of the Molino Stucky was most welcome. The gym/spa is small by US standards, take a run and do your push-ups along Guideccas waterfront instead. Molino has the pool on the roof and yesss the view from up there is pretty cool. Yes, Giudecca is a tad out-of-the-way too, never more than a 30 minute boat ride from where you are or going to in Venice. It was never an issue for siteseeing and restaurantouring, and kinda neat for the kids too. Do call ahead to the concierge for the hotel shuttle schedule, or just take the vaporetto which stops a few hundred meters stroll from the hotel on the west end of Giudecca. You're fine either way unless you've got tons of luggage in tow, inwhich case the hotel shuttle or a private taxi is the way to go. The bar is large and comfortable for lounging while you wait for a water taxi, but it's safe to assume naturally that you will be dining out simply because the options for good eats in Venice are inexhaustible and an experience in itself that should not be missed. On the whole, a great experience- THANK YOU Molino Stucky!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel of Our Trip”
Reviews.Author: JaniceMT
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, location and service!!!! Buffet breakfast was incredible. Location is perfect! The free shuttle gets your the sites and brings you back to tranquility at days' end! Would not hesitate to recommend to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our expectations! Cant think of one bad thing about this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jordanmccool1
Reviews.Content: My husband is a Hilton Honors diamond member and we have been to several of the best Hiltons and Waldorf Astorias in the world. I was not expecting this hotel to be near as wonderful as it was. As Hilton diamond members, we received many perks. We got a Venice view room, access to the exutive lounge, and free buffet breakfast. The room was not huge, felt very luxurious. I was struck by the beautiful wood ceilings that are in the lobby and all of the rooms. The ceiling really gave the hotel a very luxurious, yet cozy and rustic feel. All of the decor was luxurious and updated. Our room's window was also beautiful. It oped up to look out over the Guidecca Canal, giving a beautiful view if Venice from across the waterway. The buffet breakfast and the lounge were beyond our expectations! The breakfast has tons of choices and we had cappuccinos and mimosas every morning, The breakfast would have been a bit expensive if we hadn't had it included, but if you are not worried about paying 30 euro for breakfast, then go for it. It was a great start to each morning we had there. The excutive lounge was also an amazing perk. From 11am to 11pm, we had access to unlimited soft drinks, water, wine, beer, and champagne. Depending on the time of day, they also had cocktails, desserts, and appetizers. The lounge was right in the main part of the lobby and was a perfect place to have a glass of wine before catching the water shuttle to town for dinner. As for the hotel water shuttle, as long as you have the schedule with you, it is incredibly convenient. It leaves the hotel every 20-30 minutes and picks up at two central locations in venice. We never once thought it to be an inconvenience. After our 3 days in Venice, we went on to Florence and Rome. This hotel was tied for our favorite with the Rome Cavalieri, one of the top Waldorf Astorias in the world. I had expected the Rome Cavalieri to be much nicer than the Molino. We were very pleasantly surprised by the room, the atmosphere of the hotel, and the service. Nothing bad to say about this place! If you are a Hilton gold or diamond member, do not hesitate in booking this hotel for your time in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SoniaBraga15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hilton Molino Stucky and in regards to hotels it was the highlight at the end of our trip. It is in the Giudeca island of Venice and the hotel provides a free shuttle that runs every 20 minutes to St. Mark's square so it very very convenient. It was nice to get away at night back to our private beautiful hotel away from the noisy streets of Venice. The views are amazing! Venice overall was a wonderful experience and a beautiful city to visit!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome but expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tosind
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© & I stayed here for 8 nights, hotel staff were very helpful,shuttle was fun & relaxing though they sometimes didn't keep to time on their timetable. Food, drinks & Internet access were very expensive I would suggest going to the local supermarket to buy drinks,water,etc Liked the fact the hotel was away from 'main' Venice. Hotel breakfast well worth it

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: bobcrisp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a two week cruise. The staff was poorly trained and the site is too far from the center of all activities in St. Marks. If you are looking to have peace and quite... this is your place... as a matter of fact you can sit in the bar for hours and no one will come to bother you or wait on you...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, But Ran Into Some Problems Along the Way”
Reviews.Author: irivamon
Reviews.Content: Venice is an awesome city, but the crowds in Venice proper can be a nuisance. So it was a nice respite to stay at the Hilton, away from all the hustle and bustle of Venice. If you timed your excursions accordingly, the shuttle is not a big issue. It arrives frequently and late enough for our purposes. It was also nice to see Venice from afar, and there's something calming and relaxing about taking the boat ride. The views are great, and the breakfast buffet was worth it. Just don't order a soda during breakfast because that's an extra 5 Euro. The staff was great too. But we had some problems along the way which is not the hotel's fault. During the second-to-the-last night of our stay, we were greeted by a leaking roof. Apparently, the guest in the room above us forgot to turn off the faucet and water was leaking through the roof and onto the bed and floor. We immediately notified guest services and it took them 10 minutes to return my call. Nonetheless, they came up with a porter, moved our luggage and personal items, and offered us a Tourist Suite for the remainder of our stay. They also allowed us to access the Executive Lounge for free drinks (including alcohol), snacks and Internet access. We were tired so we found this as compensation enough, although I would have negotiated for more. The Tourist Suite was nice, but it offered less closet space than a regular room. Also, the suite has only one phone in the bedroom, which does not make sense because there's a living room area where a phone would be handy. Otherwise, it was great! Finally, the rooms were hot! Even in March and although we had the air conditioner on high. We couldn't open the windows for too long because of the mosquitoes!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: boohers
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay here. We were upgraded to a suite because we had our teenage son with us. The Suite was beautiful. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The Executive lounge was very nice. The hotel shuttle to San Marco was very convenient. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awful experience”
Reviews.Author: frdgrss
Reviews.Content: Firstly the location is ridiculous, the hotel is on it's own island so we had to wait so long for the water shuttle every time we wanted to go anywhere. We had booked this holiday as our honeymoon and were very excited to be staying in a Hilton Hotel in Venice, it all sounded so magical. I booked on Expedia and decided to go for the upgraded room, which I saw pictures of on the internet. When we arrived I asked whether it was possible that we could have an upgrade seeing as it was our honeymoon but was told that there were no room left to be upgraded to - fair enough I thought anyway we had a nice room that we had upgraded to. The woman told us that we had a lovely view from our window which we were excited about. When we get to our room it didn't look anything like the room we had booked, it was much smaller and when I looked outside our window the view was of building work - not the beautiful view that we had originally thought we would experience. On the first night we went downstairs to take the shuttle so we could go out for some dinner, after waiting a while for the annoying shuttle to arrive I asked the concierge if we could take a private boat to the restaurant and asked how much it would cost, i obviously didn't want to pay a fortune. To my amazement he told me the price was 6 Euros so we booked it. After waiting another 20 mins for that boat to come which then seemed like a waste of time because we could have taken the shuttle after all, we took the boat to dinner. When we arrived at the restaurant, to my astonishment the driver said it was 60 Euros!! When we arrived back to England We received a credit card bill for hundreds of pounds for phone bills and other erroneous bills - we never used the phone and didn't eat anything at the hotel!! I managed to cancel those charges. I would never stay here ever again, and would not recommend this hotel to anyone who wishes to have a nice romantic holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing 5 star but fabulous views”
Reviews.Author: TraceyR2412
Reviews.Content: Awesome refurbishment of a magnificent building - dominates the little island across the canal from 'main' Venice (where St Marks is) but poor service, lack of attention to detail & excessive prices in the hotel bars & restaurants in my opinion means it fails to be a 5 star as it is supposed to be. E12 for an hour on the internet (Hoxton can do it for free). E5.95 for a bottle of water in your room when the little supermarket about 500yards away it was 14cents. E9 for a (very) small glass of wine (not even Italian), supermarket had a wide choice from about 1euro - and it was very drinkable. A burger in the 'casual' bar/diner E24. Hospitality tray not refilled properly, just the little things irked. Oh, and a 'complimentary' water-taxi to a glass factory is an hour long hard-sell - Â£2000 for a bowl - beautiful it was, but please do I look like Rockefeller in my jeans, rigger boots & the hotel umbrella? As well as the impressive building though, bed comfy, room very quiet & free frequent shuttle bus to the main island & free Prosecco for breakfast were some of the good things. All in all, a pleasant trip, but I'm sure there are better value places to stay in Venice

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet, Elegant Escape from the Crowds of Venice”
Reviews.Author: ATLBob
Reviews.Content: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed 6 nights at the Hilton Molino Stucky and loved that it was comfortable, clean, beautiful, and away from the crowds of Venice. The location gives you a terrific view of Venice from across the canal and provides a chance to relax and exhale after a long day of wandering the back streets and canals of Venice. As Hilton Diamond members, we enjoyed complimentary buffet breakfast and access to the Exec. Lounge, which provided wonderful cicchitti, prosecco, wine, beer and any other adult beverages you'd like. Whenever we needed anything, we found that service was prompt and professional. Food quality was very good all around. With free shuttle boat service from 8 a.m. until around 1 a.m., it's convenient to get to and from San Marco or Zatterre. The views from the skyline rooftop pool and bar were fantastic. We're planning our next trip to Venice and have already made arrangements to stay in the Molino Stucky once again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kmandrew
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here and had a great time; given a view room overlooking the Grand Canal. We are Diamonds so also given access to the lounge, right off the lobby; great drinks, desserts, and finger food. You can also order off the menu there if you want a complete meal. Overall thumbs up, liked it better than the WA Cavaliere in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Great service -- Great Views”
Reviews.Author: sherie1012
Reviews.Content: Excellent luxury hotel located across canal from St. Mark's Sq. -- with free boat service about every thirty minutes makes location easy. Executive level is way to go as there are hors douvres and pastries all day for your return to the hotel after sightseeing. There is magnificent breakfast and rooms are spacious and very clean. The concierge is very helpful and friendly -- one of the best Hilton's I have stayed in as a diamond member. I can highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but refuse a room on the 7th floor unless you want loud music from SkyBar.”
Reviews.Author: FoxtrotOscar
Reviews.Content: Generally good - hotel feels well put together with expensive furnishings and plenty of space. Rooms are good. Shuttle boats are reliable and convenient. Two gripes however: 1. We were kept awake by very loud music from the Sky Bar, which is open until 1am at weekends. Do not accept being allocated a room on the 7th floor. The hotel also has a daft happy hour policy where you have to spend 25 eur which gets you one drink and a buffet you won't need if you are planning on eating out. Their loss as we refused this. 2. The girl in charge of the spa was very frustrating. Before parting with 15 eur for the turkish bath and jacuzzi we wanted to take a look - not unreasonable. She refused to let us see it as "there were people in there". After 10 minutes of arguing we got her to show us the facility...which was a bit pokey and not worth 15 eur. Good job we looked...maybe that's the reason they don't want to show people. Other than that, its a good upscale hotel and good value for money if you can get a good rate - we got 50% off on a weekend promotion.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but someway off perfect”
Reviews.Author: robsinclair
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in September for our anniversary. The hotel buildings are certainly impressive and we were made to feel special on arrival at the hotel, with it impressive reception. The renovation has been very sympathetic to the building's former use, with lots of exposed wood and steel beams, and I cannot fault it at all in that respect. As HHonors gold members we were given use of the executive lounge on the ground floor which was excellent, serving a wide choice of snacks and canapes throughout the day and also a good choice of complimentary beverages. We could quite easily have gotten by on the food and drink in there alone! The hotel did have one or two downsides however. The room we were given, whilst nicely decorated, was very small, with enough room to only just get around the bed. Certainly not what we had expected for over â‚¬300 a night, nor in keeping with the grandeur of the rest of the hotel. The rooftop pool too is very small for such a big hotel - being in Venice where we spent most of the day sightseeing, the quality of the pool isn't the biggest factor, but still, it would have been nice to spend a couple of hours there in the early evening relaxing in the sun - except there are only about 10 loungers for the entire hotel - completely inadequate! Worst of all was that my wife had her jewellery stolen from the room of the hotel - we hadn't kept it in the safe, a mistake we won't make again, but it was something we didn't expect from such a high calibre hotel. Whilst you can't management directly for this incident their response was less than helpful and there was no kind of investigation into the people who had accessed our room or any compensation or other assistance offered. Not really good enough if you ask me. The location of the hotel is both a plus and a minus - on a plus, you can get away from the busyness of much of the historic centre, which is crammed with tourists 24/7, on the minus you are away from all the bars/restaurants, though the hotel's waterbus service was very reliable and we didn't mind it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a little on the pricy side”
Reviews.Author: KeithWS
Reviews.Content: Had a pleasant stay with my wife the weekend after attending a conference. I had some free nights with Hilton Honours so I used these otherwise I may have chosen a hotel closer to the centre of Venice. The only to reach the hotel is by water taxi (not a surprise some may say in Venice) but you can find hotels and be able to walk from the railway station to most places in Venice but only if you travel light. The Hilton has its own scheduled water taxi to two points closer to the heart of Venice, this service is free of charge we visited in October so the hotel wasnâ€™t crowded but I guess this taxi service could get very busy during the summer months. A regular water taxi and a water taxi to the Airport also stops at the Hilton jetty so this is very convenient eth arriving or when travelling home, the transfer time is over 1 hour each way and you have to pre book the service. The rooms are what you expect from Hilton, nicely appointed with all the amenities you could ask for. As we were on a room only basis we had to pay for breakfast, that was, until we saw the cost Euro 30.00 each! Room service was also extortionate. I would visit again but the remote position put me off a little.

Reviews.Title: “Has a unique style and elegance.”
Reviews.Author: TwilightZone55
Reviews.Content: This is a very comfortable hotel, with an excellent restaurant and helpful staff. We took advantage of the boat shuttle to the mainland so we could explore Venice. Room was very nicely appointed, with a luxurious bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 5 Star Venetian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SanClementeReitler
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I stayed here during our trip to Venice. We were upgraded to a suite with a water view. The room was very large by European standards and beautifully decorated. The bed was very firm with really nice linens. The hotel offered a complimentary, private water taxi to all of their guests, so you do not need to buy water taxi tickets for multiple days. We found this to be a huge cost savings and great convenience. By far, our favorite part of our stay was the amazing complimentary breakfast. The food was delicious and included massive amounts of food, beverages, and champagne. The breakfast was 30 euros per person for non guests, which is a reasonable price. As guests, we paid nothing. It was a really outstanding meals. This hotel was a great place to stay and we will definitely stay here again in the future when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Molino Stucky”
Reviews.Author: NedSouthampton
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at the Hilton Molino Stucky and loved it. Big sprawling hotel built from the old flour mill on the island of Giudecca in Venice. Excellent modern bedroom and very welcoming staff. Fantastic Hilton breakfast couldn't be faulted. Enjoyed wonderful, if expensive, drinks at the Skyline bar with fantastic views over Venice. Free regular shuttle to Zatterre and St Marks vaporetta stops. We enjoyed being slightly away from the main Venice tourist attractions on this quieter and more local island.

Reviews.Title: “5-Star Rooms, Spacious, Modern, and Marvelous”
Reviews.Author: megadeaf
Reviews.Content: This is truly the 5-Star Hotel of Venice. Targeted for business travelers with spacious conference centers, our family thoroughly enjoyed the accommodations and marvelous breakfast buffet. Luxurious bed and mattress! Glorious canal view! We were fortunate to find a deal through Priceline, so value is difficult to rate. The lobby staff went over and beyond during a rain storm, offering umbrellas and assistance while vigilantly keeping the lobby dry. The breakfast buffet was 5-star in its own right. The hotel's private water taxi makes visiting Venice as easy as stepping out the front door! The famous Il Molino restaurant is here, and though we could not dine in Venice, the same in Las Vegas (Ceasar Forum) is truly a once-in-a-lifetime dining experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: yosefthegod
Reviews.Content: I recently took my wife here for 2 nights over Valentines weekend. Its a very beautiful hotel in an old flour mill on the southern island of La Giudecca. We had a deluxe room plus (booked on Lastminute.com for half the usual price!) which was very spacious, clean and well appointed, with lovely exposed wooden beams and a wonderful (and huge) bed. The view of the canal between the two islands was extensive and had it not been so misty (can't really blame the hotel for that) would have been very beautiful. The hotel is VERY expensive when it comes to things like food. On our first night we arrived quite late and didn't fancy going back out to the main island, so ordered room service. For two basic baguettes, it cost us â‚¬38. Oh and don't take anything from the in-room mini-bar. A small Toblerone is â‚¬8 and things are automatically charged to your room if you take them out! Staff in the hotel are very polite, friendly and helpful. It makes a nice change to have someone open doors for you and say hello every time you see them. Breakfast is great. You can take your time, and there is a huge amount of choice of fresh fruit, pastries, breads, cereals, meats, cheeses and fried. You can even pour yourself a big glass of sparkling wine each morning! Thanks to take note of: The free shuttle-boat between the hotel and the two stops on the main island. When we first arrived in St Marks square we spent at least an hour walking up and down the promenade looking for the right pontoon for the Molino Stucky boat. It is only marked by a small timetable and is near-impossible to see in the dark. We were expecting it to be more obvious and after the walk from the bus station at the top of the island we were very tired so we didn't expect to have to spend so long hunting for it. Once we knew where it was, however, using the shuttle boat was extremely easy. It was always on time and never too full. For your info, the main pontoon at St Marks square is near a large statue, directly opposite a hotel/restaurant called Pensione Wildner. As already mentioned, the food in the hotel is very expensive and I think this is a general theme throughout Venice. However, there is a supermarket directly opposite the hotel on the main island. Get off the shuttle boat at the first stop and then walk along the canal until your pretty much opposite the hotel and you will find it. They sell pretty much everything you might want for a picnic . The map of the hotel that you are given on arrival also has a very good map of Venice. It was better than the map in our guidebook. Make sure you get one. Overall, we had a great time and I would recommend this hotel if you can find a good deal online somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a big professional meeting but not seeing Venice”
Reviews.Author: Lycomedes
Reviews.Content: The building is a stunning refurbishment of a rambling brick flour mill "Molino Stucky" a listed building at the far end of La Giudecca, so a good way from San Marco and a 1.5 hour public boat transfer from Marco Polo airport. It's huge. Internal layout confusing - have to find right lift to get to right block of rooms - had to ask four times - very friendly staff - before I finally found mine after arriving late on a very rainy night having missed the last boat connection over from Zatere. Rooms nice and quiet if a bit chilly in mid February. Pricey wifi connection. Good conference facilities and about the hotel in Venice large and modern enough to hold a big professional congress. But don't expect to just pop out for a quick stroll around town without planning your boat timetable in advance. If not on expenses then â‚¬30 for breakfast - great buffet - is pushing it a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic venue, great location away from the hustle of Venice but with the benefits”
Reviews.Author: FeeJaySydney
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while I attended a conference at the hotel. We could not have been happier with the hotel or the location for our first visit together to the beautiful city of Venice. The staff were wonderful - everyone we came into contact with was friendly and helpful - we felt they genuinely wanted to make our stay with them enjoyable and memorable. Our room on the 6th floor had a great view, even though it was on the side of the hotel and it was spacious and well set out. The Stucky is well serviced by a free shuttle to San Marco and other parts of Venice. There are a couple of really nice restaurants within a 5-10 minute walk of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneShepherdess
Reviews.Content: First for the positives The hotel was peaceful and whilst not in the main tourist part of town there were very frequent and quick free transfers to the main tourist areas, including St Marks Square. We booked directly with hotel on a rate which included breakfast - the breakfast buffet was very good and extensive (although service for tea and coffee was slow due to how busy it was at times). The concierge was very helpful and gave good recommendations on where to go and where to eat. We got a good rate for the hotel and it represented good value for money. The less good bits: Our hotel room did not have a view at all - our room looked out at a piece of wasteland. The hotel's roof top bar had no atmosphere and we did not use it which was a shame given the views were great. The pool was also on the roof with great views but was crowded and hard to get somewhere to sit and there was no shade at all. I would not receommend eating in the hotel in the evening - we didn't try it but the restaurants did not look very appealing, mainly in terms of decor and ambience. I think this was made worse by the very large groups of cruise passengers who passed through the hotel for presumably a one night stay at the beginning or end of a trip.

Reviews.Title: “just what you would expect from a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: TravellersChoice657
Reviews.Content: exceptional city, exceptional architecture of the hotel. location just a bit "off" but always a thrill to take the free shuttle boat over to st. marks sq. the location again is quieter than being right in the city. great rooftop pool funny evening bar crowd staffs friendliness did not really exceed expectation...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing city-amazing hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Lauben
Reviews.Content: Staff incredibly knowledgable and helpful- excellent standards as you'd expect. The shuttle bus really isn't a problem and it was nice to be away from the hustle and bustle of the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Good surprise”
Reviews.Author: nanar37
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in September 2010, for a professional convention. The hotel has been renovated and the room we were allocated (Deluxe) was very cosy, and we had a nice view on San Marco. The shuttle service bewteen the hotel and the main island is quite efficient. A very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view of the canals”
Reviews.Author: Traveler60614
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice after a long trans-atlantic flight and set off on getting to the Hilton, which is no easy feat. Once getting there, our room was ready and it could not have been better. We received an upgrade for my Hilton status and the mini-suite had a sitting room, large bathroom, and separate bedroom. They shuttle you into Venice every hour, which is nice, but can be a bit inconvenient coming back since you didn't want to miss the shuttle. Water taxis are very, very expensive so missing the shuttle is costly. The hotel is away from the action and we did not eat there except for breakfast, which was very good. If you want a hotel with very nice amenities and for it to be in a quiet location, this is definitely your spot!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: HeavyTravel
Reviews.Content: Visited Venice with 11 friends in november, and we were very satisfied with our 3 nights at the Hilton. As diamond members we were upgraded and really enjoyed the extended service in the excutive lounge. We like to stay at the Guidecca Island because it is more quiet surroundings and the boat trip across the canal is relaxing. There was a lot of water in the streets, but that did not stop us from walking across the san marco and dorsoduro area to visit the sights and churches. We had lunch at Bancogiro one day and at Boccadoro the other day. In the evenings and night we stayed in the hotel and had dinner at the Aroma restaurant. The food was absolutely excellent and the Parmesan Fondue with truffles was to die for. Very good wine as well. The hotel staff provided very good service and showed flexibility to accomodate our group of twelve. I would absolutely recommend Venice in november because it's not too crowded that time of the year. From the airport to the hotel and return we travelled by watertaxi through the charming canals of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Overpriced Drinks!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller34372
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room and view of Venice, easy trip to St. Marks Square via their shuttle. Staff very helpful and gracious. But...stay away from the bar...$14 Euros for a Campari and tonic which was about the same price as a club sandwich with fries in their dining area. I guess that's a major revenue stream for Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: carnetdaventure
Reviews.Content: This is a large modern hotel. Rooms and service are top notch. Of course, because it is large hotel run by an international chain, it lacks the charm of a proper Venetian palazzio. But at least everything is smooth from checkin to breakfast to newspapers... Another upside is that rooms are larger than most hotels in Venice. The shuttle to go back and forth to the San Marco is also very reliable. Tips: The hotel restaurant is convenient but soulless. There are some nice trattorias along the canal (turn right as you leave the hotel)

Reviews.Title: “Calm oasis away from the frantic daytrippers of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Bellarina126
Reviews.Content: The second part of our Italian adventure was spent in Venice, and after spending a lot of time online trying to find the right hotel, I decided to book via Hotwire because I knew we would end up with the Hilton Molino Stucky based on my research. We ended up paying about $150/night for it by using Hotwire. The first thing about the hotel is that itâ€™s on a separate island from Venice proper in the Guidecca. We read Elton John actually has an estate in the island. We took a vaperetto from St. Lucia to Zattere and picked up the complimentary hotel shuttle from there. It was like clockwork, seriously. The hardest part was simply navigating a crowded vaperetto with our luggage. The hotel shuttle drops you off right in front of the hotel, and we were able to check in immediately. We were given a room in one of the back towers (this hotel is a maze â€“ it was a former mill) overlooking a small courtyard. The room was quite large by Venetian standards and beautifully appointed. After Florence, we relished the luxury of the bathtub, the large marble bathroom, and comfortable bed. The staff was friendly, although not entirely efficient â€“ they run on Italian time. One thing that concerned me when I read the reviews was the hassle of the hotel shuttle, but truthfully, it was very easy. We could go to Zattere or directly to San Marco on a set schedule. There was also a vaperetto stop within minutes of the hotel when the hotel shuttle wasnâ€™t running. We spent many nights roaming around Venice, and we were still able to get back via hotel shuttle. Additionally, I got up before the hotel shuttle was running one morning to photograph the city, and I was able to catch a vaperetto to San Marco without a problem. There is a period of time during the evening when they take a break, but you can schedule around that. You can get a full schedule from the front desk. The location of the hotel is fantastic. Venice is very crowded during the day, so itâ€™s nice to have reprieve from the crowds when you return to your room. The hotel was very peaceful and we never heard our neighbors, even though the hotel was sold out while we were there. Breakfast is pricy, so I suggest visiting the market and bringing things back to your room. There is a Billa market within a 5 minute walk of the Zattere stop with reasonably priced groceries. Thereâ€™s also a wonderful rooftop bar with beautiful views of the city. We never tried the restaurants, but Gianniâ€™s at the Zattere stop was pretty tasty with a varied menu. We had more than a few meals there after a long day of sight-seeing. Overall, I would recommend this hotel over anything near San Marco, the Rialto or on the Grand Canal. The traffic is just too frantic, and I would tire of fighting the crowds. Plus, you have to contend with the aqua alta throughout the day. The Molino Stucky is a calm oasis and a beautiful place to rest after experiencing the beauty of Venice. The beds are comfortable, the air conditioner works well, the windows open, and the service is very friendly. What more do you want? And, they have a spa on site so you can pamper your feet after a long day of exploring!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: aaroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: Not the cheapest place to stay in Venice for sure but worth its price. All well know hilton advantages plus a free comfortable and fast water taxi to Marko Polo square several times a day. Rooms are very spacious what is not common in venice and with fantastic viev on the canal Although hotel is in american standard it keeps venetian style.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NomadinUK
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice, location was sufficient as they provided complementary water transport. Rooftop pool and bar were very nice especially for drinks in the evening--although service was a bit spotty at the bar. Overall, a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: AOVERTW
Reviews.Content: the location of the hotel is perfect , breakfast is also very good and all the rest of the service but considering the price that we paid for december time i think that its a bit too much ,. Anyway ehoever goes there will have a very good time

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB.”
Reviews.Author: dutseal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from December 28 through December 30, 2010 and then again from January 1 to January 3, 2011. Of all my hotel stays around the world, this has to be one of the most beautiful hotel. By the beautiful river in Venice, ship dock right in front, free water shuttle bus to the St Mark's Basilica, very courteous staffs, good value for breakfast buffet. Upon our arrival back on January 1, 2011, we actually got the King Executive Presidential Suite with Separate Living room and Kitchenette. I wished I could have stayed longer....I love that hotel and especially the suite. Love Love Love.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: JenandChris
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon in May 2010. We found it straightforward (after quite a walk at Marco Polo Airport) to use the waterbus service where the hotel is the final stop on one of the major routes. Using the waterbus allows you to see the whole of the city in the lagoon, including Saint Mark's, before you actually get to your hotel. The first impression of the hotel is very impressive and this carries on once you are inside. The twice hourly (and free) shuttle taxi is ideal and ensured that the city centre was only ever 10-15 relaxing minutes away and this service continued to relatively late (11-11.30ish from memory). The food in the bar area is to be avoided - poor and very expensive - but the breakfasts were superb. Beautiful room with an entirely separate serving room where all the usual foods were attractively displayed and freshly prepared. The room was very comfortable. The one negative point relates to when we wanted to go the island of Murano. When asking about waterbuses the hotel provided us with a complementary watertaxi. Unfortunately this was available because of an arrangement they have with the Signoretti factory. This as it turned out is a very important factory which produces some beautiful glass. However, the whole sightseeing experience was marrred by the extremely high pressure sales techniques used. It soon became clear we were expected to buy something in return for the taxi trip. We managed to escape with a small piece of glass for 200 euro and when you consider the taxi might have cost 80 euro one way we probably got off lightly especially given the pieces we were being 'sold' initially were in the 3,000 euro region. No such thing as a free taxi ride! We would recommend you use the bus services which are excellent and that way you can see the rest of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to see Venice”
Reviews.Author: Jasminepad
Reviews.Content: Beautiful setting, history, service and views. Was worried it would be too far out from the main island. It was a short free shuttle across the river which ran frequently all day and evening. Rooms were spacious and decorated in Venetian style. Would recommend and stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Brand consistency with Venetian history”
Reviews.Author: atlbeme
Reviews.Content: It's a Hilton Hotel and to that end, they have a brand image to project. The building is a converted industrial building (flour mill). The interiors are aimed at providing certain Hilton amenities while retaining some of the old architectural elements, this in itself is very cool. We were upgraded to a junior suite with a side view of the canal. It was spacious, sitting room, great bathroom and shower. A little mold in the corner of the shower was a turn off.
