Our friends had an executive room, front of the building, facing the canal. Nice view, but our room was bigger. We used the executive lounge which was nice. We did not check out the pool or the restaurants. Even if the weather was good, why travel to Venice to swim and eat at a hotel? I don't get why some folks expect to have the place all to themselves or complain about the inconvenience of the shuttle. It's a BIG hotel. It may be the biggest one by room count in Venice. No matter where you go there will be tourists clogging the front desk, the main attractions. it is Venice, and it is a big tourist town. Try being there during Aqua Alta (high tide) when they put up the raised sidewalks. Especially around Piazza San Marco it was just one big traffic jam. The hotel is on the other side of the Giudecca canal from everything. Giudecca island has a few restaurants, stores, shops.My advice, enjoy the Hilton for it's being some what removed from all main area hub bub, the shuttle is convenient enough (check the schedule, there are breaks in the schedule, based on time of day and destination). and for those who don't want to wait. Walk to one of two Vaporetto stops ( Sacca Fisola and Palanca) 5 minutes walk either direction. The 41, 42, and 2 lines run every 10-20 minutes during the day, and the 2 line runs all night with a more limited schedule (every 40 minutes) so even when the hotel shuttle stops, you can get within walking distance of the hotel. (We arrived by train at 1am, bought a ticket on the 2 line and made it to the hotel by 2am). If you are coming from the Airport, the Alilaguna Blue and Rossa Lines stop right at the hotel, it takes 1 1/2 hour from Airport Dock to Hotel, and for 15Euro you get a ride with nice views of the lagoon, Murano, Lido, and around Venice Central Live a little, get around like the Venetians via water bus and get lost walking through the neigborhoods.

Reviews.Title: “DONT COME HERE - Unless you like bland inconvenience”
Reviews.Author: blueewan
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is clean and well maintained but here ends the good points. We arrived tired and hungry and to our amazement had to stand in a queue of behind an American couple while no less than seven staff members stood behind the battery of reception desks talking to themselves. I think the hotel is really a venue for conferences not for Tourists the guy behind the desk tried in all seriousness to upgrade us from a double to a twin room! The room temperature was unbearably hot at night and could not be moderated you either woke up in a bucket of sweat or opened the window and froze. The Hotel is in a really inconvenient position, well away from the main island and the Hotel shuttle takes a break just at the point you want to come back after Dinner. We coped OK but it was annoying to keep to a timetable especially when we could have booked a nicer hotel closer to the main attractions. The rooms are bland and donâ€™t really resemble the pictures on the net. There is no more or less than youâ€™d find in a travel lodge which is OK if you are paying travel Lodge prices or you like bland. I could not help but be envious of the guests staying in ex palaces with four-poster beds. Given the hotel is so far away from the main area you would have thought they would have their own facilities but they are sparse, difficult to find and the good ones are closed half the year. You also have to pay for every single extra facility, which does make you feel you are staying in a cheep hotel run by Ryan Air â€“ The pool was closed, the spa was extra, the sauna was extra, breakfast was extra, water was extra, TV was extra and you have to ask for pensâ€¦etc If you want to stay in a Bland â€“ jumped up travel lodge with a Ryan air price model that makes the place feel cheep, at the edge of the city and with its own infrequent public transport this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and Miss, but mostly miss.”
Reviews.Author: rosesilly
Reviews.Content: I arrived for 3 nights with my husband, exhausted and hungry. I purchased this stay with Hotwire and upon arrival at 8pm the check-in attendant (who was a snobby, almost rude man) gave us a room with 2 twin beds. I asked if it is possible to get one bed and he said "No you booked with Hotwire at a low rate (165.00/night) so it is such a cheap price so that is the room you get" The beds were small and my husband, being 6 feet tall did not fit on it, so as he slept, I got up at 5am and went down to reception and talked to a woman who after speaking wsith the manager, switched rooms for me and got a bellhop to transfer our things. The other room was MUCH BETTER although dusty, with a big bed and nice decor, and a little view too. All in all, it was not my favorite hote in Italy although I was really looking forward to sleeping there. I really appreciate the free shuttle service, and if you take local vaporretti it is a far walk so just wait for the shuttle, it is on time. I did not eat the food, although, the chichetti bars near st.mark's square were so bad late at night, i wish we ended up eating in at the hotel that night, even though the burgers were over 25Euro. Lastly, the location is not good (away from the main island, and being a 28 year old i sure wanted a little fun) but it was quiet while i slept, BUT all in all, given how I was treated upon arrival I would not stay here again, unless I purchased the club rooms which include dinner and breakfast. The doctors who stayed there were having a convention and in speaking with them, they seemed to like the food which was included in their price. But who knows how much they paid! (fyi i only stayed in 4 star hotels during my 3 weeks in Italy and the most important thing to me is cleanliness).

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TampaJack
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Molino Stucky two weeks ago for one night prior to a cruise, and we absolutely love the hotel. We received a fantastic upgrade (mainly because it was our 30th anniversary and we're Hilton Diamond members). We especially loved the high ceilings and the wood beams. They were able to retain some great features from when it was an industrial building. The entire hotel has a wonderful ambiance. We liked the executive lounge location a lot. It's along the windows on the edge of the main lobby lounge, separated by a railing and a gate. We liked it so much that we ordered dinner in the lounge. The windows looked out onto the canal. Beautiful. The hotel location is more convenient than we expected. The hotel's own shuttle boat runs each hour or so, but there are also two vaporetto stops in easy walking distance. The staff was wonderful and made us feel like royalty. I had the opportunity to meet the General Manager and he is a great guy who clearly is passionate about his hotel. Venice is my favorite place in the world, and now I have a new favorite hotel in the world to go along with it!

Reviews.Title: “Dream of Returning”
Reviews.Author: planningmoretravels
Reviews.Content: This was our first family vacation overseas. We were worried our teenage sons would complain about everything. Well the front desk staff made a mistake the day we checked in but corrected it right away. The concierge recommended the most amazing places to eat; suggested his personal favorites and we enjoyed them all. It was great to be away from the hustle and bustle (we slept in from jet lag). We relaxed on the roof when the kids went to bed. My husband and I dream of returning to this same hotel without the kids and perhaps staying longer!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: aridoody
Reviews.Content: First let me say, I am not sure what other reviewers wanted or need from hotels, especially in a place like Venice. My husband and I were in Venice just this past weekend, November 2010, and loved every minute of it, a lot due to the Molino Stucky Hilton. We traveled as HHonors Diamond members like many reviewers, but that didn't have anything to do with the hotel, the way we were treated or where the hotel was located. We thoroughly enjoyed taking the FREE (for ALL guests) vaporetto over to Zattere or St. Mark's Square every day, sometimes twice a day, and then relaxing on the short ten minute ride home. It was no different than being anywhere else and having to take a shuttle or taxi. I don't know what people expect, especially from a city WITH NO CARS! It's amazing to me that they get around on their feet and boats! The shopping was great, the food was great, and if you figured out how to order, you spent no more than you do back home. I mean we actually got a cheese pizza for $6. I can't get at that in the USA. AND it was authentic and so good. Our room was nice, breakfast was nice and the lounge was wonderful. The desserts were to die for. As far as we are concerned, Hilton got it right with this hotel. If you plan on visiting this hotel, take the public vaporetto (bus) and don't take a private taxi. We made that mistake and spent 50Euro compared to 6.50E each. And it took the same amount of time.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way from central Venice -- which is of course awesome and awful”
Reviews.Author: mdande
Reviews.Content: As others have mentioned, the hotel requires a boat ride. Rather then being reliant on the shuttle (which is always on time and works great, just not as often) we bought Vaparetto tickets. We then took whichever boat came first. With this solution I don't think we ever waited more than 5 minutes for a boat. The Molino Stucky is large and mostly full of Americans. Those, to me, are it's downsides. On the upsides the building is beautiful. The views of Venice are stunning (especially from the rooftop pool). As a Hilton Diamond member I got an upgrade to a giant suite -- it really made our stay much more enjoyable. Also, we quite enjoyed the executive lounge being in the lobby. We felt more part of the crowd and the couple of times we had trouble getting a seat, we just sat in the main bar, no one questioned us. We had Internet in the room, which was complimentary thanks to my status. In my opinion, getting away from the throng of people in the heart of Venice was a joy. On Giudecca we could walk, and breathe (but not eat -- the food over there was just plain awful). So overall a mixed review. Since I stayed with points, the value was good (I paid nothing), would I have been happy at $400 a night, probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel a little outside of the city center”
Reviews.Author: jfoxy82207
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got a great deal on Priceline ($132 a night) for our weekend trip to Venice in 2009. The hotel has a shuttle boat that takes you directly across the lagoon to the main part of Venice. The shuttle boat is always on time and leaves from the same spot. So we never had a problem going to the main part of town or returning to the hotel. We took a private water taxi from the airport to the Hilton and we were dropped of right in front of the hotel. On the way to the airport we hoped on one of the boat shuttles, which also leaves right in front of the hotel. When we arrived we were initially given a room that was right above the spot where the shuttle boats departs from. We thought that this could be quite noisy and asked to be moved to a higher floor. We ended up getting a nice room with a nice view of the city. We tried to upgrade to the get the Executive Lounge privileges but decided against it due to the pretty steep price. The hotel has a huge buffet for breakfast which was decent. Make sure you buy your water and snacks when you are on the main island as there is not much around the hotel in terms of stores.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully located expensive hotel that you would like to spend more time outside”
Reviews.Author: GPrakash
Reviews.Content: It is so beautifully located that no other can match it. It has it's own Jetty and a boat to extend drop-off to nearby destinations complimentary. The view from the promenade of the hotel is panoramic and absorbingly scenic. The hotel bar is excellent, spacious and the bar-tenders are extremely helpful in finding & mixing right drinks just for your liking. The Breakfast spread is extensive and area very large to seat 300 persons comfortably at any time. The waiters are eager to serve you with a smile and get you the best of egg preparation. The rooms are rather small but cosy. You cant expect large spacious rooms in Venice. Space is at a premium. The windows in the rooms are large but not many rooms have the view that would match the view one gets to soak in while standing or walking on the promenade just outside the hotel. So one would like to spend more time outside the hotel rather than inside the rooms. The hotel decor & lay-out offers very romantic environment and the way to many a rooms passes through winding alleys, which provides the temptation to hug and kiss your beloved time and again to add to the romance in the air. The hotel, however, is very expensive and one needs to be sure to have a fat purse with loose string before staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel on the quieter edge of venice - a free shuttle ride from attractions and great restaurants”
Reviews.Author: whenhelfreezesover
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hilton for 1 week after spotting a bargain on expedia, the hotel is on Guidecca, a long thin island just across from Venice itself. The hotel provides a free shuttle, every 20 mins in summer and every 40 mins in winter which was very handy and saved 6.50 euros each on each crossing, if we missed it we just used the vapparettos across to pallanca and walked the rest of the way (500m). Breakfast was super pricey (10 euro for croissant up to 30 euro for super buffet), we reccomend buying fresh croissants and coffee from the bakery /trattorias on the waterfront of guidecca between the hotel and pallanca stop for less than 3 euros!! Or nipping over to zatterre to do the same. Or we bought yogurts, milk, croissants and fruit from the co-op in san marco or billa nr zatterre and used the small amount of space free in the mini bar for personal use. Bathrooms are lovely, we had crabtree and evelyn toiletries and bath robes although one of the bathrobes dissapeared after one use and no replacement came. The room service people were quite stingey with the milk too so we bought are own pint. At night would reccomend nipping across to zattere and walking over the ponte dell accademia into campo santo stefano for a good choice of restaurants and cafes or just to people watch. Would also recommend going up the campanile of san giorgio maggiore to look across to st mark's for wonderful views. The skyline bar at the hilton was great for a treat (cocktails from 12 euro) and was candlelit so they give you a torch to view the menu! Food served in the rialto cafe in the hilton was nice but expensive so try to eat elsewhere as you'll be spoilt for choice.

Reviews.Title: “very modern, expensive”
Reviews.Author: IzziePEI
Reviews.Content: New hotel in old warehouse. Rooms are large, very American. Pictures on web site are accurate. Clean. Need to take water taxi or hotel water shuttle to downtown area. Bar very expensive. Had to pay for Wifi

Reviews.Title: “It was a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: fcrwb
Reviews.Content: We read here mostly good with a not so good breakfast buffet. Well the buffet was huge and it had everything imaginable. We were a group of 20 and no one had any complaints about the breakfast or anything else about the hotel. The resturants were high priced so we asked the desk for other suggestions and there was resturants in walking distance that were excellent and reasonably priced. The bakery down the street had the best olive bread we ever had and sold it warm by the slice.in the morning. The hotel water taxi was good and always on time. The bartenders at the roof top bar were very friendly and there was quit a view from there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, brilliant service, couldnt be better”
Reviews.Author: bluelady24
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a long weekend. Room couldnt be better, clean and very spacious. Evening meal wasnt cheap, but the food was excellent, as was the service. Breakfast was great - a buffet (as are most hotels these days). Hotel provides a courtesy shuttle service to Zattere & St Marks Square. Always on time, never any problems. Only problem was that although this is a non-smoking hotel there was a guest in the next room who did not follow this rule.

Reviews.Title: “Modern top-flight hotel with great view”
Reviews.Author: bordeauxbound
Reviews.Content: First time staying in Venice, and read through many reviews. This is a newly converted (was a factory) hotel, that is HUGE-probably the biggest building in Venice. They said it was converted about 3-4 years ago, so everything is new, but classy/appropriate (not modern). It's a very short boat ride, on an island called Judica (?), but it's on multiple regular vaporeto stops (#2/41/43), so in no way is it inconvenient. I read the other reviews about trouble with the hotel taxi, which we had no issue with. You'll want to get a vaporeto pass there anyways, and the docks are close enough to pick whichever one is coming next. Rooms are spacious, even by US standards, and the service is outstanding. The Executive club is basically just a cordoned off area from the downstairs bar, but with a nice view (ok, all of Venice has a nice view). Staff definitely goes the extra distance, especially since we were there in OCT so it's off peak. It's off the grand canal so you're away from the heavy tourist crowds, and it has more of a local feel when you walk out the door. Since it's not in a heavily touristy area, there are some smaller shops next door, including a place selling litres of homemade wine for 2 euros....which helps save a few dollars as Venice isn't cheap. I'd recommend this to ANYONE traveling to Venice

Reviews.Title: “You will want to get lost in this hotel -- magnificent”
Reviews.Author: hoteldivaTexas
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so much more than I had even dreamed. My room was about the size of a small house with romantic views of the canal from every room. A bottle of champagne awaited my arrival, and the almost daily and purely unexpected delivery of delights (ranging from pomegranates and chocolates, to wine and fruit) were delightful treasures. The staff truly cared about taking care of me, and I felt pampered and doted upon, no matter how many times I got lost in the hotel. I had a map of the hotel (most people need it -- it's almost a small city), but having no sense of direction, I found the most delightful areas of the hotel, basically by accident! Because this was not originally built as a hotel, it has surprises at every turn. I would highly recommend the Hilton Honors program, as it opens the executive lounge for you, and the food and drink there was wonderful (and free). I'd go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel....but a little far away from the center of Venice”
Reviews.Author: SVG108
Reviews.Content: One of the biggest and most lavish hotels in Venice, we definitely enjoyed our short stay there. The rooms are pretty big and are furnished with top of the line stuff. The hotel has several restaurants and bars (expensive - but so is everything in Venice). A visit to the Skyline bar is a must at night for some fabulous views! The rates are fairly high - even for Venice standards - but we got lucky as we used our points to make our reservations :) The biggest drawback of this hotel is that it is located on the Giudecca Island. While it is nice and quiet, we found it a little inconvenient to get to (specially at night.) From the train station, there are 2 vaporetti that go to the hotel (stop is named Palanca). But you need to check the timings first (plus each trip is EU 6.50). The hotel has a water shuttle that ferries clients from the hotel to Zattere or the Piazza San Marco. This shuttle runs every 15 mins (but much lower frequency in the evenings/weekends and they dont run after 10.00pm), which makes getting back to the hotel a bit of a problem. All the sights are on the main Venice island and you are pretty much forced to take a water taxi (Expensive!!) to get back at night. Also from personal experience, make sure you keep at least 1.5 hours to get back to the train station. (We barely made it to our train, as the vaporetti were running late!)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jannyquinn1958
Reviews.Content: If you are in Venice and want a great hotel, try the Hilton it is spotless and so friendly, they have a free shuttle to take you from the Hotel to the Main Square in Venice called St Marks square... They could not be more helpfull!! The only fault we found was the restaurant was very expensive compared to a meal you could get a any other restaurant!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NoVaMan62
Reviews.Content: After a day with the crowds in Venice, taking the boat ride over the quiet of the Hilton is a grand way to stay. A very nice hotel in a great location with an attentive staff. The furnishings were top shelf, well maintained and an overall great experience. Only drawback is the cost, but everything is expensive in Venice. The view from my room window was every bit of it.

Reviews.Title: “May be best Hilton in Italy”
Reviews.Author: JimandJudy
Reviews.Content: I was quite surprised how much I liked this hotel. Iâ€™m a Hilton Honors Diamond and have stayed at the Cavalieri in Rome six times. For me, I now rate this hotel ahead of its Rome sister. Partially because the Cavalieri is not as good as it used to be and because of the way the Molino Stucky took care of us. We were upgraded to a suite and each day received free water and a bottle of Bellini. The lounge is a roped off section of the lounge and has better fare than the Cavalieri. Their shuttle boats run often and late. The service was excellent as were the breakfasts. With all the crowds in Venice I found it nice to retreat to this very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel away from the action”
Reviews.Author: lshopsonline
Reviews.Content: We got Hilton Molino Stucky via priceline bid. The hotel itself is very impressive. It's a HUGE buildling; all of which was well kept. There was always someone around to help the guests. It's amazing! The night we arrived; we were assigned a room. Upon arrival, we found the room was a bit smokey. I was pregnant and didn't want to be doing too much 2nd hand smoke. We requested for a room change. We were immediately upgraded to another room. The quick response was impressive. The room is spacious and charming. The areas are well kept. You always see housekeeping people wiping things down constantly. The hotel run a free shuttle service between the hotel and San Marco area every 15/30 minutes. Be sure to get there early as they are limited to 40 people per trip. You CANNOT walk anywhere touristy from here. The shuttle runs until midnight; so time your visits accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: katie_travel_1
Reviews.Content: Hilton Molino Stucky is soo beautiful. Our room was complete Venetian charm blended with modern luxury. Beautiful marble bathroom and seperate tub, venetian chandeliers and canal view. The free vaparetto to go to the mainland was very convenient, and always on time, so we never felt like we were staying far away. Its vacation in venice...making time to soak in the vaporetto is a part of the deal! :)..Its a 15 min ride to San Marco square anyways.. Breakfast was unbelievable, and included prosecco/champagne - adding to the romance of Venice..We had a great time here. Its an expensive hotel ( We were lucky to have hilton points) but definitely amazing.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful but inconvenient”
Reviews.Author: lsds1
Reviews.Content: hotel is beautiful and historic, but it is inconvenient to see most of the sights in Venice from the hotel. You can't walk to anything and require transportation to the main section of Venice if you venture out.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here before a cruise and managed...”
Reviews.Author: stewmassie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before a cruise and managed to get a good price online. Fantasic views, fantastic rooms, cocktails and food were a bit expensive though. â‚¬16 for cocktail and â‚¬28 for a cheese burger. Gym was good and roof top bar and pool were awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is good but inconvenient. Breakfast is HORRIBLE.”
Reviews.Author: nahood22
Reviews.Content: SHORT REVIEW: Rooms are good. Pay extra for a view. Service is excellent. Crowd is lame: conventions and cruise ships. Do eat at Aromi restaurant which is fantastic. Do not buy w/breakfast included or pay for the buffet. It's completely disgusting. You're not within walking distance of anything. Free shuttle boats are convenient but end at 8:30pm. Overall a nice hotel, away from the bustle of Venice which has it's pros and cons. GETTING THERE: You must take a BOAT to the hotel from a parking garage. You cannot drive. Take a "shared" private taxi if you're 2 people. Take a private water taxi if you have 4 or more people. Don't take the public boat. The dock is too far from the hotel to walk with luggage. THE ROOM: The room was nice but a little on the small side for the price. Was noisy at times but overall OK. Super clean. Many rooms will not have a view. Definitely pay for the view. It's worth it to be able to look out across the canal to Venice proper. SERVICE: A+. Staff was super helpful and nice. No problems at all. MOOD/CROWD: Lame. Not a cool place at all. Lots of cruise and convention people there. Feels like you're in Orlando if you were to just look at and listen to the guests. FOOD: The formal restaurant , Aromi, was excellent. One of my favorite meals for the whole trip. Make reservations. It's really, really good. Gentlemen must wear long pants not shorts but otherwise no dress code. The buffet breakfast was DISGUSTING. Worse than Dennys and it's 35 Euros per person. Don't do it. I cannot say enough how bad the buffet was. Quality was poor, selection was poor, bacon and scrambled eggs nearly inedible. Cheese looked like Kraft from the USA supermarket. Ridiculous. CONVENIENCE: You have to take a boat for all sightseeing. You cannot walk anywhere worthwhile. The last boat back to the Hilton is at 8:30pm so if you want to eat when the Italians eat in Venice, prepare to pay expensive fares for a water taxi back to Hilton island.

Reviews.Title: “LUXURIOUS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: SaltashJane
Reviews.Content: Fantastic situation, fabulous building, beautiful bedrooms,luxurious interior,very courteous helpful staff,breath taking views from the rooftop swimming pool and restaurant,delicious food........could not fault it!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel but location is not the best”
Reviews.Author: lilair
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just got back from our stay in Venice's Hilton Molino Stucky. We were only there for 1 night as our ship had disembarked in Venice and we were flying out the next day. Thankfully it wasn't our first trip to Venice because if It was I would have been extremely disappointed. Let me start by saying the hotel is stunning! It's huge with lot of amenities including restaurants, a rooftop pool and a lounge/bar. The hotel room was perfect and we got a great view of St. Mark's square. However, the hotel makes no secret of the fact that they're not on the main land and you need to take a shuttle to get everywhere. The shuttle to St. Mark's comes only once an hour and if you miss it be prepared to walk a good 20-30min (from st. mark's) to their next stop. But if you miss it from the hotel...you're out of luck and you have no choice but to wait. It's really inconvenient to have to "wait" to get to your hotel so make sure you don't forget anything in your room. Nonetheless, I will say that if you're planning a longer stay and have lots of time then I would absolutely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: RckyMtnDoc
Reviews.Content: Great property and location. Those that complain just didn't do their homework. It's obvious it's on a different island than Venice, for us that was the appeal. The private water taxis worked just fine. if you want more options get a vaporetto (public water taxi) pass. The stop is less than 5 minutes from the hotel. Typical of Americans to complain about having to walk 5 minutes...that's why we're so overweight and unhealthy. The dinner at Aromi was the best we had in Venice. The rooftop pool and bar have unparalleled views of San Marco and the lagoon. The only complaint is that for a Hilton it had very thin walls...I'm sure our neighbors could hear EVERYTING we were doing in our roon ( I'll leave the rest to your imagination). If you want a unique, smaller property, closer in, don't stay here. If you like the type of amenities Americans typically have come to expect, this is a fine choice.

Reviews.Title: “If your going to Venice, you MUST stay here!”
Reviews.Author: rda506
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely one of the best 5-star hotels I've ever stayed at! It has it's own private water taxi (one of only 2 hotels there who has one!), and is right on the grand canal! Best breakfast buffet of our entire trip in Italy! Unique old 17th century flour mill that's now restored to a beautiful hotel! Love, love, love!

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here again even for free”
Reviews.Author: s0fi62
Reviews.Content: This was our worst Hilton hotel experience ever. We are members of the Hhonors program and usually get treated very well but I don't think this hotel treats anyone very well. When we were checking in, a gentleman next to us was berating the clerk about how unhappy he was about everything - he was a Diamond member with hundreds of nights - and wanted them to find him another hotel. Well, we were just there on points for one night pre-cruise and figured it didn't much matter, but we found out that this gentleman was spot-on about this hotel. No one on the staff was nice or helpful. The concierge was almost rude and condescending and gave us inaccurate information. We went back later to try a different concierge and he was even worse. I had to ask for bottled water we get as Hhonors members everywhere else, and they were begrudging about it. The shower/tub combination was extremely awkward, narrow and uncomfortable. I felt that it was actually dangerous and was reluctant to shower in it, but had to because of our long flight and the hot, humid weather. It seemed very likely people could get hurt. There were no washcloths, but we had brought our own. Still, it's a Hilton and they should have them. The room was tiny but otherwise adequate. My husband wanted me to fill out the guest review form because of how negatively we felt about this hotel. I found the form in the guest folder in the desk and, interestingly, it had been filled out by a previous guest last November, 9 months ago! These Parisian visitors apparently felt exactly the same way as we did! But to have such a form sit there for so long is an indication of the quality of service this hotel offers. I know you can get a good deal on this hotel on Priceline and we stayed there on (too many) Hhonors points, but it's really not worth it. It's not a real 5-star hotel and the location is inconvenient. If I'm ever in Venice again, I'd stay at a lower star-rated hotel on the main island or even the Lido, which looks very nice and is almost as close to San Marco by vaporetto. The best thing about it is the view from the roof.

Reviews.Title: “Not my cup of coffee”
Reviews.Author: windyday_10
Reviews.Content: 5 Star, poor service hotel inconveniently located across the Guidecca Canal.Staff were either apathetic or maybe trainees...accurate information was hard to come by and staff never appeared to go out of their way to help guests. Guests are dependent on the hotel's own shuttle service to get to the main squares of Venice. While the shuttle ran every 20 minutes there were many scheduled breaks or delays in the service. The vaporetto however was available but a good 5 min walk without suitcases or at least 10 min with suitcases.Walking that distance after a long flight or train ride (.the hotel does not offer assistance from the vaporetto stops) is grueling. But why would they offer such a service as "service" is far from any word in their vocabulary, We found the reception at check-in cold and uncharacteristically, for the Italian hospitality industry, unwelcoming...we were limited to a couple of questions and then dismissed. No orientation to the hotel was given and it is a very expansive property. We had much difficulty finding our room as there are several elevator banks in this former power plant restored hotel. One night my husband had to return to the desk 4 times because the keycard for the room would not operate. (no, he did not keep it next to his phone.) The next day Guest Relations provided a half hearted apology by offering a hot tip on a good local restaurant. Breakfast was not included in our stay so in order to get breakfast one could pay 30 Euros/pp ($40 USD)...It was difficult to get just coffee (they did have powdered instant in the room) without getting on a shuttle to cross the Guidecca Canal. The hotel allowed coffee if you also bought other things on the menu. Information was also difficult to obtain from the staff, even the concierge when approached glared at me as if I was interrupting him...nothing warm and welcoming there. I will say the room was very nice, the bed firmer than I would want but my husband was comfortable. Internet access was 22 Euros/day ($30 USD). We felt that because we had purchased our room from a popular hotel booking web site as we had been reminded by the desk, that we were not being treated as a full fledged guest.

Reviews.Title: “charged with no refund”
Reviews.Author: selsa10
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hilton Molino Stucky. I cancelled the hotel due to a cancellation of our trip. We cancelled well in advance , and were given confirmation number. My credit card was still charged for the stay. I contacted the hotel. They agreed we should not have been charged and I still have not received a refund. Now, 2 months later, I re- e mailed the hotel and have not gotten a reply. Beware, before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Does not live up to the Hilton Standard Iâ€™ve come accustomed too with other European properties.”
Reviews.Author: CARose
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 night stay September 6-11. On award stay, confirmed King Deluxe room. Arrived via train station. Vaporetto was a little challenging, especially with luggage. We took to Zattere and then boarded the Hilton complimentary boat. Hotel itself is beautiful. What an amazing restoration of this old mill. Unfortunately, I was not blown away, and felt disappointed. Check-In: I went to the Hilton Honors line which was directly beside the regular check in. No one was in line but me. At least 3 associates behind the counter in the regular line established eye contact with me, but no one came over. After waiting at least 5 minutes, I moved to the regular check in line. I was told that I had received an upgrade, which I appreciated. I asked if I had a canal view, and was told that I did. I was informed of the location and hours of the executive lounge, and given the code for the free internet (now available for Gold and Diamond). I asked about the breakfast benefit and was told I got the buffet for each day of my stay and to provide my room number and there would be no charge. Room: 422, a very small living room, bathroom with no tub (just a shower), and a separate bedroom. There were several large stains on the living room sofa, and cigarette butts left outside the window. My view not a canal view as I was told, but rather an old abandoned building on the side of the property. A very small slice of the canal view. I have never slept on such a hard bed. We actually dreaded going up to the room at night. It felt like we were laying directly on a box spring. This was definitely no Hilton Serenity Bed. We never slept thru an entire night and found ourselves tossing and turning a lot. We could never get comfortable. The couch in the living room was no better. Several TV channels available including CNN, Sky News etc. As others have commented, a bottle of Bellini is left in your room. Not chilled, just left on the night stand. Of course we wanted to enjoy but it needed to be chilled. I called to ask where the ice machine was located, was informed that it was broke and I had to go thru room service. I asked if I would be charged, and was told no. It would have been nice if the bottle was already chilled so you can enjoy it. I think most people donâ€™t actually end up drinking it because they have no way to chill it, so the bottle ends up getting recycled. Executive Lounge: Located adjacent to the Rialto bar on the main floor. Key card access. We found the food offerings to be very good. Hours of operation â€“ 11a â€“ 11pm. Noon service is sandwiches; around 2 pm are desserts, and 6 pm heavy hors dourves and salad offerings. Wine/presecco/juice/tea coffee etc available all the time. Hard alcohol is only available from 6-8ish. BTW- Once a bottle is gone, it is not replaced. My husband got the last drop of vodka which was not enough for a drink. Asked for another bottle and was told â€œthatâ€™s it, no moreâ€�. There are 2 computers available for use in the lounge, password required and limited to 20 minutes at a time. Most times, seating was not a problem. It was busier in the evening when people got back from dinner and wanted a night cap. Friday nights seem to be the busiest as the hotel is full with pre-cruisers. I commend all the staff in the lounge. They were friendly, professional and were always clearing plates and restocking the food. Excellent service! Internet for Gold/Diamonds: Free, must physically get a new code from the front desk each day. We asked if it was possible to get all the codes for our entire stay vs. coming to the desk everyday. With hesitation, they finally accommodated our request. It is limited to 2 IP address. Gym/Spa: Complimentary for Diamond. Otherwise there is a $15 charge. Turn Down Service: Provided the first night, then you have to call the â€œMagicâ€� line to request. On our first night, there were 2 bottles of water left at each night stand, and candies on the bed. What was funny is that every night after, only one bottle of water was left. I called the Magic line to inquiry and was told that as a Diamond, you get 2 bottles of water the first night and then only one bottle. I had to laugh. I almost wanted to ask if that goes for the candy left on the bed too. Housekeeping: Unlike most European hotels, wash cloths were in the bathroom. They were never replaced during our stay despite seeing them on the linen carts in the hall. I called the Magic line and requested, but never got. We ended up grabbing some from the cart. Coffee cups and kettle was never put back in its place. If I left my coffee cup in the living room in the morning, thatâ€™s where it was in the evening. Overall, not stellar service. Staff was very rude. I came off the elevator one morning, 2 housekeeping staff was arguing in the middle of the hallway, they didnâ€™t even move for me and continued to argue. Buffet Breakfast: Free for Diamonds, just provide your room number. Full offerings, eggs cooked to order (which were never cooked correctly), and prosecco available. Like the executive lounge, I found the staff very friendly and professional despite being very busy. Sky Bar and Rooftop Pool: What an amazing view from the rooftop. It was too cold during our stay to use the pool. I would recommend that you go to the Sky Bar at least once during stay. It is pricy, but I thought the Belliniâ€™s were better than Harryâ€™s. Hotel Staff: As other reviewers have commented, I found the staff to be very rude. Staff would walk right by you and never say hello. They appeared aggravated an annoyed at you when you asked a question, like they were being put out. A great disappointment having come from a Sofitel in Florence where the staff provided superior service. Hotel Boat Shuttle: While this is a nice service, I would encourage others to invest in a Venice Connect card and purchase unlimited Vaparetto service. The Hotel boat only goes to Zattere and San Marco. This really limits your options. During our 5 nights, we only used the complimentary boat service 3 times. Overall Impression: This is a beautiful property with lovely facilities. It does not live up to the Hilton Standard Iâ€™ve come accustomed too with other European properties. Itâ€™s apparent to me, based on the numerous reviews of this property, that the application of Hilton benefits/upgrades for Diamond members is inconsistent. However, one does not come to Venice to stay in the room or at the hotel for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated architecture with small rooms for 3 persons”
Reviews.Author: simbine
Reviews.Content: Location on Giudecca Island is really fantastic and the arcitecture sophisticated, but the "KING HILTON DELUXE ROOMS" are not recommendable for a family with 3 persons - those rooms are definitely too small (there is only one king size bed and an additional folding bed - which was only delivered "on demand" after our arrival- inside). Breakfast is manifold but we missed some fresh vegetables (eg. cucumbers...). When we booked the hotel via e-mail an explicite confirmation was ignored (refused).

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Hilton with a lackluster staff”
Reviews.Author: GD331
Reviews.Content: The Venice Hilton property is excellent however staff is not very friendly. As a diamond member I travel to many Hiltons. The property here is as good as it gets. However from the from front desk to the conceriage the staff is not friendly. Especially the Conceriage of which I had interactions with three different individuals. The property is a renovated warehouse which is an excellet property that has great rooms (with hard beds) with excellent views. To get to the property from the train station take waterbus 51/52 and get off at the Zattere stop and take the Hilton waterbus. To get to the San Marco stop take the Hilton water bus as well. Breakfast buffet is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel in Venice!!”
Reviews.Author: adymu
Reviews.Content: It was the best hotel I ever saw! Everything is just outstanding there. The service, the pool on the roof, the food, the beverages, everything gets maximum points. You also have a shuttle for Hilton guests, so you can just take your time to relax. Venice and the hotel itself are contributing to a romantic atmosphere - if you want a memory for the rest of your life, just go there. My vacation there was just perfect, and I think this is more than I can describe.

Reviews.Title: “inconvenient location, poorly designed bathtub, broken tv-- NO COMPENSATION!!”
Reviews.Author: miffymiffster
Reviews.Content: 1) getting to and from Giudecca to Venice was annoying. it wasted about 1.5 hours each day or more, just waiting for the water taxi to arrive. many times, 3 or 4 water taxis stopped at the hotel without allowing anybody to embark. if we stayed in venice (we would have stayed at the metropole instead if we knew molino stucky was so inconveniently located), we could have stayed out longer at night, and we would have been able to spend less time in transport. 2) no free breakfast, no free internet either. concierge were not able to direct us to a store where we could purchase a cellphone sim card! they said we have to ask someone in venice, and there is no place they know that sells them on giudecca! 3) our tv was broken. we could not watch anything at all and the hotel did not even compensate us with anything. no free breakfast, no discount, NOTHING. i believe part of the reason why they wouldn't compensate us is because we had already paid for the hotel stay prior to our arrival. **something we learned never to do for our future travels.. never book thru h*tw*re!!** 4) the bathtub was poorly designed! the shower head was right in the middle of the bathtub, and there was no shower curtain or glass to prevent the water from splattering everywhere. my husband is not that tall, but he is 6ft. i am 5'3'' so when i showered, i only got a little bit of water to splatter outside the tub. but my husband couldn't help it. he tried to shower without moving, but any water that hit him would bounce onto the floor. after he was done showering, the entire floor was flooded. what a poor design!

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you know what you want when booking this hotel”
Reviews.Author: travels120000
Reviews.Content: This was a typical Hilton, it boasts beauty but the hotel was really nice not a palace. The hilton sight advertises phenomenal views, you can see Venice however the views are better from the public water taxis. The wait staff, breakfast staff, lounge staff were wonderful. Pleasant and nice and kept everything fully stacked. The food and drink prices are extremely overpriced if we had not been Hilton Honors with executive lounge privileges meals would have cost a small fortune. The pool was overcrowded with kids, not a single place to sit, even getting into the pool was hard. But the pool rooftop was beautiful. If you are a couple on a honeymoon I would not stay here if you are a family going on to a cruise this should be perfect. We didn't want to stay in the main island and wanted to get away from the tourists so this was good for us. The hotel shuttle was always on time and always available which made it really convenient. Just beware Hilton's website overdoes it and I felt a little cheated but if I had not had such high expectations from the website in general I would say this was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: zdrombi
Reviews.Content: the hotel is really nice. the breakfast is pretty complete from a to z. the rooms are great. go 4 it

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Holiday99
Reviews.Content: The location is a bit out of the tourist centre but once we got to know the hotel shuttle and public vaporetto, it is actually pleasing to get away from the crowds near the St Mark area. Good breakfast. Certainly, one of the best Hilton I have stayed and I look forward to the next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting place”
Reviews.Author: EvanPSP
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a large mainstream hotel in Venice, this is the place. Nice rooms, very good breakfast, great pool bar on the roof. The hotel was pretty unprepared for the group that I was traveling with and were completely over-whelmed. But, without the massive number of guests, they might be a bit better on service. Some food was good, some not so good. This hotel was good, not great.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel - cake & wine for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: JJRae
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel about an hour from the airport by water taxi. It offers a regular complimentary water taxi service to and from St Marks Square among other places, and they arranged a free boat for us to Murano. Our room overlooked the canal so we could see the cruise ships coming in (our's included). The breakfast was amazing, wonderful coffees, lovely staff, and even sparkling wine and chocolate cake. We had a wonderful time at this hotel and is perfect for anyone about to go on a cruise in Venice as it is close to the port.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location for a Venice visit”
Reviews.Author: gerdhachtel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a separate island, just opposite to the city center of Venice. Therefore it has a very quiet environment (not as hectic as most hotels in Venice). There is a complimentary ferry service to the city. But also the public transportation service is worth to be used (unlimited use of the "vaporello" = bus-boats for 72 hours: 33â‚¬). Rooms and service are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel for a fun weekend away”
Reviews.Author: JamesMoore2
Reviews.Content: I went to Venice with my girlfriend and booked this hotel as I wanted to use some Hilton points. I had mixed expectations as I had read various, conflicting reviews, so wasnâ€™t quite sure what to expect. From the photos I had seen and from the hotel website it all sounded and looked amazing, and I was really looking forward to visiting Venice for the first time, but I had nagging doubts, as I had read a lot of bad reviews about the service. Having booked on Hilton points, I was allocated a standard room, but on arrival at the hotel I discovered that, as an Honors Diamond member, I had been upgraded to an executive room, which was nice. However, when I asked if there was a possibility of paying to upgrade to a suite I was told that they had no standard suites left and, as they only had one Suite â€˜plusâ€™ available (a one bedroom suite with water views), it was unlikely that they would sell it at a discount. At this point I sent my girlfriend off to enjoy some drinks in the executive lounge while the receptionist had a little chat with the manager. A few minutes later she came out and offered to upgrade us for 250 Euros / night. After some friendly negotiation, we agreed on 150 Euros / night, which, considering I hadnâ€™t paid for my room in the first place, was a pretty good deal ï�Š I joined my girlfriend for a drink in the lounge while our bags were delivered to the room and then we went up together. The room was absolutely gorgeous, with a large lounge, a decent sized bedroom and a beautiful bathroom. There was a complimentary bottle of champagne and a fruit platter left out for us and the squeal of delight from my girlfriend when she saw the view made the upgrade cost worth every penny. We got up on Saturday morning and went to the restaurant for breakfast. We were escorted to our table and then taken next door and given a â€˜tourâ€™ of the buffet. It was huge and looked nice, but I really fancied Eggs Benedict and my girlfriend wanted an omelette, so we asked the waiter if the kitchen could make them for us. Nothing seemed too much trouble, and ten minutes later our breakfast appeared, exactly as requested and tasted delicious! We explored Venice on Saturday, using the hotel shuttle, which was quick and easy. After visiting St Markâ€™s square, we stuck mainly to back alleys, visiting quirky little stores and finding hidden gems all over the place, before heading to the Rialto bridge and finding a cafÃ© for an early dinner. I was impressed at how cheap the food was, as I was expecting to be ripped off, but we paid less then 70 Euros for two courses with wine, including service, so it didnâ€™t exactly break the bank. We did some more exploring after dinner, commenting on more than one occasion how glad we were to being staying somewhere away from the noise of the main island. After taking the Hilton shuttle, we arrived back at the hotel around 8.15 and decided to head upstairs to check out the roof top bar. The view from up there, especially at sunset is amazing! I was lucky enough to get a sofa outside while my girlfriend went to the bar. I had read in advance that the drinks werenâ€™t cheap, so I was prepared for the shock of 16 Euros for a Mojito. What I wasnâ€™t prepared for was what my 16 Euros would actually buy! Danielle returned from the bar with what looked like pint glasses and they were by far the best Mojitos I have ever tasted! The lime and the mint were clearly very fresh and it seemed like they had done their best to squeeze as much alcohol into the glass as possible. Seriously, the drinks may not have been cheap, but they were definitely good value! After our Mojitos, we enjoyed a bottle of champagne in the warm, night air and headed back to the room. Breakfast on Sunday was a similar affair to Saturday; Good food and good service. We went down just before 11 to catch the end of service, having enjoyed a long lie while my girlfriend went to the spa for a pedicure, but the kitchen was still happy to cook eggs to order. In fact, another couple arrived, looking quite flustered, at 11.15 and, despite the fact that breakfast was clearly over, the staff were still happy to accommodate them, so again, I couldnâ€™t fault the service. On the way back to the room I asked for a late check out and agreed on 4pm. Rather than do more exploring, we decided to spend the day lazing by the roof top pool, which was absolutely heavenly. The weather was gorgeous and the views from up there during the day were incredible. It was the perfect way to end our weekend break, made better by a couple more Mojitos ;-) We used the lounge quite a lot during the weekend and enjoyed having access to free snacks and drinks. Breakfast was free courtesy of Hilton Honors, so we didnâ€™t really need to spend a lot of money while we were there, but we had the most amazing weekend! Venice is not somewhere I would spend more than a few days, but I would definitely like to go back again sometime and would choose to stay at the Molino Stucky Hilton again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: R.MÃ¼ller
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an executive room with lounge access. The lounge is actually a separate part of the Rialto bar downstairs but still ok for drinks and snacks. We found the location of the hotel excellent and the shuttle boat well functioning. The hotel is beautiful and the view over Venice astonishing! Agree about the breakfast. The breakfast room is not nice and the service is not good. The food is ok, though. Still, at least the exec rooms are great, the views over Venice are stunning and the pool is very nice to have in the summer

Reviews.Title: “A special event - then no room when we arrived!”
Reviews.Author: bebebeow
Reviews.Content: We made (and paid for) our booking in February through Sovereign. However on our arrival we were told by Reception that another party had decided to stay on and therefore there was no room for us. We were so disappointed having spent weeks choosing it for our Venice stay and then looking forward to staying at the hotel for months. (It was a special trip for my husband's 50th birthday). Although the hotel booked us into another hotel (Hotel Bauer - separate review), they did not::- *advise Sovereign of the lack of accommodation *offer us a seat or a drink whilst waiting for a water taxi to take us to the hotel *tell us initially that it was for 2 of our 3 nights booked that we did not have accommodation *explain fully the reason we did not have any accommodation *inform us if we would be staying at the Bauer for 1, 2 or 3 nights In our opinion the staff were quite dismissive of our situation (it was 9pm at night and we were quite tired and getting hungry by this time) I would have serious reservations about booking with this hotel in the future due to the lack of customer service offered to us. This situation could have been handled so much better instead of the uncaring attitude offered to us! However, I have nothing but praise for Sovereign who when we contacted them the next day - sorted out all our accommodation arrangements and ensured that we had a meal as compensation gesture.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, but not worth the cost.”
Reviews.Author: maltafaz
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the Hotel and I was astounded at how a former flour factory was transformed into a beautiful hotel. In my opinion, it is vastly overpriced. our room was 450 us dollars per night. We stayed for 3 days, then went to another hotel for 4 days in another part of Venice that was about $150 dollars per night. The second hotel room was nicer and more comfortable than the Hilton. I do love the views from the Hilton, especially from the roof top lounge. Being on Guidecca is also very nice, your very own "island" to enjoy and to take a water taxi from to get to Zattere or Piazza San Marco. The water taxi is complementary and on time. It was not a problem at all. For a 450 per night room I expected better than a makeup mirror that was nearly falling off the wall and a broken door that needed to be repaired upon our arrival. The down side to being on Guidecca is that it did not have the feel of actually living in residential Venice, but it was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MSkinner
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 1 night stay at the Stucky (pre-cruise from Venice) and can't say enough good things about it. Room was booked with my Hilton points and we got an Executive Level upgrade offer for 59 Euros. If you get one of these TAKE IT. The Executive level gets you access to all the free drinks - alcoholic and otherwise, snacks, finger foods, etc that are available all day in the lobby. It also gets you free breakfast at their excellent buffet breakfast. The free breakfast will offset the upgrade cost. And the breakfast and all-day snacks were just great. The location is both good & a little bit of a pain. It's off the main island, so there aren't the huge tourist crowds. The hotel has a free shuttle boat that runs quite frequently. However, there's 2 stops over on the main island and the times are a little confusing. Some are direct back & forth routes and others hit both stops. Sometimes they run every 20 minutes, sometimes not. We had to wait almost an hour the one time, as we missed the boat by a couple minutes. Rooms were very nice and comfortable. Quite a bit bigger than the typical 'European' room. Service was excellent and the staff would go out of their way to help you. The rooftop bar & rooftop pool were excellent. Great view of Venice. Used the workout facilities and they were excellent. Really, really good. Also ran along the banks of the island and that was a great experience - would recommend it. Who else can say they ran along the banks in Venice, with that amazing view? About 5 kms from the hotel to the end of the island and back. 2 tips: First, if you're coming straight from the airport, the water taxi is 100 Euros. A little steep, but great views along the way. You're paying that for the boat, for up to 6 people. So boat-pool. Ask other people at the docks if they want to share. A couple asked us & it cut it to 50 / couple. Second, it cost us 80 Euros to get a water taxi from our hotel to the cruise ships - literally a 5 minute ride. You can see them from the hotel & it's not far. Might want to look at other options, such as getting the free shuttle to the mainland & going from there - I don't know. Just seems like they've really got you, so they gouge you. All in all, Venice was beautiful, and the Hilton Stucky was a great hotel. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable bed, attentive staff = wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: ChgoTraveller1
Reviews.Content: Spent the last days in Venice here after a cruise. Impressed with the size of the hotel, but was amazed at the small entrance. Once inside, beautifully done hotel lobby. Veronica, Front Desk was helpful and pleasant. Room wasn't ready (which is typical at 11am on a Saturday). Spoke with Christian, Concierge who gave us info and informed us of the shuttle to San Marco's Square, then we were off! He also gave us info regarding how to get back to the airport for an early flight. Upon returning to the hotel. Our hotel keys were issued and luggage was waiting in our room. Room was large. Great bathroom. And a really comfortable bed! I read all the comments about the view from the roof, so we headed up there, but alas nothing was open due to a private party being set up! Unfortunately, they were charging guests a fee to attend! But managed to get a pic of Venice from the Skyline roof top bar. Ended up downstairs in the lobby for a cocktail in the Rialto Bar before heading out to AROMI restaurant off the lobby outside. Service was impeccable. Food was impressive. Although somewhat expensive (hotel food usually is), it was a LOT LESS expensive than our lunch meals near the Rialto Bridge! I didn't realize that our hotel rate included breakfast, so my partner and I went to search for the breakfast room. The hotel is so big we got lost! After finding the area, I wasn't too impressed with the room, but once being directed into the atrium area, breakfast was AMAZING! I've seen buffets, but was totally impressed with the food. They had everything for everyone. Fresh fruits, assorted yogurts, cheeses and meats, eggs, cereal, sausage, bacon and also complimentary Bellini's and champagne! Stopped at the Concierge desk, but Christian, Concierge was gone. But in his place, his colleague Federicka was willing to assist and book our Water Taxi back to the airport. Although expensive, it was direct and the other transportation didn't run early enough. Overall, enjoyed my stay. Great location. Private shuttles are great. I want to go back and wander around the rest of the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel away from the centre of Venice”
Reviews.Author: travel_diva_4126
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults, 1 toddler) stayed in this hotel for 5 days over Easter. The hotel itself is a short, easy boat ride away from Venice proper, and we loved the fact that it was away from the hustle and bustle of Venice. Overall, the hotel was very nice, but upon check-in, we were informed that we were 'upgraded', when, in fact, we had booked the 'upgraded' room that included access to the executive lounge. The staff were not very friendly. We were also quite disappointed that the lounge was closed, and that a small corner of the lobby was cordoned off to be the 'lounge'. This was a very small area that was often very crowded with no seating. We checked out the actual lounge, and there was nothing going on (i.e. it wasn't closed for renovations, at least when we were there). It appeared that it was closed for the season to save on costs. However, the rooms were nice and quiet, and the roof top views were incredible (pool was closed during our trip). We would stay here again because of its location, but not necessarily because of the service.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - shame about the thin walls.”
Reviews.Author: Annie_Potts
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews on Tripadvisor before we booked. How bad can it be we thought, we can sleep anywhere. On our 7 night recent stay at the Hilton the first half of our trip was marred by intermittent noise from neighbouring rooms and corridors. Be warned - take ear plugs. The staff obviously know about it and offer little help. They told us our neighbours were checking out - but they didn't. It's such a shame as the breakfast is great, the rooms although cramped with kids are OK, the location is fabulous and the free shuttle boat is a bonus. The beds are a bit hard and the camp bed provided for one of my kids is only suitable for small children. The pool was great - don't bet on getting a sun lounger though as these are all gone early in the morning. It's pot luck - for the second half of our trip, the noise was bearable. If you value your sleep -stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: CristianaG
Reviews.Content: the pool on the roof is magnific and the view over the whole city is unique!

Reviews.Title: “very expensive!!!”
Reviews.Author: shoeladyLondon
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Molino Stucky for 5 night. The pool area was lovely and the views of Venice are spectacular. The Skyview was far too expensive and such a shame that a nice glass of wine (small) to watch the sun go down cost 10 euro!! Staff in the hotel were not very helpful and ignored my complaint about my room key not working for 2 days!! There is no where in the hotel to buy water or a can of coke etc.. it has to be bought at one of the bars for huge mark up! Generally service in the hotel and the whole of Venice was awful and actually found many waiters/waitresses downright rude. Prices were high even in the back streets and with the lack of customer service made the prices even harder to swallow!!

Reviews.Title: “What you expect from a five star and more!”
Reviews.Author: kimmat
Reviews.Content: Excellent service upon check in! They offered us a great breakfast rate that was totally worth it! Best breakfast we had in Italy! The room was large and comfortable. The bed was a large king and enjoyed its linens and spaciousness. The service at breakfast was fantastic! Extremely helpful and wanted to ensure that you were taken care of. We also ate on the roof top bar and had drinks. A little pricey but worth they money for the view and the small snacks served with the drinks at night. The pool was wonderful, it was extremely clean and had a fantastic view! The hotel was also in a great location away from the crowds with easy access to the main centers via water shuttle care of the hotel around every half hour. Wonderful and relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and awesome rooftop sundeck and pool. Very good staff”
Reviews.Author: patter40
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my family of 6 which included teenagers and young children. This hotel is terrific in every way. Within minutes of st. mark's square but with the best views of venice in my opinion. The rooftop deck is breathtaking and the pool is just awesome and a big hit with the family. A perfect way to relax everyday and take in the panorama of venice. Great helpful staff. We ate in Venice everyday so I can't comment on the restaurant except I understood it was quiet good. .The buffet breakfast was excellent with very many choices in a comfortable setting. Very good fitness club as well. I was surprised by some of the negative reviews but frankly, eyes wide open, this is an expensive hotel in terms of food and drink and if you cant afford it then would recommend another locale. This is really a special place and we can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “an overall positive experience, just a few things...”
Reviews.Author: svale26
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an amazing 3 nights at the Hilton. The rooms are a fairly old style for a new hotel- it is strnage they are not in the Ventian style, but more antiqauted,,, even an executive room. The breaksfast is amazing, but the room is a little like a canteen, with no natural light. As mentioned before the hotel is on Guidecca- the free water shuttle provided by the hotel is perfect. Keeps you out of the way of the tourist crowads, is frequent, fast and reliable. The pool is amazing, with gorgeous, comforatbale sun loungers... if you are lucky enough to get one!! Executive lounger has great selection of food and drink. Objectively, its location in the main reception was too small and inappropraitely in full view of the whole reception.. Also there is only one computer availbale in the 'lounge' which is impossible to get a chance to use. Housekeepin leaves a LOT to be desired. Do not miss the Skyline bar... it was one of the highlights of the holiday, especially the view at night. Cocktails may be expensive, but wine and prosecco at 7 eurors is definitley worth it. Overall a very good hotel, what you would expect from a hilton, in a perfect location. Overall

Reviews.Title: “Would Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Narasee
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel - wonderful location on Giudeca across from the crowds but easily accessible. The Hotel's shuttle is wonderful and gets you into a non crowded part of Venice near Zattere, although it also goes to the central tourist spot of St. Mark's Square, although less often. The staff was very friendly. The hotel is an oasis of quiet elegance. The pool is awesome, great views of Venice. Some nice restaurants within walking distance. Concierge was great with recommendations. Our bathroom did have a strange smell which did not bother me but my wife really found hard to deal with. The hotel maintenance people came by but could not figure out what was wrong. For some reason the hotel website does not tell you how to get there by the Vaporetto. From the station, take the # 2 that is going to St. Mark's through Giudeca (not the Grand Canal) and get off at Palanca - the hotel is a short (3-5 minute) walk, although you do have to get through two small bridges, which can be a challenge in you have a heavy luggage - in which case the a water taxi my be easier albeit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Hugely disappointing”
Reviews.Author: IanMax
Reviews.Content: We did not stay in the hotel went to a so-called "gourmet" dinner being held to celebrate a local feast. The location is beautiful but the meal rates as utterly dreadful. It cost 250 Euros a head and has to have been one of the worst ever. Food was cold, unappetising and unidentifiable. A huge disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel by European standards”
Reviews.Author: onlythemostawesome
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and were very excited when we were upgraded to the suite. The only inconvenient part was the boat trip across the canal to get to main venice area but to be fair their free water shuttles every 20 minutes worked out alright. It's only 5 minutes from Zattere by boat and another 5 minutes to San Marco. From the airport, there's a direct airport water shuttle that comes to Hilton's doorway (it does take well over an hour, though). The complimentary private boat to Murano(available on request) was a delightful touch. The rooftop pool has a beautiful view of the main canal and the city of Venice. A must-do atleast once during your stay. They could work on their housekeeping though - the room was layered with dust even after the beds were made (barely though). Even left over cherry pits weren't cleared out. Overall the hotel was a joy to be in and we were sad to leave. Honestly, having stayed around Europe a lot, I'll take this any day.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel....Great restoration work”
Reviews.Author: nevets_83
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel through a bid on Priceline so my review may be a bit skewed for the service and room received for the price paid. I would rate this hotel a solid 4.5 Stars mainly because last year I stayed at a 4 star near St. Marks and prefered it over this hotel. I was extremnly happy with my stay at the Molino Stucky. The public areas were all stunning, everywhere you looked was something interesting. We got to the the hotel early so we left out luggage, went sight seeing, and when we got back to the hotel to check in our luggage was already in our rooms. We did not get breakfast as we had booked with priceline. The hotel pool produced amazing views, and it was great to take a dip in the pool as you see water all day and are unable to jump into the canal. The shuttle boat was always on time and conveniant but if you missed it, the next one out of san marco was usually hourly. We had our dinners on the same island as the hotel and found sufficent options. The pizza place was actually really really good and a great option. The hotel is also accessible to the airport via public transit, so it only cost us under 10 euros each to get to the airport talking the (#42 boat) and (#5 bus). Most importantly we were actually upgraded....which was surprising as we were booked through priceline. We got a suite, which had views across the canal, a seperate living area, and a kitchenette. Overall, we had a great stay at the Molino Stucky and would stay again.....If we got the same or similar rate from priceline. Would I pay full price for this room......probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sggypsy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Molino Stucky for 3 nights and really enjoyed the hotel. I liked the quiet island and found either the hotel shuttle or valporetta service to work well for me. It made wandering over Venice an easy adventure to always know where the shuttle would pick me up to return home. I had no problems with being lost trying to find a hotel. The breakfast was terrific and the afternoon HHonors lounge was excellent. I was upgraded to a suite which was lovely. The staff was very helpful. This was a great experience on my first visit to Venice. The rooftop bar was fun in the evening and the pool was beautiful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Cruise333
Reviews.Content: Don't need to buy a vaporetto ticket. Boat transfer from hotel will get you everywhere you want to go!

Reviews.Title: “Style and class”
Reviews.Author: haymor_w
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Molino Stuckey just recently. Overall, I have a high opinion of the hotel. After a hot day in Venice, it was surely refreshing taking a dip in the pool, followed by a glass of vino on the rooftop of the hotel overlooking the city. The breakfast was out of this world. Our room view was not the best, but we didn't go to Venice to sit in the room. The room was quiet, comfortable, and well appointed. Venture to the top bar for a drink in the evening. It will be a sight you won't forget. I should cover my comments by stating that I have significant benefits received by my Hilton Honors program, which made our stay that much more appealing. It must be the case in Europe, but wi-fi access is not assumed in hotels as is the case in the U.S. Every hotel we stayed at in Europe didn't offer free wi-fi. Why???

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional hotel at fair rates - no small feat in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: PJM-53005
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for 3 nights prior to leaving on a cruise. We got a great rate through Hotwire. Upon arrival, we were given a chance to purchase the buffet breakfast which wasn't included in the Hotwire price. While the buffet seemed expensive, it was far and away the best buffet breakfast we've had in our European travels. It was more like an American breakfast buffet with scrambled eggs, sausages, bacon, etc., in addition to the usual European fare of cereals, cold-cuts, hard boiled eggs and juices. Our room, on a corner overlooking the canal couldn't have been nicer - nice size, comfortable bed, over-all a good experience. The hotel is fairly recently created (apparently) from an old flour mill. The original wood support posts and beams were used in the construction, rather than hidden making for a unique, comfortable design. Because our room overlooked the canal and the hotel's shuttle boat dock, there was some noise but it didn't last into the wee hours; the noise was neither loud nor jarring. All rooms were accessible by elevator. Speaking of the shuttle; there is a free shuttle to St. Marks's Square that runs at least hourly from early morning to at least midnight (more frequently on Fridays and weekends. The shuttle goes from the pier in front of the hotel across the Guidecca canal to a stop right next to the Zattare Vaporetto stop, then on to St. Marks. The return also stops at the Zattare. The same shuttle crosses the canal to the Zattare and back, without going on to St. Marks. The hotel's web site has a schedule. If you're coming in from the airport, you can take one of the Alilaguna water buses for a very reasonable fare. We didn't do this, instead we took a water taxi which was very expensive (100 euro) but quite an experience in that we went right through Venice on smaller "canals" not traveled by the Alilaguna or the Vaporetti. We bought drinks at one of the bars in the hotel. They were expensive but well made. We didn't eat at the hotel (other than breakfast); but we did eat at a restaurant on the Zattare - right next to the shuttle stop - on 2 nights. Both meals were wonderful. (I don't know the name of the restaurant, but the sign above the door said "Pizza" and the floating pier on which we ate had dark green awnings.) Given that many hotel reviews we've read in researching our stay in Venice spoke of small rooms, high prices, noisy canal views, I'm very happy with our choice. The only reason I wouldn't recommend the hotel highly is in fear that it might become so popular that the rates will be out of sight the next time we visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “a luxury hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: BradnMarianne
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel that has made the most of its historic setting in a former industrial building. We were using Hilton points but that did not matter to the staff who were courteous and helpful. Our room was great and the cocktails at the Sky bar added to the overall experience of a quality hotel. The massage we treated ourselves to was worth every cent! Relative to the main island, the island of Guidecca is very quiet and peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and view let down by staff & hotel design”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraMNottinghamUK
Reviews.Content: Had a 4 night stay in the Molino Stucky, the views and location were fantastic especially to get away from the noise, heat & bustle of San Marco and other tourist attractions. The hotel renovation looks fantastic but is let down by some design flaws particularly the thin walls in the 'Arsenale' block. It is not pleasant to be kept awake by the convsersation of the occupants of the next door room, or to have to listen to another guest being offensive on the tepelphone to hotel staff or to be woken by the alarm calls of at least 3 or 4 neighbouring rooms as the phone calls reverberated around the building. The staff were generally badly trained and inattentive to guests needs, and certainly not upto 5 star standard. We went to the roof top bar and waited 10 minutes for the waiter to take an order and after a further 20 minutes, he came over to say our drinks were on the way ! We left at that point but it was hardly any better elsewhere in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top Location to stay in Venice and overviewing the city”
Reviews.Author: Hupflinger
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located across the center of Venice, Piazza San Marco. You can easily go there by private baot, free of charge. The hotel architecture (I guess it was a old noodle fabric) is very unique with tasty rooms, very well designed. Compared with other hotels in Venice the hotel is tall, you can oversee the Island of Venice pretty good. Don't miss the outdoor bar at the top floor for a "Spritz" while they serve free olives, nuts and others. Romantic building illumination in the evening. Heavily frequented from Americans during my stay, breakfast was OK, but nothing special. Nice swimmingpool located at the rooftop. Surrounding area outside the hotel area was partly under construchtion and a little bit messy

Reviews.Title: “worked brilliantly with kids”
Reviews.Author: europe100
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Venice with husband and two kids 9 and 7 and just wanted to say that the Hilton worked brilliantly for our purposes - just one tip too - having been to Venice many times from Australia I made sure that we went outside European school holidays (the kids were good enough to agree to miss three weeks of our school!!) - we did London Paris and Venice, and didnt encounter any of the usual waiting in lines for attractions - the weather towards the end of June proved to be beautiful and hot in Venice, which made the amazing roof top pool a hug attraction (sitting there with a drink watching the cruise shops float by was incredible). Several friends who have lived in Venice tried to put me off the Molini with comments like - why would you need a pool in Venice when there is so much art to see, and dont you want to be in the centre? well needless to say they dont have kid and im really glad I didnt heed their advice!!!
