(what I now know in retrospect is that young children have a really limited capacity to view renaissance art all day!) Anyway I had spent ages researching this trip - the Cipriani is obviously the ultimate if travelling to venice with kids ie pool and green area to run in - but was really really expensive, I also looked at the Danieli - but again it was expensive and wouldnt allow the old squeeze two kids and two adults into the one room (also, while there is one stunning and famously photographed "pink" building there are also two rather worn out annexes attached), and I now know that being in the "centre of town" so to speak just wouldnt have worked well with two kids who are used to lots of space and no crowds (I did actually go inside the lobby of the Danieli, just to check it out and to his credit the guy at the front desk was very friendly) anyway let me say that unlike some of the reviewers we found the hilton fantastic, the pool, as I said was a god send - we went on a family package three nights for 900ish euro, breakfast, welcome drink, gift for kids (cute red bath robes) suite - which was a two room bonus and fantastic, and kids eat free in resturant (maybe not many people know about this family package because at first lovely helpful Rita at the front desk didnt know what it was - i did have a print out thought -book direct on the hilton Molini site). it was also a lot closer to San Marco than I had anticipated from trip advisor negative reviews. Also just minutes away is the first stop of the shuttle boat which is Zattere across the water - two minutes - with the Ponte Del Accademia bridge and the Peggy Guggenheim Collection (partly staffed by two adorable American students) just down the lane - icecream shop, resturants and a supermarket called "Bila"a little walk next to the water in the direction of the cruise ship docks (look out for the yellow and red shopping bags) - Then, when one wants to go into San Marco one just stays on the boat for a really short ride with a special hilton dock virtually in front of the Danieli. For visits to Murano the hotel organised a free taxi boat ride to a very fancy glass blowing factory - where I spied on the wall of fame Mick Jagger, as well as the actress from Medium, a nice fellow showed us around - the kids both had a turn at glass blowing which was a huge thrill. the sky would be the limit at the amount one could spend there I think it was called Signoretti - but dont fear, we just brought a couple of inexpensive trinkets for the kids - and they were still lovely. Can happily recommend the Hilton - kids had a ball, somebody has obviously thought long and hard about the layout of the rooms, and it was actually a bonus not being in San Marco - cant wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great view, nice high quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robertomazowiecki
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights in Molino Stucky with my girlfriend, when I visited Venice for congress this June. Got upgraded to Executive floor, which was very nice (fantastic view from the 6th floor at Venice at the other site of the lagoon), the bottle of chilled Prosecco in our room at night was a great touch too. Room was nicely furnished, comfortable, good bed and nice bed linen. Comfy bathroom finished with alot of marble stone. There was an executive lounge space in the main cafe area, well stocked with drinks and wine as well as some snacks and appetizers. We enoyed this a lot. Most of the staff were very friendly and kind. The public areas like hall, bars and cafe are clean and modern but still in quite classic style, so I felt very well in the hotel. It is possible to have coffe or breakfast at the tables in front of the hotel hotel at the shore, which is great when the weather is good. The location of the hotel gives you really fantastic view of Venice, the only drawback is that you have to take a ferry (free of charge, goes twice an hour) anytime you want to go anywhere. It takes about 15 mins to get to S Marco - so it is not that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: OnthemoveChicago
Reviews.Content: The room was small with no view whatsoever and the bed was above average. The drain in the shower was very slow and we had to be careful not to let it overflow onto the bathroom floor. The room safe was broken and was never fixed even after I pointed it out on the first day of our stay. In my opinion it does not deserve a 5 star ranking although it has 5 star prices.. The value just wasn't there. We thought the staff was mostly good but even that was a hit or miss. I not sure I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overwhelming hotel complex that underwhelmed us”
Reviews.Author: Figaro522
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Molino Stucky for 2 nights in May 2010. The hotel was fairly accessible via vaporetto and we found the free hotel shuttle to be on time and convenient to the â€œmainlandâ€� of Venice and was not too crowded, however, for the price of the room, the inconvenience of having to take the shuttle everywhere wasnâ€™t really worth it. Our room was fairly small (not the 5-star quality we expected, even by European hotel standards) and our view was of a wall of other rooms, forcing us to keep our curtains drawn at all times. Since the hotel is built in a renovated mill, the room shape was awkward and the size was pretty small. Overall, we had expected a luxury hotel and found it to be a run of the â€œmillâ€� chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Mikelfry
Reviews.Content: I booked the Stucky Molino Hilton via a popular internet booking site. What initially appeared to be a very good deal turned out far less than a good deal. Why was this hotel a bad choice: (1) Upon check-in and a request for a room with two beds, the front desk clerk basically said that with the internet booking, no such choice was available to us. However, for only "39 Euros per day extra", he would get us a room with two beds plus one with a view. We did get a very small room with two beds and even a view. Unfortunately, it also had a connecting door to the next room. We were kept up very late for two of our three nights at the hotel by loud voices and TV from next door...even the wall between the rooms was slightly opened at the top. I cannot remember EVER staying at a hotel, even a very cheap one, with such poor sound insulation. To spend the day walking extensively around beautiful Venice and then being unable to have a decent night's sleep upon return to the hotel was very frustrating. (2) I mentioned this upon check out (dissatisfaction with our stay). The clerk completely ignored what I had to say. The hotel staff had so involved with a large accounting/financial group that most of the time when we might have wanted help from the staff, it was too crowded at the various desks to obtain help. (3) The hotel location, on a small island across from the main island, had drawbacks. First, one had to get on a hotel shuttle boat to get to the main island with most of the attractions of the area, and then possibly onto another vaporetto to go further. Hence one's late night and/or early morning activity was tied to that hotel shuttle boat. Also, there were very few alternative restaurants or shops on the island where the hotel was located. (4) The hotel's continental buffet breakfast was quite good, but at 26 Euros extra per day along with extra the 39 Euros for our room, we could have easily stayed elsewhere. At least, we would probably have had a quieter room, breakfast included, a more convenient location for walking around the city, and much more personal, attentive service. The hotel itself is quite a beautiful property and had the staff been more attentive and the room quieter, perhaps we would felt better about it. I'd still tell anyone to think twice about staying there!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: sms6778
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at Molino Stucky and really liked it. The room was very clean and confortable, with a cozy but upscale decoration. The room wasn't very big (it was a great deal through Priceline), but had a king size bed with many pillows, a big desk, two big wardrobes, a reading chair, and a modern LCD. The bathroom was also beautiful. We had no problem with the location, and used both the hotel shuttle and the vaporettos (bought a pass while still at home). It really was nice to come back to the quiet of Giudecca at the end of a busy day. The staff was also really nice throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Georgiadawg0905
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect! Everything about this place was beautiful and well ran. Staff was great! Bar was very big and fun to watch FIFA 2010 at. Breakfast was a full spread buffet with everything you want including champagne!

Reviews.Title: “Good base to see Venice”
Reviews.Author: JOCK65
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton at the end of May for three nights in a executive room (Kingsize) on the sixth floor.The room was spacious with all the facilities you would expect and unlike some reviews the air conditioning was fine,having said that some of our friends rooms on lower floors had issues with temperature and certainly were not as nice with lower ceilings and less space.The view was not brilliant from the room but as we were out a lot it was not an issue. The cleaning in our room was excellent with a member of the hotel team checking daily that we were happy with it and delivering our water (part of the HHonors pack).Unlike some reviews here we found the staff in the hotel to be excellent and always willing to help. We used the executive lounge during the stay and it was ok but we have seen better as the nibbles were a bit limited and there were no spirits available. The Breakfast is excellent with plenty of choice and if you can get a decent rate I would advise taking it as you can set yourself up for the day.Venice can be pricey but go off the beaten track a bit and look where the locals go and its reasonable. The Hotel was full when we were there with it also being used as a venue for cruise ship parties so do not be suprised to find areas/lounges shut off. As said the Hotel was full but we had no trouble using the complimentary water shuttle but do get a copy of the timetable as times can vary. There are supermarkets and restaurents on the island if you want to stay on the island a bit, but with that view across the water why would you?!!! We enjoyed our stay there and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in Venice, Outside the City Center”
Reviews.Author: idahoprincess8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for four nights in late May, and we had a great experience. Location. The Hilton is across the lagoon from the city center of Venice. It's fairly convenient to get to the city center (two stops on the other side, including one at St. Mark's Square), with the Hilton boat shuttle and the nearby vaparetto (water bus) stop. You just have to plan around the shuttle times. Room. We had a beautiful, spacious basic room in the "G" building. We did not have a great view, as we looked out over a construction site. But as my husband said, at least we could see the water! When asked about moving rooms or upgrades, we were told everything was full for the duration of our stay, and we couldn't move. Our shower was broken on the first day, and after calling to have it fixed, the staff came up and fixed it within 45 minutes (very impressive!). Hotel and Amenities. The hotel is enormous, very modern, and nicely appointed. As one reviewer said, it's easy to get lost, especially when you're trying to find the fitness center. The food is very expensive (26 Euros for a burger and fries at the pool), and the Wi-Fi is even more expensive (12 Euro per hour or 22 Euro for 24 hours). That said, the breakfast buffet was a delicious meal every morning. The pool was very nice and had beautiful views of Venice and the lagoon. We found the hotel to be packed with fellow Americans, mostly on their way to or from a cruise. Staff. The staff was helpful and very professional. We found the concierge to be very helpful in booking tickets for us to see a Vivaldi concert in Venice, as well as to arrange for a water taxi to the airport. We would definitely stay here again. The hotels near the city center of Venice may provide a bit more unique experience, but the Hilton was very nice and comfortable and made for an enjoyable stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem away from the tourists, a haven of peace”
Reviews.Author: destination28Essex
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Venice is a great hotel. We booked a 3 night city break in febuary, and most of the facilities were available even though we were out of season. The hotel was very luxurious, and nicely furnished. After reading bad reviews of the hotel we were slightly concerned, but found it to be comfortable. The rooms are very nice, good furniture, large and clean. The views from some of the rooms are critised, and if you are wanting a water view you may be dissapointed with some of the rooms described as having a view. The hotel is located on a Island away a short boat ride from the main attractions and the building is impresive. There is a free shuttle boat provided by the hotel. Be aware the hotels food is expensive, but in line with the rest of Venice. The breakfast is brilliant but pricey if not in with the deal. Overall a luxury Hilton hotel, with great facilities in a good position.

Reviews.Title: “Nice to have the lagoon as a buffer to the hustle of the main island”
Reviews.Author: Mark30375
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days in late May and had a wonderful time. GOOD:Upgraded to very nice room. The executive lounge had a nice selection of wine, beer, cold drinks and assorted nibble food. The island itself had several good relatively inexpensive places to eat. The people on the island seemed to have a little nicer disposition than the residents we encountered in Venice. Quirky: Getting to the workout room is a challenge early in the morning before the spa is open. The hotel is large and takes a couple of day learn ones way around. We enjoyed the distance across the lagoon. Having purchased a Venice Card before arrival we did not rely on the Hilton shutle every time we were ready to go accross. Highly recommend VENICE CARD purchase before arrive. Could Be Better: Pool area had great potential but getting a lounge chair was a challenge. The view from the pool was amazing. The conceirge was always busy and we got the "quick" "next" answer a couple of times.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel With OK Location”
Reviews.Author: wbt81
Reviews.Content: This was the only "name brand" hotel that we stayed at during our trip to Italy and it was pretty much as expected. Much nicer accommodations, responsible staff and a nice upgrade from the other hotels. Only thing to be aware of if you are considering this hotel is that is located across the lagoon from Venice. This was really not much of an issue for us, but getting to Venice (and to the hotel from the train station) can be a little tricky as the private shuttle the hotel runs only runs to Venice once at hour at some times.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: bonessa
Reviews.Content: T'was the most sumptuous of our Italy trip. The views are unbelievable and the brunch is worth the stay...outstanding! The room was elegant and unique. It was great having our own water shuttle and fun staying across from Johnny Depp's yaght. Don't expect an authentic experience, as the hotel, being a Hilton, is full of Americans. That being said, it was reassuring to have the quality of a Hilton while in Europe. After reading mixed reviews, I would highly recommend it. It is elegant, yet set in a very unique setting. Frederica was amazing, as a concierge. She was most helpful, booked whatever we needed and had a refreshing sense of humour.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Area”
Reviews.Author: Ranman36
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Hilton and could not have been happier, we found the hotel to be very clean, great service and good area. Unlike some of the other reviews there is plenty on the island, good food, supermarket, hair salon all at local not turist prices. The Hilton has normal prices for drinks, food water etc. that you would expect to pay at any 5 star hotel. If you venture out just a short walk away you will find the area to be quite charming where mostly locals live as the hilton is the only hotel on the island, the free water shuttle worked great up until 11:30 PM. If in Venice, I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL AWAY FROM THE CROWDS”
Reviews.Author: dandnCardiff
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a lovely island across from Venice. We arrived early hours of Sat morning and found the receptionist to be very helpful at check-in. We were given a room which had views across to Venice which was wonderful. On Saturday was the FA cup final and my husband is a Chelsea fan so wanted to watch it. The Concierge rang a local Trattoria who he knew had Sky and asked him to put it on for us - great service. The trattoria itself was family run and we had a lovely meal, with bottle wine and beers for Â£60.00 which in Venice is good value. The Hotel water bus was always on time and took you to St Marks Square and return. On a Saturday night for 16 euros each you can go to the Sky Bar on the 8th floor where there is a DJ, you get a cocktail and substantial nibbles - again this was great value as the food was good and filling. Venice is a gorgeous place to visit, however it is very busy and crowded, to be able to get away from the crowds and go back to the Hilton was wonderful. Would recommend hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: mark785643701
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is clearly a high quality place to stay, a 4 -5 star based on the American scale. Built in a former flour mill, the rooms were large, unique and very comfortable. The restaurant breakfast buffet was among the best I have sampled. The bath rooms are luxurious. A free watertaxi comes every 20 minutes to take you to the Venice proper or to pick you up and take you back home. The rooftop lounge offers impressive city views.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location on Giudecca - very relaxed - great rooftop pool & view”
Reviews.Author: daffofils
Reviews.Content: We loved staying on Giudecca Island, as it got us away from the crowds within Venice. The hotel shuttle was great to get back and forth to San Marco. The hotel is very large with lots of great rooms over looking the lagoon over to San Marco. We loved watching all the boat traffic even the big cruise ships coming and going. The rooms were very nice and typical comfort to any of the top hiltons. You could not beat the view from the 8th floor pool across the lagoon into San Marco. Awesome. The breakfast was true huge buffet each morning. It was great to walk in the open fresh sea air along the promenade viewing San Marco. Made a great place to stroll or run each morning or evening. There are many good restaurants on this island as well to view the city & boat traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Not as lovely as expected”
Reviews.Author: PollyB3
Reviews.Content: I was on a weekend break with my Mum, who is a gold card member. We've stayed in many different Hiltons and I have to say they are not at all consistent. The hotel was very new when we stayed, and the shower in our room didn't work! We were sent off to another bedroom to use the bathroom, but it was hardly ideal given this room was on another floor. The restaurant certainly lived up to the very high expectations we had, as far as food goes. However, we were completely forgotten about at one point, and were waiting half an hour for dessert. They did give us one dessert for free to compensate, but given we were paying more than both of our flight costs for this one meal alone, we were expecting better service. The sky bar has fabulous views and gorgeous cocktails - recommend the bellinis. Also having a swim in the rooftop pool was great fun. All in all, it was a pleasant stay, but a little too rough around the edges still. Let's hope it has improved since. I would recommend it if you can get a good deal, but not at full price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gypsyMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great. Location is across the lagoon but they have excellent shuttle boats running. It was August, very hot and crowded so it was nice to escape. Rooftop pool is small but great views with the cruise ships passing thru the lagoon. Room was nice but difficult to find due to the fact that the hotel is a renovated factory. Breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “top hotel”
Reviews.Author: njp51
Reviews.Content: We stayed at four hotels in Italy including the Molino Stucky. While the "star rating system" is not on the same level as other places in the world (such as in the U.S.) this is truly a 5-star property. The entire place was classy, rooms were appointed well, the service was highly professional and it was a great choice for us. Check out the roof bar for an incredible view. Our only complaint was the very expensive daily Internet charge (28 Euro). This unreasonable rate is a bad decision on the part of management for those that only want two minutes per day to check their emails from home. Other than that we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great for quick weekend”
Reviews.Author: PiotrParis
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with the nice rooms and good breakfast in the morning (I admire the sparking wine in the morning :-) One interesting point was the swimming pool well presented in all of the reviews however it's only open during summer period. Service is little lazy but overall in the Italian standards.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to my expectations”
Reviews.Author: CCCCardiff
Reviews.Content: The Molino Stucky is a great hotel. I had high expectations of both Venice and the hotel and fortunately I wasn't disapointed with either. The hotel is on a seperate island from the the main part of Venicewhich gives it a nice relaxed atmosphere. The hotel shuttle was really good & the water bus stop has a service that runs every 15 mins or so that is a 5 minute walk away from the hotel. We had an exec room and so we had access to the exec lounge which gives you unlimited soft drinks, tea/coffeee, booze and snacks all day. If you are staying at this Hilton it's really worth checking out the cost differential for an exec room as a beer was 8 euros at the hotel, wine 10 euros a glass and the prices are about the same across the water. The hotel is huge but still felt different and special. Mostly the staff were lovely but there was one rather brusque chap in the skyline bar...talking of which the roof top bar was closed for a private function from 5.30pm - 8pm one night...we were a bit disappointed in this because the website makes it one of the hotel's selling points. Also they only open the roof top swimming pool if the staff beleive it's the right weather so on one relatively sunny day it wasn't open. Overall an awesome hotel and one I would defiantely recommend for a really special experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but fix the air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: karw
Reviews.Content: Located right on the canal, this beautifully restored hotel has all the amenities of a US Hilton including wonderful towels, ice machines. Wonderful breakfast buffet. No complaints here other than the air conditioning seemed to be out of order and could not open windows due to monster mosquitoes.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect way to see Venice”
Reviews.Author: ilvshoeslane
Reviews.Content: This hotel was more than we expected. I was not excited about staying so far from the heart of Venice but this was perfect! The island of Guidecca was lovely and had great views all around us. The shuttle boat ran so frequently that we saved major money by not having to get a water taxi. The hotel had an amazing breakfast and great staff. They upgraded us to an executive suite with two room and windows on all sides. It was amazing. They even provided some free cocktails for our room. There are several amazing resturants within walking distance and the side walks are very wide and perfect for a late night walk. We spent 10 days in Italy but my 3 days at this hotel in Venice were my favorite!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful building - not great service”
Reviews.Author: mansaclaire
Reviews.Content: We used 10,000 airmiles for a two night stay at the Hilton, the hotel is great, beautifully converted and very clean. Our room was lovely, we were on the executive floor but had no access to the executive lounge. We were also told we'd have a Venice View and sadly had a view of a wall. Its extremely expensive, and charge for things that a 5 star hotel really should include. The breakfast was cold on both mornings and the service was terrible at breakfast, and due to not being told , (even thought we'd asked where to wait) that you need to actually stand on the pontoon for the boat to the airport, (it sailed right passed without stopping!) we had to pay 110 Euros to get to the airport. Had 2 spa treatments - therapists were outstanding . The hotel offers a complimentary shuttle to the main part of Venice which runs really frequently. In summary, stunning hotel. nice quiet location, not sure if 5 stars is justified purely due to service.. # Don't think I'd go back to this hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Distinctly Average”
Reviews.Author: xxxStafford
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton between 3rd and 7th May 2010 and booked through Sovereign. We arrived via private transfer and reception was quiet but the hotel had not upgraded us to an 'Executive' room as stated in our booking. This was corrected but the upgrade did not allow us access to the executive lounge. We had e-mailed ahead to tell them that we were celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary during our stay but this was not acknowledged at check in or at any other point which was disapointing. This is a lovely large hotel, beautifully renovated from an old mill. It has large reception areas and a rooftop pool among other good facilities but it is a bit souless (which I suppose is to be expected from a Hilton). Private transfers were on time and good but we felt that staying in Venice itself would have been better as the last transfer was 11.20pm and it would have been nice not to clock watch when we were out for the evening. The skyline bar is lovely but drinks are very expensive. A gin and tonic was 16 euro but the cocktails are amazing and much better value for money in comparison. On our anniversary we had made a reservation at the Cipriani but the heavens opened and we had a terrific thunderstorm. Concierge were very helpful with suggestions of other restaurants in Venice but eventually we decided to stay in the hotel and eat in the Aromi restaurant. Big mistake. We had the most bizzarre meal which consisted of a green frothy liquid, described as 'wild root soup' then the 'duo of hen'. This litteraly was a small chicken breast and a smaller chicken thigh marinated in a light sauce. There were no accompanyments, nothing. At first I assumed I had missed the veg section on the menu but I hadn't. I have eaten 'nouvelle quisine' in my time but this was rediculous. We ordered a bottle of red with our meal and bailed out early taking the wine with us. And the cost... 189 euro! Breakfast was OK although we got up from our table on our first morning to go and get our food and returned to our table to find it being cleared of our coffee and juice and re- set ?. You should in my opinion not expect to see chipped bowls and glasses at a hotel of this rating either. Staff vary, some smile and some don't and I also have to agree with a prevous reviewer in that the air con in the rooms is useless. It was only 20 degrees during our stay but the room was way too hot. Rooms are adequate and overall the hotel is clean and tidy. At the end of our stay the hotel had no information on our pre arranged airport transfer. The consierge was helpful the night before we left and telephoned our agent who gave the details to us but reception the following morining were oblivious to when or where the boat would pick up. I think I just expected more from a 5* Hilton. Little things are missing. We had no offer to take our cases to our room on check in and there was no turn down service until the last night. All these little details matter and make the difference between an average hotel and an wondeful one. Could do better Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations, huge property”
Reviews.Author: BreckBearSki
Reviews.Content: Prior to arriving, I questioned the hotel's location - being off on a separate island. After experiencing it, it was certainly manageable. We are in our late 30's and don't mind walking though - so half the time we found ourselves on the Hilton boat and the other time we were on the Public Transit (ACTV) - a little walk from the hotel - 500 meters - not too bad though. Only had difficulty one night when we stayed out in Venice past midnight, the Hilton boat was no longer running, but we finagled a way to take the ACTV one direction, get off, walk a couple 100 meters, then catch a different ACTV and it worked out. It does add some travel time, but you're generally taking boats all day anyway, so it's not a big deal. Hotel was great, upgraded with the Diamond status, had not seen an Executive Lounge like that - but for the record, it is because the hotel is renovating the "real" lounge...again, we made it work. Was amazed at what a huge property it was - this is a large hotel. Breakfast is busy but a great spread and service. Did not eat any other meals at the hotel as there are just too many great restaurants all throughout Venice. If I went to Venice again, while it may be intriguing to stay "in" Venice - I bet we would choose the Hilton again as you won't be as COMFORTABLE as you would be at the Hilton - oh one last thing - they have decent beds - much better than anything else you find in Europe where most of the beds seem straight out of prison cells!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price we paid but not up to five star standard”
Reviews.Author: Yak-n-Gnu
Reviews.Content: We used Hotwire to book three nights at start of May for UKÂ£103 (US$160) per night excluding breakfast - would always recommend doing it this way if you don't mind the gamble/fun of not knowing for certain where you'll be. In summary, very over-priced if you pay rack-rate, most facilities as expected of a 5* except rubbish air-con, poor room cleanliness/finish and everything extra is very expensive. Pros: - The complimentary shuttle boat is great although make sure you note where it drops you off because the stands are not clearly marked. - Nice to be able to get away from the chaos of the main islands. - Taking our relatively low rate into account, the hotel was very good value for Venice. - Staff seemed friendly and pretty good. - Modern room of a decent size - not the norm in Venice. Cons: - The air conditioning in our room was next to useless. It was much hotter in our room than in the corridor or outside even when we had it on full blast despite our room not getting any direct sunlight. Next door had their door propped open presumably to get the freezing cold air from the corridor into their room. If you arrive and find your room seems a bit hot then don't do what we did and assume the air-con would eventually sort it out - tell the desk. - The roof-top bar is very expensive. A Rossini (a Bellini but with fresh strawberry pulp rather than peach) was 14 euros, a martini was 16 euros, a spritz 16 euros and a small bottle of beer 8 euros. Great views of Venice from the outside terrace though and the cocktails were perfect. Watch out for very loud and awful music on a Saturday night (I mean Simply Red!). - A bit soulless - once inside you could be anywhere. - The pool is outdoor so not open all year round. - There were dog paw-prints on a glass surface in our room when we arrived!? - View from room was of a wall but got to expect this sort of thing when you use Hotwire. - Selection of tea/coffee provided included lots of herbal tea and decaf nescafe but only one proper tea and no milk. Housekeeping obliged as soon as asked. Other - If you walk along the waterside then avoid the first bakers you come to - they intentionally ripped us off and wouldn't be argued with. Might be expected for Venice but this was the only negative experience of this type that we had. - If you get a vaporetto to Giudecca then don't get off at Sacca Fisola - use Palanca - it's much easier to find the hotel entrance if you do this. - Eat at Altanella! - just five minutes walk away - book even if you think it won't be full. See separate review. - There's a cheap but good supermarket called Prix on the waterfront just before the Redentore vaporetto stop. Basing our value rating on the sort of price Expedia quotes (Â£300+ per night) since the price we paid through Hotwire relies on you not knowing the Hotel name.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: IacobA
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with really good service ;). I would harmly recommend to anyone visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten track and quite nice”
Reviews.Author: GRM59
Reviews.Content: The Hilton in Venice is good choice, for it is across the canal from the main part of Venice, and in a quiet location. The free water shuttle provided by the hotel is excellent, and walking around the main section of Venice is easy. The rooms were large by European standards and quite comfortable. I would say the staff could be a little more friendly and helpful. The service in the small restaurant in the lobby area is very slow, and the food is very expensive. Our granchildren were looking forward to using the rooftop pool, but it does not open until May 1 (their web-site should tell you this.) Overall, though, a good choice for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great value---service can be a bit up and down”
Reviews.Author: peterbotto
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights after skiing trip. Booked on Priceline. Com and had a great deal. lovely room with all facilities. Excellent boat service to the main island. Extras are v. expensive but this is Venice Italy not Venice Beach Ca!! They need just to up their game on a few service issues as this is a 5 Star hotel. Room not quite properly prepared---old towels left in bath--no choice of pillows (v.hard) and coffee and tea bags not topped up. Also the courtyard tables were not being cleared and cleaned as on would expect for 5 stars plus litter in corridors. This is a management issue and they need to be on top of it all the time. That said I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Stay - Best Customer Service!!”
Reviews.Author: JRDTexas18
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in Feb and had an excellant stay. The room was gorgeous. Cute, clean and confortable - everything that I look for in a room! I loved our stay here and will stay again if I ever return to Venice. The location is not on the Venice mainland, but the hotel has a ferry that will take you there so its still very convenient. The customer service here was exceptional. Upon checking in, we were upgraded to a suite with separate living room. The concierge desk was extremely helpful. Venice is a strange city to get around in, but the staff at the desk provided us with helpful info and maps. The last night of our stay we had transfer (sadly) to the airport Marriot and the Hilton staff was even nice enough to call the other hotel to get directions and they arranged our boat transportation to get us there. They also arranged for us to get a complimentary boat taxi to a glass factory in Murano for a glass demonstration. (I believe the glass factory pays for the taxi so we had a bit of a sales pitch once we arrived, but we just said thanks, but no thanks and were on our way) Also, one night in the executive lounge area, we mentioned to the waitress that I didn't like most wine and she recommended one for me to try that was absolutely delicious. In fact, we emailed the hotel last week to ask about the wine that they served and they emailed back immediately with the answer. Thank you Hilton Molino Stucky!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms”
Reviews.Author: GrahamN
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights. Unfortunately spent whole of one day organising journey out because of the flight cancellations. However the room was fantastic. Very quiet (stayed one night at a 3 star afterwards and regretted it, would rather have payed the extra and stayed in the Hilton). Room was beautiful, large, very well laid out and quiet. (I hate noisy rooms !) Hotel allowed colleagues to stay on at the same good rate. Did not profiteer from the flight cancellations so full marks. Although a boat ride to the man attractions, shuttle boats were always on time. Only criticism is that the internet at Euros 27 was very overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “A Virtue in Venice”
Reviews.Author: coloraia
Reviews.Content: When I came to Venice, I was expecting crowds, tourists, and everything else that comes with an overly burdened place. My experience at Venice was made all the better by staying at the Molino Stucky. I kept my expectations low and ended up coming away with a good deal. Everyday I was treated better because I was alone, not something everyone would do. My room was clean, quiet and had a wonderful bathtub. Every day I had a warm and delicious breakfast replete with Prosecco. This hotel is not everyone. But for someone who wants a good and safe place to stay, this would be a good bet. The old adage when traveling in Italy is you get what you pay for. If you want to be treated for EU80, then you will get that. I always stay at a Hilton when I'm abroad and I got more than I wanted. The staff went out of its way to make me happy, even providing me hard boiled eggs for breakfast because I did not want the scrambled stuff. It was also in close proximity to the Palanca vaporetto stop as well as Harry Cipriani's Sister restaurant which beats the tourist trap. Definitely opt for the included breakfast buffet because it will keep you sated for the rest of the day. Sorry to those of you who don't like that the hotel didn't treat your bratty kids well. I would not recommend this hotel to those who are penny wise and pound foolish, and are always looking for "a bargain."

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully refurbished hotel with stunning views”
Reviews.Author: golfgenius
Reviews.Content: Our choir sang at St Mark's on Sat 10th April and the company organised the Hilton as one of the accommodation options. The hotel is convenient from the airport about 45 mins by water taxi. It is in a beautifully refurbished old mill building and the rooms are very well decorated. The staff are extremely curteous and we enjoyed an excellent breakfast. The only downside was being charged 6E for a small bottle of water from the mini bar. Shame the hotel has to"rip off" clients. It would have been a thoughtful touch to actually provide a bottle of water each day. I am sure they could cover the cost somewhere in their pricing structure. There were plenty of products provided in the excellently appointed bathroom, which included large white dressing gowns and white slippers. There is a free water taxi to and from the island to the heart of Venice. Why charge an exhorbitant amount for water?

Reviews.Title: “Serenity in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Merlin5
Reviews.Content: We had booked a shared private taxi through Viator for our arrival as we were arriving too late for the Allilaguna, and apart from the fact that we had to wait 30 minutes for the taxi to arrive, it delivered us right to the hotel's jetty. Check in was very easy and even though we were staying on Honours points, we were upgraded to a beautiful room in the main building with a view right onto the canal and across to Venice. Our room was beautiful - as is the hotel - high wooden ceilings, and marble floors, with several courtyards between the buildings. Contrary to some other reviews we found all the staff we encountered to be friendly, helpful and professional, in fact most staff went out of their way to help if we needed anything. Breakfast was very good with enough choices to suit most people and again, the service was not lacking, even when the breakfast room was very busy one morning. If we missed the hotel's shuttle to Venice we simply walked 5 minutes to the bus stop at Palanca and caught one of the plentiful buses. We had bought our bus tickets at the airport while waiting for our taxi as there is a Veniceconected booth there. We ventured up to the skyline bar on the roof of the hotel one afternoon and yes, the views are superb - but it was extremely busy so we didn't stay and have a drink. Unusually for a Hilton, their club lounge is just an area segregated from the main bar area - we have only encountered separate rooms for the lounges in other Hiltons, but this was fine. Check out was very easy - and an item that had mistakenly been added to our bill was removed as soon as we queried it. We had a lovely stay at the Hilton - the location made us lazy about going into Venice for the evenings - but we have visited Venice several times before and it was nice to explore Giudecca which is very pleasant to wander around and find different restaurants - and there are no throngs of tourists to push through (Venice was extremely busy over Easter - even busier than I have seen it in the summer). I would definitely recommend this hotel and we will probably return in the future. Thank you for a lovely stay - it was just what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Service A+++”
Reviews.Author: mazie164
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from the Hilton and thought it was terrific. We found this hotel by doing hotwire and were delighted with the results. When we arrived we asked if there were any upgrades and were able to get a room overlooking the canal for only 60 euros more which was a fantastic rate. The room was very clean and was great. The staff were very helpful! This is a great place to stay. Don't miss having drinks at the rooftop pool!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to unwind far from the maddening crowd!”
Reviews.Author: onebigepicurean
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel housed in a converted grain mill. Though room rates are steep, you can see where all of the money goes--excellent staff, facilities, and amenities. The concierge staff was most helpful, especially Irene. The executive lounge is not much to write home about but manager Francesca made sure that I was well taken care of. My room was too small and I was not upgraded as a Diamond member--I was given the stock response that the hotel was "full" and that no rooms were available on the executive floor. I found this a bit incredible. The water shuttle to San Marcos was very prompt and reliable and it added to the pleasure of visiting other areas frequently throughout the day. Breakfast buffet was very nice, though not top-notch as one would expect from a hotel of this calibre. I didn't eat in any of the restaurants as the prices were far beyond what I am accustomed to in Hilton Hotels. Instead I opted for some places in Venice which were most enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great views - A good alternative to central venice.”
Reviews.Author: Freeman1948
Reviews.Content: The good things about this hotel begin at the airport, namely that the Alilunga waterbus, either the blue route or the red route, takes you to the hotel's private jetty. This saves trundling one's cases around the streets of Venice, a very good thing. The hotel is, of course, in the vast and newly renovated warehouse at the western end of Guidecca. The check-in and checkout systems are reasonably efficient. So are the porters. All our bags reached our room long before we did. The public areas on the ground floor are huge and comfortable. They have been well fitted out with beautifully patterned marble floors etc and lots of comfortable seating. There is an excellent bar which does snacks, and the drinks in this bar seemed to be a good deal cheaper than the drinks up in the Skyline bar. We found the staff in the bar and reception areas on the ground floor, indeed all the staff, to be helpful and pleasant. Navigating around the building is a little tricky to begin with because each wing has its own elevators, but one gets used to it. We had a fairly cheap room in the middle wing, which had no view. The room however was excellent. It was quite large, as was the bathroom which had a separate shower and bath and was fully tiled in thick marble. The bed was large and comfortable and we slept very well indeed. The only slight complaints I have about the room would be that there did not seem to be much in the way of drawer space and the bathroom needed a little maintenance -- the shower hose was leaking, the handle on the bath was loose, and the doorstop was about to break off, etc. A more vigilant maintenance routine seemed to be in order, particularly as the hotel is quite new. One particular irritation was that the hotel made a significant charge for Internet use, a minimum of â‚¬12, and that just for the first hour. I consider charging for Internet in an expensive hotel like this to be completely unacceptable. Internet use should be part of the service. The breakfast was okay. It was served however in a somewhat soulless restaurant on the ground floor but the buffet was reasonable and they brought a half decent cappuccino when asked, which is something of a rarity, even in Italy. The overall effect of breakfast was somewhat marred by the use of rather nasty paper place mats and serviettes and by putting mugs on the table. One might expect that in a Little Chef but it is hardly what one expects in an expensive hotel. The views from the roof terrace are indeed stupendous. The pool must be great fun in the summer months. We had mixed experiences of the Skyline bar (see my separate review), but the views from the terrace of the bar over virtually the whole of Venice and the lagoon are quite extraordinary. We also liked the quiet position of the hotel, which is far removed from the mayhem of San Marco. In order to get to Guidecca from Venice itself one can either take the vaporetto to Palanca, or the free hotel shuttle which goes across to Zattere twice an hour and San Marco once an hour. We spent a very pleasant few hours just wandering around Guidecca itself, finding pretty back streets and canals and then walking back along the waterfront opposite Dorsedouro from the Cipriani which is at the far end of the island. There are a number of pleasant restaurant on the island, including Harryâ€™s Dolci, which is only about 100 yards away, and which is excellent. I'm not sure whether the hotel represents good value for money. It certainly was for us because we got a cheap deal off Air Miles. The simple fact is that almost all decent hotels in Venice are ruinously expensive these days and I doubt the Molino Stucky is far out of line with its peers. Overall we really enjoyed our stay there and will certainly keep our eyes skinned for any more cheap deals out of season.

Reviews.Title: “Have $375 to burn? Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: emandj
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because we wanted a "name brand" hotel and we were willing to pay for it. Still, at 284 Euros it was pretty steep for March (not even "tourist season" yet). First thing that struck me was the building itself, which used to be a factory - they did a LOT of renovating, and did a VERY good job...it looks beautiful. PROs: The service was impeccable (free champagne for a dirty towel left in a bathroom), the breakfast was AWESOME and included, the services were great (conference center, pool on the roof, bars & restaurants in the hotel, etc.) CONs: Expensive (even for Venice, but not especially for a 5-star), the beds were comfortable but the pillows felt cheap (not 5-star quality), some rooms had very good floor plans and views and other didn't. The Hilton kind of "nickel and dimes" you - internet and room service is REALLY expensive.

Reviews.Title: “COMFORTAABLE BUT RUDE STAFF”
Reviews.Author: janineb01
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a little off the beaten path so having to rely on the water taxi was a hassle as we always had to watch our "time" so we could not wait a half an hour at the shuttle stop. Being golf memembers we were told we were upgraded to a superior room only to find out it was a handicap room without a shower door. The internet charges were exhorbitant. One cuppacino 6 euros. We found the reception staff to be very rude, The executive lounge was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and predictable”
Reviews.Author: dlisbona
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located away from the center of historic Venice which is good for having a quiet spot away from the bustle and noise of Venice but means more time to get to center and dependence on the hotel's shuttle boat. The hotel is in a huge reconverted industrial building and is quite a rabbit warren. The front desk staff were polite but impersonal. We had a lot of trouble getting our room key to work and they were between indifferent and unsympathetic which is not what i would expect from a five star hotel. The furniture in our suite was elegant but characterless. The food in the so-called gourmet restaurant Aromi was good but far from outstanding or memorable. Our expectations of the hotel were higher - we were rather disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ssheppard0403
Reviews.Content: Its a great hotel. Quite opulent, but that's to be expected. Good restaurant, beautiful rooms, great experience. The only challenge is getting there from the train station. It a fairly expensive water taxing ride to to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best View of Venice”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeB3
Reviews.Content: The rooftop pool overlooking the city is spectacular. The cruise ships float by at eye level for great photo ops. The breakfast buffet that comes with the room is the best I've ever had. The rooms are luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel...Rooms are huge and gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: PeaceInTraveling
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I had 2 nights in Venice. Rained the whole day that we were there...I mean monsooned so not too fun. This hotel was our saving grace as the hotel is beautiful and spacious. First off, the rooms are huge (we got upgraded to an executive room as we are Hilton Gold members) and are decorated beautifully. The furniture is all dark wood and the hotel looks very newly renovated. The breakfast spread (both hot and cold food) was SO good. The executive lounge is in the bar area downstairs (so was not separated like other Hiltons) and was kinda cool because we could get food and drinks in a fun atmosphere vs being in a confined "Executive Lounge" kind of room. There is a spa and fitness center there that is really nice...can't comment on the services as I did not get a spa treatment but definitely a nice spa area. Only drawback of this hotel is that it is not located on the main island....is on Giudecca Island so you have to take a Hilton boat back and forth to Venice. Overall, the boat ride is not bad and only takes about 5 minutes. Problem comes in if you forget something or want to go back and forth to your hotel...that is a hassle because you have to watch the ferry schedule. Other than that...this hotel is great and I would stay here again. Oh...There are not any restaurants on Giudecca...you will do nothing on this island except the Hilton....all of the fun and restaurants are on the island of Venice. Sounds not so great, but is really not that bad. The hotel totally makes up for the boating back and forth. It is really nice. 5 STAR.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome - Just Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: aerodude87
Reviews.Content: Arriving in Venice after a Delta flight from Hell, the hotel was a much needed breath of fresh air. The airline had lost our luggage, and the hotel staff helped us with shopping for a new wardrobe. We were upgraded to a huge suite with beautiful views of Venice. The staff worked very hard at making our stay a pleasant one (comp wine, food, Vaporetto fares). I just can't say enough. Regarding the issues with the private shuttle schedule, we would just use the Vaporetto when the shuttle wasn't available. Only had to walk a few blocks to the launch. All in all, just a wonderful place.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: MSoca
Reviews.Content: We stay here for only one night since we were taking a Mediterranean Cruise. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms are spacious and very clean. The shuttle service to St Mark's Square is very conveniente. We got a magnificent room with canal views, very romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Am on my way back and can't wait! Aesthetic and warm in every way.”
Reviews.Author: mbj2
Reviews.Content: Using Hilton Honors points, I stayed here for two nights in April 2009. Now I'll be using he last of my points to return this April. Notwithstanding the difficulties mentioned by others with the timing of the shuttle to the hotel, this was by far the best hotel experience I've ever had. First, the staff greeting was warmly welcoming--not at all officious or snooty as in some other Hiltons (Milan, for example). I was given an upgrade; I understand that now there is a charge for the upgrade, even for "gold" members, but i'll be satisfied with an interior room. The bathrooms are a work of art even in the standard rooms (I peeked); the beds are clouds and the decor is bright despite the dark wood, which itself is warm and elegant. The hotel has an "arrangement" with a Murano glass factory. A private taxi takes you over and back for free, but you can see only that one factory. The desk clerk warned me that I could get the same glass at shops near St. Mark's Square for less, but I took the bait at the factory and bought there. I'm not unhappy that I did, because I was buying a "total experience," not just glass. However, next time I'll take the taxi over, walk around to other factories, and then take the vaporetto back (again, as suggested by the staff). In the evenings I strolled about the island on which this historic hotel property is situated, and that gave me a pleasant break from the intense tourism accross the canal. The public spaces of the hotel were both elegant and cozy--quite a decorating feat--with much of the original bakery/factory structure preserved and polished up, and many little "nooks" where one can rest quietly. I could stay at other Hiltons for two nights instead of one that this one will cost, but the Molino Stucky experience is, for me, well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: becannon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 night in May 2009 prior to boarding a Mediterranean cruise. We both thoroughly enjoyed this hotel for a few reasons (1) the breakfast was very good with both hot and cold choices as well as sparkling wine, (2) our room overlooked the Guidecca Canal which was beautiful and highly recommended location, (3) transportation to/from Saint Mark's was free, and (4) the room was large by European standards with a huge bathroom (even by US hotel standards). The hotel itself is either relatively recently remodeled or new so everything was in pristine condition. The mattress in the room was very comfortable and the staff at the hotel was quite accommodating. The real downside to this hotel (as has been mentioned previously) is its location to the main sightseeing areas in the city and the long periods of break for the shuttle. In the middle of the day and again in the evening the shuttle takes a long break (maybe 1.5 hours). Once you are aware of this and can plan, it is not a problem but if it catches you off guard then you could be prepared a long wait. However, I would recommend this hotel, particularly if you have Hilton Honors points to use. In fact, I plan to stay there again when we return to Venice in September 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed after 8 nights in Italy!”
Reviews.Author: twilson22
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a wonderful way to end our trip in Italy. We had stayed at various apartments rented through vrbo.com which we were pleasantly surprised with. But after packing up, touring, and training through Italy, this plush hotel was just what we needed to get our energy restored and enjoy Venice. This hotel is located across the canal, but they do have a complimentary water taxi that will take you across to see the sites. The view from the hotel room of the canal was a site in itself. You can always count on Hilton to keep their hotels consistent evern Internationally!

Reviews.Title: “The best room points can buy!"”
Reviews.Author: HollySFO
Reviews.Content: Using Hilton Points we stayed for a week - the best in the Hilton chain, in my opinion - everything was perfect! Easy access via vaporetti, fantastic breakfast, quiet, beautiful rooms (airtight, which is important after sunset in Venice--mosquitos). The view from the pool is perhaps the most amazing in the world - nothing like swimming while you are overlooking one of the most beautiful cities in the world. Save your points, PW's - it's worth every one!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Hotel Molino Stucky”
Reviews.Author: Aloush
Reviews.Content: It is a very good hotel with excellent services and with a view of the Adriatic sea

Reviews.Title: “Peace in Chaos”
Reviews.Author: tripstyler
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Hilton Molino Stucky this fall. All in all, we have very fond memories of the hotel and would stay there again if we return. See more details and tips below. Location - Even though the location is not on Venice's main island, it is only a 12 min boat ride to St Mark's Square. With frequent hotel boat shuttles, staying a little away from the action was both relaxing and provided a truer view of Venice's daily hustle and bustle. Alternatively you can take the water 'bus' to and from the hotel. The bus stop is located approx 5 mins away from the hotel. * Water taxi rides can set you back approx 50 - 100 euros, don't bother. Service - The service is decent, but not fabulous. If you are from North America, you may be taken aback by some of the ways hotel staff handle questions and requests, but just remind yourself not to be offended--it's cultural. One plus was we got to the hotel around 11am, having just came in via night train from Paris; within 20 mins of our arrival, they placed us in a lovely room. Rooms - We booked the hotel via Hotwire, so I wasn't sure what kind of room we'd get. I was pleasantly surprised. Our room was spacious (especially for European standards), brights and well appointed. The bed was very comfortable. Pool - This is the hotel's "piece de resistance." The modern roof-top pool provides a stunning view of venice, including st mark's square, etc... Depending on the time of year and fog cover, the roof-top pool is bright, relaxing and peaceful. There is an adjacent bar that uses the pool's deck at night. Restaurants - Although many of the restaurants looked nice, we didn't ever eat at the hotel--we were too busy exploring the sites and always seemed to eat on the go. I wish we'd had a drink at the bar at the top of the hotel. Tips - - Venice is overpriced, so if you want well-priced snacks, there is a little grocery store 10 mins away from the hotel. Go out the front doors and walk to the right. ask the concierge for directions because there is not a big sign to distinguish it. - Visit harry's bar (inventor of the bellini) for an overpriced, but incredible bellini. - The food in venice is less flavourful than elsewhere in italy. if you've been to other italian cities prior to arriving in venice, keep this in mind, so you're not too disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking Views.... Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: lotsofdreams
Reviews.Content: This hotel requires a shuttle ride to Guidecca Island, Make sure to keep a schedule with you at all times and plan your trips around the shuttle boat, there is no way to get to the hotel without hiring a private boat. However, the shuttles do run on time and provide a comfortable ride during transport. The hotel itself was beautiful and amazing and we enjoyed the restaurant as well. I traveled with my 14yr. old daughter and she enjoyed the experience over all the hotels we visited during our trip to Italy. The Skyline Rooftop bar provides a magical and breathtaking view of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Not upto the quality standards expected in a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: EUTravellerZurich
Reviews.Content: No executive lounges, full travel advice to the hotel not given i.e. hotel shuttle was ignored when requested for best way.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but very inconvienent location.”
Reviews.Author: DallasChris
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our honeymoon and thought the hotel itself was beautiful and amazing. My wife's luggage was stuck in Vienna and the hotel staff had it delivered to our room the day after we arrived. Service was ok, nothing spectacular. Our biggest complaint was that the hotel was on the Guidecca Island and we had to constantly wait on the shuttle boat. Make sure to keep a schedule with you at all times and plan your trips around the shuttle boat, there is no way to get to the hotel without hiring a private boat. We were stuck in St. Mark's Square for nearly 1 1/2 hours waiting while the boat took a break, very cold in November I might add... Overall, I would recommend the hotel based on the hotel itself it is beautiful and world class, as expected, but I would not recommend it if you want to enjoy Venice on your own time, instead of on the shuttle boat's schedule. I would find a place in Venice proper over this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “romantic and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: KateTosh
Reviews.Content: wonderful hotel, great restorant, great location! very romantic and good spa!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the local feel.”
Reviews.Author: NagsHeadNcUsaJake
Reviews.Content: Took all our children and spouses on a trip of Italy. All had rooms on the executive floor. Executive lounge was very nice. Hotel could have taken better advantage of the views that could have been offered there. Bar and views on top floor breath taking. Enjoyed being on Guidecca Island away from San Marco Square. Had the chance to see how real people lived in Venice. Not so touristy. Try to get a room overlooking the Guidecca Canal. Free shuttle to the heart of Venice, prompt and enjoyable. Would go back tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with unbelievable views”
Reviews.Author: figkatz
Reviews.Content: The main thing that was incredible about the hotel were the views from the rooftop and front of hotel. You could see all of Venice and surrounding islands. I really think the view would be better than most hotels in Venice since there you wouldn't see everything all in one panorama. Everything else about the hotel was great--great service, rooms, and cleanliness. Pretty much what you would expect of a nice hotel in the U.S. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants since they were pretty expensive. If you're looking for cheaper food on the island, stay away from Osteria Ae Botti--it was some of the worst food I've ever had. I would go over to the main island for dinner. We did, however, find a little pastry shop down about 1-2 "blocks" from the hotel that was good (can't remember the name). The only negative thing about the hotel is the inconvenience of the shuttle service. It was timely and we had no problems getting on it, but it doesn't run continuously so we waited almost an hour our first night there so we could check in with our luggage. However, I think that this is worth the trouble if it allows you to stay in Venice at all since the main island can be pretty expensive. We found the Hilton deal through Priceline and saved a lot of money. Overall, we would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Guidecca Escape”
Reviews.Author: pinky45
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two teenagers stayed at the Molino Stucky on Guidecca for Christmas 2009. The hotel is large and extremely comfortable, recently converted from a wheat factory. We stayed on Hilton points, but I would recommend it very highly at full price as well. The hotel is extremely clean and has a simple elegance. Service was excellent. The rooms and bathrooms were great, as were the beds and bedding. We had free breakfast, which was an extensive and delicious buffet, and we had access to the Executive Lounge, which is right next to the Lobby Lounge and Bar. Some have complained about the location of the Lounge, but we found it very comfortable and convenient, with very generous offerings for a hotel lounge (free food and drink from 11:00 to 11:00). The hotel is a distance from San Marco, and you cannot walk to the major sites (although it is lovely to walk around Guidecca), but we didn't mind at all, because the shuttle reminded us that Venice is an island, and we found it to be a very nice commute. The free hotel shuttle ran perfectly while we were there. We found it extremely convenient, and you can't beat the price (it's free as opposed to the 6.50 euro you pay for the public water shuttles). We also appreciated the view of Venice and the snow-capped alps from our bedroom window every morning. Contrary to an earlier review, there was a huge public area full of sofas, chairs, tables and artwork -- it is around the corner from the main lobby, on the way to the Aromi restaurant. Perhaps it was added recently. There is no free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: walkermr
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel with a great view of Venice from the rooftop bar. The complimentary shuttle to the main island is perfect and staying away from the crush of tourist Venice was especially nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for perfect stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Lightyearz_B
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect hotel for a romantic trip to Venice. I'm not quite sure what some of the other reviews are on about - YES it is a short boat trip to the mainland but that just adds to the charm and uniqueness of the place. We found boats were always on time and were very easy to use. Rooms were very spacious, beds super comfortable and showers were amazing!!! Best of all however, was the fact you can book to use the spa area on first floor absoutely FREE. they had a jacuzzi, turkish bath, relaxation area and saunas. We used it everyday to soothe our tired legs and feet after hours of wandering around Venice. If i went back I wouldn't stay anywhere else - the hotel was just perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not really a five-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust500
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel through Priceline. I was offered a Five Star for a reasonable price and I accepted. The hotel was nice enough, but not five-star nice. The rooms had a musty smell & flat pillows. In addition, they did not offer free internet service - wireless or otherwise. The shuttle stops on Venice to get to the hotel are not identified and we had to call the hotel to find out where we catch the hotel shuttle. Once that was figured out we got used to taking the shuttle back & forth to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with a Great Spa”
Reviews.Author: StephanieRose
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Molino for 3 nights during our 14 night honeymoon in Italy. We loved this hotel. The staff was very friendly and met 5 star expectations. The accomodations were comfortable and our bathroom always clean. We would highly recommend heading down to the spa for relaxing in the sauna and Turkish bath-free. As for getting to the sights, we found the free water shuttle to be easy to manage. Less than a 5 minute boat ride to St. Marks Square. We used points to stay at this hotel but would absolutely stay again. Although it's not in the heart of Venice, we enjoyed slipping away to more quiet. Good: beautiful hotel with wonderful accomodations, free water shuttle, spa, VIEWS, decktop bar and pool Bad: breakfast really pricey, hotel can be confusing to navigate Safe travels!

Reviews.Title: “Best Holiday/ Birthday ever”
Reviews.Author: solo40Nigeria
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel, got upgraded to the presidential Suite. best 4oth birthday present . i will surely be back

Reviews.Title: “Very deserving of the five star rating.”
Reviews.Author: SandMike
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful and elegant hotel property. As a Hilton Honors member, we were upgraded to an Executive room which was spacious and elegantly appointed. The King bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was oversized and totally tile and marble with granite vanity tops. There was a large double door closet and a separate dressing area. A sitting area outside the bath room provided extra space for storing our luggage leaving our sleeping area uncluttered and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful from the moment we checked in. In addition to our room upgrade, we were given daily breakfast for two and use of the Executive Lounge, both at no charge. The Breakfast was an exquisite buffet of everything imaginable. Breakfast would have been considered pricey if we had to pay, but not pricey for a Five Star Hotel in Venice. The Executive Lounge was an additional treat. Cheese and fruit snacks alternating with desserts were both accompanied with a selection of wines. The location will please some but not all. It is quiet and secluded from the main attraction area of Venice. The hotel provides FREE shuttle boat service to and from the main attraction area. We found this to be a very manageable way of getting around. The rooftop bar and pool area offer stuning views of Venice. Even the Executive Lounge (which is off the first floor lobby) has many windows overlooking the Lido of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Venice”
Reviews.Author: merseytripper
Reviews.Content: Hotel is on Giudecca Island and can only be reached by the hotel's own shuttle or by waterbus (stop 5 mins walk away) from Venice Island. From Marco Polo airport, you can get the Alilaguna waterbus (15euros) but there is only one an hour that stops at the hotel. The journey takes over an hour. However, you can get one of the other Ailiaguna boats to St Marks Square and pick up the hotel shuttle. I suggest you contact the hotel for directions to the shuttle stop as it is not well sign posted. The hotel is very nice but expensive. I paid with Hilton Honour points luckily but would not have paid the regular rate. The hotel is comfortable and clean, but breakfast is extra. If you can get a hotel cheaper near the centre, I would recommend that option as hotel shuttle is only hourly on a night and restricts enjoyment of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but far away from the action”
Reviews.Author: Perfect_Travel
Reviews.Content: The good: Looked like one of the nicest hotels in Venice Wonderful spa area and relaxation room Very friendly staff The bad: Had to take a (free) hotel water taxi to the main area of Venice for the restaurants, shopping and action

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in a Wonderful City - Made the Visit Special”
Reviews.Author: WhiteCollarNomad44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were joined by the sister-in-law and her 9 year old daughter, and the four of us had a great stay in this hotel. It has a private water shuttle to take you to the main part of Venice (it is off on another island) which makes it rather special. The hotel is very new and very well kept up. The stay was generally friendly, and the rooms were American style (which, after several nights in bed-and-breakfasts and smaller hotels in central Italy, was a VERY welcome experience). The executive lounge was incredible, since you could sit watching the boats go by, sip on your glass of wine, eat some local cheese, and soak up the ambiance. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Retreat to Giudecca”
Reviews.Author: SunDapple
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stucky in July prior to our cruise. We were expecting crowds, and heat, and we got 'em. Our transfers from the airport to the hotel were flawless. I would suggest calling or e-mailing the hotel to arrange for a transfer ahead of arrival. There was a bit of a wait for check-in but the lobby and adjacent bar area are very comfortable. We were very pleased that our room had a king size bed, a little treat I was not expecting. The bathroom was quite roomy, the beds were comfortable, and there was adequate storage room for our clothes. A word of caution, don't pull the string that hangs in the shower/tub. It's a call system for "assistance" should you fall or need help otherwise. Some might complain that this hotel is inconvenient to Venice proper, but we found that the shuttle worked very nicely, and only once were we not able to board the shuttle when we wished to. Be aware that the shuttle only holds 40 people, so if it's a busy evening time for dinner across the canal you may have to wait for the next shuttle. This happened to us, but we took advantage of the situation and walked down the main street of Giudecca Island, on which the hotel is located, and found the lovely Moka Efti Osteria, where we had a canal-side table with a view of the lights of Venice as they twinkled to life. The seafood and wine there were quite good. We were booked into this hotel with breakfast included in our rate. The buffet selection of food available was broad, but my cooked to order omelet was a disappointment, albeit a minor one. There was plenty to eat. We would definitely stay here again, as we liked being able to adventure into Venice proper for the sights and intriguing little side streets and then escape the crowds to our "retreat" on Giudecca, the Hilton Molino Stucky.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your ear plugs and don't pack much.”
Reviews.Author: anchorAlaska
Reviews.Content: We were so looking forward to our stay at the Hilton in Venice. We booked it on Priceline months ahead. When we arrived we found the desk employees stuffy and not helpful. The rooms were small and had a door adjoining the room next door. We couldn't sleep, for we could hear everything, and I mean everything. The rooms were small and hard to move in. The front desk wouldn't do anything about our problem. Only stay here as a last resort.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service, Too Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Babe66London
Reviews.Content: For 350 EUros per night you would have thought they could include breakfast, but no this was 40 Euro extra. The pool was closed despite beautiful sunshine and the staff were plain rude. I would never stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - not what I would expect in a 5* hotel.”
Reviews.Author: malvern09
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing. We normally find special deals at 4* hotels in Venice, but decided to push the boat out this year with a 5* (10th wedding anniversary). The building is very impressive (an old red-brick flour mill), but once you get inside, it's a run-of-the-mill (pardon the expression) big American conference hotel. The disappointment started just after we arrived - we went to the ground floor coffee bar/cafe for a quick snack. Tried to sit down at one of the tables by the windows, with a view of the Giudecca canal, only to be told only Hilton Club members could sit there - don't expect to be treated like a second-class citizen in a 5* hotel. Price was ridiculous - 25 Euros for a very mediocre toasted ham & cheese sandwich, tomato juice, and small bottle of beer (8 Euros for a small bottle of the local beer!). And the money-grabbing continued - anything other than a news channel or the Italian dreck on TV was 14 Euros. Use of the internet (which many places allow free these days) over 20 Euros/hour. I know hotels are there to make money for their owners, but I've never been as concious of it as in this hotel. Breakfast was OK - big (except for things not being replaced when they ran out) but not outstanding quality. And a constant battle to get more coffee - you expect waiters in a 5* establishment to know you want more before you do, not to have to battle to get their attention. Room was OK, but nothing special. I haven't experienced many 5* hotels (not a millionaire!), but those that I have were a very different experience to this, with all sorts of little extras and a level of discreet service this place can only dream about. We've stayed in 4* places in Venice (Residenza Canareggio, Ai Mori di Oriente, Liassidi Palace) that were as good, or better, at less than half the price.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DianeZZZ
Reviews.Content: Late review. One of my closest friends and I stayed at the Hilton Molino Stucky last fall for four nights. We arrived after dark following a long journey. We absolutely loved the hotel. The staff, especially in the executive lounge were both helpful and friendly. We loved the location and enjoyed the quietness of Giudecca.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and pretty view, but kinda inconvenient and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: TheBelafonte
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for free using hilton points, but after ordering room service and having a drink and small meal at the bar (as all the restaurants near the hotel were closed, seasonal? or perhaps just our timing), left with a $200 tab. Partly our fault, but for the price, food was so small portions and beers were warm. We stayed here for one night before leaving for a greek cruise. Had put so much energy into planning the honeymoon, went with an easy Hilton choice for the night before the cruise. No shuttle to the airport, and across the water from the cruise port. Took a water taxi from the airport (100 euro, there is a water bus for much cheaper, just takes 1.5 hours or so, while the water taxi took us 25 minutes), but they do have a shuttle to St. Mark's square which was great, and it's free and right outside the hotel every 15-30 minutes, very nice. The hotel just isn't near anything signaficant. Took a water taxi the following day for the cruise ship, split it with another couple going the same place, which was great, as it's 60 euros to go 5 minutes on the water to the cruise ship! There is a water bus, but it makes a bunch of stops and with all your luggage, it just gets to be a pain. Hotel is beautiful and has a wonderful view, and although the rooftop pool was closed for the season, I'm sure it's really great. Rooms are great, and just as you'd expect for a Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mark1123
Reviews.Content: Wow, where to begin. We arrived on July the 3rd, it was PACKED little did we know it was Redentore a holiday only celebrated in Venice. The Tronchetto was packed and they were telling people the lot was full, we where told we would have to park at the next town and take the train into Venice and take a water taxi to the hotel. After we got off the train we found ourself on the ACTV (public boat transit) after a long ride we finally got to the hotel and after a good 20 minutes of waiting in the "Hilton Elite" line we where told are room was not ready. We went out and found it to be packed, restaurants where only serving pre fixe menues for exorbitant prices including the hotel (â‚¬300) we ened up spending way to much money at the little bar in the loby for a sandwich (â‚¬20) and pasta (â‚¬24).
