Subpar is all i have to say. After finally getting into the room i was disappointed for the amount on money we spent. We had a horrible view of a rooftop and a TV that failed to work. The Hotel pool was out of service for the time we went to visit and was failed to be notified by the booking site. The one good thing was the private seating for the fireworks, a price that was not worth it in the long run. The nice thing was the free shuttle boat that was not always on time :( ... It was a nice looking hotel, with marble floors and stuff but i found that to be useless to my stay :/ ... The hotels WIFI was not free, i mean it is Venice but i found it be overpriced and slow. Possibly it was the day we arrived that caused all of this mess.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful retreat on Guidecca, Minutes from St. Marks' Square”
Reviews.Author: Valerie066
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at this hotel in Venice. We went on a Mediterranean cruise ,and stayed here following the cruise for 2 nights. Guidecca is the quiet island just across the lagoon from the heart of Venice. We shared a water taxi with friends from the ship,and later,a water taxi from the hotel to the airport. The hotel is a converted mill and very large, but beautiful. The rooms were well appointed with great marble bathrooms, luxury bedding, and all the comforts. The hotel has a shuttle boat that goes to a few stops in Venice, including St. Mark's, but it only goes every hour, so we mainly used the vaporetto stop, "Palanka", coming and going, which was a a short walk from the hotel. Very quiet on Guidecca and few restaurants. Unfortunately, the restaurant at the hotel was totally overpriced so we never used it. The breakfast buffet would have run about $70 US. We picked up some rolls in Venice and had them in the morning with the coffee in the room. The hotel has a beautiful roof garden with lounge chairs and an infinity pool. The views from there are fabulous. We totally enjoyed our stay at the Molino Stucky, and if we could find a good rate, would love to stay there again. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Out o the ordinary”
Reviews.Author: mathildexl
Reviews.Content: The location is off the main tourist trails and the impressive architecture makes it special. We had standard room # 123 and it was good enough for the price we paid (priceline-rate). The Rialto Bar is ok for a drink after a hard days sightseeing. The complementary shuttle service to St Marks square is convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ginola95
Reviews.Content: this is one of the fantastic hotel I used during my life. The service was perfect and fast. room very large and rich. the staff was so helpfull and nice. Hotel has a boat for transportation to the important stops in venice that make the live easy. The price value is reasonable for such hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay at Hilton Molino Stucky”
Reviews.Author: petravelinfo
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Hilton Molino Stucky. It's a very large hotel, so, if that bothers you, this may not be the place for you. However, the lobby is beautiful and spacious. The room was fairly small but, more than adequare with a marble bathroom. We had a lovely view of Venice from our room. It's actually a very convenient place to stay. You do have to carry your luggage over 2 small bridges, but, you would have to do this at many of the hotels in the center of Venice. We used both the Hilton Shuttle and the Vaportti and found them both convenient. Can't stress enough...don't take too much luggage...you will likely be carrying it onto a boat or over a bridge unless you take a private taxi and your hotel is right on the canal. If you decide to stay here, just e-mail the hotel and ask for directions. We followed them and had no trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet, comfy beds, free "shuttle", great employees!”
Reviews.Author: cmssmith00
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Molino Stucky with a huge group and I couldn't be happier with the way we were all handled! The beds were super comfortable, the employees were courteous and always happy to help and the shuttle to the main island was so convenient! After walking around the main areas of Venice (and then staying in other cities) I couldn't have been happier with the location and environment of the Hilton. Being on the island of Guidecca it was extremely quiet which was amazing after a long day! I would highly recommend the Hilton Molino Stucky to anyone visiting Venice! OH, and the Skyline Bar on the roof is an amazing perk! Great bartenders and view!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: katedog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at two hotels during our stay in Venice, and this one by far had a better room - especially the bathroom. It was roomy and comfortable, although the bathroom did have some mold. One of the hotel's best quality is the free shuttle to and from St. Mark's square. The staff was horrible and not helpful at all. We tried to get assistance on how to get to the cruise port and we got 3 different answers from 3 different people. The power went out in our room, but we were leaving so we didn't really care. Overall, I would stay there again but wouldn't expect great service.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location and accommodation, but service let it down badly”
Reviews.Author: BerkshireNell
Reviews.Content: The hotel and location are lovely, and the Alialaguna water transport from the airport drops you off right outside (excellent value at 25 euros return trip each). The room was extremely comfortable, with all amenities. Our major drawback was the breakfast, at 40 euros each you somehow expect the best both in terms of food and service. However, we were left to find our own table, and many tables were just piled high with dirty dishes. The food was in another room across the hall, and although there was an hour left of service, many dishes were empty, (although to be fair, when my husband went for food 15 minutes later, a few had been restocked) However, coffee pots were empty and trying to find someone to refill them pretty hard. Surprisingly poor service all round - however we have nothing to compare it with in Venice. I would revisit Venice, as lots left to see, but would probably stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Best use of Hilton Honors points ever”
Reviews.Author: fishingcarlos
Reviews.Content: Venice was the last stop on our Italy trip and while we had enjoyed the smaller, quaint hotels we stayed at elsewhere, we were looking forward to a grander stay. This is a huge hotel, several different buildings actually strung together. I don't think we even saw it all. The lobby seems overwhelmed at check-in and there was a wait, though not protracted. I used Hilton Honors points for the stay and we were given a beautiful courtyard view - no canal view rooms were available and I suspect those aren't often handed out for points stays. The room was very nicely appointed and the bathroom was large and comfortable--nice tub and American size shower. We had nice gifts of chocolates and Bellinis waiting in the room as well. We enjoyed the managers reception each night after a long day of sightseeing. Did not use the pool but did visit the beautiful rooftop bar and had a pricy cocktail while watching the sun set. The breakfast buffet was complimentary for us each morning and massive in selection--very enjoyable. We ate dinner one night at the hotel, but really enjoyed a couple of the local canal front restaurants on Giudecca. This was a lovely stay--would definitely save up those points to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: sdibrango
Reviews.Content: We just returned on Oct 15 from our second trip to Venice and our first stay at the Hilton Molino Stucky. It was a true pleasure, the Hotel is located across the canal and provides a shuttle to and from San Marco which was very convenient. We had read previous reviews concerning being able to hear voices from ajoining rooms but did not find this to be a problem at all. I would suggest that you include the Breakfast buffet when booking as the choices were great and more affordable than purchasing seperately. I would also recommend the Executive lounge as this was a great place to unwind with a cocktail and refreshments. The rooms were a nice size for Europe and very clean. We found the service to be great and the staff was always able to help us with booking train reservations etc. Be prepared if you arrive early that you will have to wait until check in time for your room, the hotel was fully booked when we arrived and we had to wait several hours for our room. Totally would recommend this hotel. Go to SkyBar for the view, hard to get service for a drink but the view is well woth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wow Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Slm55
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on Guidecca which is an island from Venice proper. Its a perfect place to stay, more high end though. If you don't want to stay there they have a great bar on the top floor that overlooks Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Way overpriced, not what you expect!”
Reviews.Author: batraveler1
Reviews.Content: My family went to Italy this summer and the final part of our trip included Venice at the famous Hilton Molino Stucky. I want to make this review short and helpful so I'll go to the point. If you have enough money to pay for this hotel, then seriously consider finding a different one. The transportation arrangements from the hotel are not the best: it sits on an island and you have to make sure that you get to Venice when the hotel is running their boat shuttle to take you across, otherwise, you will walk with your suitcases all over town trying to catch a water taxi that will take you there (not fun). The service stuff at the hotel is not friendly (as everything and everyone in Venice), meals are overpriced (49 Euros for a continental breakfast !!!). Will not recommend the hotel to anyone i know. If you can afford a 5 star hotel go for the real thing, this is not 5 star service.

Reviews.Title: “A modern hotel in the middle of town full of history”
Reviews.Author: LondonTraveller_t6
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, rooms were clean and new, easy shuttle transfer to San Marco square. Would definetely return back to Venice and this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a Priceline purchase”
Reviews.Author: IBCruznSoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 3 nights post cruise. We were fortunate to have our bid accepted on Priceline and for 3 nights, we paid slightly more than one night priced on the hotel's website. That was a great deal! Pro's - Hotel is large, has a few restaurants. During some periods of rain, front desk had umbrella's available. Hotel offers boat service to Venice, but watch the scheduled times. (Sometimes it was easier to get back to the hotel by taking the #2 boat service which dropped you off a little ways down the sidewalk from the hotel). Con's - There is no complimentary interneet service via a business center, you must pay by the minute. On our last day, there was a private event scheduled at the pool, and the entire pool was closed to any other guests. In addition, a few hours later, the entire lounge up by the pool was also closed for a private function. The hotel appears to do a lot of convention business, and I believe this is why some of the amenities seem to be booked for private events. Had I paid full price for a room, I would not have been very pleased. We did call the front desk after finding out that the pool was closed, and we only received an 'I'm sorry it's closed'. There is only 1 pool at this facility, so there really was no other place to go outside and enjoy the nice weather. I think this hotel is a good value if you can get it for a discounted price. I think the rates listed on their website are overpriced for what you receive.

Reviews.Title: “Motel Architecture, views, cleaniness and staff was outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: COreejr
Reviews.Content: The Motel Architecture is truly outstanding. The views from the roofto swimming pool is georgeous, 360 panaramic. The motel is located on a waterway thorofare and is accessed by courtesy boat every thirty minutes which we found convinient. The motel was very clean with premium interior materials. We were not there on business but view the meeting spaces which are enormous and attractive. We also enjoyed the very elaborate buffet full breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great access to Venice - Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mirth60
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Molino Stucky on Hilton points. The staff is trained in amazing service! We took advantage of the Executive Lounge in the evening and the fabulous breakfast each morning. It's easy to take the complimentary water shuttle into Venice - running every 30-60 minutes. The view of the city from the roof-top bar is amazing! We spent a wonderful evening relaxing and having drinks there. The only difficulty we had was a young waiter who kept asking to be paid in cash (without presenting a bill). We insisted on charging to our room and asked for a written receipt. He did oblige when we insisted. If you can get a good rate on the rooms - it is worth it to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderul hotel away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: Litetraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights pre cruise and were not disappointed. Our executive room which overlooked the Guidecca Canal towards San Marco was large with very high ceilings that added to the space. It was very well appointed and comfortable. We only ate breakfast and this was of the usual Hilton high standard with the added bonus of the availability of Prosecco which was lovely to toast each other the morning of our wedding anniversary. It was also very nice to have the option of eating breakfast outside in the gardens and we noticed that many of the restaurants in the hotel had an outside option. The service we experienced overall was very good however on our last night after waiting for over 20 minutes in the nearly empty rooftop bar for a drink we gave up! This however did not distract from our overall very positive experience. If you do not mind large hotels and want some space away from San Marco with outstanding views, and enjoy boat trips this is the place for you. If we ever return to Venice it will certainly be the Molin Stucky for us.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, a bit away from everything.”
Reviews.Author: djbake6798
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Molino Stucky is an absolutely stunning hotel visually. Our room, though on the small side, was probably the nicest looking room I've stayed in, and had a comfortable bed. The view from our room was marred by a collapsed building next door but it looked to be in the process of being cleaned up. The location could be looked at both as either a positive or a negative. Its on Giudecca Island across the lagoon from Venice proper. There is not a lot to see or do on the island, but the views across the lagoon are nice. Its very quiet and can be seen as a refuge from the bustle of Venice. We were in Venice during Carnival so this was a positive for us. The hotel provides a free shuttle that runs every half hour so getting out to the action and sights wasn't a problem, but it also stops running late at night at which point you must rely upon public transport or water taxi. Overall excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: angelofmercy
Reviews.Content: Pros: Nice room, great view from room and roof, great bathroom, bottle of Bellini in the room, free shuttle. Cons; Shuttle takes breaks, you need a schedule, the public vaporetto stops at Palanca and is a five minute walk, you need this or transportation can be sketchy, assigned us to a room that had not been cleaned and when we told them, they did not understand at first, when the bellboy brought our luggage, he called for us and they moved us right away, This man was one of the nicest employees, we almost got left in Zattare one night because the shuttle stops at around 12, be careful. I would stay here if I ever went to Venice, but I won't because after Rome and Venice I won't ever go back. I feel traumatized by the attitudes of the Italians. They were always cheating us. I never appreciated the us so much. Riding around on those vaporettos you smell fumes, it made me feel sick. At one restaurant, my daughter told the waitress she did not like her dish, I tried it and it was bad. The waitress said,"So, don't eat it" When we got the bill they charged for the dish and they added a cover charge and a gratuity which they all add a gratuity up front, so they don't have to give you good service. The first night we got there late at night, we waited for shuttle for over an hour, remember those breaks. We were the first ones there. Then, a few minutes before the shuttle shows up about 40 people show up, all dressed up, they were the tango dancers. When, I started to enter the ramp, two women, in stillettos charged forward, almost knocking me down with my suitcase. It is the survival of the fittest. On another occassion, we were the first waiting outside the hotel for the shuttle and the crowd of people pushed us aside and we had to wait for next boat. Europe can keep all your rude people. They were rude in Paris, worse is Greece and horrendous in Rome and Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Worth recommending if you get a bargain”
Reviews.Author: Blue_Ocean33
Reviews.Content: Hallo everybody, I just thought I could share my experience with Molino Stucky. Well, Itâ€™s not that I have been at many five-star hotels, but naturally my expectations were very high, especially because I decided to spend half my salary on a weekend outing. When my girlfriend and I arrived at St Lucia railway station, we thought it would be best to take a water tram to St Markâ€™s, from where the hotel shuttle boat leaves, which wasâ€¦ a bad idea. Itâ€™s very difficult to find the location of the boat service around there. Perhaps itâ€™s wise to follow the directions on the hotel website, or email the hotel for precise directions, and have the hotel phone number ready. When we reached the landing in front of the hotel, a hotel boy rushed forward and grabbed the bags. Tired as we were, that was when we first felt we were given a special treatment, not the last time though ï�Š The hotel room (executive) turned out to be quite nice, and very nice and spacious for European standards â€“ American travelers, be aware Europe tourist spots do not offer rooms as spacious as their American equivalents might doâ€¦ The room was yet spacious enough (about 30 sqm, I guess), appearing slightly smaller perhaps owing to the high ceilingâ€¦ The room had a very comfortable bed, and all the extras you might expect from a hotel of this class: hairdryer, bathrobes, nice La Source cosmetics. When checking in, ask for a room with a canal view, thereâ€™s no extra charge, you might just be lucky and get a wonderful view of the canal. Because the hotel is very large, it may not be always possible to get canal view. With executive rooms, there is such an option, at least. Much seems to depend on your personal charm at check-in. Always worth tryingâ€¦ At check-in I was surprised to learn the room included breakfast, which was wonderful (eggs, sausages, mushrooms, cheeses, fitness-style, whatever you need, freshly squeezed orange juice), and also, unique to executive rooms, access to the executive lounge, which was open from the moment the breakfast room closed to eleven at night. In the executive room, you had complimentary snacks (wonderful pastries, nuts, olives) plus some wines (excellent cabernet), sparkling wine, beer, juice, mineral water. A nice touch to the hotel where drinks and food are overpriced, in my opinion (for example a Hilton burger costs 28 euros there). The first place we went to was the rooftop bar - wonderful, with excellent views, but bear in mind the pool is rather small for any serious swimming and the whole place is exposed to direct sunlight with no shade at all). All of you reserving a room at Molino Stucky must realize the hotel is located on an island, 15 minutes boat trip away from St Markâ€™s square and the like. This might be considered as a disadvantage, but for me it was an advantage, as it was nice to get away from all the tourists and spend a quite night elsewhere. The hotel boat service is free, leaving from St Markâ€™s and hotel every half an hour or so, and, frankly, adds a nice touch to your stay in the place where water taxis cost more than European average cheap airline tickets. Summing up, I recommend the hotel, with one reservation that it is rather pricy even for Venice. If your budget is tight I recommend looking elsewhere. If you can find a special discounted rate (like I did getting two nights for the price of one), I strongly recommend it. For people who seek budget options, I recommend executive rooms, more expensive than the standard rooms, but worth the price considering the extras, especially access to the executive lounge (I had never before had better wines) Hope it was useful. I just wrote what I would expect to see in a review. Good Luck! If you have any questions, feel free to email me at piotrw@icpnet.pl.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location not so great”
Reviews.Author: CanSunSeeker
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. Rooms were spacious. Views were great. I was able to get a great deal through priceline 138US taxes a night. Stayed for 4 nights. As others have mentioned hotel services are very expensive.Tip take the shuttle boat to the first stop Zattere walk to your left for about 3-5 min. almost right across the hotel there is a Grocery store " CO-OP" buy your supplies there. Reasonable prices. I bought 2â‚¬ bottle of Wine from the Multipucano Region great wine. Roof top view was terrific pool was nice but a bit too cool, we were always able to find a lounger in late afternoon. Clean Quite hotel I wouldn't pay any more than what I paid. I would have rather stayed on the mainland as the shuttle service was inconvenient. ask the locals for Restaurant recommendations and get lost in the streets

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Dutchboy135
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 days last week. This is a great hotel to stay at in Venice. We had a room on the 7th floor with a great view. The breakfast is delicious and has great variety. The staff, especially Daniel, who works the executive lounge in evenings, are there to take care of you. Check in went very fast and were granted a free upgrade on the room. The concierge services were very helpful in providing information on boat and train schedules. The pool and bar area on the 8th floor are spectacular, however we did not swim in the pool. I like the location, which is a bit out of the way from St. Mark's, but it is away from all the hustle and bustle. There are a few restaurants located near the hotel that are also worth trying, thus not having to use the boat shuttle. I was very happy with our stay at the Hilton Venice and would highly recommend to anyone that is accustomed to Hilton quality and service. We have stayed at many Hiltons all over the world and this one is worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: DCtraveler93
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night at the Hilton prior to departing on a Med. cruise. We shared a water taxi to the Hilton which saved us paying 115 euro (paid 54 instead). The hotel is lovely and the rooms while small are very nice. We had a great view. The bed was very comfortable and we went upstairs to the rooftop pool and sat out for a while in the early evening. The cruise ships came so close it seemed you could touch them and the view was lovely. We didn't find it crowded at all. Check in was a snap and they had our room ready at about 11:30. The complimentary shuttle was great -- there was always room and it was like clockwork (always on time). There was a great pizza place close to the hotel so we ate outside and enjoyed dinner before walking back to the hotel. Overall, this hotel was great and I really enjoyed not being right in Venice. The shuttle was very flexible and we had no problem getting on and off. The hotel staff was very nice and we had a good experience at the hilton. Very close and accessible to the cruise ship terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at Hilton Venice”
Reviews.Author: marnie_g2001
Reviews.Content: We booked at a 'special' price. Lovely interesting hotel on Guidecca Island. Nice spacious classic room with marble ensuite and quality fittings. Check in and out no problems, staff very polite. The shuttle service is excellent and reliable. Great casual pizza and pasta place ( eat inside or by the water) as well as a great gelati shop straight accross the water at Zattere (Vaporetto stop). You can also walk through to the Acadamia bridge and on to Rialto or San Marco. Saturday night at the hotel is Latin Dancing night which was fun. The swimming pool area and lounge is superb. Have a drink and a snack and enjoy the 5 star views. Superb! Yes, its expensive however it is 5 stars and it is an experience not forgotten!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: TraipsingAround
Reviews.Content: We booked through Priceline, so we got an amazing deal on the Hilton. The only issue with this, no one told us we did not qualify for the breakfast until we went down there and were told it was not included in our room rate. Oh well, what can you do? We took the No. 2 Vaparetto to the hotel, only to be kicked off the water bus about 4 stops before getting to the hotel. Apparently, the line was in service. We figured out another Vaparetto going to our stop (no. 41) and found the hotel from the stop (Palanca) with ease (5 min walk). At check in, the concierge indicated No. 2 would be available the next day, and she was wrong. But we made our way around with a few bumps. The location is on Giudecca Island, across a huge canal from Venice. The island is quieter than Venice (though Venice didn't seem to have much of a night life on a Sunday night either), but we liked that. The hotel shuttle worked great. We had no problems with space or timing. We couldn't find the shuttle in St. Mark's Square (man, is that place crowded or what), but the stop at Zatteras was easy to find (though not really marked that I could tell). The room was probably the largest of all 5 hotels during our stay in Italy. The bathroom was well quipped, the tv had about 6 or 7 English speaking channels. the bed was comfy. The room and public spaces were very clean. Of course, the rooftop pool and terrace rocked. What a view! We weren't up there when the food and bar service was available, but we had a nice swim and relaxed on the loungers. We didn't try room service - 26 euro for hamburger is not our style. There are a few restaurants near the hotel. If you are sick of spending so much money, there is a pizza takeaway (Facos I think) for 5 euro for a cheese pizza. It is right by the Vaparetto stop, just walk about a minute in the opposite direction of the hotel from the Palanca stop. All in all, we liked our stay and know we got a great deal through Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: lmp124
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel and setting, Beautiful room and bath . Convienient free shuttle to St Mark Square. Wonderful rate on Priceline.. Travelled with another couple , parked at Tronchetto and took private taxi to hotel $50 Euro (worth it with baggage). Only negative : waitress at bar in main floor lounge very rude :Although not busy took 30 minutes to receive glass of wine, again waited for service then we approached for second glass ,told closing in 15minutes, ordered wine, waitress not pleased major huff and rolled eyes( lesson in customer service required) All other staff wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, adventure in Venice”
Reviews.Author: frezz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with both sets of parents went on a 2 week trip throughout Italy. The Hilton Molino was the first hotel we booked, won on priceline at a discounted rate. The hotel is gorgeous and everyone loved their rooms. The only real issue with this hotel is shuttle service. The first 2 times we tried to take it the shuttles were full and wouldnt be returning for 40 minutes (some times there is a 20 min window, sometimes 40). We would up using the Venician Water bus service instead most of the time bc it was so much faster and less complicated. There is a stop about 1/2 mile south of the hotel on the island. I liked this hotel and if I had known of the shuttle issues up front I would have booked a day pass on the water bus line faster than we did. The sites from the pool deck are not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful... but expensive”
Reviews.Author: niyfl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights arriving early (1100) so are room was not ready, we left bags and went exploring. We found the shuttle very reliable, but we also used the public water buses just a short walk away. We stayed in room 646 it was compact but very nice as you would expect. We booked through hotwire and got a really good deal (room only) we heard the breakfast was great so we though we would try... 26Euro for continental or 40Euro for cooked each .... we looked through the window instead. we went to use the Skybar... its was expensive but it is an excluisve bar... All in all the hotel is very nice, the location is great for views and only a short hope to the main island.. if you get a room cheap its great if you win the lottery then you wouldnt care anyway.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: chp37
Reviews.Content: It was a little confusing to get there as the instructions we were given were non-specific ie. take the water taxi (but what stop do we get off at? Answer:Polanca, which way do we go when we get off? Answer from hotel: Go straight you'll see it . Real Answer: Go right and go over canal bridge and hotel is there. Once we got there, it was beautiful. We had a sweeping view of all of Venice including Piazza San Marco. The room was plush and luxurious with a huge bath. They have an executive lounge accessible to elite members. The disadvantage was it was not on an island connected to the main part, but they have a complimentary boat to take you there. It has a lovely rooftop pool and watching the traffic on the Guidecca canal was interesting in itself. We even saw a cruise ship coming into port. Breakfaast was sumptuous, but eating outside was better in thought than reality. The pigeons were super aggressive. This area is mostly populated by Venetians, so it was not very touristy.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: ciaoOhio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Molino Stucky in Venice for 2 nights and didn't even want to leave the hotel, it was so comfortable and very clean. Our room was quiet, lovely and overlooked the canal. It was quite romantic. My husband is a diamond member with Hilton which gave us access to the executive lounge which had lots of drinks and appetizers. One evening we scheduled a spa appointment which was very nice and private as you must schedule your time, even though there is no cost. The facilities were all immaculate. It is a large hotel, and we found the concierge to be the very best we dealt with in all of Italy. We came home and emailed them to say how much we appreciated their service and hospitality. If you want some rude, snobby employees, go stay at the Marriott on the Via Venetto in Rome. They are crooks too. And that was sad, because the Via Venetto itself is beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “The Good, Bad and the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: TorontoStella
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stucky for 2 nights before we returned home to Canada. The hotel is modern and very clean and was refreshing after staying at a worn down 3 star hotel (Palazzo Ravizza) in Siena. The rooms were clean and modern although somewhat cramped. We had an Alcove Suite which had a very small sitting room a corridor and then the main bedroom with the bath off the corridor. It was a tight fit all around for a suite. My daughter's rollaway bed was really like an army cot and not a bed. However, again the decor and cleanliness of the rooms made up for it. As for the location, it is definitely more roomier in outside space than the other San Marco located hotels where everything is tightly jammed. However, be wary of the shuttle service. The staff was hit and miss. They tried to be helpful but some staff members were certainly not at the 5 star level. You are very much tied to their schedule and if there is an event going on such as the Regatta races while we were there you could be trapped on the San Marco side for 6-7 hours with no means of transportation back to the hotel which is very frustrating. Even taxi services were not running at that time. As well, I wasn't very impressed with the restaurants on the island. We had planned to eat at Harry's Dolce (one of the famous Ciprani restaurants) and I was expecting high prices due to the name, however, I couldn't justify spending $30 on a Caprese Salad so we skipped it. Overall, I found Venice to be very touristy, extremely crowded and highly overpriced compared to other Italian locations. Venice must be seen once in a lifetime but I don't have any intentions of returning. If I do need to return, next time I would definitely stay on the San Marco side at the Westin or Gritti Palace. By the way, I saw both of those hotels and although I didn't see any rooms, I actually liked the Westin better although the Gritti is far more expensive and requires more points through the Starwood program.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, shame about some of the staff”
Reviews.Author: texantasha
Reviews.Content: Overall, my Mum and I had a great time and the location I found great. Once awe knew the 'drill' it was not a hassle to get the transfer boat to/from the hotel. Front desk was not helpful, there was no leeway with them. My husband is top tier with Hilton and they would not permit me any of the extras (exec/club floor access for breakfast and late check-out etc.) that they would have done if he was actually on the trip. The lady took a lot of joy in letting me know I was just a mignon and not deserving of any of the Hilton Honors extras - oops, how small did I feel?! Small point but knowing how friendly they are in the US & UK and happy to say 'thanks for all of your business' it was a tad disappointing that I couldn't extend that to my Mum, but never mind. Our room was pretty small, but then that's Venice for you. Bathroom was very nice and well appointed. Took a peek at the roof-top bar, didn't stay but it looked lovely with a great view. I would definitely return to this hotel. One word of warning - try and arrange your transfer in advance. We had disembarked a Windstar yacht in the morning and had no idea that we were almost directly opposite the hotel. We thought that our negotiation from 60 Euros to 30 Euros was good until we had the 30 second transfer (I kid you not) from one side of the canal to the next. I learned very quickly in Venice! We loved Venice though and discovering it on foot was by far the best option. Hope you have a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “***THIS IS A MUST STAY*** Stay Here! Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: LVDAWNETTE
Reviews.Content: At first you may think this is too expensive, stop and rethink your trip. Do you want to feel pampered? Treated like gold? Then stay here. You arrive by water shuttle that you can get from two different locations, or by taxi. We were taking pictures of the hotel before we even realized we were staying here! The water shutlle drivers were all very nice and helpful with our luggage. Check in at the front desk was very courteous, kind and professional. This is a 10 out of 10 hotel. The front desk person checked us in, we told him where we had been and he listened and made nice comments. But the next day when checking out he remembered what we had said and where we had been! Impressive!! Our room was very nicely done with rich woods, marble bathrooms, large tub. The bed was very comfortable. It was very hot in August, but the airconditioner was nice and cool. The Pool is a must see and do! What a great pool you can be in the pool and overlook Venice. If you like water, you must stay here. This was warm and relaxing. We went to the Bar at the top for a nightcap. This was a great experience. Good staff and beautiful views. We left early the next morning and had to take a early taxi to the airport. As we left, I wished we could stay. We will return to this Property when coming back to Venice. Stay Here, Stay Here, Stay Here... thats what I would reccommend. Save you money if you need :), but stay here.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel in venice bar none - shuttle is a joke”
Reviews.Author: phdtravel
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel like a Venetian plague. The shuttle boat is a farce and the staff is rude. Because of location you must rely very much on the shuttle to get to Venice proper. They give you a map and timetable but do not stick to it and the hotel takes no responsibility for any delays. On 1st night, the shuttle picked up from a point 100m away and one bridge across from that indicated on the map. Had to scamper around in the dark to locate it. Rude concierege said its the gondoliers fault. On 2nd day, shuttle did not show for an hour. Many anxious guests were waiting. When we called, they said its just a courtesy so too bad must wait another half hour. Because of no show shuttle we returned few minutes after check out to room. Rude front desk staff threatened if you don't get out in 10 min I will charge you one more night. Told her it was the boat delay. She said that is not our fault. Never stay here! For the 480E/nt price of the Hilton you can stay in San Marco instead. Plus there were short and curlies in the bed when we checked in and shower drainage was poor.

Reviews.Title: “Great concierge service and in house dining...”
Reviews.Author: BKandMK
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel for two nights and the front desk folks, specifically the concierge (Carlo and his staff) were fantastic. After our luggage was delayed at the Venice airport, the Hilton staff was very helpful when it came to providing essential items. Also, Carlo made an extra effort to keep me updated on any communucations he had with Venice airport regarding the status of the lost bags. Great onsite dining options as well.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect base in Venice”
Reviews.Author: JerVan11
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is not central - we thought this was one of the biggest plus points as Venice can get quite hectic and it is nice at times to be an onlooker.... Some times you come to expect second rate hotels and service in big tourist towns like venice but we were blown away by the quality of this hotel. Our room was small but definate luxury. The breakfast buffet was as good as any I have seen and the service was always efficient. The free boat shuttle was always on time and comfortable. We paid a brief visit to the sky bar, it looked very nice but was too pricey for us to hang around for too long! If you're looking for real class in Venice, you would be hard pressed to find better.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: vemar
Reviews.Content: I treated my husband for his birthday to a 5 night stay in venice and opted for the Molino Stucky, being part of the Hilton group and i managed to get a very good deal on Expedia. I booked the Executive Plus package which upgraded our room to a Venice view and we received entry to the executive lounge which offered finger foods and free drinks including alcholic, we were very glad of this as the prices in the hotel for food and drinks cost a fortune, 8.00 euros for a coffee and 15.00 for a gin and tonic. On checking in we received a 1st floor executive room, the room smelled terribly of damp which we immediately refused and they moved us promptly to a fifth floor room. Considering the price of the room i was disappointed with the size i was expecting something special but it was just a normal sized room, bearing in mind we also had a small bed in there for our daughter which reduced our space considerably but the view was fantastic. On settling into our room on our second night we were unable to sleep because people moved in nextdoor and decided to unpack at 1.30 in the morning, the walls being paper thin we could hear everything and also heard they guy ask his wife if she wanted a bellini! We called reception, for them to answer 'well they have just checked in'. The next morning at 9.00 my daughter was a little upset and with our wonderful neighbours banging on the door and wall, spoiled our day. My husband again went to the reception to complain, they told us they would be checking out that afternoon, after this my parents moved to the room nextdoor. The breakfast was disappointing as the hot side of the buffet was colder than the cold selection, and service slow and poor, my parents, every morning asked for fried eggs which came all burst after a 30 min wait. Overall the hotel is nice looking, provided a good service with the complimentry water taxi, which takes you to St Marks Square and collects you. The pool area was very nice with an amazing view over venice although the facilities are very small considering the size of the hotel, but you dont really go to venice to sunbathe and frolic about in a swimming pool. Venice was fantastic, really enjoyed it, weather was amazing the problems we had with the hotel didnt manage to spoil the fun we had. Also eat on the main island of venice away from attractions like rialto and st marks square you will pay a fortune look for little back street restaurants. The restaurants on the island of guidecca near the hotel are poor in comparision.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Theholidaymakers
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this lovely hotel in Venice on a very hot sunny weekend in August. The hotel is very new, the executive rooms were clean tidy and large. We unfortunately had a room over the back of the hotel we should have asked for a lagoon facing room. The rooftop pool was well used by our teenage girls. One point to make is that the sound proofing in the rooms on the third floor were not great!! The shuttle water boats operated by the hotel were very efficient so it was very easy to get to the main attractions and we actually loved being far away from the crowds on the grand canal. As a diamond hilton member i do have to say the arrangement of the executive lounge on the ground floor was not a good idea. The executive lounge was not in operation upstairs.Not sure why as it was beautiful. The lounge was next to the bar and in such really everyone was just walking in and using the facilities. There was no staff asking to see if in fact you could use the service. As such there was no exclusivity and it was always way too busy with no seats.Just a minor gripe but it always a lovely end to the day to sit and enjoy a quiet drink. Apart from that well done hilton, this is truly a very special hotel.

Reviews.Title: “God Awful”
Reviews.Author: philipmallard
Reviews.Content: First, lets start with the outright fraud in my bill. I was charged for breakfast on the day I arrived and I arrived at 3:00PM. As I unhappily found out over the next few days, breakfast closes at 10:30AM. This was an anomaly when I reviewed my bill at the end of my stay, along with the price tripling from a 15 price per person to 45, but I thought it was rectified and happily signed the bill. But the fact that the charge reappeared on my credit card statement at the prior larger amount is contemptible. The hotels staff misrepresented the cost of everything and the amount charged to my card was clearly not what I agreed to. Now I will spend a few weeks debating this point in my broken Italian to a service staff half a world away. Second, the location is terrible. The boat ride to and from the hotel is at least 30 minutes and if you miss the boat there is a water bus, but trying to decipher the schedule and lines after enjoying a night in Venice is torture. Some vacation. Whatever energy I had mustered for the evening was routed and destroyed by the lengthy boat trip to SanMarco. Sure, its a complimentary service and thats nice. But you built the hotel on an ISLAND. Unless you are issuing flippers to guests, its somewhat of an implied service, unless you want to hold your guests ransom to the highwaymen masquerading as water taxi drivers. Also, the nearly deserted island of Guidecca (in mid August) where the hotel is situated is a terrible place in and of itself. Dont like the 10 euro coffee in the bar? Take the boat to the mainland because the nearest bar on Guidecca (besides the wonderful but exorbitant Harry's Dolci) is about a 15 minute walk. Want a snack? The cheapest thing on the menu is the 28 euro Stucky burger. I cant imagine a burger that is worth nearly 40 us dollars with service and cover, let alone the prospect of room service. Not if Ronald McDonald, Dave Thomas and the Burger King got together in some sort of anti-american monopolistic conspiracy to create the greatest burger ever could 40 dollars ever be reasonable for a burger. Lastly, as if the terrible location and deceitful staff were not enough, getting to the airport was nearly impossible. We had an early flight and after our near argument about breakfasts on days when were not in the region, we had to take 3 boats to get to the airport. We consulted with the concierge about a water taxi and that ended up being a 103 euro prospect. We were close to doing it, but the idea spending another euro as Stucky Molino's terrible geographic location was so appalling that we got up at 3AM to take the night boat to saint Mark's and then sat on the public water shuttle for an hour and a half to make our 7AM flight. Stucky Molino is a joke and easily one of the most invidious experiences of my life. Sure the pool is nice. But the obnoxious children and their parents aren't. Ya it has a western breakfast, but its not worth 45 euro. Hell its not worth 10 euro because most of the time you sit there, your waitress forgets about you and they run out of glasses, milk, orange juice and every thing else. This hotel is poorly run and exists solely because American associate the Hilton name with some level of hospitality. Dont do it. Stay on the mainland bite the bullet. Youll thank yourself for not having to make boat schedules to get back to Guidecca and youll get to enjoy the night without worry. Not to mention youll save an hour everyday not getting to and from the whole reason why you came to Venice in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Dawn267
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel from our cruise in the morning so our room was not ready yet. Decided to have tea. For 2 cups of tea 16 euros. Not a good first impression. We went for breakfast on our 1st morning which was a sunday. Chaos. They did not seem to be able to cope with the volume of people. Tables were not cleared, you asked for tea etc.. but they would forget to bring it as the staff were running around like headless chickens. Service did improve on the week days so may be a good idea to avoid the weekend rush! We also found some of the staff sharp and unhelpful. Rooms were lovely with a great view and the rooftop swimming pool was great. However we would not go back to this particular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: doha1
Reviews.Content: Being a Diamond Hhonors member we received an upgrade to a canal view Suite - great view over the canal & venice. Would throughly recommend the waterbus if the hotel shuttle is not available - No.2 waterbus goes down the grand canal * No.41 goes to Murano for the glass factories. Food at this hotel is extremely expensensive on UK standards (30 Euro for a hamburger & fries), but the breakfast is up to the usual Hilton standard - plenty of choice and of a good standard. Water taxi from the hotel to the airport is 100 Euro and takes about 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: TravellingCanucks_9
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel at 11 a.m. after an early flight and was surprised to find out that not only was our room available already, but we had been upgraded from a Deluxe room to a suite (I have Hilton Gold status). We haved stayed at over a dozen Hiltons in Europe so far this year and this one was by far the nicest. This beautifully restored building was very clean and inviting. The shuttle to Zaterre/Saint Mark's square was very convenient. In typical Italian fashion they driver often stretched a 5 min trip into 20 min, but we didn't mind as we never tired of the views. We actually liked the location of the hotel, it felt like an oasis from the tourist masses, yet the shuttle made it as convenient as any hotel on the Grand Canal itself. The roof top pool was absolutely spectacular, nothing like watching a cruise ship sail by so close you feel you could almost touch it! Well, actually the stunning views of Venice were a tad better.... As for the service, I found the service excellent for Italian standards. We have found each country in Europe has its own quirks, and have experienced much worse service in other places in Italy. We were blown away by the cost of drinks in the Skyline Lounge on the top floor. Two Mojitos cost us 32 Euros! Very strange considering our Suite (with Executive Lounge access) only cost us 105 Euros per night. All in all though, we had a memorable trip, in no small part to our experience at this hotel. We definitely recommend this hotel and are already planning a return visit in the very near future.

Reviews.Title: “Very mixed experience - service needs sorting out”
Reviews.Author: londonaustralia
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two nights at the Hilton Molino Stucky with my sister. Overall the hotel is very impressive. The building is spectacular and is beautifully decorated. Our room - an executive twin room - was also lovely and well appointed. We enjoyed the hotel's pool although we felt it's cleanliness left something to be desired as the water looked cloudy and there was lots of mould/algae around the sides. We also very much enjoyed the free shuttle service to Zattere and St Mark's Square which was never overcrowded as previous reviews have stated and was always on time. With our room, came access to the executive lounge - this was a great perk and we visited the lounge on several occasions to take advantage of this. On our last morning however, we were asked by a member of staff for our room number as we sat down. On giving this, we were told we were "not on her list". Having explained that access to the lounge was part of the deal with our room, she apologised and left us alone. We felt so uncomfortable however that we left as soon as we had finished our drinks. Interestingly, she did not appear to have any list with her and given that the executive rooms are only on one particular floor of the hotel and therefore start with a number which anyone working there would know, we were even more surprised to be challenged. We could only conclude that it was because we were considerably younger than anyone else in there at the time and therefore an easier target. Housekeeping also left a lot to be desired - on our second day, the "housekeeping" consisted of making the beds - the bathroom had not been touched which we know because we had left swim-wear drying and left the bathroom scales in the middle of the room and all was exactly as we left it when we returned. As part of our room package we were supposed to have a turn-down service but this did not materialise. Our night clothes were left thrown in a ball on the bed rather than being folded which was disappointing for a five star hotel and certainly not five star service. Breakfast was great and there was an immense amount of choice. The large rooms in which breakfast was served however felt a bit hangar-like and impersonal. Overall, this is a very nice hotel but the level of service is absolutely not five star sadly. Next time we will stay at the Cipriani.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great looks, great potential - read on for the great disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: Maxw311
Reviews.Content: What was right.... warm welcome, prompt check-in (12 at night), clean everywhere, very nice spa facilities and rooftop pool. The letdowns....... the first room had a gap at the top of one of the walls to an adjoining room - could hear every word said at a whisper....privacy?! (We found out when we were woken early the following morning by children whispering and giggling) Booked a double deluxe, got a twin deluxe.....we've got children, but not with us! Breakfast generally v good - Sun was dire by any standards. No tables avail, when table made up was then occupied by other guests before we could sit down. Ended up eating a greasy spoon style leftovers breakfast (1 hour before sitting ends) 100 yards from breafast bar (possibly a blessing!) in the open air(the nice bit)!! Complementary transport - good most of the time. Some drivers were fabulous/helpful, one in particular was not ie. not waiting as we approached even though it was 5 mins early (that is until 2 Italians turned up!) We noted that other guests were unable to get on this service on a couple of occasions due to the number restricted on board. DO NOT rely on this if time is critical for connections of any sort. Spa - while this facility is very nice, it is restricted to 7 guests per half hour (yes, SEVEN). I have no idea how many guests there can be in this hotel, but catch it at the wrong time and you could possibly be waiting until your vacation next year! As it turned out, we had no problems........ Swimming pool - Small but very nice to dip in with exceptional views of Venice. With reference to the comments about the Spa, there are only about 30 sunlounger spaces available up there. It was packed on the occasions we went to lie out, so we sat on a towel on the tile floor. We were abruptly told we were not allowed to do that for a reason we could not fathom (the month didn't even have an R in it). There seems to be a tendancy for the Italians to be abrupt/rude, but we must try and not take it personally! Service - On the whole service was OK, but as I stay in hotels on a very regular basis for work, I don't expect Hiltons to be very good - they are not of the standard they used to be. If you are used to rapid, courteous service, find somewhere else! The suggestion that you have to go to the main island for everything is misleading. There is an off licence 10 mins walk from the hotel if you don't want to pay 9-10Euros for a glass of wine - that's up to you. There are also a few little restaurants/bars there too and even a supermarket if the kids are a bit fussy and want something cheap and cheerful. Frankly, I wouldn't consider taking children sub 10-12 years to Venice at all - I am glad we didn't take ours (It was only down to fate that we didn't as we have always taken them with us before - that's a story in itself!) travel/transport there is venice card to buy for 73 euros(66 for under 30's and other rates also) - this gives access to several tourist attractions, free use of many toilet facilities(euro1-50 a go otherwise) and free use of the water buses. It lasts for 3 days and includes the bus back to the airport. I would say this is v good value and can be used to structure your visit rather than sitting at a bar watching the boats drift by! Venice is a wonderful place to visit - personally, I would see it over 2-3 days. You are able to walk,eat and 'culturefy' yourself stupid in that time - enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Rooms, Great Pool, tolerable service”
Reviews.Author: JimboMaine
Reviews.Content: Hotel is 'reasonably' easily accessed by ferry from the train station and by either ferry or private taxi from the airport. Private taxi to anywhere is at least 60 Euro and up, and since there isn't much to do on Giudecca, you'll get good at taking the public vaporetto. Staff is relatively unhelpful, and give you the impression that you are a neccessary annoyance... but, that's not unique to this hotel. I took advantage of spa services, which were quite nice (and the spa attendants were uncharacteristically very nice) and unlike the restaurant and room service, the spa services seemed reasonably priced! The place is nice and clean. I was given a room with a view of a brick wall, and asked about an upgrade. For 75 euro, they would upgrade me to a room with a 'slightly better view'... they sent me up with a bellman to show me the room. He showed me the door. I asked whether we might be able to see the inside of the room, but he said that he couldn't, because he didn't have a key. Likely a misunderstanding compounded by my poor Italian, but strangely typical of the interesting way this hotel serves its clientele. The internet connectivity is a usurous $27E. It is, however, the best internet connectivity I encountered in europe, and a video conference with Los Angeles was as clear as any I'd seen. Almost worth the money. Do go to the pool. It's lovely, and the one truly attentive staffer at the hotel seems to be stationed there. The view of the canal and Venice is splendid. One last caveat: I was assigned this hotel by a large 'name-your-own-price' site and my room cost me a laughably small amount. Were I paying 'rack rates', I may well have been less humored by the service foibles.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: travelangel777
Reviews.Content: Unlike some of the previous reviews, we thought the hotel was awesome! It was one of the nicest hotels we stayed in. I booked the trip for my husbnd and I from Hotwire, and got an amazing rate. We took the water bus from to train station to Palanca, and from there it was only a 5 minute walk. The Hotel is right across the water from the main attractions of Venice. The free shuttle runs every half an hour and we had no problems getting on. The rooftop pool has amazing views, and we enjoyed the swim one day. When we checked out I realized I had forgotten our passports and a few hundred dollars in the safe! When we returned I was releived to find out the passports and all the money was counted and sealed in an envelope and waiting for us at the front desk. It is a safe and honest hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Honestly--Average Hilton Experience”
Reviews.Author: redskins2971
Reviews.Content: I Stayed at the Hilton Molino Stucky for about 3-4 nights with a 7 and 14 year old. Our room was well put and was very big considering it being Venice and in Europe. Then again, It's something which you expect when you pay $700-1000 a night and plus its a HIlton. The lobby is pretty small for 4.5 star hotel. I actually went out of the hotel when I first checked to make sure it was the HIlton because the lobby was that unimpressive. The conceriage and room service isn't the best either. Not prompt and seemed a bit rude at times to be honest. The location isn't anything special either, about 80 euros to get to the train station and it is about 20-25 minutes away from the main island of venice using the shuttle provided by Hilton. Overall, a bit disappointed with Hilton but won't rule out this hotel next time I visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, felt like I was staying in a shopping mall”
Reviews.Author: mcmcginlay
Reviews.Content: My review is probably coloured by the fact that we were in a tiny room overlooking the back of the hotel... no view at all. Only good point was roof top bar - even there, you need to stand up and look over the wall to know you are in Venice. Ordered room service at 10pm, delivered at midnight and cold. No atmosphere, big empty lobby and bar... could easily be a shopping mall. So disappointed that we left the hotel at 8am every morning and went back as late as we could.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better!”
Reviews.Author: Genneau
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights at the end of July. The air conditioning was a Godsend but apart from that we were pretty disappointed with the service. We had stayed in a couple of excellent hotels before we came here and this hotel didn't compare favourably. Our beds were only turned down one of the three nights of our stay, rubbish was left on the floor (which had not been there previously), they failed to leave the complementary water in our room one of the three days, the breakfasts were like animal feeding time at a farm. To top it all off, having left my ipod and a few other things in the desk drawer when we checked out (I'm pregnant and a bit forgetful at the moment), and upon calling later that evening when we got home, we found that the items had 'vanished'. Not only this but they were really slack at investigating the loss/theft and only finally looked into it properly 4 days after we reported it. This is absolutely not what I would expect of a 5 star hotel. Suffice to say we won't be going back! I'm now making an insurance claim...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: FamilyofBoys
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel. The restaurants were overpriced, but we didn't stay there for that reason. The rooms were great with gorgeous views of the waterfront. The included breakfast was a fantastic buffet which covered your every need. Yes, the pool is not gigantic -- how could it be when its on the roof of a historical building. The view up there is wonderful. The only negative we experienced was the water shuttle to the main island did not have very friendly or helpful drivers at times. The front desk was always helpful and happy to answer all our questions (regardless of how many we asked). The concierge did a wonderful job of having our private water taxi ready to take us to our cruise ship and to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: sooz1960
Reviews.Content: My son & I were so looking forward too our stay in this splendid hotel & the only reason I choose this particular hotel over other 5* hotels in Venice with pools was because of it's beautiful (much publicised) roof-top pool! To our huge disapointment (& without prior notice) the roof-top pool was closed for the whole week-end of our trip due to a celebration (Redentore) which is celebrated annually & was used for a Gourmet Night on the Saturday. Would have been nice to be aware of this before booking? The management offered dis-gruntled customers a complimentary cocktail/lunch as compensation - considering how much I had paid to stay there I thought it was not good enough. I can't fault how stunning the hotel is, but value for money - I would say no.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hilton Stucky...Great Service”
Reviews.Author: julesgeo
Reviews.Content: Loved staying on Giudecca Island. Explore this wonderful residential island. Servce was top notch with a friendly front desk staff. Boat service was always on time and very efficient. Rooms were a little on the small side but very well equiped,clean, and comfortable. We were given a room with a beautiful view of Venice. Nice drinks and food with the excecutive lounge off the lobby. It was the perfect fit for our tired bones after a long plane trip. Never made it to the pool but it did seem to have some odd hours along with the near by roof bar. I would love to go back and stay again. Thank you Hilton for a lovely stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views from the rooftop pool; lovely situation on the island of giudecca; but only 3* service”
Reviews.Author: paul1477
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated on the island of giudecca; which is only 10 minutes away from San Marco square by either the hotel boat or the vaporetto service and just 5 minutes from Zattere. Being on a different island is no disadvantage at all; going from rialto to san marco would also take you 5 or more minutes. It's rather an advantage since the island of giudecca is a calm oasis compared to overcrowded streets of venice. There are very nice restaurants close to the hotel (walk to right when leaving the hotel and just follow the waterfront) which offer a great view over the giudecca canal towards zattere and san marco square. The best feature of the hotel itself is the rooftop bar & pool. Nothing beats refreshing in the pool after a long day of walking in sunny venice (yes; it can be very hot in summer!). One minor disadvantage is that the pool closes relatively early; at 19.30. I read in some reviews that the hotel charges for towels or sun loungers; none of this is true (at least not when we were staying there in july 2009). Also there are free lockers available next to the pool. It can be a bit crowded at the pool area; don't expect loungers to be available at any time; but you can just put your towel on the floor and enjoy the breathtaking views over venice from the pool. There is a restaurant at the rooftop with offers overpriced ordinary snacks (hamburger for 30 EUR); you can rather eat a good lunch in the italian restaurants close to the hotel. Minibar prices are high; OK it is a 5* hotel; but the price seems just to high since the overall service level of the hotel is rather 3* than 5*. EUR 9 for a beer from the minibar seems just too much; anyways there is a supermarket on the giudecca waterfront and you can also buy cheaper drinks from many vendors in venice just before taking the boat back to the hotel. Why 3* service? The breakfast is one big chaos. I donâ€™t expect to stand in a line for 15 minutes when having breakfast at a 5* hotel. Also I would expect all food, or at least most of the food to be available; all 4 days that we had breakfast many items were not available; empty bowls and dishes were all over the buffet; many times orange juice wasn't even available for periods of 15 minutes. I wouldnâ€™t blame this on the staff as they were running around; the hotel just seems to be very badly organized and managed and just not prepared to receive large crowds. Same story for checkout; lines of 15 to 30 minutes just to be able to pay your hotel bill. OK; it was crowded; but come on; you're selling 5* service. Do I really need to wait 30 minutes in a line to pay my 9 EUR beer from the minibar? We did get a nice gift from the hotel though; in our room there was a complimentary bottle of bellini together with a letter from the hotel (addressed to a different person !!!!). There were no bathrobes in our room and we had to call three times to the MAGIC number (thatâ€™s what they call their customer service) before they were delivered. First call on the evening of arrival; second call on the morning after & third call on the evening of the second day. Again this is not up to the service level I would expect from a 5* hotel. Additionally there was a problem with the toilet in our room; the water didn't stop running after flushing the toilet. We notified the magic desk on our first day; they wrote it down; they would send somebody but it was never repaired. Well I didn't bother to call a second time over this. The shuttle boat offered by the hotel was a nice extra service; however its usefulness is limited as it didn't fully respect its own timetable (this was handed out by the reception upon check in) and many times was full (the maximum capacity is 40 people) and you would just be denied boarding and left stranded at the hotel. Now this is not really a problem as there are 2 vaporetto stops near the hotel (less than 5 minutes walking along the lovely waterfront of giudecca). The vaporreto runs every 5 minutes and takes you to zattere; san marco and many more places. In fact I would only recommend taking the hotelboat as it just happens to be there when you want to leave; but don't waste your time waiting for it as the vaporetto is a perfect alternative. Overal I do recommend this hotel; just donâ€™t expect perfect service; itâ€™s location and the pool canâ€™t be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Goof but not 5 star.”
Reviews.Author: PIno32
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, in good locations with excellant amenities, very clean. Gym, Sauna, best I have ever come across in a hotel.Breakfast, too good. Roof top bar, definately a place for a few sun downer drinks with great views across Venice. Only one gripe, waiting staff of all levels seemed over worked and stressed, made us sometimes feel like we were a pain and not welcome, unfortunately, this alone would probably make me go elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but not 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: 2boystravelling
Reviews.Content: I booked thru Priceline and got a really good rate for Venice so I don't have much to complain about. The Hotel is what was expected for Hilton and the rooms were decorated very nicely with Ventician chandelier with high beamed ceilings. The bathroom was all marbel with separate tub (extra long) and shower. The only complaint comes from the service staff - housekeeping barely "picked up" room and didn't replinish soap or coffee. They also left a broken glass in the dusty cabinet. I called to request the items they forgot around mid afternoon and at midnight they still had not brought them..so i called again. The bar service was horrible, the bartender seemed overworked and irriated. The pool area, while very pleasant, is lacking enough loungers.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeepscreeps
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely beautiful. I'll start with the gripes to get them out of the way. The hotel staff was not as friendly or professional as I would have expected for such an upscale place. The concierge was distracted and seemed annoyed at our questions. When checking in, one front desk staff became irritated with us and raised her voice a little. To their credit however, when the one staff member became annoyed, her coworker took over and was friendly. There is no free internet access. One other thing, the hotel is large and has an odd layout. On to the good things. The water shuttle that went from the hotel to the main island of Venice was fast, frequent, clean and convenient. The hotel is absolutely beautiful, inside and out. There is a large grocery store a few blocks away and tucked back around a corner from the hotel where we bought lunch and breakfast foods so we wouldn't have to pay for the pricey hotel food. We asked the concierge (who seemed annoyed) where to find it. I suppose I might be annoyed too as a concierge if some cheapwads staying at my hotel want to know where to find a grocery store. The views from the hotel shore are amazing! Our room did not have a view, but we booked it through priceline, so what can you expect. Since our stay was in October, the rooftop pool was closed, so we can't comment on that. Too bad though because it looked really great. Overall, it's a lovely hotel, and I would definitely consider staying there again if I were to return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Venice”
Reviews.Author: OregonBigsky
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent six free nights at the Molino Stucky, using Hilton Honors points. What a return on on our diligent point-hoarding! The hotel is spectacular! We were upgraded to a suite, and given executive lounge access. As we'd already been in Italy for two weeks and were feeling a little anxious about how much we'd already spent, we took full advantage of that lounge! We had free breakfast in the hotel each morning, drinks and appretizers every night, and pocketed breakfast goodies for our picnic lunch a time or two. It may sound a little crass, but... The room was great. The bathroom was top notch. Having the extra sitting room gave us much-needed extra room to spread 3-weeks worth of luggage. The room wasn't as luxurious as the amazing room we had at the Conrad Bangkok, and it wasn't quite as plush as the Cavalieri Hilton, but it was certainly newer! The shuttle boat was a really nice touch. It would have been impossible to stay here without it, but it really added a luxurious character to the experience. The gym was okay, but a little small. The hamman was a very nice touch. The rooftop pool was unbelieveable. What a view! After the Cavalieri Hilton, I must say the breakfast was a bit of a letdown. In general, the feel was not quite as exclusive. However, the buildings exterior appearance and location, the pool and hamman, the water shuttle, and the very helpful concierge really made this a great stay. Add that to the upgraded suite and executive lounge access, and of course the fact that it is all in one of the most beautiful and romantic cities we've ever seen, and it made for an unforgettable stay. Thank you Hilton Molino Stucy and Hilton Honors!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, 5 star!”
Reviews.Author: kristopherowens
Reviews.Content: the good: so much! this hotel is relatively new, very clean, and the location ain't bad. the room was very spacious, as was the bathroom. the decor was what you would expect from a five star hotel, but with some touches of venice (exposed wooden ceiling beams). we took a vaporetto there because we weren't sure where the free shuttle would pick us up. but once we found that, we made much use of it. a grocery store is just across the water, and the major sights are very close. the free hotel shuttle actually drops you at san marco. the bad: none really.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get any better than this!”
Reviews.Author: reclermo
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Molino Stucky is in a word, SPECTACULAR. I cannot fault the hotel in any area. Everything from the moment you check in to when you leave is carefully prescribed. The rooms have extremely high ceilings and luxuriously appointmented bathrooms. If you are looking for a honeymoon or romance hotel, this is it! We also enjoyed swimming in the hotel's rooftop pool which overlooks the canal. The view is unbelievable and it is well worth it to take a day off from touring and just relax around the hotel. We also enjoyed a delicious dinner at the hotel restaurant on the water. It started raining halfway through dinner and the delightful staff helped us move inside. The staff at the restaurant are the finest I have encountered on any trips to Europe. Make sure to try the risotto, it was fantastic. There is also a private boat run by the hotel to whisk you up and down the canal, so you don't have to be crammed into the public boats with the hoardes of other other tourists. Even though the Hilton may be priced quite high, it still offers an outstanding value and is worth the extra splurge. I will return as this is my new hotel of choice in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for Venice”
Reviews.Author: dileo
Reviews.Content: Ill try to keep this short. The Hilton Stucky was a beautiful hotel. We used our Hilton points to stay and were treated like royalty. The taxi made everything so easy to get to. We thought we would miss out on Venice by staying on the outskirts of the city, but by the end of the trip we wouldn't have it any other way. We took the taxi over during the day and walked all over Venice, ate dinner, and "escaped" back to our hotel to relax on the roof top overlooking the city with a cocktail-----incredible. This is a must stay hotel or at least go have a drink on the roof top----O one more thing---we heard of Venice being smelly, but we did not experience any of that during our 3 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: JJT25
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for one night at the end of May before leaving Venice on a cruise the following day. What a wondeful location this hotel is in. On entering you immediately think WOW. We headed straight for our room with the bell boy carrying our luggage. Our room was lovely even though our view was only of a fire escape but Venice and the hotel in general are so beautiful you don't want to spend too much time in your room. My boyfriend and I headed straight for the bar on the roof and what a view. I have never seen anything like it. The pool is also on the roof and is just amazing. I would recommend this hotel to anyone as it is something special. The buffet breakfast was amazing. There are several restaurants in the hotel but we choose to eat in the centre of Venice with the free shuttle bus taking us to St Mark's Square. A really nice touch otherwise it could be a lengthy journey but easy to get to from Piazza Roma (bus station and train station). Got a fantastic deal at 150 euros and was keen to stay again on our return from our cruise but the price jumped to just over 500 euros for the night so it was a no no for us. Would return if the price was right. Highly recommend a visit to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever stayed in my entire life!!”
Reviews.Author: nfard11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there( junior suite) in August for our anniversary due to the good reviews at that time. First, the "Venice view" rooms don't have the view. May be if you open the window and stick your head out and bend over you get a little view of Venice. The view right in front of our window was an old ruin. The hotel rooms smelt. The first room we stayed at was on the top floor. They have a pool and a bar on the roof so you can imagine the noise(be aware of top floor rooms). Furthermore, lucky us, our room was located right underneath the public bathrooms(the pool restrooms) and smelt like toilette. So after hearing the toilettes flushing about 55 times at 12 midnight we finally requested a different room. Our original room was a junior suite with venice view( cant get better than that right?) in exchange we got a regular king room and we didn't get any money or apology back. On top of all that this second room smelt like smoking cigarettes. I called the staff to the room and they agreed the room smelt like smoking cigarettes but we were told this was a "none smoking" room and some of the previous guests probably smoked in there and it is not hotel's fault!! and they had no other room available!! So at 12 midnight we had the choice of toilette smelling room or cigarette smoke smelling room. The AC in both rooms was not working properly either. When I got to Paris( the next part of our trip) my cloths even the ones inside my case smelt like smoke. The positive: good breakfast buffet My advice to you: Save your vacation and stay some where else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but..............”
Reviews.Author: Cucchitravels
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice, but that's about it. The hotel layout is TERRIBLE. Only 1 elevator worked (we would sneak in to the service elevator)., the nice rooftop bar was closed at weird times, at breakfast they ran out of syrup and they didn't replace it through our stay. Bypass this hotel and get one IN Venice. Hotel Monaco is a much nicer hotel and location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Vitzi
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Molino Stucky for 3 nights during Easter 2009. We got a really good rate through Hilton website which included breakfast. The hotel is very modern. The room was nice and well appointed. While the located in the island of Guidecca, across from Venice, the hotel runs boats crossing to Venice every 20-30min. Boats go to 2 stops, San Marco and another stop handy for Dorsdouro area (great restaurants, Accademia museum). IAs it was Easter, the hotel was full, but there always seemed to be enough boats to take everyone across. Breakfast was great .
