We noticed that there seemed to be a wait for tables if you arrived for breakfast after 10ish. Did not eat dinner at the hotel, but did have a drink at the bar, which had great views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, sometimes missing a bit awareness.”
Reviews.Author: ContributorStuttgart
Reviews.Content: It's a great experience, Venice & the new Hilton five star hotel in between! And there is a great view from hotel to Venice. Everything can be reached easily by public transportation, bus & ship(vaporetto) day and night. If you arrive by car just stop at parking areas before the bridge connecting Mestre and Venice. It's much cheaper(â‚¬4 against â‚¬25 per day). The bus station is very close to parking area. Bus No.6 gets you easily to water bus station 'Tronchetto'. Vaporetto No.2 takes you to stop 'Palanca' close to Hilton hotel. Hotel stuff is very friendly. If you need to complain something like we did during our three day stay (there was only cold water available in our bath tub) don't worry too much if it won't be fixed. You are in Italy, Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world”
Reviews.Author: PoppyH13
Reviews.Content: By far the best looking hotel in Venice. It was our first time to Venice and we chose this hotel for a little luxury after spending a week travelling around the Tuscany region. The hotel is breathtaking, its own website gives a pretty accurate description and it certainly lived up to our expectations and beyond. The concierge was helpful, reception staff friendly, lifts a little confusing until you get the hang of it. Our room overlooked the canal and Venice. It is very very expensive but for that extra special trip i highly recommend this hotel. The rooftop pool is lovely but there is a lack of sun loungers so get there fast. The Skyline bar is also very nice and staff friendly. Once you find where the hotel shuttle boat leaves from at the other side its a great servive but we struggled to find it on our arrival and received little help from the locals when asking for directions, dont let that put you off though. A glorious hotel and i will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “what a dissappointment”
Reviews.Author: mrRadiant
Reviews.Content: where to begin? start with the layout, the hotel is a warren, the four main structures being Arsenale, Bieenale, Canaregio, Donatello. Showing a total lack of imagination. ABCD - really. The fact that they all interconnect on different levels and have narrow warren type corridors doesn't help the feeling of claustrophobia either. A new hotel should have been better thought out. how come you need a map to find your damn room? and the signage is so poor that I once found someone wandering through the corridors with his suitcase who had been lost for 15 minutes. OK, remember that this is a new hotel, so how come you can't get a mobile phone signal? the damn place burned out twice during restoration and you would have thought that with a shell to work from it should have been easy to ensure the relevant technology worked. How come the rooftop bar isn't open 24/7? and why haven't they tidied the disgusting mess that lies next to the hotel and ruins the view below. a small garden would have cost pennies to aquire and maintain. How come the service is so poor, Hilton generally pays its staff good wages and apparently aquired a number of top managers from throughout Venice. So why if you book a meeting with someone do they arrive 30 minutes late? perhaps they get lost in this nightmare too. How come the lifts are inadequate (a friend of mine was in a lift that fell four floors - in a new hotel). This is poor to say the very least. perhaps maintenance isn't up to scratch either. About the only plus is the rooftop swimming pool, which despite being tiny, does have good views. Get there early as there are very few loungers and you have to hire towels. Shocking considering the prices of the rooms. last but not least, if you are going to book Venice then stay "in Venice". The Molino is on the Giudecca, which means transfers to and from the main islands. Fun at first them irritating to say the very least. If I could chose again I'd book at the Locanda di Vivaldi or the Westin Europa Regina on the Riva degli Schiavoni, unimpeded lagoon views.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: HellyMbro
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Molino Stucky for three days in June for a friends birthday. First view of the hotel from the boat from the Airport is stunning. its a magnificent builiding restored very sympathetically. the lobby and downstairs restaurants are very stylish with marble floors and lots of settees etc. in the lounge area. Upon check in they had upgraded us to a room with a view over the water and had left a letter of congratulations for my friend which was a lovely touch. I must say the Bellinis in the roof top bar are far better than those in harrys bar!! Fresh peach juice... yum!! And what a view from up there! The pool was lovely with a good number of loungers and fresh towels. We found the staff very friendly and helpful. There was a complimentary shuttle boat over to the "mainland" which was regular and always on time which was very handy. the rooms were nice and well appointed as were the bathrooms. All in all a lovely stay in a great hotel. Would thoroughly reccommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “superb view great architecture”
Reviews.Author: tripperBelgium
Reviews.Content: perfect restauration of industrial building to top class hotel on top location; service not always top... insufficient management, but a lot of goodwill with most of the staff; rooms are large and quite, Hilton quality

Reviews.Title: “Drink cocktails while overlooking Venice.”
Reviews.Author: plexas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on an island on the southside of Venice, and at 8 stories high is one of the tallest buildings around Venice. The rooftop swimming pool and lounge are great for taking in the sunset while looking over all of Venice. The staff was friendly and the rooms were very clean. There is a shuttle that takes guests to the mainland every 30 minutes, so getting around is convenient.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice place to stay at.”
Reviews.Author: jone2008
Reviews.Content: Arrived hassel-free by water taxi, greeted by friendly staff, and had a very nice king deluxe room with an excellant view of Venice. The food at the aromi was great as we ate outdoors during a sunset. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel Stay In Venice”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra60
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Hilton Molino Stucky on Guidecca Island, a twenty-five minute boat ride from the airport. Although I had previously viewed the hotel from its website, my jaw dropped when I saw it as we arrived in our private taxi at midnight. It was so much more than even the beautiful photos I had poured over. As if the majesty of the hotel wasn't enough, we were upgraded to a suite which had a gorgeous view of the lagoon and the cruise ships passing by. The service was wonderful; the breakfast buffet was the best we have ever had; the swimming pool on the roof of the hotel overlooking all of Venice was fabulous; and being able to enjoy the executive lounge at any time of the day or night was a huge plus. Guidecca Island is quiet and was a welcome respite during the May 1st weekend when St. Mark's Square was crowded with local Italians on holiday. There is a complimentary hotel shuttle boat for guests which goes back and forth to St. Mark's Square every half hour and takes less than fifteen minutes. Rick Steve's book on Venice was so helpful and enabled us to find hidden treasures during his step by step walks. We thoroughly enjoyed our walks on Guidecca and finding such hotels as the famous Cipriani and The Bauer Spa, where we enjoyed very expensive bellinis and soaked up the ambiance. We stayed for six nights and we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Service ok.....apart from at the Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: KiwiMattToronto
Reviews.Content: After a 2 Hour Boat Ride (Cheapest way to get to the hotel)... we arrived at the Stucky Molino Hilton. Being a 5 Star, I would expect someone to assist with the luggage, and welcome us on the dock, but no such luck. It cost about 30 Euros for two of us (One Way). It's a lot more expensive to travel on a private boat. Check In was not friendly.... the German Girl at the desk could not crack a smile to save herself, and her supervisor was not much help either. The hotel was full, and to schedule one person on the desk....and 3x Concierge... someone obviously does not know how to run a Front Office. She could not help me with any of my questions, and was not very accomodating...but finally I got a room at the Front of the hotel looking out over the Canal. I asked for a particular room type,...but they said they were full. I know this was not the case as they were still selling on Priceline and Expedia and as I work in the industry, I know these cheaper rates are available to get last minute bookings. The Hotel is amazing! The lobby is very grand, and romantic and great if you are looking to impress. I was there to propose to my girlfriend,...but don't expect the hotel to go out of their way to help make it a memory for you. I wanted to propose on the roof top, and had notified the hotel prior, but they close the pool area at 6pm, and the rest of the roof was for a private art party. (Generally in hotels... public areas are not used for Private Functions). The F&B is very expensive... I brought a beer and a bottle of water and it cost 17 Euros... I had to laugh at the Rip-Off. They could have at least showed a little service, or brought it over to me and my GirlFriend who were sitting down. On a good note,.... the Hotel is amazing...I mean,... it is truely 5-Star in Looks...and the Rooms are very nice with Old Wood Beam ceilings....truely very luxury, and I have stayed at many many 5 Star Hotels before. The breakfast was very good, and the F&B staff were very professional and welcoming. They have a huge buffey for 30 Euro's for two people...which is fair as far as North American standards would go. I would stay again...but purely only for the hotel....and not the staff. They really need a Front Office Manager who can motivate, stimulate, and engage their staff. Just because I had booked on Priceline didn't mean I needed to be treated poorly. I was stil paying $250 USD per night. I would recommend it, provided you can look past the Desk Staff Service. The Concierge were very good!...but reluctant to help with luggage. I watched on let a bag fall into a guest, and then argue with another staff member, but the other two were good. I did find some ants in the lobby bathroom toilet...and notified the staff... were seemed suprised.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING hotel, but on the expensive side”
Reviews.Author: BethanieKay
Reviews.Content: My corporate travel department booked this hotel for me for a recent trip to Venice. Being a Hilton brand, I knew it would be a nice hotel - however, I had no idea it would be so absolutely incredible. The building itself is amazing - it's an old renovated flour mill that has been creatively restored and transformed into this gorgeous modern hotel. So, as you're walking through the hotel, parts are very luxurious and modern, and other parts feel like a medieval Venetian fortress. Hilton has done a wonderful job of maintaining the historical aspect of this 13-building compound, while allowing all of the luxuries of a 5 star hotel. My room was on the 7th (top) floor, and I had an absolutely incredible view out my bathroom and bedroom windows of Venice and the Guidecca canal. The room itself was gorgeous - Victorian style decoration, huge comfortable bed, tall ceilings, beautiful chandelier, lovely Venetian photographs adorning the walls, and the usual amenities you'd expect in a Hilton hotel; flat screen TV, work desk with high speed Internet, etc. I especially enjoyed the "welcome" letter signed by the manager of the hotel and the box of Venetian chocolates that were waiting for me on the table when I first walked into my room. What a wonderful, personal touch! I can also gush on and on about the bathroom - wow was it gorgeous! It had a bathtub with 2 windows that looked out over Venice, a glass shower, toilet and bidet, beautiful sink, tile and fixtures, and fuzzy robe and wall heater to warm the towels. Another fabulous feature of this hotel was the rooftop bar, which offered incredible views over Venice at sunset. There is also an amazing pool in the rooftop, with plush lounge chairs on the sundeck, and even a lifeguard. As one of the tallest buildings in Venice, the views from this hotel were fabulous. We had the breakfast buffet, which was very pricey, but had an amazing assortment of fruits, breads, meats, cheeses, etc. I think some room rates may include breakfast, but ours did not. The food was amazing, but I'm not sure the price was worth it. The staff overall were amazing - true to Hilton standards as far as quality of service, helpfulness and courtesy. The only downside to this hotel is that it is on Guidecca islan, which is across the Guidecca canal from the main part of Venice where most of the attractions are. The hotel does offer a courtesty boat/shuttle from the dock directly in front of the main door of the hotel, across to the water-bus stop of Zattere and on to the Piazza San Marco stop, but the timetables did not always work for us. Twice we had to take the water-bus to another stop on Guidecca island and walk to the hotel. It's good to allow plenty of time to get around Venice; boats take a long time with the slow speed they are required to travel, and boat/shuttle times may not always mesh with your schedule. Otherwise, this is an incredible hotel. It's definitely not for the budget-conscious traveler, but if you can manage to get a good rate, it's worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: HappyCamper3L.A.
Reviews.Content: We got to Venice a day early for a cruise leaving from that port and had a great room with a beautiful view of the canal and St Mark's Square in the distance. The food was a little expensive but the breakfast buffet was the best I have ever seen. Staff was friendly and helpful with assisting us to find transportation. Our room was terrific too and had windows that opened for fresh air.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with fantastic views, but a tad expensive”
Reviews.Author: InterationalTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a lovely city, a great place to stay for a romantic trip. The hotel is very attractive and striking from the outside. And the views from canal facing rooms are just fantastic (ask for one of these). The views from the rooftop pool/bar (8th floor) are even better. Our room was spacious, had a very high ceiling, and seemed very luxurious. I would have been happy to stay for a long time. The breakfast was excellent (though I probably wouldn't have paid for it, were it not included), with a wide selection of fruit, pastries, and made-to-order egg dishes. I might have liked to see more hot dishes, but no big deal. The lounge (for Hilton Gold and Platinum members, or those staying on the executive floor) was a small section of the bar. So it wasn't as nice as the usual Hilton lounge, though it did have some decent snacks. I tried to find out what happened to the real lounge, but didn't get a straight answer. We actually walked through the real lounge (it's still there and the doors were open, but empty of people and staff). As for internet, it's not included and shockingly expensive. Maybe just plan to not use it. The location is great for the views, but (as mentioned by previous reviews) it is a little bother to get across the canal to the interesting sites in Venice. There is the hourly hotel shuttle boat, as well as the public boat-bus service (about 6.5 Euros per trip, or get the daily pass for about 18 Euros). The water is pretty choppy, so this hotel might not be appropriate for people who get motion sick easily or don't like boats. We used points for our stay because the prices were absolutely shocking. We were glad we stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Wow. Great place.”
Reviews.Author: IWannaGoAgain
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel in an amazing place. We had a fantastic room and loved having access to the executive lounge for snacks and drinks and the wonderful breakfast buffet. Beautiful, large, clean hotel with friendly and helpful folks. Relaxing lobby and bar area. Internet access in the lobby is by the minute and is charged to your room if you like. The hotel is across the water from the sites but they do have their own shuttle boat that picks up near St. Marks. We took the public boat from the train station and had a bit of a challenge finding their dock which is a few bridges past St. Marks (shared with a public boat station). We wound up using the public transportation from the two stops near the hotel more than their shuttle...they run more often and it's a short scenic walk away. Also, their shuttle takes long breaks during the day so be sure you carry a schedule.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: StockportSunny
Reviews.Content: wonderful this hotel is real class. Expensive though for food and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: looneytune123
Reviews.Content: Will not repeat what others have said about how nice the hotel is - elegantly decorated and furnished rooms, sumptous breakfast buffet, great view from the rooftop pool, great service by friendly staff, which is quite different experience from the other Italy hotels we've been on this trip. Being a gold member, was given the VIP card b/c the lounge was not accessible, so you get 50% off food incl room service and 20% off drinks which you can get free on certain times. This hotel is listed in the top luxury hotels in Europe and the food was excellent. There is also a shuttle boat from the hotel to 2 stops - at Zattere and San Marco - wish I knew about this - wasted 28 euro on a 3 day pass - hardly used b/c of the shuttle availability. Also, if you dont want to walk from the reg stop of vaporetto or water bus (Palanca) , take the shuttle boat.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lafayette1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely beautiful! While it is not on the main part of Venice, it is just across the Giudecca Canal. Because of this, they offer a complimentary shuttle. While this is a slight inconvenience, it is well worth it to be in a nice, new, luxurious hotel. You also have a great view of Venice. If you get the complimentary breakfast buffet as part of your reservation, do not miss it! It was filled with all the breakfast staples in addition to many gourmet items. I've never seen a breakfast buffet this extravagent. Also, we received complimentary bottled water and chocolates for the turn down service. While the normal published prices were high, we took advantage of a no cancellation advance promotion and got a very nice room for under $200. They offer internet service/computer in the lobby for a fee. We stayed one night post-cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! Good value”
Reviews.Author: miamiicpa
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. After seeing others in San Marco carrying there bags over bridges to get to their hotel it was great to be right on the canal across the way. I got a great rate for a std rm 154EU incl breakfast. We did get a standard room with no view -which was fine. The room is still smaller than American sz rooms but spacious for european size. I would rate it a 4 1/2 star hotel. The concierge was amazing and when I asked about a restaurant I had read about they quickly requested if we wanted a reservation. Also when I called to request addt'l toiletries not only were they delivered within 10 minutes I got a follow up call to make sure everything was to my satisfaction. Regarding the location its literally across across the canal closer than expected. The shuttle only goes to San Marco 1 time every hour and is very timely I wish it would run more often - I suggest you purchase a vaporetto pass (do it early thru veniceconnected.com for a discount) as there is a stop 3 minutes from the hotel and will allow you to come and go as you please. We ended up getting the pass for 2 of the 4 days of our stay and it was great. We took the vaporetto directly to the Rialto Bridge, Murano and to catch the train for our next stop. To get to the hotel splurge and take a water taxi. We purchased tickets inside the airport for the Alilaguna which was 1.5 hr ride and not what I expected. You are inside a boat (I thought it would be open air) its warm and after a ten hour flight it would have been nice to be in the hotel in a 1/2 hr. The hotel restaurant is very expensive. The rooftop bar was great and reasonably pricey. The breakfast was good, its a buffet plus they will make eggs or waffles to order, its not a huge brunch or even cruise buffet but satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome hotel, in great city”
Reviews.Author: jhakimmd
Reviews.Content: located on a secluded island, this was an awsome hotel, nice ventian breeze with all the things a usa traveler would like. totally up to standard. really nice breakfast in the morning. I used my hilton high honors points to stay here, and the executive level rooms are really nice with a view of the canal, and a great breeze in the morning. When you run down the island there is a grocery store and nice restaurants nearby that are very reasonable. The pool on the top of the hotel is the envy of the city. The hotel is expesive at 350 euros each night, but it is well worth it to splurge with hilton high honors points. i was dissapointed that they charged 30 pence a minute to use the internet. if you are a business traveler, you will find no internet hotspot in all of venice, and the internet charge at the hotel is obscenely high. the gym is very average and doesnt have much stuff. in general, this is an expensive place.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific experience, I'd come back again”
Reviews.Author: skwood
Reviews.Content: I admit that I had a great deal -- I was using Hilton points and stayed for free -- but I would still recommend this hotel highly. I was concerned because it was across the canal from the main part of Venice, but the hotel has a free shuttle that runs every 30 minutes to/from St. Mark's or Zattere and it was very convenient. BTW, anyone can get the shuttle if you would just like to see Giudecca or wander around in a part of Venice is not tourist infested. In fact, although Venice was not over-crowded during my trip, I think it would be a plus to be able to escape some of the high season craziness. I was upgraded to a suite overlooking Venice and the room was lovely. large, and very quiet. And while the hotel is enormous (used to be a factory) I thought it had a lot of charm. I see previous reviewers commented about the price of everything. It certainly is true that the lobby bar's espresso was very expensive, even for Venice. But you can get on the shuttle to the Zattere stop (5 minutes) and have lots of less expensive, pleasant choices. The roof bar was actually not too expensive, and the evening view of Venice is lovely -- worth a visit even if you are not staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comes with it's own water taxi”
Reviews.Author: RobReno
Reviews.Content: Big and fancy, even for a Hilton. Start with the water taxi that picks you up (or drops you off) at St. Mark's Square. Room was up-to-date and beautiful. View was great. Largest buffet breakfast I've ever seen - and good. Staff was English speaking and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very beautiful building succesfully renovated”
Reviews.Author: columela
Reviews.Content: I have stayed for four nights in this hotel while attending a medical conference in this town. The hotel is in a very beautiful location, just at the west side of Giudecca island, looking over the Giudecca canal. It is a wonderful former sugar factory made in red brick and iron dating from the beginning of the 20th century. The rooms are spacious and well decorated, unless we did not have a very nice view (a building site) but it was a very reduced rate so no complaints there. There was no noise and no bad smells at all. The shuttle boat is extremely puctual and brings you in no time to the main Venice islands. The staff was quite helpful, spoke good english (and some even good spanish) and was very polite. On the bad side , the internet connection was extremely expensive, and not fast at all. I cannot comment on the restaurants there as the prices were completely outlandish (example Hilton cheese burger 27 â‚¬) and there were other options nearby which were interesting and not so expensive (Venice is expensive anyway). In summary, a very pleasant experience, although there is certainly scope for improvement in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: knorc
Reviews.Content: Got a room for $149 on Priceline. This was a great hotel. If it wasn't for the Venice public transportation strike while we were there (which made its location a bit inconvenient) it would have been perfect. Ask Priceline for a 5-star venice hotel and you are likely to get the Hilton Molino Stucky. Best value in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Its a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: mlockwood
Reviews.Content: Everything you would expect from the Hilton Brand. Great rooms, very clean, beautiful decorating and you get nickled and dimed for everything. It was also across the water from "downtown" Venice, which means you can take the vaporetto bus (7.50E/pp) or the Hilton Shuttle (free) which runs once an hour. If I were to do it again I would spend the extra money and stay "downtown" much more convienent and walkable from the Train Station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: T1bby
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Molino Stucky Venice in August 2008 for 3 nights. The location is good, Giudecca Island is a short boat ride from Venice, and the hotel has a two an hour shuttle boat service. There are also several boats that stop at Giudecca that are a 5 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel is huge. The room was standard; we didnâ€™t have breakfast there as it is quite an expensive hotel. The staffs were very unfriendly. We didnâ€™t stay at the hotel much but it s good base for Venice. However the hotel did have a rooftop swimming pool with beautiful view of Venice. Venice however, is the most beautiful place I have ever been too and it was worth staying at the Hilton just for that.

Reviews.Title: “Shame on you for how you treated us.”
Reviews.Author: raleighschwinn
Reviews.Content: Having read other reviews about the construction, I was apprehensive about our stay here. Let me warn everyone that one side of the hotel faces a construction pit complete with construction equipment and noise. It you stand facing Venice and the hotel is behind you, then it is the side of the building on your right. We are Hilton Diamond Members and used points for our stay. Check in went smoothly. We learned that we were upgraded to a suite (guess what side of the building it was on), had complimentary breakfast and access to the executive lounge for evening appetizers. Arrived at our room and opened the curtains to reveal the view and accompanying noise directly below our fourth floor window. Immediately we decided the room was not for us because of the noise and the view. Now we knew why we were upgraded to the suite. Within five minutes we were back at the front desk to ask them to change our room and were informed there wasn't another room available. Not one single room was available. I guess none of the other guests wanted to stay in that room either. We made our reservation back in January and they must have been holding this peaceful room with a wonderful view specifically for us--only for us loyal diamond members. Shame on you Hilton for treating loyal customers that way. When we complained and asked to speak to the manager, the front desk clerk called for security. Talk about intimidation. Talk about customer service. Shame on you for putting us in this uncomfortable position. At that point about seven other individuals came to the front desk to see what all the commotion was about . One of these individuals we concluded was someone in authority and she proceeded to assist us. She informed us that she could provide us with a standard room overlooking Venice but it would not be a suite. It took us all of a nanosecond to decide that this room would be fine. She took us to the room to get our approval and it was fine and the view was fine and it was quiet. That is all that we wanted. Shame on you for not giving us this choice in the beginning. When we looked back on the experience, we concluded that they threw in all the comps so that we wouldn't complain about the location of the suite. What they should have done when we checked in was give us the option of a suite overlooking the construction site or give us a standard room overlooking Venice. They should have let us check out the suite and then let them know our decision. This approach could have avoided the subsequent scene at the front desk where we were told there were no more rooms. The blame rests solely on the General Manager for condoning this type of behavior and leading hotel guest to believe that it is that room or no other room. I thought to myself about the other guests who checked in later that day. If there were no more rooms for us to switch to, then where did they stay. By the way, to smooth things over, they delivered a bottle of Bellini to our room with a welcome note. Ironically we don't drink. Aside from the initial room assignment, everything else about the hotel was fine and I would recommend it to anyone as long as they aren't on the construction side of the building. It is unfortunate that we had to be put through the experience of insensitive personnel at the Molino Stucky Hilton and I want to alert others so that they don't have the same experience that we did. Enjoy your stay but throw in a pair of ear plugs just in case...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Far from the Crowds”
Reviews.Author: intsik
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is on Giudecca, the island below the the lagoon. I was initially skeptical because it wasn't right bang on the center of the action, but it turned out to be the best thing about it. It is easy enough to get to via public transport, and the hotel has a shuttle to the San Marco. Beware if you have bags though, there are a couple of bridges to cross to get to the hotel. The hotel itself is beautiful. It is a converted flour mill, and inside, a lot of the architectural detail has been preserved, making for a very pretty place. The room is spacious, and the bathroom is awesome. Only downside is that value-wise, it is a bit pricey. We got breakfast with our room, which was excellent, but otherwise it would cost a lot. The other food outlets were very expensive compared to what you could get in normal restaurants.Internet was kind of pricey. Go to the rooftop bar though, it gives a great view. The pool was closed when we were there, but it is also up on the roof. Service, especially in the breakfast room, is excellent. And be sure to explore Giudecca. There isn't a lot about it in guidebooks, but it is fun to go around it to see how the locals live.

Reviews.Title: “A luxury experience”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Peg
Reviews.Content: A great Hilton experience. A bit a of distance from the center of Venice, but they offer a free water taxi back and forth at regular intervals. A plush and beautiful hotel. We were fortunate to be able to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great priceline value”
Reviews.Author: fielbard
Reviews.Content: Beautiful new hotel in Giudecca, a 10 minute boat ride from St. Mark's Square in the heart of florence. Beautiful rooftop patio. Spacious rooms, elegant lobby, and charming decor. Service was somewhat disappointing for a hilton -- our room was unbearably hot as the A/C was not in service for the duration of our stay -- would have expected more from a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Newer Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: CiaoBellaBunny
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Molino Stucky is very nice hotel. The hotel complex is very big and new. The rooms were clean, offered a good amount of space, and the bathroom was very spacious. Our room was located in the front of the hotel (although the hotel tried to take me out of the room even though Iâ€˜m a HiltonHonors member) so we had a view of the main waterway and Venice. We didnâ€™t eat at the hotel but we did go to the SkyBar twice for a drink and that was a good spot to start the night. For your stay if your looking for a newer hotel in Venice with bars and places to eat this would be a good choice. If you want the smaller European hotel atmosphere with the free breakfast youâ€™ll want to stay somewhere else. I called ahead to find out how to get to the hotel as we were arriving by train. The hotel told me to get on public water taxi #41 and get off at the 4th stop (Palanca). Once we got off the water taxi the hotel was a 5 minute walk away. Now, we had to wait 20 minutes for the water taxi at the train station on a crowded dock, when the water taxi came it was over crowded with people, we have all our luggage, once we get off the water taxi we had to walk about a Â½ mile to the hotel with our luggage , and the walk to the hotel included two bridges. I would recommend hiring a private water taxi as these boats dock right at the hotel, but youâ€™ll need to spend extra euros for this. The convenience of the private water taxi should be worth the extra money. I hired a private water taxi the day we left and for 100 Euro the taxi takes you directly to the airport, about a 40 minute boat ride. It is impossible to get coffee in the hotel unless you order the very expensive room service. We ordered room service one morning just to get coffee and they charged an 8 Euro delivery fee. The total bill was 35 Euro for a continental breakfast with coffee. The hotel water taxi was fine but you are on their schedule. We walked to St. Markâ€™s one day and we decided to take the Hilton water taxi back to the hotel from that point. The funny thing was the Hilton dock wasnâ€™t identified for the us and we actually had to follow the boat as it was coming over in the water to find the dock. We werenâ€™t the only guests of the hotel watching to see where the boat was going to dock. Some of the staff was very friendly and helpful but others just not as friendly. When we stayed at the hotel there was a big corporate function going on and the group just seemed to always be everywhere, they just overwhelmed the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Molino Stucky”
Reviews.Author: karen400
Reviews.Content: The room is fine and what you would find at any Hilton but the service staff were not friendly and at times unhelpful. Simple requests like getting ice were ignored. Our trip coincided with a big convention so most of their attention was to the group and not the individuals. The hotel is in Giudecca and although they provide shuttle service, keep in mind that it is out of the way. And as for their food, at first the breakfast buffet looks very impressive but the actual taste of the food was mediocre at best. Would not choose this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great view, really enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: sheeney7
Reviews.Content: We used our points to stay here, and when we first checked in, I asked if there were any available upgrades for Hilton honors members. She right away gave us a room with a Venice view, that was truly unforgettable. It didn't include the executive lounge with breakfast (an additional $50) but we didn't mind...we're not much breakfast people anyway. But the room did include an assortment of hot tea every morning, which was lovely. I really liked the building, and the inside was so lovely. The shower was definitely a bit crammed, and very narrow. We did discover, on our second to last day, that there was a wonderful spa with a jacuzzi and very very unique steam room (go check out the steam room when you're there....so cool!), and a refreshment lounge that was very relaxing after a long day of walking. Take advantage of the spa area. The free shuttle was nice, and used just enough. One thing I wasn't expecting, from Venice, was how rude the Italians are. Maybe it's just a cultural thing, or maybe they truly are sick of all the tourists, but I was so shocked at how incredibly rude (by American standards) the people are. There is no customer service, and no one smiles. I was looking like a fool, walking around, smiling to everyone. Haha, I guess you just don't smile in Venice. We spent 3 nights at the Hilton, and honestly, we were ready to get out of there (not because of the Hilton, but just because of Venice in general). We went on to much nicer parts of Italy (Cinque Terre, and Florence). 1 or 2 nights in Venice is plenty. Really. Someone told me that, and I didn't believe them--but it's true. But I would definitely recommend staying at the Hilton. The views are incredible if you get a Venice view--you can even see the Swiss Alps! One complaint I have about the hotel, is that even though it was freezing in Venice when we went, the hallways out side of our room were always blazing hot. Right when we got out of the elevator, it was like humid and warm. Really weird. But didn't feel like that in our room ever. Just something little to complain about. Oh, and WAY too expensive to use their internet: 27 Euros for 24 hours. It was ridiculous. Oh AND it was literally $45 for a burger at one of their restaurants. We of course didn't get it, and could only laugh at how utterly insane that was. But worth mentioning on here: don't eat at the hotel! Other than that, it was a fabulous place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ddilkens
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed one night at this hotel in Venice. We had a great room overlooking the lagoon and Venice. The service was great...the breakfast was great and the view from the roof was even better. We passed on the special Sushi night....a little too pricey but walked down to a restaurant just 200m from the hotel and had a great meal. The private hotel water taxi is convenient and reliable and the vaparetto service is very convenient but requires a 5 minute walk which can be long with a lot of luggage. Thankfully this wasn't an issue for us. The hotel used to be an old flour factory and has been beautifully restored. It really is great. If I go back to Venice I would stay here again. It is quiet and very close to all of the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel That”
Reviews.Author: tommytourz
Reviews.Content: My family and I loved this hotel. The facilities are in perfect condition and we enjoyed the charm of the old factory. Our room, with high ceilings, was large by European or U.S. standards, looked out onto the water, and we were able to watched huge cruise ship slip on by. This location (which we liked) was quiet because it was across the water away from all of the sights. Transportation by the hotel's private boat or the Vaporetto stop a short walk away made it easy to get quickly back and forth to the sights and the crowds although the crowds do dissipate in the evening. The roof top pool was not crowded and the views were wonderful. The concierge lounge was one of the best of any Hilton Iâ€™ve stayed; or for any hotel chain for that matter. For a romantic stay you may want to stay in Venice proper but for everyone else you just canâ€™t go wrong with this great place to enjoy all that Venice has to offer. ttz

Reviews.Title: “Good Overall”
Reviews.Author: SDWanderlust
Reviews.Content: Disclosure: I stayed at this hotel in Oct 2008 for three nights. I donâ€™t think things have changed much. Location: Giudecca Island and therefore one needs to take a shuttle boat to the side have sightseeing etc. The location can be a blessing or a curse depending on oneâ€™s taste. I personally liked because it was sort of away from the touristy crowd. Having said that, I missed being able to walk out of the door to fun places. First time to Venice many years ago, I stayed at a more central area. Overall, I think that location should not be a deciding factor for staying at this places there are many pluses at this hotel. Room: It was really spacious and had flat screen TV and all the amenities one expects at this category. The bathroom was spacious and well stocked with Evenly and Crabtree toiletries. Beds and pillow were comfortable. However, I had a real grip with the bed size. We had two beds in the room. The beds were extremely small. The hotel claimed they were twin size. I did not think so. It was so small that I was afraid to fall onto the floor during the night. I have a rather small frame 1.70 meter in height and 60kg. I cannot imagine how other larger folks can manage on these small beds. I will post a picture or two for you to see. The book on the bed was â€œTime Out to Veniceâ€� so you will have a sense of scale of the bed. Facilities: Pool was closed. The rooftop bar had a really good view to the other islands on a clear day. Lobby was large. Everything seemed to be adequate. Services: It was definitely was not 5-star service. When I checked in, there was only one receptionist doing the checking in. I had to wait a really long time to get checked in. It was about 20 minutes or so. There was only one person ahead of me. I had no idea what the hold up was. I thought it was bad having to wait that long. I almost lost my temper. The concierge was good when I asked questions and they were really helpful and friendly. The boat shuttle service was prompt and adequate. However, they do have an hour break during the lunch hour. Recommendation: Overall, I do recommend this place for it spaciousness and cleanliness and a bit away from the busy tourist area. Just donâ€™t expect white glove service like the Four Seasons or the Pen and nothing really special in terms of dÃ©cor here. Just like the typical Hilton anywhere else except those surprisingly small beds.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Venice........”
Reviews.Author: rmg88
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel to be of very high quality. Stayed for 3 nights during the summer and loved every minute of it. Our room was very spacious and spotless. Had a beautiful bathroom, extremely comfortable bed and great view (would give a sea view room as a preference) and a very large t.v. The staff were very polite and helpful and we were made to feel very welcome. Had dinner in their Aromi restaurant, which was absolutely sublime, although a bit expensive. My only complaints would be that, the breakfast area isn't really big enough for the amount of guests, and can get very crowded and loud. And also, it would be nice if there pool was a bit bigger. But besides from those, I would most definately return again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hiltons around!”
Reviews.Author: pikapptcu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the week before Carnivale. We checked in on a Tuesday night. The place was dead.....only 24 guests that night! We were immediately upgraded to a suite for the length of our stay. I must say this Hilton is super clean and new. I am a gold member with Hilton and this is the nicest Hilton I have stayed in to date. The suite had plenty of room with sitting area, nice size bath room, and separate bed room. Not much of a view, but we could see the main island from our room. We had some wine in the bar and were given a discount because the Hhonors lounge was not open. Since it was slow the rooftop bar was not open during our stay. I wish it had been so we could enjoy the views while sipping wine. We also wanted to watch the sun rise and were not able to from the roof. We headed down to the cafe by the Vapereto stop and enjoyed a coffee one morning. My only gripe is with the free Hilton shuttle......it seemed to run on the drivers wn schedule versus the published scheduled. He'll also skip the stop across from the Hilton, even on the scheduled times. We found out the hard way as we were left at the dock as he sailed on by once......so we headed back into town and drank more wine ;)

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, for a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: GoCommando
Reviews.Content: Excuse the title but having stayed in a lot of Hilton finest in london and elsewhere I was expecting overpriced averageness but got a pleasant surprise. This is a high class hotel. We were there just as the hotel opened and I think there were a couple of teething problems but nothing important. This was a mini honeymoon for us and we enjoyed our time in Venice very much. Don't be put off by the fact that this hotel is away from the main part of Venice, it takes literally a few minutes on the hotel launch and I'd rather be here than stuck in the melee around Piazza San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: corky_c
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous hotel in true Hilton style. The Hilton Molino Stucky is located on Guidecca Island off Venice so it's not in the main island iteself. However, that's not a problem as the hotel has a regular service to a couple of stops on the main island. It was late at night when we arrived by boat at the hotel and a bellboy was waiting for us at the pier and promptly took our luggage from the boat and into the hotel. So far so good... At reception, we were the only customers there at that time and had to wait a good 10 mins before we were served as there was only one person at the check-in counter and she was on the phone (note to customer service: serve the people right there first, and call back the person on the line). After this initial hiccup though the rest of the service (concierge, housekeeping) at the hotel was impeccable. I booked a standard room using my Hilton Honours points. We got a room overlooking the water and with a view of Venice. The room, as with most Hilton rooms, was very spacious. The bathroom was large, with marble tiles and was beautifully done. As with most Hilton hotels, they had Crabtree and Evelyn toilettries, which I love. Overall I was very happy with this hotel. The only thing that could have been improved was the check-in process but other than that everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: msteBG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Molino during our first visit to Venice, we were travelling through Italy on the way back to Sofia, and chose to stay right in the heart of venice rather than one of the many hotels outside. On arrival in venice we had to park the car at the station and take one of the many waterboats to the hotel. Arrival itself was a small adventure but well worth it when we arrived. Reception was first class, they gave us a very nice room, sightly small but well equipped and extremely comfortable, quiet and with a view over the canal over to St Marks square. What a wonderful view, maybe one of the best in the world? Breakfast was excellent with a wide range of food, excellent service and good value. The hotel is a large, old and extremely interesting building, full of interest and charachter. Well worth a trip to the rooftop for stunning views of venice and there is a pool, although too cold in January to use. Unfortunately the fog rolled in during the late afternoon, but I am sure in Summer this would be a fantastic place. The Hotel has a shuttle which runs regularly accrosss the canel to the main island and over to St Marks square. perfect. Really hard to find anything wrong with this hotel, if I was to make a suggestion it would be to pick up guests from the station and take them direct to the hotel, rather than having to take the public water transport or a private boat. I have stayed in many hilton hotels during my working life, and always thought they were a very corporate experience, but this one was a notch above, excellent service, very nice rooms and of course how could anyone ever complain about the location ! Well done Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Gross lack of customer service nearly ruined the 3 nights stay”
Reviews.Author: xyz35
Reviews.Content: Wanted to celebrate my wife's birthday (1 week after) in the festive season in the romantic Venice. So used 120000 Hilton Honours rewards point to book this hotel. The check in clerk did not seem to know her job. We asked for a upgrade with the silver VIP status and her supervisor wanted to charge us extra 70 Euros per night although there was availability and by Hilton rules, if there is availibility then the hotel should upgrade you. This took time before the clerk got the ok. The supervisor made us wait after a long journey and refused to include this and said other Hilton hotels were wrong to offer this without charge. We compalined and after a long wait managed to see the duty manager. After a lengthy discussion, he offered us use of executive lounge but no breakfast. He did apologise but the superviser still had 'could not care less' attitude. After a realtively long and tiring journey in cold weather, our holiday managed to ruin any happiness. Then the upgraded room they had assigned had bad toilet smell as soon as we entered in and the porter then agreed about the bad smelland talked to someone and then moved us to another room. They provide complimentary water to silver VIP Hilton Honours members but we had to remind them after 2 days of no such service ! We just were to check out after this terrible experience. The hotel management seem not to know the festive Christams spirit to treat the customer or care ! When the marketing people and the big wigs at Hilton timeshare talk about ' Great gateaway and grand customer care that they pamper the customers' they need a bit of experience we had, before making tall talks and marketing claims/promises !!

Reviews.Title: “Historic amazing buidling, free shuttle boat!”
Reviews.Author: LilyPip
Reviews.Content: This hotel thoroughly impressed me. It was once an old flour mill and the Hilton has transformed it into a luxury hotel while still keeping all its historic charm. We booked just a standard room which was far above standard. The hotel staff were friendly and they even had a free and regular shuttle boat that took guests to the mainland and picked them up again. Even though the hotel is not on the main island of Venice, it did not prove to be a hassle at all and in fact proved to be far more relaxing being away from the crowds. I will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “A gem that shines but could glitter”
Reviews.Author: brendoon
Reviews.Content: When staying at the Hilton, go direct by water taxi if you have flown in as it could be a long wait to use public transport. Saves time and you settle straight in - its worth the 100 euro. Reception is one area that the Hilton could improve. Checking in/out can be a problem as limited staff. This may have been due to being low season but this is one area they need to review The hotel otherwise was fantastic and staff were attentive to any requests. The hotel shuttle service is good and using this in combination with the normal water buses is no hassle seeing all of Venice. It was nice to withdraw to this hotel after a hectic day checking all the sites and knowing that its all across the canal. If you are lucky and get a front viewing room, you may get to see cruise ships floating pass your windows which was a pleasant surprise

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Oberschwabe
Reviews.Content: Fine hotel, a really good choice if you want to avoid any risks to find yourself in a tiny, dark, noisy and overprized room (as it often happens in â€“ even â€œluxuryâ€� â€“ Venice hotels). A little downside is the location, as you have to catch a boat for the main parts of Venice, but the trip just takes some minutes and can be funny (especially when you take the free hotel shuttle with its â€œCapitanoâ€� flirting with every goodlooking female person nearbyâ€¦ ). Our room (superior) was perfect and a real hideaway after long footwalks through the Venice quarters. Breakfast is very stylish (on executive floor), fine selection with nice presentation. We would definitively stay there again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very nice!”
Reviews.Author: olimaspecto
Reviews.Content: Booked three rooms here at $120/night + taxes (so about $145 total per room/night) on Priceline as a 5* in Venice proper. The hotel is located on an island about 15 minutes by boat from St. Markâ€™s square but has free shuttle service to St. Markâ€™s square (as well as an intermediate stop) every hour from 8am to 11pm. The hotel is very nice and modern (its only about a year old), and when we were there it was definitely far from full occupancy â€“ not that unusual given that it is the off season. As a Hilton Diamond we received access to the Executive lounge (basically a sectioned off area off the lobby, though they do have a full, expansive executive lounge on the 6th floor, but for whatever reason it is not in use currently) as well as free breakfast at Il Molino restaurant in the morning. The hotel is very American in feeling and what it lacks in charm or eccentricites it makes up for in style and amentities. Iâ€™d definitely recommend this property for a trip to Venice, given both the location, quality and pricing it offers a nice combination of quality and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: IrishDawgTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect escape from the crowds of Venice. Beautiful on the outside and luxurious on the inside, it was a nice change from our stay at the supposedly #2 Bed and Breakfast in Rome. (See Rome Post) We are Hilton Gold and were upgraded to a large room on a high floor as well as breakfast each morning. The room was very clean, modern, and comfortable. Breakfast each morning was more than filling - make sure you try the hot chocolate! The shuttle from the hotel to the Vaporetti stops across the water was very convenient; however, the Vaporetti stop just down from the hotel was equally easy to use. If you get a bus pass while you're there then it makes it simple to plan your trip. We'd stay here again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Stunned by the mix of old and new”
Reviews.Author: Venezianuts
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed in high class hotels good and bad across the world, but the Stucky Hilton took our breath away with the enormity of the project and the fabulous mix of old and new. We arrived late on Christmas Eve for a 3 night stay, and it was surreal to be just two of a very small number in such a large complex. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff on duty over Christmas, and our first floor room overlooking the Giudecca Channel was absolutely perfect. Had we been staying for longer than three nights the amount of hanging space in the surprisingly small wardrobe might have been an issue. The carpet in our room was also a little grubby, and again, it was a surprise that a hard floor material had not been used in construction instead of carpet. The marble floor in the bathroom was beautiful. The shower area in the bath was a little small but, it's not a major issue, and the water flow and temperature were perfect. All the food we were served was top class, although a little short on quantity, the fillet steak probably the most tender we have ever experienced, truly melt-in-the-mouth. The shuttle boat was always on time and was well run, and if we wanted to go somewhere outside the shuttle timetable there is a handy vaperetto stop just five minutes walk away. In summary, we had a fantastic time, the staff were superb, the food excellent and above all the hotel itself is another reason for visiting Venice, if any more are needed. Our only real gripe? The price of the food and drinks is quite frankly exorbitant. The 1:1 exchange rate of Euro to GBP means that a bottle of Nastro beer is Â£8, and a bottle of water from the minibar is Â£6. The cheapest wine on the menu is Â£39. We pushed the boat out on the first night as it was our Christmas meal but, we did hold back a little on our third evening. Would we go again? Most certainly. As a location for something special it must rate as one of the best, being in the heart of one of the most awe-inspiring cities in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: JimmyJ
Reviews.Content: The arrival to the hotel was a fun experience. Taking the water taxi is the easiest, but will set you back 50 Euro. The hotel is a very nice property. The staff, for the most part, was not so great. The door men were very pleasant, but the desk people and the "Executive Lounge Host" were a different story. I paid for a premium room with a view. I am also a Diamond member which I hoped would guarantee my request. So, I was told I was upgraded to a "Suite with a wonderful view". I was happy to hear that everything was going as expected. I have read, in previous posts, to be careful about the view because their idea of a view may be different than yours. So we get into our room to be accosted with a terrible view! I would prefer no window at all. Please see attached picture. I called the front desk and asked to be moved to a different room, but was told it was "not possible". This was in late November and this is a large hotel. Even yet, I was firmly told that a nicer room was not possible. I said I didn't care about the suite, just give me a room with any other view. It was not possible. I can't tell you how disappointed I was. When looking at the pictures, please keep in mind that many people pay a much higher rate for this "Suite". Beware. The room itself was nice, but there was not enough hot water to take a normal shower. I called to remedy this issue, but was informed that it was "not possible". Very strange. As far as the "Executive Lounge", it is a joke. It took us 2 days to realize that it is not located on the top floor, as the staff and signs would lead you to believe, but it is actually in the normal lounge. It is a row of tables in the bar. The lady in charge of this section is easily unlikeable. Her attitude was more of a prison guard than a helpful guest attendant. She scorned some poor older lady for dropping a glass and breaking it and mumbled something about a bill. We were told that we cannot bring food into the "Executive Lounge" from the bar, yet the day before we did. The next day others were as well. There is no real separation from the regular lounge and the Exec Lounge, which is not an issue for me, but why can't I eat a burger at one table and not the table next over? Ridiculous! There is no sense of order in this matter and the lady in charge makes it even more frustrating. The free shuttle is a god send, because without it, you are pretty much stranded. The boat captain is very nice and prompt. The hotel will lead you to believe there are no shops or food to be had on the island. Don't believe them! Our last day, we finally made a short trip around the island and found 2 pharmacies, 2+ restaurants, and a grocery store! Good to know because the food prices at the Hilton are even more expensive than usual Hilton fare. If you are one to wake up and go out strolling around the city, make a pit stop back at the room to freshen up or take a nap, and then head out again for more sights, this location will cramp your style. It is not very convenient. You will need to plan your activities around the shuttle service. All in all, the place is nice and the rooms are small, new, and nice. If they could get their act together, it may have been a more pleasant experience. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HelenM30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Molino Stucky for 2 nights in November and had a fabulous time. It was clean and well presented with amicable but not over friendly staff. We booked the hotel through Priceline which didn't include breakfast. If you buy breakfast when you are there it is about 25 euros each!!! You are better off heading across the water and having a coffee and croissant at the little coffee shop on the front for a couple of euros. The complimentary water shuttle from the hotel is very frequent and runs until around midnight. On arrival at Marco Polo airport you can either take the bus to Venice (cheapest and quickest option) or a water bus (most scenic) which drops you off in St Marks Square then just take the complimentary water shuttle bus to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Molino Stuckey”
Reviews.Author: auvixen
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay through Priceline and the hotel was very reasonable. The hot chocolate in the lounge is a must for chocolate addicts. Great staff! The morning breakfast served in the restaurant is buffet only for about 40 euro. Save your money and get a delicious omelet in the lobby/bar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jon402
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed here in March 08 and we found the property to be absolutely beautiful. The staff were professional and our room was very modern and looked out over the property through a huge floor to ceiling window. The window was almost the entire bedroom wall, pretty cool. The room was adequate in size with a nice bathroom and was very comfortable. The big flat screen was great for relaxing after lots of walking. The only thing we did not like was the time it took to get to the main part of Venice. Though they did have a private, complementary boat it still took way longer to get back and forth than if we had stayed somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: JacobSweden
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with very nice view over Venice. The shuttle boat is great and runs on time several times every hour. Our experience would have been greater if we not would have been given a room at the first floor, quite noisy and not quite the view as the other floors. Had dinner one night at one of the hotel's restaurants, was ok, recommend that one books other restaurants in Venice that the very professional conciere can assist you with. Dont miss the rooftop bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hilton”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravelers
Reviews.Content: We arrived to Venice by train and took Vaporetto Line 2 downstream to the Palanca stop and walked to the hotel (turn right when leaving the stop). We used our points to stay at this hotel. We were visiting Italy for 2 weeks and Venice was our last stop and it was our anniversary. When booking the room, we put in the comments that it was our anniversary. The hotel had a bottle of Bellini and a card waiting in our room (it's the thought that was appreciated). After 11 nights in budget rooms throughout Italy, this hotel offered great comfort. We had a smooth check in and was on our way to our room on the 5th floor (519). The room is very nice, decorated in a melon color and dark wood. The bathroom in marble, with a shower and a tub, a vanity and a bidet. The room had a nice, large, flat screen TV (we were there during the US election), large desk, table and chairs and a safe in the closet. There were small drawers in the closet as well. There was also an electric tea pot if you wanted tea. If there was anything to complain about the room, it would be the stained carpet. The hotel is located on the island of Giudecca, but they offer a free shuttle that ran from 0800-2350 while we were there, it may run later in the summer. It left the hotel at :00 and :40 every hour. When leaving at :00, it stopped at Zattere and San Marco. When leaving at :40, it only stopped at Zattere. It left from Zattere back to the hotel at :30 and :45 every hour. It left from San Marco back to the hotel at :20 every hour. There was an hour break between 1340 and 1440 and between 2040 and 2140. I was blown away by the breakfast buffet since we had been used to having cappuccino and a croissant every morning. The buffet had pastries, sliced meat and cheese, fruit, cereal, and hot items: eggs, potatoes, ham, and tomatoes. The ham was delicious! The rooftop pool was closed during our stay in November and you couldn't even walk out by it. The rooftop bar is open in the evening and gives you some view of Venice proper. Internet is available in the lobby for a hefty fee of 0.35 Euros a minute. We flew out of Venice and was able to find our way to the airport without having to pay 100 Euros for a private water taxi. We took the 8am hotel shuttle to the Zattere stop and walked to Piazzale Roma in about 20 minutes. From there, we took the 8:40am bus #5 (2.50 Euro pp) to the airport and was dropped off at the terminal in 25 minutes. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice place with amenities while visiting Venice or anyone looking for a nice place to end a trip to Italy. Just remember that it is a Hilton and may lack some charm experienced in other hotels or B&Bs. I thought it was perfect that we ended our trip here and had a nice romantic, comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable - a lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: globalskier100
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay in the Hilton Molino Stucky. The building is a large landmark and arriving at night on the 'N' vaporetto from Piezzale Roma is spectacular. I had booked the weekend for my boyfriend's 30th and he was very impressed when I pointed out the hotel building, all lit up, as we passed on the boat. Arriving at Piezzale Roma from Treviso airport at around 10.45pm, we weren't sure which vaporetto to catch to get to the hotel, so we called the hotel and the receptionist happily advised us on the best route to take. We had a standard 'king' room in the Arsenale wing. It wasn't huge but certainly a lot bigger than most hotel rooms we've stayed in in Europe. Because they have preserved the exterior of the old flour mill, there was only one window but it was a floor-to-ceiling window that opened fully so there was plenty of light. We had a view across to the main island. All the furnishings, sheets, toiletries etc are lovely. The bathroom was large relative to the size of the room, with a separate bath and shower cubicle. Some reviewers have commented that the hotel's free shuttle bus is infrequent and inconvenient. We only used it once during the whole weekend as the vaporetto service is so good - frequent and quick. The 'Palanca' stop is a 5 minute walk along the waterfront from the hotel and from there you can zip across to the main island very easily. The vaporettos run until very late at night. Saturday evening at the Skyline bar is happy hour with complimentary nibbles. Apart from this we didn't eat or drink at the hotel because we found it overpriced, as is usually the case, compared to the many local bars and eateries around Venice. I chose this hotel because of the competitive rates offered on the Hilton website. We paid Â£117 per night through booking in advance online, which would get you only an average 3 star hotel on the main island. For that reason, it was excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Came unstuck at the Hilton Molino Stucky”
Reviews.Author: Addicked
Reviews.Content: Having been to Venice many times and always staying near St Mark's Square we decided to stay at The Hilton as it looked such an impressive building, and was away from the crowds. We took advantage of a special deal and booked and paid in full 5 months in advance. Just before we arrived we checked availability and found that the rooms were even cheaper. We emailed the hotel cheekily asking for an upgrade as a gesture of goodwill as we'd paid 5 months earlier but didn't receive the courtesy of a reply. Upon arrival we brought this up,but the receptionist just shrugged and said that prices change all the time. Not only did we not get an upgrade but we were given 2 rooms in the Arsenale building, one of which was uninhabitable for the following reason. At 6.30am the first morning we awoke to the sound of people in our room, or so we thought. We could hear every word they said, we could hear them stirring their tea and zipping up their suitcases. It transpired that the walls were wooden and they acknowledged that there were problems in that building. Why they put a family with 2 children in such rooms is surprising, especially as they were not full, and were able to relocate us immediately. Another problem with the room was that cigarette smoke was blowing into it via the air conditioning, on a non-smoking floor. Our next rooms were quiet, but small problems nagged- the toilet flush was faulty, the hairdryer nozzles wouldn't stay on, one shower hose was broken, the ice machine on our floor didn't work. As mentioned in a previous review, the internet charges were very expensive- for 5 days the cheapest price was $108. The staff were hit and miss- some were wonderful, especially in the restaurants, while some on reception, like the one who on check out seemed incredulous that we'd left our luggage in the room to be collected and stored, and the one who told us our pillows were all they had although it was clearly stated others were available on request. On reflection we won't be returning to the Hilton, but will revert to our old favourites.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed in the lack of character”
Reviews.Author: katroisin
Reviews.Content: Stunning views from the roof top bar and pool area although drinks in these areas are very very expensive. Had room looking over water and the cruise ships going by were an amazing sight. Rooms good size and well furnished however housekeeping service not as expected. The hotel is on an island with a free water bus across to St Marks and runs every 30 minutes which is a bit of an inconvenience if out sightseeing all day and back out again at night for dinner. The hotel overall lacked atmosphere and character and the staff although efficient were not particularly friendly but then again not unfriendly, just impersonal. Would I stay here again, probably not .

Reviews.Title: “Zoom Right to the Top!”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaArchitect
Reviews.Content: On our recent trip to Venice my wife and I wanted to stay someplace unique and quiet. The new Molino Stucky was perfect on both counts. We were checked in quickly and shown to a beautiful canal facing room. The views of the snowcapped Dolomites behind Venice and of passing cruise ships was pretty amazing. The hotel is an adaptive reuse of the old Molino Stucky pasta factory, so it has some quirks (like cast iron columns right in the middle of hallways!). The rooms are not huge, but they feature blown glass chandaliers, Fortuny coverlets on the beds, beautiful bathrooms, and wonderful furniture. Lots of attention to detail here. The drawers and cabinet doors actually gently close on their own. The hotel is on Guidecca Island so you are actually staying on a Venetian Island with few tourists and a whole lot of everyday Venetian residents. That makes for some wonderful walks. Although the rooftop pool is small it is one of the only two hotel pools in Venice (Cipriani being the other). If you are HHonors elite member you can have access to the superb executive lounge. The complimentary breakfast in the lounge featured wonderful meats, cereals, and lovely fresh fruits and yogurt. In the evening it was the perfect place to unwind and enjoy a Bellini. If you don't have access to the lounge, you might want to seek food elsewhere. The food is good in the Hilton restaurants, but the $50 tab for breakfast here tips the scale into the realm of absurd. The hotels beautiful fleet of wooden motor launches takes you direct from the hotel to Piazza San Marco at no cost twice an hour. The closest vaporetto stop is quite far away, so if you have a lot of luggage it is better to take a water taxi here. This is a new hotel, so it is not as well known as the other five star establishments. That will change. This hotel is a splurge. But then again, going to Venice is a splurge!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment with first stay in a Hilton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WilliamOmagh
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one week at the Molino Stucky Hilton Hotel in Venice. This was my first time to stay in a Hilton Hotel and I was looking forward to it. I was some what disappointed with the room, cleanning and the level of housekeeping. The sheets were only changed once during the week. Bathroom was not as clean as I expected, floor of it was sticky, did'nt seem clean to me. The overall standard of the room did not reach my expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning location, quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: deehell
Reviews.Content: I had the great fortune to spend 4 nights at the Molino Stucky as part of a work conference in mid September. Location: it's over the water from the main part of Venice but is none the worse for that. It means you get stunning views from the rooftop bar and pool, and there is an excellent (and free) water shuttle that runs throughout the day - usually twice per hour - and much of the night. If you get a water taxi there from the airport, they can take you the slightly longer way round meaning you get the view of St Mark's and the Grand Canal, and it's worth every penny (albeit it will probably cost around 100 Euros). According to my guidebook Giorgio Armani and Elton John both have houses on the island where this hotel is located. If you take a backstreet walk in the evening around the hotel, it's utterly charming with lots of apartments and familes enjoying the evening. Not a lot of restaurants though - although there is a Harry's bar outpost 5 minutes away, if you are ok paying 42 Euros for a plate of pasta.... Rooms: I had a great corner room on the fourth floor with views across the main waterway towards classical Venice. Not spacious by North American standards but given a) it's an old mill and b) European hotel rooms are big on comfort, if not space, it was just fine. Water pressure in shower just the right side of ok. But it's the first room I've stayed in where you get eye to eye with the main deck of a cruise liner as it goes past your window. Do remember to close your blinds! Facilities: an amazing rooftop bar and (small) pool. Stunning views across the lagoon. Even if you don't stay here, it's worth a visit for those views. Public spaces were spacious, airy and hard to fault. Food and drink: yes, it's pricey. 8 euros for a beer and I gather breakfast is the best part of 40 euros. So either be disciplined and get your breakfast in a cafe or take your credit card. The breakfast was excellent quality - very fresh food. Staff: I found the staff charming and very friendly. Even a please and thank you in Italian went some way and they did speak faultless English. I know that some of my colleagues found there wasn't a great sense of urgency for small but important requests - eg an iron early evening to press a shirt or blouse ...and still don't understand why chain hotels like the Hilton don't provide irons and boards as standard. But all my experiences were very positive. They were also keen to go the extra mile for simple requests that were directly within their control. Overall, I'd love to stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “the best 5 star hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Simondrake001
Reviews.Content: An amazing addition to the Venice 5 star section and a worthy winner in my view of best hotel in Venice ! The rooms are sesational and the staff unsurpassed. Quality of food was world class. Will be booking again very soon !

Reviews.Title: “Overall an A”
Reviews.Author: buzzaldren
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was above average. My biggest drawback to the hotel was the expense of Venice. We had drinks at the top of the hotel, which the view was awesome, but the tab was over $40 American for 2 drinks. Also, you need to take a boat everywhere you go. To do to Venice proper the have a shuttle that takes you there. That is pretty cool. That way you are taking a boat everywere. On the other hand, getting to the airport required a water taxi. Also, I thought the concierge pushed affiliated businesses and did not have the guests best interest in mind. We got a free trip to Murano from the hotel but it was purely a sales pitch. It was still free but was like a time-share light. Having said all that, I would stay there again. The hotel was awesome and there was something to be said about being away from the fray.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: olivia727
Reviews.Content: this was a great hotel. beautiful place, great pool (on the roof!), and a fantastic location. complimentary transportation brought us where we needed to go. service was great, kind, knowledgeable staff, and beautiful rooms. we had no complaints, and had a wonderful stay. we were there for only a night, but that was long enough to tell that it was a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: italoanglo
Reviews.Content: the location is not in the centre of venice but it's great location if you want to reach different part of venice quickly. the complemantary transport is great. runs always on time and takes you across the canal or to San marco's Square...you choose. From there you can enjoy the walk in the little canals of venice. stayed for 2 nights. we booked the standard room, which was small but very clean and comfy with a nice bed. that's is only you need because you will only see the hotel room for that few hours while you are sleeping and resting your feet from the extensive walking around. the staff is very pleasent and attentive. i have requested some roses as surprise for my wife and they were there in the room on our arrival...even sprayed to look more shiny! I was expecting an over charge for that but for my surprise was a shop price. will raccomend to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “best view of venice”
Reviews.Author: val t
Reviews.Content: First time that I had bid on priceline but paid Â£119 for a Â£240 hotel room. The hotel is on Guidecca which made a pleasant change from the tourist hotspots of St.Marks where we have stayed 3 times before. The hotel has a shuttle boat. Hotel big, rooms very nicely furnished with plenty of room but expensive to eat and drink there. Fantastic views over venice from the rooftop pool and bar. Not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEl”
Reviews.Author: caz79Surrey
Reviews.Content: What an excellent hotel. We arrived at the airport and decided to go to our hotel by water taxi and what an expereience that was . It was amazing and well wortth the 90 euros. It was just like being in a James Bond film zipping through the water arriving at our hotel in 20-30 minutes rather then the 2 hours if using public transport. Upon arriving at the hotel first impressions where amazing. It is massive and extremely impressive looking and right on the waters edge. The impressions did not change when entering. The hotel is extermely attractive and drapped in marble. The reception/checking in was very efficient. Our room was lovely. It had a side view which looked over a side canal which was fine. Our room was a very good sixe with a hugo double bed plenty or wardrobe space, safe, flat screen TV and a lovely bathroom which was plenty big enough. Upon exploring the hotel we found 4/5 very lovely look restaurants which lived up to their impressions as the food was amazing, We chose to eat in our hotel for both our evening meals and where not disappointed. Breakfast is amazing as well with so much choice and as we had breakfast included with our room you could basically eat as much as you like.
