The hotel offer a FREE shuttle boat which takes you to main land venice. It take 5 minutes to get straight across the water and 10/15 minutes to get to St Mark's square. The boat ran on time every time and was incredibly easy to use and a great novelty. You are offerered a time table at check-in and the boat runs late into the evening so no problems with getting back to the hotel. Hotel has a swimming pool which is a lovely extra. It is roof top and a good size. There are only a few sunbeds which you do have to pay for but we had no problmes just laying our towels down on the floor instead which is of course FREE. We used the pool each day we where there and was a lovely way to cool down in the summer sun. We also used the spa/gym facility which was also lovely and a nice way to spend an hour or so relaxing. We decided against any treatments as they did seem a little on the expensive side but you can use the other facilities for FREE. Over all wethroughly enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend it. Thehotel was lovely and the staff where very helpfull. If you have the opportunity to stay at this hotel then do as you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “what a treat”
Reviews.Author: CLARESouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of staying at the molino Stucky for 2 nights with my family. we had a Grand Canal facing suite on the top floor ( executive floor). and wow what a hotel. the rooms are beautifully decorated, the view was divine and the pool which is situated on the very top of the hotel was absolutely stunning. the Executive floor clients have access to an exec lounge/dining room which offers free drinks and snacks until 23h00 every day which was perfect. although the hotel is not situated on the mainland it is a short complimentary ferry ride across the canal to St Marks square. All in all if you want to treat yourself , I can highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spanglish_Orellut
Reviews.Content: A great Hotel making a very worthwhile 4 day break. After reading some reports we were a little concerned that the hotel was on the Island of giudecca, this however made the stay more interesting and it is not a problem to move about. I had a room with a great view on the Exec Floor, Staff also very good and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wow factor”
Reviews.Author: louisebarnsley
Reviews.Content: We speeded our way from the airport direct to the hotels front door in a water taxi and our first impressions were very good. The concierge immediately took our luggage and we checked in at reception with ease. The receptionist gave us a map of the hotel, Venice and the hotel shuttle service timetable. She gave us much helpful information for our short stay in venice. Our luggage was taken to our room immediately and we were so happy with our deluxe room. No view but here are the benefits, a large comfy bed (the comfiest ever slept in), two large wardrobes, a large flat screen tv, slippers and bathrobe, good air conditioning, a marble bathroom with bidet, sink, bath with lovely shower over, very nice crabtree and evelyn products, lots of fluffy soft white towells. The room and bathroom, carpets, furnishings all clean, modern, new and to a very high standard. The room and bathroom were kept immaculate throughout our stay as was the whole hotel. Best of all there was no noise at all, the walls seemed very thick so nothing could be heard from other rooms. We dined in the hotel IL Molino restaurant outside on our first evening and the food was excellent as was the service. The second evening we had our best meal of our stay in Venice at the hotel Aromi restaurant. Again the food, service, ambiance was excellent. We dined inside due to weather but on warmer evenings there is a lovely terrace to dine near the canal with beautiful views. The breakfasts served in the Il Molino restaurant were again excellent with so much choice and variety catering for all nationalities. A highlight for us was being able to return from the husstle and bustle of Venice to such a beautiful hotel. We used the roof top pool and sun loungers. From here the views of Venice and the cruise ships sailing by is stunning. Another bonus is the Skyline terrace bar which serves excellent cocktails till late evening, a beautiful place to watch the sun go down and again excellent service. The hotel runs a free shuttle service from the hotel to Zattere and St Marks Square (15mins) throughout the day till evening. This is an excellent service. I was a little concerned with booking a hotel not on the main land however when we had seen the hotel and its excellent facilities plus the ease of taking the shuttle we were so glad we had chosen the Hilton. We were a little disappointed with our meal on our 3rd evening in Venice near the Rialto Bridge. The quality was not up to the standard of the other meals we ate at the hotel. Perhaps we should have enquired with the concierge for recommendations. This hotel definately has the wow factor all areas are immaculate and decorated to high standards. Service form all staff was excellent. I would definately return Venice is a beautiful city, we enjoyed our stay here so much and as a travel agent of 15 years I will definately recommend to others. Its not very often to go away and not have a single complaint but this was the case with this excellent hotel. Many thanks Hilton I am so pleased to have seen your email with details of this beautiful hotel and am so pleased with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Honors advantage”
Reviews.Author: mjobmi
Reviews.Content: As a gold or diamond member you will enjoy more. This was best use of Hilton Honor points I've found. This was an incredible stay! The staff was great, room very comfortable, the view from the 6th floor overlooking the canal was unmatched. The executive lounge(for Hilton Honor gold and diamond members) offered free breakfast, snacks all day and drinks until 11PM. The island of Giudecca was quiet and fun to explore. Mostly locals but a few good resturants and markets. A quick water shuttle and you're in the heart of Venice.(Shuttles are complimentary and run about every 20-30 min). The rooftop pool and bar offer stunning views however the drinks were no bargin. Wonderful trip to Venice,expect to spend some $$$$.

Reviews.Title: “Smart Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spitfire24
Reviews.Content: Very smart hotel. Room was on the smallish side but very clean and comfortable. Hotel is across the water about 10 minutes by the shuttle from St Marks. Reliable free hotel shuttle service vitually every hour from 09:00 onwards. Staff were also very helpful and friendly. Can't really fault it although it certainly is not cheap. Had trouble finding it initially. Caught the waterbus from the airport (â‚¬12) which took about 90 minutes. If you get off at St Marks then the Hilton shuttle shares a water busstop (square floating objects with yellow bands around the top). Look for the statue of the horseman and it is to the left as you look out on the canal. It runs at 20 minutes past the hour. If you are fortunate enough to take a water bus that goes on to Zaterre then the hotel is just across the waterway and arrives twice every hour.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas style hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: NYExotic_Traveler
Reviews.Content: all that was missing was the casino. Magnificent hotel located across the channel from the old city, where you can sit at the rooftop pool or lounge that looks over the city of Venice and watch the cruise ships pass by. I was very impressed with the staff at this hotel. They even gave us a private tour of the Presidential suite and the lookout from on top of the steeple. This is the highest point in Venice, even higher than St. Mark's tower. The air conditioning was the best in Venice, very quiet and very cold. Very easy to get back to the airport, take the Hilton shuttle across the channel and get off at the first stop. Take the vapparetto to the Roma station. Take the number 5 bus to the airport terminal. It takes 1 hour.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but very impersonal.....as all big ones are”
Reviews.Author: istee
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice......big enough.....bathrooms clean and big. The hotel is on a seperate island, so getting there is difficult. You either have to hire a private water taxi from the station that will cost you about 70 to 100 euros or take the water bus......that is painfully slow and has fixed timings. A trip in the private taxi is great fun......but it is over as soon as you start enjoying the ride......the hotel has ferries with a fixed time table.......the last ferry from the main island to the hotel leaves by 1 in the night....so if you plan to party .......make your own arrangements. The hotel breakfast is good enough...though if you order eggs of your choice don't expect them to come before at least fifteen mins. The waiters are so overworked that i saw one dripping sweat all over.....kind of gross...... and while checking out a cup of coffee worth 50 Euros MAGICALLY showed up in the bill. According to the hotel my husband had enjoyed this brew in the sky lounge or something .......it is a roof top cafe or a bar...which we never even caught a glimpse of. They showed us a bill signed by someone with what they said was our room number. But my husband felt the hotel was misreading a 4 as a 9......... anyways they knocked it off our bill after they tallied the signatures....... overall it was an OK experience but i am sure you can get better service with the same kind of money somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: chelsea1977
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hilton for a weekend and had a great time, Its in a good location away from st marks square. We got private boat taxi from airport for 100euros (30mins). We booked through priceline and got a good deal and I aske dto upgrade at the hotel to a view luckly I asked to see the rooms first and it was not worth upgrading as the hotel was full and the partial view room was small with a side view of the canal, we stuck to oour extra large courtyard view room which was massive. The hotel has a great terrace and roof top swimming pool. All staff were helpful and there is a free boat shuttle every 30 mins to st marks square (5mins by boat). I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Venice Hilton is the place to be”
Reviews.Author: dcl80
Reviews.Content: Pros and Cons about this place.. Mostly Pros! Lets start with the cons. Getting to the Hotel, it is on an Island, well all of Venice is, but this is on its own island. I had to email the hotel a few time for tips on how to get there from the airport.. One would think the hotel would run something to the airport, even for a fee... The hotel has a boat service to the mail part of the city and it work find, there is an hour break for lunch and dinner.. This is prime for travelers also. I think they should not do this, there is over an hour of dead time, and you could get stuck at the Hotel, or have to use public transportation. The room I had was an Executive Plus, corner room with 2 windows. The room was very nice.. I can not say anything bad about it.. The price is high, but it is a tourist city. The room gives access to the Executive lounge, and nice place full of FREE drinks and food.. Very nice to get drinks for free... well worth it..

Reviews.Title: “Treat Yourself”
Reviews.Author: Relay
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at this Hilton property and we'd return in a heartbeat. We thought the hotel was excellent. I suspect the previous reviewer has hit the nail on the head - if you book through Priceline (or similar) you get one of the smaller rooms. We chose to book on the Hilton website and we were allocated a very nice room overlooking the front of the hotel. Maybe the rooms aren't as luxurious as say a Four Seasons or as sophisticated as a Rocco Forte hotel but then you're not paying Four Seasons prices (even when booking on the Hilton website). We found the staff to be charming, friendly and helpful. Every request we made of the hotel (from room service and housekeeping to the front desk and concierge) was met with efficiency and a smile. The hotel shuttle boat to the Piazza San Marco is a real treat each day and we were able to come and go as we pleased by using either the hotel shuttle or the vaporetto (which is a real plus as the main island becomes incredibly crowded and congested during the day.) If you can, try and get a room in the Arsenale at the front of the hotel overlooking the main waterway (not the side canal). Yes there are problems with noise intrusion in these rooms (which Hilton needs to take a serious look at improving) but then that's part and parcel of staying in a converted flour mill with wooden floors, open beamed ceilings and cast iron columns. Not your standard Hilton! Food and drink at the hotel are expensive but there are cheaper options a few minutes stroll away. If you fancy a simple pasta dish or salad with a glass of wine head for the little cafe on the waterfront just beyond the Palanca zaporetto stop - great for lunch or just a drink. We also followed a previous reviewers recommendation and tried the Ristorante San Trovaso just a few minutes walk from the Zattere hilton shuttle boat stop - great for dinner with food and drinks less than half the price charged in the hotel. The Hilton has a fantastic rooftop pool and indoor spa with a good range of treatments. As previously mentioned the rooftop bar has stunning views - a real must for a chilled glass of prosecco. All in all we found the hotel to be everything we could have wanted and more. If you fancy a special trip to what must be one of the most beautiful cities in the world then you could do much worse (and spend much more) than stay at the Molino Stucky Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone loved the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: McLean4
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, we went back and forth about booking, but then decided the "cons" of being a little bit away from the action were not that significant. We were very glad we did. We were a family of four and booked adjoining rooms. Accommodations were excellent. The shuttle transportation to and rom the hotel was easy to use. We would typically return to the hotel about 4pm to rest and clean up for dinner, and it was nice to be away from the crowds of Venice and retreat to the quiet luxury of the Hilton. Front desk and concierge staff was very helpful. We were able to use Hilton HHonors points, which were quite a bargain given the Euro to US dollar conversion. The public transportation system to/from the airport was not the most convenient and we ended up taking a water taxi both ways. And given the nature of the construction and open beams, the rooms aren't soundproof -- you can hear your neighbor's hair dryer, etc. But it's Venice, so you should plan to get up early and explore the city and the islands. We had several excellent meals. "Cafe Saraceno" by the Rialto Bridge and "Laconda" were favorites. And as we waited for the shuttle back to Hilton, we always found time to have a gelato from Nico's right across the lagoon from the hotel. There is also an internet center a few blocks away that is much cheaper than the hotel's business center.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, slightly removed from all the action”
Reviews.Author: ottwatrvlr
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Molino Stucky is a relatively new/renovated hotel located on Guidecca Island. Guidecca ia a short boat ride (very frequent private hotel shuttle, or nearby vaporetto station) from St.Marc and everything else that Venice has to offer. The hotel is an old (pasta?) factory and Hilton did a good job of integrating elements of the factory with the very modern look and feel of this hotel. Funny enough though, the wood beams ceilling made me more feel like I was vacationning at "The Great Canadian Lodge" rather than being in Venice! The rooms are of reasonable size and you get great views from the rooftop bar or pool (you need to reserve in advance to get access to the pool). I had access to the executive lounge during my stay which offered a reasonable assortment of food for breakfast. The food offering is rather light for the remainder of the day but was still a nice place to go and relax to grab a quick bite before dinner. A good thing - those who have lounge access can also enjoy a "full breakfast" at the Hotel's restaurant for free. The staff was extremely friendly and accomodating. I actually liked the fact that the hotel was not in the main area of Venice as it actually allows you to have a great view of Venice every time that you step out of the hotel. Food options on Guidecca are somewhat limited (dinner time) as it is less of a tourist area but there are a few spots that seves decent food. One thing to note - Although all rooms have AC, the very high humidity in Venice may something make it feel as if AC is not working or is not powerful enough. Although we were comfortable throughout our stay, most papers left in the room became very damp and it was nearly impossible to dry clothing.

Reviews.Title: “Attention Priceline Users: In My Opinion NOT All Rooms Qualify or Rate 5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: scarpenter4
Reviews.Content: IF YOU LIKE ROOMS THE SIZE OF A SHOW BOX...BOOK NOW !!! Yes... I purchased my room via Priceline, as I'm sure many others have as well. Including all taxes my `1 night stay was just under $275 USD for a single night, and a pretty good deal even compared with average 3 star hotels. If you are considering this hotel and are planning on using Priceline (other websites indicate that the Molino Stucky is generally available to those who bid for Venice 5 Stars) you should know that the hotel seems to have 2 classes of rooms. I noticed that on the service carts (parked in the halls) that even the shampoo comes in 2 sizes... the regular Hilton size and a more deluxe large size (I suppose for the "Real 5 Star Rooms" As a Priceline customer.. I never expect a "room with a view" (hey, but it happens) But there seems to be an extreme difference between in size (room and/or shampoo) between the lowest class and the average class of rooms. In short... the non view rooms are TINY and if you read all the reviews you'll find others who have negative comments about the hotels rooms If you buy via Priceline... don't expect most of the 5 Star Reviews to be relevant to your stay. Yes its beautiful, very luxe, but I've never heard of a 5 Star expereince where the room was more or less a "Shoe Box" I was LUCKY... I got one of the few "Shoe Boxes" with a view, I doubt if there are many of them to be had. If your looking for value....you need to consider that there does not seem to be a single pay phone on the whole island...this Molino Stucky is the only hotel I've ever seen that does not have a single pay phone. Oh and the food.... don't even think about eating at the Molino Stucky... just read the other reviews. But a short walk along the water there are a few places that were far more reasonable than on the main island, filled with locals and to be honest.... the highlights of our stay. In my opinion these few restaurants are the only reason to visit the isalnd..... I'd suggest you stay on the main island and then with your water bus pass, visit and have a meal. As an example, our breakfast was 3 Euro for 2 people...total. Also its far easier to reach the hotel using the water bus and walking a quarter mile with your luggage than dealing with the Hilton's free launch.... where you need to carry your luggage down into the boat vs. rolling on and off the water bus. Last Point / and my Problem.... I wanted to use my telephone credit card to make a few calls... The pages regarding this in my room's leather binder were missing.... I called the "Magic" customer service and asked "how much to make a local call?" and I was told "1 Euro" probably higher than a pay phone... but since none are available why not?..... at check out my 5 calls were charged at 27 Euro (seems its a Euro a minute) I declined to pay the 22 Euro difference and was told that I was "difficult" at some point I was offered (since I was difficult" the opportunity to split the difference and pay 50%... I stood firm and finally paid the 5 Euro after explaining that I had a cell phone that costs me $.099 USD per minute.... why whould I choose to pay the Hilton the equiv. of $1.60 per minute for a call? Make sense to you? Anyway I was shocked to be told that I was difficult and then very difficult. In closing.. its pretty, unique, but lacks charm Many other reviewers seem to concur about the staff I wouldn't care to say here again, even if it was free. On my 3 week trip (UK, France, Italy) I stayed in a varitey of hotels from 1 Stars to 5.... and this was my least favorite hotel BY FAR

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: JandD07
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fantastic location, beautiful rooms, amazing view (upgraded to Venice view). The crowning glory is the rooftop swimming pool which we got to ourselves every morning at 8.30 for at least an hour! We could not fault the cleanliness, hospitality & facilities. We can't wait to return for a cold glass of wine in the rooftop cocktail bar at sunset. Highly recommended by me as a hotel professional.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tripping222
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome hotel. Everything is new, and sparkling clean. The staff was friendly and helpfull. Can't say enough about it, everything exceded our expectations. The location on the Island of Giudicia, across from San Marcos Square, is not a problem. Free shuttle boats run back and forth from the hotel every 15 minutes. It was not a problem at all. The only problem we encountered was that they were having some kind of difficulty with the swimming pool. Food and drinks are very expensive in this hotel, so we just avoided that. We were going to ride the Aliguana(water bus) from the airport to San Marcos Square. The cost was 25 Euros each; however, we negotiated a water taxi for 95 Euros total for four of us. That was definately the way to go. We had heard the water taxi's were 80 Euros each, but found differently when we arrived. It may change when things get more crowded during the summer. Our technique for street vendors and gondola's. First have the exact change ready, then make an offer and show the money, when the vendor counters your offer tell them it's all you have then turn and walk away. We paid 80 Euros for a nice gondola ride, that after being told it was 120.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and Consistent”
Reviews.Author: boehnkek08
Reviews.Content: Everything you would expect from a high-end hotel. The Hilton was run very professionally with attentive, helpful staff. Spoke English and communicated easily. The Hilton is on a seperate island from the main island of Venice, but a quick ride via Hilton's complimentary water shuttle. The hotel is massive, with several restauraunts, a spa and small workout facility. We found the food to be decent at the restauraunts and thought the rooms were great. It is a convention hotel as well, so the business center was nice and there were many people working while there. The hotel offers a free water shuttle to the island of Murano which was a perk and it isn't the easiest or cheapest place to get to. Overall, a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Hotel with Amazing Views”
Reviews.Author: venturagm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite impressive. The interior and exterior finishes are just amazing. This complex just stuns you when you reach the hotel's boat launch. The only draw back to this hotel is the A/C system. Oddly enough, the system cools the room but does not dehumidify. So you get this cool sticky feeling when you walk in to the room. The bedsheets have this cool damp feeling when you get in bed. Our particular room had an odd musty odor that must be a result of the high humidity. Go figure, that in Venice, there is a lot of humidity...LOL. Must have to do with all of the canals and water. The main spaces on the reception level were not Air Conditioned, so watching the Euro 2008 Semi Finals at the Rialto Bar was a little uncomfortable. If they had just opened a window or something, I think it would have been more comfortable. The Executive lounge has a very unique lay out. It's a long space with enclaves or private areas partioned so that groups of 4-6 can hang out in some sense of privacy. The pool is small and the water warms up fast with the sun, but the location (on top of the hotel) provides breath-taking views. The breeze up there will help you cool off once you take a dip in the pool. The pool bar is also extremely nice and provides some exceptional views. If this hotel could address the excessive humidity issues in the rooms and provide better A/C for the lobby, it could easily be one of the best hotels in Italy if not Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Best ever!”
Reviews.Author: StelJo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a lovely 4 days in the Hotel Molino Stucky. We used our Hilton Honors points (40,000 per night). It was sheer luxury. We went last year on a very good offer as they had only just opened the hotel. This year we were upgraded to an Executive Suite which was just beautiful and it faced the Canal overlooking Venice. They have a very good Executive lounge with very good attentive staff. The Manager Lucan couldn't have been more attentive with a lovely sense of humour. Enjoyed the food very much and it was so very well arranged. The only downside was the access to the hotel as we had to go over a few bridges and it was very difficult with the cases. Anyone who is thinking of going in a group could use the Water Taxi which would work out cheaper and more convenient. We must mention the Russian girl who was on reception and it was only her third day and she was very pleasant and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Posh hotel with fantastic view!”
Reviews.Author: travelingandtouring
Reviews.Content: We got a phenomenal deal staying at this very expensive deal. Our room overlooked Venice and was very clean. Hotel staff very accommodating. Easy to get to via water taxi and the hotel even offers their own free taxi to two other stops. The roof top pool is something to definitely enjoy. We had access to the executive lounge which was perfect after a long day of touring. Word of caution though! Avoid the free tour of Murano that leaves from the Hilton. It's very shady and just annoying.

Reviews.Title: “American Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: barcelonabrat
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is new and fresh compared to the old hotels in venice.No creeky floors and windox box air conditioners. If you like the big american way...this is it. Everything is expensive so bring your money.The taxi from the hilton to the airport is 100 euro....or you can lug your bags on two boats,spend double the time and pay alot less on a public boat. Enjoy Venice....it was fun!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, not a great location”
Reviews.Author: psychoteacher
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with first class accomodations, but riding the shuttle can be inconvenient. My husband went back to the hotel to change in the afternoon and it took over an hour to get back to the main island using the shuttle. It might just have been an unusual circumstance, but there was another boat parked in the place where the shuttle docks, so they had to sit out in the water for 20 minutes. We loved the room and the property, but there really is nothing else on that part of the island. Staying on the main island would have been a better choice for us. The staff was a little cold too. As another review notes, we were told the cost for calls is 20 cents to access a line for an 800 number, but were charged much more on check out. When I complained, there was no offer to remove the charges. The staff was helpful in recommending a nearby restaurant, but there are much better ones on the main island.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, modern hotel - expensive, but accommodating”
Reviews.Author: lbom
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the end of May prior to embarking our cruise around Italy. The Hilton Molino Stucky Venice was a perfect option as it was a mostly new, modern hotel that accepted our Hilton Honors points for redemption. And having read good things about this hotel on this site, I felt confident that my "American" husband would feel right at home! A couple of brief observations: *The Hotel is beautiful and perfectly situated. *The rooms are a good size (for American standards) and have good working "western" bathrooms. *The Rooftop Bar is amazing and has incredible views of Venice. *The food is expensive in the hotel. *The hotel management is accommodating and willing to work with you if you have a special request. I had read previously on this site that the food in the hotel is very expensive... and it is... 30 Euros for the breakfast buffet. As a pretty savy business traveler and a member of Hilton Honors, I asked if we could upgrade our standard deluxe room to the Executive Level... knowing that the Lounge probably included Continental Breakfast and evening Hors d'oeuvres. To our good fortune, the manager accommodated us and we paid an additional 45Euros for an "upgraded room" and we were put on the Executive Level with the perks that come with it. We had an afternoon snack, and what amounted to dinner, along with continental breakfast the following morning for two people. The food was plentiful and more than above average and cocktails were complimentary! One thing also worth mentioning is that the vapretto comes right to the hotel... so if you have physical issues with handling lugguge over several canals or need extra assistance with a lot of baggage, I would definitely recommend this hotel. We traveled with my mother and her older friend, and well, I am glad that we stayed here... too much luggage for them to deal with on their own and staying at The Hilton made it very easy. Thanks to all that recommended this hotel... I am also now endorsing it!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant 5 star facility!”
Reviews.Author: ptmcnutt
Reviews.Content: This beautiful new facility has large rooms & bathrooms, top notch service and staff and wonderful meeting facilities. The room top terrace bar is "must visit" with breath taking views of Venice. The complimentary hotel water taxi that transports you to San Marco was a great service as this hotel is not on the main islands which is great thing when you want peace and queit at night in Venice! It is a bit pricey but then again everything in Venice is! If you are going to spend a lot on a hotel you certainly get a lot for your money at the Hitlon Stucky!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, an amazing hotel.”
Reviews.Author: truprunbike
Reviews.Content: Redeemed Hilton Points here for May 10th-12th. This is an amazing hotel. Getting there was a little long, as we decided to take the Water Ferry from the airport at about 8pm, and didnt get to the Hotel until 10pm. Our boat driver skipped the San Marco stop and we had to get off at ST. Marks Square and then walk to the left over 3 bridges to the Hilton water shuttle stop- which shares a ramp with a public boat taxi. Checking in at 10pm was very easy. They did not have me as a gold member on file, but i had my card with me and they upgraded us to a suite on the 1st floor and free breakfast and longe access. The bedroom was huge with a great bed. The second room of the suite was large with a few tables, TV, and even a kitchen. However there was no view. We had 2 TV's and 2 minibars. The bathroom was also large with lots of lights, a vanity chair, jacuzzi tub and standup shower. The Executive Lounge always had some type of snacks. Sometimes it was just chips and pretzals, but they also had sandwiches and appetizers throughout the day as well as other items such as desserts. They also always had some juives, beer, wine, and mixed drinks available free of charge. They had a full buffet breakfast which was very good. The front desk was very friendly, but seemed to be the only ones who knew english. We asked for an outlet converter and they brought up one very quickly- but it was the wrong kind, and i think they were going to charge us for it, or it might have just been a deposit.... I am not sure, so we passed. We also asked how much it was for local calls and they said 20 cents a minute. We got charged like $2 a minute, which they took off after we told them we were told 20 cents a minute. The shuttle is great and drops you off very close to St. Marks Square. It can be busy during peek times as it runs about every 30 minutes. The rooftop pool is amazing and offer great views. The lounge chairs are very comfortable and relaxing. Overall this is a great choice with really no negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Hilton at it's Best”
Reviews.Author: Englishman_in_NJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the Hilton Stucky - basically still a new hotel. The renovations have been carried out beautifully, and you really get a sense that you are staying in a historic building. The rooms are beautifully decorated and, because the doors are set in from the corridor, they are very quiet. Staff at the Reception were excellent - very friendly and helpful. The water shuttle to San Marco runs every 30 minutes and is very clean and efficient - a nice way to get to the center. It can get a little tiring after a couple of days going back and forth, but that's the trade-off for a world-class hotel in a quiet location. The view from the swimming pool is stunning - it must be one of the best views in Venice. To get to the hotel from the train station, take a vaporetto to Zatterre (take a boat heading to San Marco, not to Rialto, otherwise it takes a long time!). Then you have to carry your bags over a small bridge to the Hilton shuttle stop (runs every 30 mins, takes about 5 minutes to get to the hotel) Most of the meals we had in Venice were average quality - typical tourist stuff. But I would recommend the San Trovaso restaurant which is a short walk from the Zattere water shuttle stop. Also Bacaro Jazz, close to Rialto bridge, is a fun, atmospheric place for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “TOP Notch hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jamescasonjr
Reviews.Content: I don't usually give 5 stars to a hotel, but in this case its deserved... Great hotel, i really enjoyed it. The room was fabulous, we got a corner room with a view to Venice. The bathroom was very clean, the room was modern, and nicely decorated.The bkfast buffet was large with lots of options. The only worry that we had when we booked the hotel was the location, but after arriving we found that the free shuttle was perfect. We actually preferred the shuttle as we enjoyed the ride into Venice... Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “A great experience..”
Reviews.Author: spdp
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful trip to Venice! We enjoyed our stay att he hhotel, we took a water taxi in since our lilttle one was just too tired and we didnt want the hassle etc. We arrived and were greeted by the reception team warmly and upgraded to a suite which we didnt expect at all, it was lovely! The hotel was very clean and well kept, location was not brilliant and if we go again we would probabaly stay somewhere closer to the main area however with a child it was nice to get away from all the craziness and relax in luxury. We ate at the Aromi too which was just lovely, very good wine and food, attentive waiters and good service. Breakfast was good too, a wide selction and attentive staff again! We really enjoyed the stay and would maybe stay here again if we were to return with our family but if we were to go alone we would opt for a hotel with more activity options around it especially resturants! But overall a good hotel with good staff!

Reviews.Title: “not up to all the hype”
Reviews.Author: buzzy100
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Molino Stucky as a 3-day add-on stay in Venice following our Italian cruise on the Oceania line. Although the room was very nice and quite spacious by European standards, it overlooked a small interior courtyard. Since we were on a low floor, all the natural sunlight into our room was blocked by the surrounding hotel structure - we had to literally put our heads out the window to see if it was sunny or cloudy! Also, since cell phones are apparently not permitted in the public areas of the hotel (a plus for most guests, if this is truly their policy), it meant that cell phone users were stepping into "our" courtyard to make their calls - we were treated to one-sided conversations in a variety of languages at all hours of the day and night. Our bathroom was large and seemingly luxurious, but the water would not drain from the washbasin and apparently the drainpipes from the rest of the hotel ran right down our bathroom wall - it sounded like Niagara Falls! The first night we were there, the air conditioning system was not working (in just our room?? in the entire hotel?? this still remains a mystery...) so we slept with the window open - usually a delightful experience, but in this case, the cell-phone conversations came in even louder and clearer, and so did the mosquitos!! Our weather in Venice was warm and lovely, but the "beautiful" rooftop pool was not open for the season, nor were they serving drinks on the terrace, so we didn't get to enjoy either of those amenities. The hotel staff seemed oddly pleased at my disappointment that I couldn't take a swim. And just a tiny word about prices - a cheeseburger in the lobby cafe goes for 30 euros - at the time of our stay, this was the equivalent of 45 American dollars!! Their restaurant prices were by far the highest we saw in Italy...however, we can recommend highly the artichoke pizza at the Cafe Redentor, a pleasant stroll down the Giudecca from the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Seven things that donâ€™t work at the Molino Stucky Hilton in Venice”
Reviews.Author: LivePaola
Reviews.Content: Consumer advocacy is not the first need that comes to mind when spending a weekend in a Venice blessed by perfect spring weather after deciding that once in a while itâ€™s worth splurging on a luxury hotel. However, the Molino Stucky Hilton, a late 1800s industrial flour mill sitting in a quiet location off the beaten track (the Giudecca island, also home to the historic Cipriani hotel) yet minutes by boat from anywhere in Venice, beautifully renovated as a hotel by the Caltagirone group and opened with great fanfare under Hilton management in 2007, manages to disappoint on so many counts that at some point I started keeping a list. Call me a snob, call me someone who canâ€™t appreciate the fine things in life, but here are seven ways a hotel can go wrong â€“ and at the Molino Stucky Hilton, all seven are wrong. 7. Internet access, provided by Swisscom, is fast and reliable but offered at extortionary prices. Business packages are 24 hours for â‚¬27 or 7 days for â‚¬108; if you choose Economy access (bandwidth and data volume limitations apply), you can choose between 60 non-consecutive minutes within a 24-hour range for â‚¬12 or 24 consecutive hours for â‚¬22. During a three-night stay, I burned through three of the sixty-minute packages â€“ I hardly ever used the full hour, mind you, which only left me the added frustration of not being able to carry any unused minutes over to the next day. 6. There is no turndown service for the night, unless on request. And even on request, there is hardly any turndown service â€“ it mostly consists of the removal of some pillows to a chair or a closet, depending on the housekeeping whim of the day. Drapes were left open for us to remember closing on our own. For rooms that set you back between â‚¬400 and â‚¬700 per night (but you can also choose a â‚¬3,700 Tower Suite, should you be so inclined), I find it in extraordinary bad taste not to provide turndown service by default. 5. Iâ€™m all for the environment, and in principle I do sympathize with the effort to conserve water and not dump synthetic detergents into the Venice Lagoon. Yet, for the aforementioned â‚¬400 to â‚¬700 per night, I expect to have the option to keep the same sheets night after night, should I so desire, by placing a little green card that says â€œIâ€™m green, donâ€™t change my sheetsâ€� on my bed before leaving the room in the morning. I do not expect the default option to be that Iâ€™ll have to sleep in clammy sheets, unless I remember to place on my bed the little green card that says â€œIâ€™m just not that into green, so do bother to change my sheets, pleaseâ€�. That is precisely the unpalatable choice that the Hilton management inflicts on any morally conflicted guests at one of its most hyped luxury locations, and probably elsewhere too, considering how much cheaper it is. 4. Suites and junior suites come with complimentary access to an Executive Lounge on the sixth floor. On inspection, however, this turns out to be a singularly depressing space, dimly lit with minimal amounts of natural light coming from gunholes on top of the walls, and reminiscent most of all of a narrow airport lounge at some minor hub. An inexplicably undrinkable orange juice is served, and Sunday newspapers only appear on Sunday morning only after reminding the lounge staff that Sunday is, indeed, a day of the week when many newspapers are regularly published. 3. A beautiful swimming pool on the seventh floor of the building is surrounded by such precious few deckchairs that, on a sunny afternoon, guests start getting turned away. This may be indeed a structural limitation, yet it is not one that the hotel designers couldnâ€™t foresee. Another rooftop solarium, perhaps? Deckchairs in the garden? Itâ€™s only May and youâ€™re running the pool at full capacity â€“ how many guests are you going to disappoint by July? 2. Ah, no pool, but at least one can get up in the morning and go to the state-of-the-art-gym for a good workout, right? (Remember the open drapes issue above â€“ item 6. â€“ and the fact that the sun does rise at a very early hour these days, especially for a weekend morning). Most people who work out are used to getting their workouts sometime between 6 and 8 am, right? Well, no such luck. The gym, which is described in the in-room Guest Services book as opening at 8 am, really doesnâ€™t open until 9 am. Guests who show up in workout gear anytime before 9 are turned away. 1. Finally, the staff is spectacularly untrained and occasionally clueless. (With a notable exception at the spa, the only department where people were competent, experienced and friendly: if you need a beautician, ask for Ella). Almost everybody looked like theyâ€™d just shown up for their first day of work. A request for Earl Grey tea at the aforementioned Executive Lounge (item 4.) was met with an uncomprehending stare and two consecutive attempts at tea that were not Earl Grey. A pool attendant (5.), asked whether there might be a house phone nearby, gleefully answered â€œI have no clueâ€�. Lapses in training, even at a hotel costing you the aforementioned number of Euros per night, can be forgiven; lapses in attitude will poison the guest experience to the point that a guest will only return under extreme duress. (For a well-thought-out philosophy of the hospitality business, I recommend Setting the Table by New York restaurateur Danny Meyer). Of course the Molino Stucky Hilton is not a boutique hotel. But still, one would wish to enjoy some glimpses of good service, and good management, even when staying at a bigger place. The Park Hyatt in Tokyo, in my experience, had just that kind of magic sauce. The Molino Stucky Hilton doesnâ€™t.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, service just okay”
Reviews.Author: wuhhoo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. We had complimentary water taxi to San Marco and Murano which was great. The service at the hotel was less than the other hotels we stayed at in Italy (even though they were not five starts). That may be just because the hotel is so large. The view from the hotel pool area is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your earplugs and mosquito repellent”
Reviews.Author: trev88
Reviews.Content: On the surface, this hotel is very nice. As noted in other reviews, the rooms are large by European standards, and the bathrooms are magnificent. However, the walls are paper-thin -- the thinnest I've ever experienced. You can hear EVERYTHING that your neighbour does and says next door. (In conversation with other guests, they noted it, too -- so we weren't simply unlucky with our room choice.) The other thing that spoiled the visit were two pesky mosquitos that dived bombed us all night and ruined our sleep! We didn't think to bring bug spray, but now we think about it -- Venice's canals must be bug-heaven. Be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Great location”
Reviews.Author: guycarol2002
Reviews.Content: Fabulous Hotel with very helpful and friendly staff. We loved the location. It was away from the crazy foot traffic in Venice and yet just a 3 minute boat ride to get to the city center. It's location works because Hilton offers it's own shuttle to the city center. Our room was beautiful and quite spacious for Europe. We didn't pay extra for the city view and were not at all disappointed. Go to the top floor bar at the hotel and take in the sights while sipping a drink. It's breathtaking. We will stay at this property next time we are in Venice. Compared to any hotel in the city center, this one is incredibly easy to get to. We saw lots of people dragging their suitcases through Venice's crowded streets trying to find their hotels. It's really inconvenient. You can't just take a taxi to the hotel entrance. Hilton's location is a definite plus for this.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: SanMarco07
Reviews.Content: The staff is very pleasant, always had a smile. I found the executive lounge to be well-stocked when we were there at Christmas Eve through Dec. 27th, 2007. There are sofas and a sitting area to the left of the actual lounge and the lounge had more than ample seating. It was very impressive to us. No complaints with the staff, housekeeping or lounge. In fact the only complaint that we really had was that the shower/tub is small and there isn't a full wall/door of glass across the tub so you have to maneuver very carefully but that is the ONLY complaint and for ten minutes a day, it's not that big of a deal. Request a room on the Venice side, you will not believe the sunrise and the daily view. It's indescribable. The hotel water taxi is such a lifesaver but you must be prompt, it is on time every time! Be prepared to pay if you are going by a "private" water taxi to and from the airport, it is a half hour ride and will cost you a bit more, but we thought it was worth it. One last thing, stay near the Rialto or San Marco square when it starts to get dark because it is very easy to get lost. It is hard to read your maps and navigate after dark!!!

Reviews.Title: “luxury”
Reviews.Author: evsUk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Venice where we stayed at the Hilton Molino Stucky on Guidecca Island. Arrived late and had to pay for an expensive water taxi (60 euro) from San Marco to the hotel If you arrive late you can get the private Hilton Water taxi from San Marco (furthest stop) until 2am which we didn't know. No ticket needed. Free service. Look out for the Hilton sign on the jetty. It runs every 30 mins from the hotel to San Marco and is excellent! Hotel very beautiful inside but very expensive to eat there. 40 euro for breakfast. Also you can use the public vaparetto (water bus) from the public stop Palanca a few yards up from the hotel. You need to buy a ticket. Yes I agree with another traveller the walls are thin in the bedrooms and there was noise one night but security quickly came and sorted out the problem. All good otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “WOW - Fabulous Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: TheRobinsonz
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 2 night stay at the end of March with my 14 year old son. We got a good deal from the Hilton website. We had a fabulous time - the hotel was amazing, huge room, great breakfast, amazing location, attentive staff, excellent shuttle service. This is the best Hilton I have stayed in, and one of the most amazing hotels - Venice is a great city and this hotel helped make the holiday even more special.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with an old twist - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: PenA1976
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights over Easter (March) 2008. The hotel is large, modern, clean and the communal areas immaculate with numerous restarurants, bars and swimming pool, and the original features are an added bonus. The location is in a quiet residential area, but there is no supermarket closeby although there are a few restaurants a short walk away. As mentioned in previous reviews, if you like to be away from the hussle and bustle, and don't mind having to take a 20 min boat ride to and from St Marks Square then this hotel is ideal. We didn't find this a problem since the boats ran all day and were always on time. We had originally booked (via Hilton website) a deluxe room with breakfast included in the rate, and upon arrival we were upgraded to an executive room with access to the lounge. We regret taking the upgrade because we ended up with a room which we felt was smaller than what we originally booked, and the view out of the window was onto the staircase of the adjacent spa. Apart from the view, the room was clean, modern and of high standard of fittings, complete with a 5 piece bathroom suite with marble tiles. The lounge was dark with no windows, there was no free internet access or toilets within the vicinity. We only used it once during our stay. This was quite disappointing since we have had access to Hilton lounges in the past and this one wasn't the best. Aside from these little niggles, the hotel was lovely and at a bargain price for a 5-star in an expensive city, we would definitely return and recommend to others. Previous reviews of this hotel on Tripadvisor are an accurate reflection as to what it is like.

Reviews.Title: “A Really Great "Big-City-Style" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mykel67
Reviews.Content: Venice has to be the most expensive city we've ever visited! I spent hours online looking for the best quality accommodation for the high prices we would be paying. I was surprised that the 5 star deluxe hotels (according to the guidebooks) are not very well reviewed here on Tripadvisor (Gritti, Danieli). Also, rates vary widely depending on which website you book through, so do your research. We ultimately booked an accommodation package at the new 5-star Ca'Sagredo for 4 of our 5 nights in Venice through Luxurylink.com. We still needed a hotel for our first night in Venice though (a Saturday), and since we were arriving late we did not want to spend another 450 Euros to add an extra night at the Ca'Sagredo. After a lot of online searching, we ended up booking a night at the Hilton Molino Stucky through Priceline for the incredible rate of $147 US. It almost seemed too good to be true. We were worried we'd end up in a broom closet! Getting to the hotel is rather easy. We were in no hurry to check in, so we took the Alilaguna (12 Euros each) to the Zattere stop (1 hour, 20 minutes), and then caught the Hilton's shuttle (it arrived within 15 minutes and took about 5 minutes to cross the canal). Check-in was quick and efficient. The front desk clerk was very pleasant, and no mention of Priceline was made (paying such a low rate for the room I was wondering if we would be treated as second class citizens - we weren't). As expected, our room (227 in the Arsenale wing) didn't have much of a view (interior courtyard), but that didn't matter to us as we were checking in after dark and leaving the next day. The room was richly appointed and a good size (but not huge). The bed had already been turned down for us, and there were robes and slippers available for our use. The furnishings and linens were of an excellent quality - certainly the plushest Hilton we've ever stayed in. The bathroom was especially nice, with a separate shower, heated towel rack and Crabtree & Evelyn toiletries. After dropping our bags and freshening up we headed upstairs to the rooftop lounge, where we had a couple glasses of prosecco to toast the beginning of our holiday. This is probably one of the nicest hotel bars I've ever seen. The atmosphere is clubby but subdued, the service is friendly and efficient, and there's a terrific view across the canal to Venice proper. There were dozens of candles lit around the bar and pots of citronella were lit up on the terrace (although it was a little cold for sitting outside). Our drinks were served with complimentary nuts and a fruit platter (which was quickly replenished after we made short work of the first offering!) We then headed down to the lobby restaurant to have a light dinner. Again the service was excellent. The food was expensive (as is almost everything in Venice), but it was nice to enjoy a meal while watching elegant Italians milling about in their finery (attendees of a yachting gala in the hotel's ballroom). We skipped the 40-Euro brunch the next morning, but it looked tempting... I would definitely recommend this hotel as a summertime option in Venice. The rooftop pool and the hotel's removal from Venice proper would provide a welcome respite from the heat and crowds of the peak season. Off season, waiting for a shuttle to take you back and forth to the main island might be a little inconvenient if you wanted to go back to the hotel for a mid-afternoon nap, etc. However, for the price we paid I wouldnâ€™t hesitate to stay there at any time of the year! It is definitely Veniceâ€™s best luxury bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: raymad
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with a great view. The hotel boat was very convenient as it went every 40 minutes to two different stops until 12am. The staff was exceptionally kind and helpful. The executive lounge did not have a good view, but it seems that they saved the best views for actual rooms along that side of the hotel. Wireless internet was very expensive in the room: 27 Eur for 24 hours. In the exec lounge and in the business center it was .35 per minute. Drinks in the Skyline bar were between 6 - 10 euro each, not too bad, I thought. I think during busy times it could be hard to get a room with a good view, but still a good place. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark100Bristol
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I had a wonderful weekend stay at this hotel. It is located on a separate island to the St Marks area but the hotel taxi service is frequent & efficient. The hotel was very quiet and it seemed we had the place all to ourselves. This recently opened hotel is certainly worthy of its rating - our room was immaculate and the offerings for breakfast were extensive and would cater for anyones taste. The skyline bar was also a pleasant way to round off the eveniing - unfortunately it was too cold to sit on its pool terrace during our stay, but the views were fantastic and perfect for a warmer evening. The prices seemed to equate to other establishments in Venice (i.e nothing is cheap - but it wasn't too expensive - and you felt you were getting value for money). I would certainly recommend this hotel and it was a picturesque base for a lovely romantic trip to Venice

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect!”
Reviews.Author: TheRovingWeimaraners
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a wonderful getaway to Venice in February. It was awesome to have a hotel with its very own boat-taxi! The staff was very nice and helpful to us. We were particularly pleased with the executive lounge. The only complaint was that the walls in the rooms were very thin - we could hear our everything our neighbors were doing, even when they were speaking quietly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent service, highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: DagnijaC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at â€˜Hilton Molino Stuckyâ€™ for 4 nights in February during the Venice Carnival 2008. The hotel is located on the island of Giudecca across the lagoon from Venice and is easily accessible via hotelâ€™s complimentary boat shuttle that takes you back and forth to Venice every 40 minutes and stops at Zaterre (5mins.) and San Marco square (20mins.). It is operating from approx. 7am-1am and you can get the time table at the reception. The hotel itself is new (opened in June 2007), beautifully designed, the rooms and the common areas are modern, spacious, clean and beautifully decorated. Check-in was fast and efficient, a porter took care of my bags. I asked for a best room possible in the category I booked and was given a double deluxe room on the 6th floor. It did not have a Venice view but was a very nice room nonetheless. I did not eat at any of the hotels restaurants as it was Carnival and I preferred to eat out in the town but I did go to the â€˜Skylineâ€™ bar a couple of times and would recommend it to anyone staying in Venice as they have a beautiful Venice view, really exceptional staff and nice and relaxed atmosphere. I used the room service only once to order a bottle of wine which arrived in less than half an hour. I also had a couple of drinks in the hotelâ€™s lobby bar (â€˜Rialto barâ€™) whilst waiting for the shuttle boat. Service there was fast and efficient â€“ I never missed my boat ï�Š. The continental breakfast buffet offered a great selection of varied foods. The staff and service were friendly and professional and made me feel very welcome on my first visit to Venice. Especially I would like to point out the bartenders in the â€˜Skyline barâ€™. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone; the only negative I can think of is that if you like to pop-in to your hotel room several times a day that could be a problem as you have to cross the lagoon and it takes 20 minutes. If youâ€™re not bothered by that youâ€™ll love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not your typical hilton”
Reviews.Author: ARHF
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a diffrent island ( giudecca) about 10 minutes boat ride (the hotel provides a free shutle service). The hotel is big and complicated you will get lost unless givven a map. Beeing a Gold VIP we recived a two room suite . The service and the food where execlent. I would recommend as a romatic gateaway.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful”
Reviews.Author: AlkiGreece
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Molino Stucky Hilton for 3 nights, arriving on January 2nd 2008 and leaving on January 5th. We had two interconnecting rooms at the executive floor, one for us and one for our kids. We had requested Venice view which was really worth it but the rooms were also beautifully designed, with nice furniture and very well appointed details. The hotel is situated on the island of Giudecca but it has a shuttle boat that takes you back and forth to Venice every 40 minutes. The staff was very helpful and the common areas, were beautiful. My only negative comment is that the only restaurant open for dinner was the expensive, upscale one which is not appealing to a family with two young kids. But with the shuttle boat, we just crossed 5 minutes on the other side and we had the best pizza ever at "Ae Oche" (highly recommended). All in all, it was a great stay and whenever we go to Venice again this is where we'll stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked it!”
Reviews.Author: Claypole
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend surprised me for New Year with a trip to Venice and we stayed at the Hilton for 4 nights. We got off the aiport ferry and asked the tourist desk where the Hilton Complimentary taxi was - followed directions right to it. Check in was great. We had booked an Executive Room but we were upgraded FOC to a Venice view room (the hotel is on Gieudecca) which was lovely. Room was spacious although like a sauna. We reported the air con problem and it was fixed within the hour. Because we booked the exec room we had access to the exec lounge which was great - aperatifs and different food during the day all free of charge. We found transportation fine between the hotel and main Venice island - You can either go to St Mark's Square or Zaterre (15 and 5 mins respectively). New Years Eve was a bit hectic but what do you expect?? They laid on additional boats which was fine but it is a bit of a free for all. Breakfast was very varied and substantial - great buffet. We did not eat in the restaurants but it looked pricey for what you get. The concierge was always helpful with booking restaurants and directions. We popped down to use the spa one day which is small but nice steam room - jacuzzi was broken. Overall I was very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: s0da
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent a wonderful 5 nights at this hotel for my birthday. We stayed in a suite but were very disappointed with the view.The service was exceptional and the concierge even more so. The only complaint I have is that I did not enjoy the food in the hotels main restaurant. Well worth a stay but I would definately recomend dinner at the Ciprianni one of the most memorable evenings ever!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Building”
Reviews.Author: Vathy
Reviews.Content: An interesting hotel recently converted from a derelict flour mill into a top class Hilton. Situated on the island of Guidecca it is close to the Palanca vaporetto stop. However, the hotel has its own motor lauch which runs from San Zaccaria (next to San Marco) to Zattere and then to the hotel and back again. If travelling from the airport take the Alilaguna water launch to San Zaccaria (about an hour but only 12 Euros) and then pick up the Hilton launch. Check in was slow, but the staff were polite and helpful. Our room was superb and overlooked the Canale della Giudecca. We stayed as Hilton HHonors members and had use of the Executive Lounge. This room was disappointing as there was no view and the windows were low in the wall. However, the Sky Bar offers wonderful views over the city. We felt very at home here and will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Time”
Reviews.Author: LouisianaMom344
Reviews.Content: We got a really great rate on this hotel through Priceline. We found it one of our greatest experiences while we were in Europe. We would recommend the hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Teetering on the edge of chaos”
Reviews.Author: cmr20
Reviews.Content: I visited Molino Stucky with my husband for 4 nights over new year. We arrived by train and got the vaporetto (water bus) number 1 to the Vallaresso stop for St Marks Square. We searched for the Hilton taxi stop eventually finding it at the opposite end of the promenade which took 15 minutes in the dark!! We eventually found the shuttle at the S Zaccharia vaporetto stop(which is the stop afterValaresso!) Get the No 1 Vaporetto straight to S Zaccharia- there Hilton how hard was that! There was a notice which seemed to suggest that the shuttle was alongside the stop but when we went down that path we were sent to the vaporetto waiting room where we sat for half an hour. When the shuttle eventually arrive everyone surged down our original path and pushed on in front of us!! Manouvering through the crush with suitcases would be impossible with any sort of disability or small children and no help was offered or given The hotel doesnt have an obvious main entrance (presumably planning issues) and seemed to be having problems with its front doors in the wind. One was cracked and broken on our arrival- two more were damaged whilst we were there- (not our fault!)-they slam shut in the wind ! The check in was efficient and we were directed to our room with our bags. No porter was offered. We were on the 7th floor and although the view toward St marks Square was lovely and the room itself very pleasant there was a couple of problems. The first was that only one of the two (very small) available lifts was working for our entire stay, even on New Years Eve when there was a large function booked into the Sky Bar above us (at 450 Euro a person!!!!!!). There is a wonderful view from the Sky Bar terrace but only when it is open. Otherwise you cant see anything. The lift was constantly full of people going up to the top and then coming straight back down because it was shut. On more than one occasion we used the stairs because it was impossible to get into the lift! Obviously the second lift need to be in working order but a notice on the ground floor to say that the terrace was shut would have saved countless wasted trips- there Hilton how hard was that! The noise level in our room was ridiculous. The roof bar has a tiled floor so we could hear the clicking of high heels and the dragging of furniture. There was a service staircase next to us which they used to clear the empties at the end of the evening which was also very loud. We didn't complain because otherwise all was fine and we're such night owls that it was usually winding down be the time it mattered! New Years Eve was a different matter We went to bed at two but the music sounded as if it was playing in our room! We stuck it out till 3.00 when we phoned down to ask what time it was finishing and were told 4.30!!!!! We were offered a room change but couldnt really cope with it in the middle of the night and to be fair the music did quiet down a lot shortly afterwards. I dread to think what the noise would be like when the pool and its terrace are open but meanwhile there is a nightclub on the bar at weekends. Do not stay on the floor beneath unless you will be attending it-there Hilton- how hard is that!! A lot of other problems were caused by the staff levels being too low. Breakfast is fine but everything runs out very quickly and not everything was replenished. We didn't get tea at breakfast for the first two mornings because the waiter couldn't find any! On lunchtime we waited so long to be served in the bar that we gave up and our room was twice being made up when we returned at 4.30 in the afternoon. There was also a complete lack of 'service'. We had a water shuttle timetable for the first three days but on the fourth it changed! We were left to dicover the new times and new routes for ourselves.It isn't asking too much that new ones could have been handed out on the shuttle the previoius day, made available at breakfast or been put into rooms the night before. There Hilton how hard was that!! As we left there was a blocked drain in the middle of the hall and the smell was disgusting. The girl walking out before us cut her hand on the smashed glass door of the entrance door. What a shame - a lovely hotel to look at but it is poorly managed.

Reviews.Title: “New and Wonderfully friendly”
Reviews.Author: mojoeagle
Reviews.Content: After getting a excellent deal on my weekend away, I paid 3 star hotel prices for our stay. It was the first time to Venice, the Hilton staff made us very welcome. Loved the room very clean and tidy with a 27inch lcd tv! Breakfast was excellent. Only had one downside they tried charging us for breakfast both mornings, had been a mix up with reception and restaurant. Good job as its Â£30 a head! In the evening go to the skyline bar its amazing, very romantic but its expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Could do better Hilton”
Reviews.Author: EKD
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked our visit to Venice as a treat for New Year celebrations. The Hilton proved to be reasonable (for Venice!) so we booked through the website. On arrival to Venice, our first time, we managed to manouevere our heavy suitcases (note advisable to travel light!) to the stop at Zattere where we would catch the Hiltons shuttle service to the island. I would suggest the Hilton make the sign clearer as to where to alight their shuttle boat, for first time visitors we needed help!! As we entered the hotel it certainly has the wow factor, bright, spacious albeit slightly over air conditioned, friendly reception staff and an inviting bar area to sit and relax. Our first room was wonderful - dark wood beam ceiling, double sinks, seperate shower cubicle and without asking we received the 'turn down service' which was a nice touch. However, i would agree 100% with the previous review that noise level between the rooms was intolerable. We could hear the people next door as if they were standing next to us. It got so bad that we requested a room change, the next room was by no means in the same league as the first however we were fed up of moving so did not pursue another change. Both my partner and i requested the turn down service again as we were so impressed with the small luxury. It took 2 phonecalls and 2 mentions to reception staff for 2 nights they missed us out of the service - I decided to speak to the Manager to whom i also mentioned the sub standard room we were moved to (shower was dodgy, carpet had stains on it and there were cigarette ends outside the window). As an apology we were offered a fruit basket? which did not arrive, the next day we received some biscuits and water!! Rather despondent with the hotel we thought we would give it another try! and perhaps enjoy time away from the evening hustle and bustle in Venice centre and spend time in the wonderful hotel spa and the waterfront restaurant. We were not disapointed. The restaurant was absolutely first class, the staff were so professional and super friendly and a visit to the Sky Bar afterwards was magical. My overall opinion is the facilities and restaurants are first class and make the hotel stand out - just make sure you get a noise free room.

Reviews.Title: “incredible luxury”
Reviews.Author: diane13c
Reviews.Content: An absolutely beautiful hotel. Got a room with views over the canal to venice. Everything in this hotel was first rate - service, cleanliness, amenities, furnishings. You can only get to/from the hotel via hotel shuttle or water taxi. The shuttle stops at two convenient locations across the canal to begin exploring Venice. Shuttle only ran every 40 mins while we were there, which was good enough for our daily excurions in/out of Venice. Hotel is quite a distance from both the train station and airport, will cost you a LOT if you want to take a water taxi. We took the water shuttle from the train station which took a while (40 mins), but got us there for a fraction of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Fabulous Service”
Reviews.Author: LMBurgoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for three days in December, we accidentally left our passports on the water boat along with our money-the staff was so nice, responded by bending over backwards to find our bag-calling the taxi service immediately and eventually finding it. They sent us up to the executive lounge to relax and have a drink taking some of the stress off. Everyone we dealt with was wonderful, polite and helpful. The hotel does have a shuttle into a very nice area but you have to take a TAXI or shuttle to the hotel from the train station which is 6 Euro per person. I kept looking for the Hilton shuttle and couldn't find it and it was because there isn't one from the train station-just be aware. Also, Several places in italy do not take credit cards-be aware and always be able to pay with cash for any meal, etc. The hotel is beautiful!!!!!!!!!!!!! the ceilings in the room are amazing and the bathrooms are fantastic, one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “It was fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: Notanotherholiday
Reviews.Content: Wow! I was tempted not to write a review in order to keep this place to myself - but that seemed so unfair on others. It was brilliant - a beautiful conversion, with fantastic attention to detail. The staff were all extremely helpful. Bedroom was amazing - couldn't fault it. The buffet breakfast was something else - lasted us the whole day! So convenient with the free Hilton shuttle boat across to St Marks Square, but also handy for the waterbus stop too. It was really quiet at night and the rooms were so spacious - which must be a first for Venice! Food not cheap, but it was well worth 2.5 Euros for a cafe latte in such fantastic surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Lacks 5 star service - Happy to say a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: SamirDewan
Reviews.Content: We had been given a written confirmation for a Venice view but were given room 627 facing ruins of buildings. We had to struggle with guest relations manager to get a venice view room and finally manage to get room 109 but did not realise it was just on top of Rialto bar with piano music going on till midnight disturbing the sleep. Luggage from room 627 to 109 took 45 minutes and reason given was group arrivals. Though a written apology and a complimentary bottle of champagne was sent to our room but it did not make up too much a pleasureable way to start with. especially as it was a surprise for my wife. The concierge sent us in wrong elevator to room 627 at check in and we had to come down to ask for help again while still expecting a nice view which we were gonna have !! Surprising that being 5 star, they did not have UK to Europe power adaptor and just apologised for the same without much help. The breakfast in restaurant wasnt much of high quality and must say service was too poor. Hostess just showed us the place to sit and never explained about breakfast. Had to wander around to ask for help. Chauffing dish of Hash browns at buffet breakfast was always empty and when asking the chefs wandering around, did not understand much english. (surprising for a 5 star hotel). They certainly lacked proper staff to supervise the breakfast in a professioanl manner. Housekeeping Department was great and did really cleaned the room well. I am myself a hotelier and could easily sense that the hotel lacks attention to detail. The food in rialto bar was really nice. Please be specific when making room bookings as you may end up like we did - rooms facing demolishing building and also the rooms on 1st floor where the Piano music can be heard all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable & Clean”
Reviews.Author: Weezyt
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 4 year old son & my parents for 3 nights. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The water shuttle runs on time and is wonderful (and free!). Next time we go, I will use the public water taxi (for $15 euros) rather than the private water taxi (at $100 euros) to and from the airport. Keep in mind that if you are looking for inexpensive food, it's not going to happen here. The food is ok - but the value of the US dollar is so poor, everything is expensive. Also, $25 euro per day for internet access is ridiculous. The hotel is beautifully renovated - restoring the old while moderniziing. The marble bathrooms are very nice - ours had a deep tub + a shower & bidet. The bed was very comfortable. Ask for a room with a view of the canal - it's worth it! The rooftop pool is beautiful - nice for a evening stroll with a gorgeous view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “WOW That was one of the nicest stays ever!”
Reviews.Author: Florian_Krueger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Molino Stucky (HMS) for about a week on HHonors Points. We had booked a standard room and received a complimentary upgrade (Diamond Status) to a canal-view executive room which was truely amazing. We were my wife, my son (3) and myself and had the best stay in Venice ever! We will most certainly come back to this great place and bring our friends on one of our next trips. The staff was VERY friendly to our quite active son and made us feel at home from the moment we stepped into the lobby. The food was good within the hotel and I agree it is a little expensive, but Venice is an expensive turf and everybody who goes there knows it and should be able to cough up about 70-90 USD per adult per meal, or he or she will get mediocre quality. The staff at the executive suite was seriously helpful and the little bites, which they provided were so good that we actually skipped lunch and dinner on a couple of occasions. They even had Bellini in the free bar! As you can tell I am still impressed and I am NOT working for Hilton ;-)

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton Molino Stucky Venice Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Giudecca 810, 30133 Venice, Italy
